At checkout, Hyatt tried to charge me for daily breakfasts, which were included in my room. I pointed out that error and also found that there was a fraudulent $287.65 charge for dinner. Our famiy had dinners off-site. Somebody charged to our room! I pointed this out and the charge was taken off. Today, Hyatt again

Motel 6 ......rooms  and no customer service  Had to call numerous times to get basic essentials ...very unbecoming of Hyatt.  Would not suggest this hotel.......  THe rooms were like a motel 6 with a new mirror but very old...

Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and it was mediocre at best. At check-in, I was assigned a room that smelled bad and I could hear the neighbors very clearly. I asked to be moved to another room and was put on the far end of the hotel property. The room was not in great condition and had obviously not been updated in some time. The walls are thin in the hotel so be prepared to hear your neighbors. The water pressure was decent and the room was clean so no complaints there. The hotel seemed understaffed in general, especially in the restaurant.  To be clear, the hotel is average, not terrible. If the rate is $200 or less, I think it's acceptable. It is one of the shabbier Hyatt Regency's I have stayed at and I think I would stay elsewhere in the future if I returned to the area.

Based on the room pictures, I thought that it would be something special but really it was much less than expected. Overall the place needs an upgrade with amount of money one is paying to stay there.

The shuttle runs to Fashion Island and Balboa - and that was really nice.  I like the layout of the property.  There are a lot of trees and pools and it feels very relaxing.  I was there scouting for a conference and I really liked what they had to offer.

I would not stay at this Regency Hyatt again. I think this hotel lacks in customer service. This hotel lacks in customer service. I expected better treatment since I am a World of Hyatt Member and Hyatt Property Owner

Our family stayed at the Hyatt Newport Beach last month. What a disappointment! The hotel is old and the rooms very small. I booked a poolside room and at first was given a room facing a wall. After my family complained, we were moved to a poolside room. We paid for 3 nights with breakfast in advance. $28.00 for a buffet no better than the Comfort Inn was not worth the price. The pool and grounds were very nice. That's it. They require a $75.00/night security deposit, which I understand and paid with my debit card. At checkout, I was charged for 3 days of breakfasts and $287.00, which someone else charged against my room. I pointed out the problems, and the bill was adjusted. I had a zero balance.  After checkout, I found that another $204.00 was charged against my debit card.

Location good.  Attentive staff.  Rooms rather noisy...heard much noise from hallway and adjoining rooms at night.  Bathrooms could use some attention, decorating-wise.  Overall good place to stay, but, as it is a 'Regency" I expected better.

We really enjoyed our trip to the Hyatt Newport Beach for our wedding anniversary. The location is excellent. Close to numerous activities. Staff was very friendly and left us a card, bottle of champagne, and chocolate covered strawberries to help us celebrate. Overall a very enjoyable and relaxing trip. Definitely plan on staying again.

Rooms were nice, however could hear everything in adjacent rooms.  The outdoor areas were very nice, enjoy a glass of wine on the patio!  Staff and drivers very friendly.  Price of food for quality is not good, eat elsewhere.

All the reviews of this Hyatt are spot on; from the 1/5 to the 5/5.  Great grounds,nice pools, paper thin walls, noisy kids, expensive parking, etc.  I really wanted to love this place,and it has some special qualities, but overall it was just above average. "Back in the day" I was the doorman at a 5-star/5-diamond hotel in Aspen so I have a discerning eye for service and hospitality.   If you want to know what to expect from your stay at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach, read all the reviews, both good and bad. They paint a broad picture of what you will likely encounter.

Very nice, I will visit this property again. Grand kids enjoy coming each year. they really enjoy the water slide, making new friends, the kids play area and the breakfast. We will return time after time. A lot of fun.

My husband and I have stayed here a few times and love it because it's consistent in its cleanliness and overall appeal. The staff is always helpful and friendly. This time, we had a room overlooking the golf course and had a wonderful run on the nearby back bay loop trail!  We always have a lovely full breakfast in the morning. They are always happy to accommodate my Vegan & Gluten Free requests.

Summary Heading: Close to balboa island and fashion island
Summary: The shuttle service to balboa island and fashion island was a good benefit.  The pool and the mini water slide was good for the kids.  The bar and lounge was a nice relaxing area with a good service staff.

Love the decor of the hotel.  It has 3 nice pools, 1 with a small water slide.  Cool bar with lots of lounge areas, indoor and outdoor.  Hotel fees cover green fees at the nice golf course.  Friendly staff.

Summary Heading: Too expensive and too many hidden fees
Summary: I expected to pay $400-450 after what I was quoted, but the bill was $700, and not from anything but the bare minimum room charge and all the hidden fees. No room charges, no room service, no minibar, it was ridiculous! The pool is beautiful, the rooms are niceish, the practically shower toilet combo was so cramped, and the beds were very uncomfortable. On of us used the pool one day and had to pay a nonnegotiable $30 fee per day to have access to the pool.  Too expensive, I'm never going back.

Stayed 3 nights, family trip. The hotel is big and has 3 pools. A bit pricy but good for a summer break with the kids and wife. Huge parking, close to everything. 5 min drive to mostly every place you´ll need. Closer to Fashion Island shopping center with a fantastic Wholefoods Market. Hotel has shuttle to a few places but hasn´t needed since we brought a car.

The rooms are spacious, clean and nicely furnished. Free water bottles, bike rental and the best hotel gym we've ever had! The outdoor pool is wonderful, beaches also close by. Super friendly staff, from vallet to housekeeping. We will definitely return!

Summary Heading: best put together that old vacation hotel vibe , but  with a modern Spanish twist..
Summary: As I continue my hotel to hotel , home away from home, experience .. after the  AC marmot in Irvine I hit  a few  genuinely terrible service I  thought I was cursed.. but I'm not her to bash on those  I'm here to thank the Hyatt regency Newport Beach and there  trulls talented staff. every employee  knew  exactly what there duties  as far hospitality.  I'm my entire stay I would have to say I think  this was the most I see  staff being able to perform there standard duties , but exceeds to  the du dilates to assists a. customer in any field  to the best of there ability and if needed d   which is great signs of  management . I will say well rounded group of people so if your trying to to get that vacation vibe on a week day . then this is also ur spot

Old property where you can hear every footstep in the room above you.  Poor service in general.  Unbelievable that after 10:00pm when the gift shop closes... if you want water/snacks you'll need to leave the property.

Summary Heading: Ok but wouldn't say it was five star!
Summary: Hotel lobby lovely, daytime staff helpful and friendly. Nighttime staff rude... We arrived at 1am after a long flight delay and 27 hours travelling and was sent to our room with no information at all. Guy who helped with finding the room didn't speak to us and carried one small suitcase and then expected a tip.  Pool great, bar food available around the pool with waitress service ( quite expensive though- average was $40 for drinks and snacks)  Rooms were small and outdated, maid service was really good some days and non existent on others. 2 days nobody arrived, had 2 days when we had to request clean towels, toilet roll and bottled water. Expensive extras (parking $27 for self park and resort fee of $15 plus tax) adding over $500 extra to the holiday.  Breakfast choices in the

Hotel rooms were dirty, aisles in the hotel very smelly and old. Hotel needs a makeover. Unless it gets a full renovation and is shut down for a remodel for several months I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The garden and the plants are beautiful but it doesn't help overcome the shortcomings of the old and smelly hotel rooms. The first room we got had a dirty bathroom and the second room was fairly smelly. Otherwise the location is good.

Summary Heading: One of the nicest resorts I've been to.
Summary: This is not a hotel. This is a full resort with three pools, multiple restaurants and a golf course. The price of parking was reasonable and they provided shuttles to various spots in the area. I would absolutely recommend this plac!

Had a great birthday weekend. Hotel provides bike rentals. Enjoyed a long ride on the back bay. Breakfast buffet was yummy and well stocked. Also stayed in July for my daughter's 11th birthday and had a great time with adjoining rooms. Near beaches and Fashion Island. Good location.

The check-in/out staff were the nicest I have dealt with in a long time.  This to me goes a long way when you stay at so many different hotels.  I also appreciate that when I used my free one night stay at this Hyatt they actually gave me a great room.  Typically I get the worse they have to offer.  I found this very refreshing.  The grounds of this hotel are top notch, lots of options with the pools, catering to different personalities.  It also looks like the hotel is making more improvements, this is nice to see.  I highly recommend this Hyatt, now one of my favorites.

Love this hotel so many things to do you will not be disappointed, this last trip was with the family but me and the wife have been here just the 2 of us. So you if you want a good family get away or a couples retreat this is the place.

Summary Heading: Super service and great for families
Summary: While the rooms are a bit worn (but large), the public areas and the swimming and other resort facilities are awesome for families.  I've been coming here for years and have known the place since it was Del Webb's Newporter Inn.  Service is great.  Highly recommended for families on a vacation as location is also great for sightseeing, beaches etc.  I choose it as my relatives are in the area and I grew up just down the highway in CdM so it feels like home.

Beautiful resort with nice amenities like free 2 hrs of bikes and shuttle trips. Near Orange Co Museum of Art and Balboa Islan.  On the bay so there are biking and walking paths for miles.  Not from from John Wayne Airport. Delicious food.

I have stayed at every Hyatt Regency in California except the one in the San Francisco financial district.  The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach has a much more “lived in” look than the others; but, that’s okay.  The battered look of the property is baked into the room rate, which is considerably less than the Hyatt Regency OC or the Hyatt Regency Huntington Beach.  It’s not great, but then its not the worst in the state either.  The Hyatt Regency Mission Bay holds that distinction, but that's a different review.     At the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach, I had a king room in the Balboa building which was very spacious and clean.  The layout is a bit weird as the love seat is on the same side of the room as the TV so the TV is not visible from the lovesea.  Because it is an older

Summary Heading: Visit was just okay. Nothing special.
Summary: I booked this location because of the close proximity to the beach. It isn't close. You have to drive. My family and I stayed for 5 nights. Check in was busy. 4:30 and our room wasn't ready. Didn't get into the room until 5:30. We booked pool view with two doubles. Double bed room with garden view was ready then but the room I booked wasn't available yet. Waited in line for 15 minutes to check in. Told me I wouldn't have to wait again when I came back to get the key when the room was ready, they were wrong, I had to wait again. Only two people staffed for their prime time check in time. The room we got was on the ground floor with a view of the pool gate and wall. No view of the actual pool. Told them at the first check in that we did have a car, but still had to fight to get

My husband and I have two conferences to attend in LA and San Diego, so we decided to stay here for a night using our free night voucher. The hotel is clean and modern. The room is comfortable and of a good size. It is located in an upscale neighboorhood and it is very nice to walk around the area. Front desk people are very friendly and helpful. We are happy with our stay.

The hotel rooms certainly need a facelift and a good cleaning.  We arrived to a dirty carpet, our socks were black from walking on the carpet. Made my toes curl to my knees.  Should have gone to the Marriott, across the street. The pool service of slow, but the staff was friendly.   Only thing going for this place is the location, the outside pool area and the landscaping.   It a shame because I also thought Hyatt was a step above the rest

This hotel is so over priced considering it is not even on the beach. The resort fee is $30 and the "Self" Parking is $27 and the walk to the hotel room the parking lot is extremely long. The room was small and the amenities were average. This room was nowhere near worth $349 a night. So disappointing. Thank God we did not pre pay our stay. We were scheduled to be here our entire trip of 5 nights. We checked out after first night and never regretted it.

Worst hotel experience ! They mixed up our reservations I was sent an upgrade, so I upgraded but we went from two beds to a king size bed for four people!! and then when we got there the room was horrible it look like a Motel 6. the toilet was dirty, chain was broken, the carpet was dirty. it was the smallest bathroom I've ever seen in a hotel.  i've never been so disappointed. Fancy from the front lobby, but when we walked to the Lido area it looked like We walked into a Motel 6. the guy cole at check-in was very nice, but he checked with his manager and she never came out to even talk to us even though we were clearly dissatisfied. We just stayed one night and checked out and told them our complaints, but the staff didn't really seem to care! so we checked into the Marriott

This hotel is tired.  How this Hyatt Regency has a four star rating is beyond my comprehension.  The rooms are clean but no special amenities.  Lots of children making the pool uninviting.  There were clothes left outside the room overnight everywhere at the resort.  This property appears more like a motel.

Hotel was very busy but inside my room it was totally quiet and peaceful.  Spacious, well decorated room, extremely comfortable bed, linens, and pillows -- I slept like a log.  Most of the staff were very nice, helpful, and responsive despite the mobs of people they were dealing with.  The food at our conference was delicious and the service professional.  At the busy pool the outdoor furniture was stained and covered with wadded up towels, but overall the rooms and facilities (e.g., great exercise room) were clean and nicely decorated.  It was a lovely few days.

Great Staff. Nice property. Not on the beach. Food was very good. My balcony view was of the roof with equipment on it, so not very nice. lots of great places around the property to sit and read. Excellent to print your boarding pass. Best I have ever used.

This review isn't really about the hotel, because it's just fine.  Probably a 3 or 4 Star Hyatt.  Nice clean rooms, comfortable beds, over priced food and beverages, decent pools, and good views of the Newport BackBay/Pool/Golf Course (depending on the room).  Blah, blah, blah.  Pretty normal stuff.  This review is really about a couple of people who truly make this hotel a terrific place to stay and almost single handily put it head and shoulders above the plethora of similar hotels in the area.  FYI- I'm not related to any of these people-just feel very strongly that their excellence and "above the call of duty" professionalism should be recognized, because they are what really makes this hotel a great place to stay, and they embody those qualities that make the difference

I want for a family vacation we took 2 connect rooms !  What we paid for it was not there at all rooms were old they need to remodel the rooms carpet really old and dirty cleaning was not done right stuff not very friendly and they need to hire more people specially by the pool area !

We stayed here quite a few times but this last time has caused me to lower the rating. The hotel is in a lovely location, and we found all the staff really nice and friendly. This time though we were let down by the bad odour coming from the bathroom. The smell seemed to be coming from the drains. I reported this several times and was told they would contact housekeeping. After 3 days my Husband went to the front desk to see if they really were going to do something about it. Again they said they would send someone to fix it. The first time they put salt down the drains but the smell still came back. Then I asked if they could pour some bleach down the drain. They said they would come back after we had gone out. We came back to a room smelling of no bleach but some kind of room

Summary Heading: Destination Hotel for Business or Family Vacation just minutes from the John Wayne Airport
Summary: This is a very expansive property with a tropical flair to its design.  The rooms are spread out and almost makes me wonder if this is a very old hotel that has been renovated, or at one time an upscale motel that was renovated.  The giveaway is that the rooms on the second floor are accessed by stairs, unless there is a hidden elevator somewhere that I could never find.  I was in the Lido block of rooms and there was a pool in the middle of the complex along with a fitness center.  The Newport bay is also with a short walking distance and there is also a golf course on the property.  The room I stayed in was nicely appointed, room service is 30 minutes or less with a very "healthy" menu.  Each of the rooms have a private balcony or patio.  Although I did not use it, there is a

While the hotel is in a pretty setting grounds are nicely kept they put a weiry business traveler in a double bed room directly facing the large kids pool. Not what was needed after a long day of work and travel through LA traffic.

Summary Heading: Very Nice Resort with Amenities in Newport Beach
Summary: This hotel is a great place for a wedding or family reunion. The amenities are wonderful and include a par-3 golf course, bike rentals, swimming pools, towels, beach chairs, shuffleboard, tennis and more -- all included in your resort fee. Lots of places for families to gather and a short walk to Balboa Island or Fashion Island mall. Plenty of restaurants nearby. You will love this place!

Chris Isaak concert was great (concert was right at the Hyatt's own amphitheater.  Chris Isaak played for over two hours.   Very nice crowd.   Venue is very  small (about 700-800 seats).  Tickets very reasonable.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, lots of amenities, delicious food
Summary: The title says it all! Definitely stay here when you're in Newport Beach! The restaurant food was delicious, the staff was very accommodating, even when we tried to order off the breakfast menu after they stopped serving breakfast, the waiter took our order and made it happen. The room was clean and quiet, and the grounds and surrounding area are amazing! Thanks Hyatt Recency Newport Beach!

We stayed two nights as part of an Californian road trip.   Newport Beach is an excellent place to stay with a lot of things to see and do. The hotel is nearby both Balboa Island, Fashion Island shopping and the beaches of Huntington and Newport.   The bulidings of the hotel are not the best with a mix of old style motel and barracks. Also the room was pretty drab and the bathroom was sub par with a bath tub only and  those horrendous shower curtains.   Furniture throughout is a bit cheap and staff uniforms should be changed. In fact staff did not look very well groomed.   However: Staff was well meaning and delivered excellent service.  Food in the restaurant was very good indeed and in fact better than what we got in other hotels like Hotel Bel-Air and Four Seasons Santa

Summary Heading: Our Room was robbed سرقوا الغرفة اثناء اقامتنا
Summary: I stayed at the hotel for 7 days, and my room was robbed on the last day, the window was broken and there were no safety box and a door lock from the inside. the hallway had no cameras. what was really upsetting that the hotel staff treated us unprofessionally after that. they still requested us to pay the remaining tax amount. كانت من اسوء التجارب فقط تمت سرقتنا عن طريق كسر النافذه والدخول الى الغرفة اثناء خروجنا بسبب تهاون الفندق باجراءات الامان بعدم توفير الغرفه هذه بالتحديد ب سيفتي بوكس وكانت ردود فعل موظفي الفندق سيئة جدا حيث انهم طلبوا منا دفع باقي رسوم الغرفه ( الضربية) رغم انه تم سرقة اغراض بمبلغ يتجاوز ال 10 الاف دولار.

Summary Heading: Quality room, staff, amenities all around
Summary: Being a Hyatt member, I was booked for this specific hotel due to location of several business meetings I had. Really comfortable atmosphere; staff were very welcoming when I arrived; helpful; thoughtful during my several days; very fast valet parking and vehicle retrieval; convenient restaurant and good quality food (and gluten-free items!); quiet room; and most of all -- a VERY comfortable bed and clean bathroom and carpet! :)

Summary Heading: How is this a Hyatt Regency?
Summary: While this hotel was fine for a two night stay with my kids, it should not be in the Hyatt Regency category.  It was built in the early 60's and although they have done upgrades, it's still a hotel from the 60's.  The lobby is nice, Starbucks in the am converts to a bar in the pm. Kid pool is great for kids.  There is an adult pool that I did not get to see but it's good to have that option.  The rooms are tiny and beds are tiny. I was able to get a room by the pool upon request which was a plus.  My biggest complaint are the service charges for everything.  The poolside service has a random charge on it.  The room service charge was 24%!  Seriously outrageous.  I realize the guy that brings the food gets some of that but I would rather just tip what I want.  Why charge me a

We visited during our summer holiday and had a great time. The location is good with easy driving distance to shopping and the beaches as well as the Balboa Island. Staff was friendly and helpful and the food was good.

Disappointing experience, considering the price we paid for this hotel.   Large property with multiple pools and several nearby attractions, however, terrible service and outdated rooms. Luckily, the valet service was amazing and earned this hotel one additional bubble!

Summary Heading: Way over priced for small rooms
Summary: These rooms are small for the price the charge. And the pool service is horrible. Only one person for the whole pool. Even when it's pack. And paying for a cabana doesn't help with that. We had to get our own drinks most of the time. High fees too.

We loved our stay here. Firstly the room was nice, we loved the 3 pools, and the grounds, staff were friendly and helpful and even enjoyed the odd game of suffle board and horse shoes. We would go back for sure.

My family of four stayed for 3 nights (July 2017) and it was not good at all.  First, we have two adult kids (20 and 18) and usually make it work in one room with two double beds as long as we get one roll-away.  We booked the room with a roll-away and we called two days before arrival to confirm we'd have a roll-away.  At check-in... nope... can't do a roll-away - fire hazard.  I was using my points for the stay, so she wouldn't upgrade us to a bigger room.  The room was on an outer portion of the hotel, facing the bay (not a nice view) and feeling a lot like a motel, not a resort.  The room was old;  last updated 25+ years ago; popcorn ceilings and a bathroom door that was really wooden shutters.  Everyone in the puny room could hear whatever was going on in the restroom.  The

I was not impressed with the rooms ( dirty carpet, so bad my white socks were black on the bottom from walking on the carpet) The service was slow and not on spot.  The outside pool area with the best feature.

My wife and I needed a break from the desert heat, and the Hyatt Newport was the perfect answer.  Good weather, and cool for the summertime; beautiful setting with three swimming pools; friendly lounges; excellent dinner house with thick pieces of salmon and halibut.

WAY over priced for the quality of a heap motel. $24.99 for a 5 oz container of sunscreen...SERIOSULY? Plus the Hertz car rental was closed on the weekend...REALLY??? Drinks and food WAY over priced as well. Service was sub par ESPECIALLY for the room rate. My air conditioning leaked the entire time. Went to front desk and still nothing was done.

The hotel is in the best possible location for access to the beaches, shopping, boating, biking and running. It is located between the back bay and Fashion Island shopping center.The grounds, room and pool areas needed a good and continuous cleaning.

We arrived and the line was very long for check-in at 4 pm.  They couldn't accommodate our request for an early check-in.  We booked through Southwest and the room itself was fine, the building was very old and not appealing.  There is the Balboa Building and the Catalina Building which are very aesthetically pleasing, we were in the Lido Building which looks old and I definitely felt like we were in the discounted section.   The other buildings were beautiful and the grounds were very tropical and pretty to walk around.  There were 3 different pools and our family enjoyed the kids area pool.  The restaurants looked very nice too.  I would just recommend staying at a different building.

Beautifully manicured and well kept hotel in Newport Beach.  With or without a vehicle, you can Uber to the Fashion Island to shop or beach/swim to Balboa Island or Crystal Cove.  Lots to do and see in the area.  3 pools with great pool service and excellent food with good variety (healthy and not so healthy).  Suggest to opt for floor room with walk out balcony for second access door.  Weight room is great - really good equipment with lots of freestyle options and clean.  Only ordered room service once which was excellent.   Concierge staff are OUTSTANDING.  Chloe is SO HELPFUL!!  Love her.  She basically planned our 4 days with me when we arrived and everything worked out perfectly.  She knows the area well and provides honest suggestions based on age of family and activity

Great cozy hotel with reasonable pricing for Newport Beach.  Close to Fashion Island and also Balboa Island.  Walking trails behind hotel and great activities included in resort fee, like 9 hole golf and renting bikes.

This hotel at Newport Beach, was selected to the end of our California trip. We had the best time. The service was very good. Maybe the best in our vacation. The room was big, and had all you needed. The food in the restaurant was great. The pools, fitnes room and internet access was all best in class. The only thing that was not ok, was the planes going over the hotel every 5-7min. But the hotel is not to blame for that. We had a good time.

Summary Heading: Great family place.  Great service in restaurant.
Summary: We came with the family for a great time. You can walk to Balboa Island but the kids and grandkids decided to stay at the hotel. They loved the kids pool. There is a water slide, ping pong, games all around the pool.  Pool waitress with great attitudes. We rented a cabana (bit expensive but worth it to have all day shade).  It same with an ice chest of ice and a fruit plate.   First night we ate alone at the onsite Shor Restaurant. Food was wonderful!  Service even better!!  (ask for Robert with an English accent).  I had salmon that was outstanding. Husband had an eclectic combo of foie gras and then a bowl of tortilla soup.   Jazz music is happening on the lawn on Fridays.  Sounded great but boy did the hotel lobby fill!  Go later for dinner, buy tickets for the concert or do

Great hotel near Newport Beach and Back Bay. Very walkable hotel, close to Balboa Island and shopping. Hotel van will take you to Fashion Island,Airport, and drop off near bridge of Balboa Island. Never rented a car, using the hotel van and Uber..

This was an overall bad experience: $27/day to self parking; $26/day resort fee/ rooms are not cheap. Food service was not consistent- wait person would take order and disappear-then come back the food that was either

Summary Heading: Front desk staff & facility makeover required
Summary: I don't usually write something unless it's an incredible experience and on an extreme rare occasion will I write a negative review. Unfortunately the later is true in this case. Overall the property in my opinion needs an extreme makeover. They need to gut the rooms and update the walls and ventilation. The layout is not great for rooms that do not face into the property and they need to rethink where and how rooms face. The valet, bell and bar staff was awesome but unfortunately the front desk situation overall and treatment requires greater training on how to care for customers. As a regular 4 and 5 star accommodation biz traveler on the road almost weekly - for a Hyatt - this disappoints on several levels

excellent resort close to shopping etc.  near airport, short ride to beaches, close to many restaurant choices.  Recently renovated, Very quiet, comfortable and able to accommodate from families to road warriors.  Many satisfactory stays over a 20 year period.

Summary Heading: Nice family get away in Newport!!
Summary: I would love to go to Hawaii every weekend, but needed a quicker and more realistic option for a local resort for the family for the weekend. This hotel was very local and had many offerings which reminded us of the island resorts.  3 heated pools with jacuzzi, water slide for kids, water splash pad area for kids, shuffle board, outdoor lawn chess board, were all things we enjoyed.  In addition it allowed us to enjoy the beautiful Newport beaches a short drive away. The hotel also offered shuttle service to nearby Fashion Island and golfing, but we did not have time to take advantage of that.   The hotel had beautiful grounds and there was actually a wedding ceremony occurring while we were there.  Beautiful water fountain, palm trees, manicured grounds, flowers, etc.  you can

Hotel is located in a central Newport Beach location. You have to drive to the beach, short walk to Fashion Island and Balboa Island.  The hotel was clean but dated. Needs upgrading to be on par with other high end hotels in the area.

Billed and priced as a resort, but it isn't. Looks like an old Holiday Inn that's been refurbished. Clean enough, but disappointing. Certainly not up to Hyatt standards in my opinion. I've been frequenting Hyatt's for a long time and would have thought I'd be given a preferred room...I wasn't and I wasn't acknowledged as a member at check-in.

The Newporter has been a favorite of ours for many years.  I did request the balboa building when we booked the room but did not get that building.  The grounds are always kept up very well and the fireworks were great.  This year, however, it was pretty hard to sleep comfortably.  The hotel should spend some money on sheets that stay put!!! It sounds silly but the sheets bunch up and come undone.

Summary Heading: Nice family vacation at a perfect location
Summary: Hyatt Regancy is a perfect place if you want to combine a family vacation with the attractions of Newport Beach and OC. Located 10 minutes by feet from Balboa Island or Fashion Island you are footsteps away from the points of interest.

Went for a little weekend getaway with the wife for her birthday. Top notch on everything, food, service, valet, rooms, pool, just a great experience and super convenient with fashion island right around the corner. We slept like babies!

I stayed here because of Eric Marienthal's High Hopes concert.  Please continue to host his concerts and I'll be making a habit of getting a room for the night so that I can attend his concerts there for subsequent years.

As a local Orange County resident, I've been to this hotel, at least 40 times, since the first time I attended a Summer Series concert, in 1996. This year, however, I needed not to purchase concert tickets; instead, I rented a room, with an upgrade to a King suite with a balcony and partial view of the stage.   My 3 daughters; two/9-year old twin grandchildren and I had the best time and the experience was so much more than we all expected.  The room was beautiful; immaculate and recently renovated…I think in 2014…very nice.  Our view of the stage was awesome, and we heard the concert, perfectly.  Of course, we couldn't clearly hear the artist's introduction of each song, but that was okay, LOL. The breeze that came across that balcony, the beautiful palm trees and lovely

If you like to walk a half a mile up and down stairs and in and around walkways to get to the parking lot this is the place for you and you pay $27 for the privilege.  The room was dark one very old with no circulation unless you left the front door open. The jets from John Wayne airport were right overhead and were taking off and landing from about 8 am on. What a dump!

Very clean hotel, spacious rooms and bathrooms. Great location and the grounds and pool are very nice. I would stay here again. Restaurant food and staff were great. Nice lobby and bar area. Parking was easy.

I would recommend this hotel. As with any travel you do, there are pros and cons. However the pros far outweigh the cons. Pros: very clean hotel. The room was clean and good size ( had a 2-queen room). The beds were comfortable and bathroom water pressure very good. They have multiple pools and a water slide. The grounds are beautiful. They have a small par 3 golf course attached (free for guests) shuffle board and life size chess game.  The location us great. Very close to Fashion Island (3 min ride) and Balboa Island. It is on the slower side of Newport Beach. They offer a free shuttle to air port, mall and balboa island.  The cons: the water slide does not go into the pool and the hotel offers free bike rentals but the bikes are old and heavy beach cruisers. The service at

This is an older hotel but in a really great location close to Fashion Island and the beach.  Our room was clean but it was older style and not updated in some time. Air conditioning was added later from a wall unit and did not circulate well in the room.  The lobby and bar area has lots of sitting and relaxing areas. This was a nice touch.  Pool area is large and very busy as it has multiple slides and attractions for kids to keep busy

Clean, expensive, great great great location. Near play area called Newport Dunes, pools are super too. The rooms are well maintained and the front desk staff girl got us in a bit early after a long trip. Parking ridiculously expensive if you have a car.

Poor F& B pool service. Property common areas were not clean. It appeared that the property was poorly staffed for a busy holiday. We were told by service staff that they were working 6-7 days. Better planning and recovery from the 4th would be in order.

We stayed for one dreadful night. Toilet backed up in the bathroom. Asked for a elevator building, as walking long distances is difficult for me. Put in elevator building, with our room farthest from the elevator. Halls and room depressing. Second and last experience at the Hyatt brand

This is actually the worst Hyatt I've ever stayed in. Staff is friendly so nothing to do with them. The property itself is old & looks way outdated. Rooms are small, beds are tiny & uncomfortable. Pool is average with a small slide for the kids. It is located in a nice area but this property needs some serious overhaul. Unfortunate too, I was really looking forward to this Hyatt

Summary Heading: No blankets and no running water
Summary: They ran out of blanketsat night and claimed that they ran out. Dirty blankets and sheets pulled but were not replaced. In the moring the hotel had no running water. Were not able to use shower and toilet

Did not meat our expectations check in was not a good experience room wasn't ready even when we returned they wouldn't store we asked the first to store our luggage and they said they couldn't do that so we had to carry them back to the car until we returned

Although the facility was nice and looked to be well kept, there are some buildings where you do not want your room to be at.  The main buildings seem to be clear and rooms looked decent but when you get to the bungalow area , the "Bay" building forget it.  Noise everywhere, tight quarters and no privacy.

Not what I was expecting of a hyatt. Staff just couldn't handle the holiday and food and service reflected that. Should be more prepared for a busy time. The lifeguards being so nice to my kids were the one positive of the trip.

Hyatt Regency in Newport is a great place for family. They have multiple pools which is great because if you want to have some adult peaceful time then you can enjoy yourself in one of the adult only pools. I personally love the Hyatt for its pet friendly policy. The views from the balconies are great and very peaceful.

Constance Lewis at the front desk really went out of her way to help me on a  few occasions during my stay.  Her helpfulness and attitude is a real example of what a first class company does to endear its customers!I

Summary Heading: WAS NOT HAPPY WITH OUR ROOM UPGRADE
Summary: We were there staying for a wedding we upgraded our room which i don't believe was much of an up grade that i paid extra for then the other guest in our party. I had asked if we could get our room changed because we were no where near our family and way in the back. But they said we couldn't. I nor was our family to happy. For the price we paid and the dollar amount of food,drinks and not to mention PARKING i expected  more.

From the complimentary shuttle to check-in and the beautiful property...amazing stay for a birthday celebration! 3 beautiful and clean swimming pools with hot tubs!! I just can't say enough about our stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach.

Two of my daughters and I stayed here overnight as a quick staycation.  I was lured by the location, pools and activities.  We arrived early, our room wasn't ready so we went to the pool.  When we went to our room, we were given one king bed although we had been told at desk it was two doubles.  They moved us to another room, unfortunately it was in a much louder section of the hotel.  My kids were excited to go to Balboa Island for Balboa Bars, but the shuttle did not run every hour as we were told, apparently it runs every other hour because when we went down at 3:20 we were told that the next shuttle was at 4:30.  After dinner at a nearby restaurant, we went down to watch the movie at the pool.  Unfortunately, between the wedding reception at the hotel and a concert at the

From the friendly receptionist to the staff at breakfast service was amazing. Its a beautiful resort.  I had a room with the view of the water.  Its a large resort.  The best rooms are in the main building.  The bar is lively with excellent service.  We ate at the pool, good selection of the menu and not overpriced. There are several pools scattered through out the property.  The gym is also well equipped.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for family and just to get away
Summary: I went to this hotel to get away and while I was there enjoyed pitch and putt golf shuffleboard giant chess board horse shoes. Pool is great. While I was there ran into a couple getting married a couple celebrating there anniversary from Canada and had fun all around

Really wanted to like this place, but outside of the lovely grounds surrounding the hotel there was little to enjoy.  Thin walls made our position on the 2nd floor not a happy place. Hearing our upstairs neighbors every flush kinda took the spark out of me and my wife's little getaway. Not to mention hearing conversations of people outside, next door, and in the hall. Took about 2 hours to go to sleep on a Friday night. My dorm room in college had thicker walls than this. Didn't think to bring earplugs, because who thought I would need them at a "resort".  Secondly, didn't really appreciate the shake down. Eggs and bacon $18.  Most restaurants here would be embarrassed to charge $10 for a bowl of oatmeal. Not here. And two large invisible fees were tacked on to the room price.

Expected to pay a much steeper price.  Hotel is somewhat dated (depends on zone selected) but clean and updated with amenities.  Newport Coast is withing walking distance (20 minutes); Balboa Island Ferry not much further. Only prep: If carrying your bags expect a bit of a hike over stairs.

This very crowded, large resort is probably good for large crowds and families but not a romantic get away for couples. It has swimming pools that are lovely but it depends which room you book as to whether it is a quiet pool or full of kids. You have to drive everywhere, to beaches, restaurants, etc.

Summary Heading: California dreaming is just what this was. From Las Vegas and escaped the heat was just what we were looking for
Summary: Best California vacation ever beautiful weather beautiful room and property to walk around.  We had an amazing time and staff was very on top of everything.  Love Hyatt regency Newport Beach    The valet was also amazing and check in check out very fast.  You are a hidden secret in California

Summary Heading: A Newport Hotel by the bay
Summary: The best part of the Hotel ,for me, was the Upper Newport Ecological Preserve located in the back of the property!  It was easily accessed and proved to be a great place for walking, biking and roller blading. Additionally, the shuttle to the Fashion Mall and Balboa Island were wonderful.

This hotel is in an unbeatable location for all the local attractions.  The property seems always to be busy, so service can seem rather impersonal, though Chloe and her colleagues at the concierge desk were always exceptionally helpful and friendly. Rooms are large and very clean and the bed comfortable.  Plane noise can be annoying when you are by the pool.   Still unimpressed by the quality of the food available, certainly doesn't warrant the price and the menu doesn't seem to change from year to year. Extra charges such as the daily resort charge and $27 a day for car parking can bump up the cost of your holiday quite considerably, though if you hire a car from the Hertz office on the property you do at least save the cost of parking.  The hotel shuttle can be very

If I tell you I may not have a room next time. Seriously, the personnel and service was as good as it gets.  このホテルこのせかいいちばん。ひとgょう。食べ物美味しい。H位gとわsともだち嬉しいホテル。Dおモアs離合後財務。   Only complaint is that I am required to utilize a minimum of 200 words on this survey.

Summary Heading: Not my expectations for a Hyatt resort
Summary: Glorified motel experience but for quality of food at the shors.  Would not recommend.  Colleague waiting for me to share experience prior to her booking and I told her to go to mission San Diego instead.

If you are looking to stay at an upscale Hyatt property near the beach, I recommend the Hyatt Regency Huntington Beach as this property is nothing more than a glorified motor lodge.  The suite we booked was a good size, but in disrepair.  The walls were dirty, furniture was scratched and torn, a sofa was oddly placed in front of a large Armoire, and the room had a musty smell and cobwebs.  There is no central air, and the hotel is directly under the flight path of John Wayne airport so there is constant noise from 8:00 AM until 10:00 PM.  The kicker however was the large raccoon that was roaming the corridor outside my room.  My experience felt more like a Motel 6 than a luxury resort in Newport Beach

I'd rate this place somewhere between good and very good. Property was very pretty. Room was nice and clean w/ a balcony and view of pool. But smokers were everywhere and made being outside miserable.

This is fabulously located hotel with a warm friendly vibe. Sadly the quality and price point of food and beverage doesn't make it a go to place. The area is surrounded by dozens of much better places for your dining.

Excellent in every way!  The Hyatt is close to Balboa Island and many other places.  The Hyatt Summer Concert series is the best and we always have a great time.  I would definitely recommend this vacation to anyone who wants to get away and have a great time.

Summary Heading: 4 Star Service at a plain ole conference
Summary: The gorgeously landscaped Hyatt Regency spread out above a charming marina was a delightful surprise when I accompanied the hubs to a routine annual professional conference. From valet to gracious check in we were treated exceptionally well. Ben gave us a lovely poolside room (there are 3 pools) and I, princess that I am could not tolerate the mild but ever-presrnt piped in music.  Ashley kindly and quickly re-roomed us to a quiet spot in the back  (Room 263). Great marina views and blissfully free of muzak. We asked for late check out so hubs could finish his business and Cole kindly accommodated. Nice room, spectacular and classic SoCal landscaping and impeccable hospitality. Just what this demanding guest loves! Hats off to great employee training, dear Hyatt management

First impression at check in ... they use too small of a space and not enough staff. Waited in line for almost 1/2 an hour.    Inside bar area also small.  Lots of outside space ... but not comfortable in the heat.    Lots of history stored on this property ... John Wayne wine cellar etc!   Banquet staff was very helpful and their service excellent.    If you stay here ... be sure you use the pools, golf or something ... you pay a Resort Fee every day you are there ... !!!!  Bathroom doors in your room are dicey!!

Summary Heading: A California Visit w/my sister for my 60th birthday
Summary: I'll start by saying that the registration employees were nice.  BUT the hotel website is misleading to say the least and the rooms are small, smell a bit strange, have low popcorn ceilings and the ac is not central - didn't turn on at night (I felt like I was in a motel 6 room).  The bathroom was tiny, tiny - bath rub w/shower, toilet in center w/sink next to it & not even a real door ... had a sliding door - so much for privacy! The hotel is old - we were told it was renovated in 2013 but if it was, they only added some molding in the rooms but it still feels old.  We upgraded to a balcony room - the first room w/balcony overlooked the parking lot.  Seriously ... that was an upgrade.  So we switched rooms & had a view of basically the same thing except it was in the main

So.. bartenders are cool, they tell you the story of the hotel.. past patrons and all. Valet workers have no name tags.. the security guard or whatever he does here who also said he only has two years invested in this hotel and has never been in a situation where a patron ( my friend and I ) who have been unsure of employees who don't have name tags. Basically, I'm supposed to assume everyone works here. Name tags help. It gives people visiting some sort of sense of security, but I guess the lack of customer service nowadays precedes service. I may be old school but if you have a uniform and name tag-- I will assume you work for the hotel. My bad. Hotel rooms are decent. Smell a bit strange, but are very clean. The ac is not central, it makes interesting noises. My toilet faces

Stayed here for a family wedding, hotel was beautiful. Luxurious facilities, several pools and jacuzzis, wonderful gardens, loved it here. There was a bar that served Starbucks coffee in the morning and breakfast bits which then served alcohol at night, which was reasonably priced for the fact Orange County is one of the most expensive places in the US. Our rooms were huge and tastefully decorated with all the amenities you needed. Would 100% stay here again!

Summary Heading: Hyatt Newport has upped there customer service game
Summary: I've stayed at this property many of times and have never had the level of customer service I did this trip. The staff went above and beyond. Looking forward to me next stay here.  Don't forget to ask for a cookie when you check in

Summary Heading: If you like bugs, outdated rooms and sneaky this place is for you.
Summary: Visited this location on a business trip, very disappointing. Bugs in the room, outdated and dirty rooms, and sneaky billing. I talked to the front desk, management and customer services, without satisfaction. Left messages and never received call backs.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel with good pool areas....
Summary: This hotel fulfilled our expectations, nice rooms, decent size. We stayed in the Bilbao building facing the pool. You can borrow bikes free for 2 hours, this was really nice. You can take the bike to some really good breakfast places around the hotel, within 2km lots of good places.

The hotel is very nice and clean.  The pool is great!  The restaurant and cafe on site were very good as well.  It is in a pretty great location; not far from the beach and about a 30 minute drive from Disneyland.  I'd stay here again.

This Hyatt Regency is not a new hotel, however, it has gorgeous grounds and very helpful service. Both the wifi and air-conditioning worked well. It met our needs. The property is rather large which provides for some nice walks.

Ok hotel other than the silly and expensive   resort fee.   If you don't have a choice, just build it into the rate.   On the plus side the internet service worked way better than most hotels....plenty strong signal everywhere and my vpn stayed connected consistently.  Parking is far and stupid expensive   Otherwise a nice stay.

The three story units were not as peaceful and relaxing as the beautiful location. The property is family friendly and the children in the unit above me ran around the room starting at 7 am. Ask for the third floor.

In choosing this hotel, I looked at the pictures on their website very carefully. Nowhere did I see rooms looking anything like this. There are better locations within the hotel but not many of them. Incredibly, I paid an up charge for this location!   On the bright side, the staff is friendly and helpful.

Visiting our daughter's birthday celebration, I decided to stay at this hotel again (my wife and I spent three weeks last February) since it's location is just perfect for our purpose. The reception was able to secure the same room (Lido # 280). The shuttle driver was very accommodating and following the short ride, the C/I was quick and friendly; it's nice to be recognized as a repeat guest. Enjoyed two rounds at the short par three golf course which was very well maintained. Can not say enough good things about the staff and the service at this Hyatt Hotel. A very pleasant return visit.

When you check in after being greeted by very nice staff, you anticipate a great experience.  As I walked to the Balboa wing to where my room was that expectation slowly diminished.  It looked like an older hotel.  My room had that musty tropical scent to it.  Rooms compared to other Hyatt Regencys I've stayed at are in desperate need of updating.  At night there were guests in another building near mine with ground floor rooms that opened to lawn and they were having a party outside and in.  Looked like fun, but if I was in room next to them I would have been livid if I wanted to sleep.  My guess is that this is not best place Newport Beach has to offer.

Summary Heading: Great room, dirty, overpriced, unremarkable hotel
Summary: If you're a family with kids that want to swim in a big pool, you'll be happy here. This hotel is noisy, the grounds are unremarkable, the pool area was full of piles of dirty towels all the time. Loud drunks walking past my room at 2AM, 4AM, 6AM. My room was surprisingly nice, but the rest of the hotel was dingy and laid out more like a Motel 6 than a luxury hotel. The nearby Marriott is 100 times nicer - and the rates are similar.

The hotel that's OK felt like it needed to be a little bit update it room was nice clean drinks by the pool over horrible felt like the waterside should've stayed open later a lot of the guest were upset about it

Do not waste your money here.  - our room was not cleaned for 4 days (despite using the 'cleaning requested' hanger for the door) we did call and someone called mark answered yet didn't apologise - brown stains on the bedding - shower barely worked and the water did not drain - sink drain smelt absolutely vile - stupidly expensive valet parking fees (self parking was too far away)  - overpriced food and drink - the maids have absolutely no consideration (our room was outside a store cupboard) and they were playing music at 7am yet still didn't clean our room! - the walls here are insanely thin, we heard everything from guests either side of us (due to all rooms being connecting) and especially the very noisy people above us - they have conferences and weddings quite often so

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort -Sets high standards for hotels in Newport
Summary: We came here for my friends wedding as she reserved a group rate so the cost was pretty good considering how beautiful this hotel was and how many amenities it had! We saw (but sadly didn't get to enjoy) 3 pool areas, property games, golf course and beautiful garden grounds overall. In addition the rooms are nice and spacious. My husband and I loved the fact that we were so close to the shopping areas, restaurants and beach. More than anything we were a 5-10 minute drive to where our friend hosted her wedding on a yacht. I will definitely stay here again next time i'm in Newport.

Summary Heading: Not much bang for the buck
Summary: Although they charge twice the price of the Hampton Inn, I felt that their overall service was only half as good.  They are apparently very short-staffed when it comes to personnel to help with luggage, and are (what I considered to be) not very apologetic about telling you that you will just "have to wait" (or else carry your bags up to your room yourself, WITHOUT allowing you to use one of their luggage carts -- which in my opinion is far more likely to result in you injuring yourself, than if you were allowed to use the cart).  Also -- if, at check-in, you are asked if you would like a room near the elevator (or if they ask if that is OK with you) -- you would be well-advised to say "No."  Their elevator makes so much noise in the rooms that are anywhere near it that it is

We just stayed here this week and loved it. We have two kids ages 5 and 2. We liked the pool area, which had a slide, games (corn hole, mini golf, etc) and a hot tub that wasn't too hot. They had a crib available, which is crucial for us. The biggest positive I've of this resort is that it is located on the back bay, which is phenomenally better for young kids (no waves, but still has water and beach). We would stay here again!

The hotel is good but far from Town We enjoyed our breakfast, cooked to perfection. Buffet not many options but they have an extra menu for freshly cooked breakfast which was the highlight of our stay.   We stayed near the gym and hot outdoor jacuzzi, access to gym 24 hours what more do you need when you have a toddler ! You can go at any convenient time! The hotel is slightly big and has various pools and access...  Overall I can't fault this hotel. Perhaps is slightly tired, but overall is good.   Slightly on Pricey side for what you get but it's perhaps California prices.

Summary Heading: Ridiculous Parking Fees, Far Away Parking, Shocking Resort Fees and Poor Deposit Policy
Summary: I would advise nobody to stay here.   Where do I start? I checked in 5 hours ago and already I know I will never come back!  I have been touring California for nearly 3 weeks and this is a hotel I wish I never booked.   On arrival I found myself riding up to the entrance where you find yourself being surrounded by valet parkers. I will be in and out of this hotel various times during the day, therefore I just want to park the car myself. I'm not here to spend anytime in the resort as I have other business in the area. I was directed to the self parking area which is way out of the way and quite far to carry two fifty pound luggage bags, a vanity box and a bag with some supplies. They also don't have elevators which is even more annoying.   So apart from having to do what felt

This Hyatt was beautiful, our room was nice and clean and had lovely view of Newport's back bay.  The Shore Restaurant dinner was great; the bar was busy but $13 can of beer was ridiculous. Pools are wonderful!

First: The concierge, Chloe, is FABULOUS.   Now that that's out of the way, I can go on properly. Unfortunately we stayed during an unusual cold/rainy spell. But we made the best of it with great friends. Rooms ok. It definitely feels reminiscent of an older, 60s hotel in structure. Bathrooms are ok. Again... older in terms of limiting what could be done in the space available.   Solid staff. Solid food. Good overall.

Room which was booked, was at 5.00PM no more availble due to overbooking. The alternative was not ok; I would have preferred my booked room instead of a discount to the fare. Next morning soap was taken away; the benefits of the resort charges of 25,- Dollars per day were not given the 2nd day. Worst Treatment in a Hotel since years.

This is a nice hotel with well kept grounds in a nice area but the room quality very varies. The hotel is not very  handicap friendly to say the least. and self parking is such an extremely far walk it doesn't feel like your car is even parked at the hotel so if you are traveling with small kids it could be difficult. Some staff was great others were very cold and rude.

Summary Heading: Fun Place for a Family Trip
Summary: Our room, facing onto the golf course, was pleasantly furnished and quiet. There are 3 pools - 1 for kids and families with a water slide and fountains, 1 less busy and with fewer amenities, and 1 small pool for quiet relaxation. Shuffle board, giant chess board and other games to keep the kids busy. We enjoyed a short game on the 9-hole pitch and putt course. We had expensive fruity cocktails in the bar one afternoon, and a nice breakfast on the patio one morning. There was a 3-day Indian wedding underway during our visit on Memorial Day weekend, which made for a busy and noisy environment, but it was fun to see all of the happy people in their beautiful traditional dress.   The parking situation is not optimum. You can park temporarily at the front entrance to unload your car;

Summary Heading: lovely grounds but room was not deluxe at all
Summary: room smelled musty, chips in bathtub, tape on pipe in walkway outside, just looks like an old building that has seen better days, the grounds are nice but parking is very far from your room, pools are nice

We stayed here for a quick getaway - to enjoy Newport, rent a Duffy boat on Balboa, and relax.  The Hyatt Regency is in a wonderful location to do all that and more.  They offer fun services like bike rental and golf, in addition to beautiful grounds and nice pool areas.

Summary Heading: Not a relaxing stay as I expected. Get only free breakfast as globalist
Summary: This is a resort, I expected to have a relaxing stay, unfortunately it was not. The hotel seems have bunch of people for event. The check in was not easy, I requested higher floor in my profile, but it seems the agent was not properly set up. Since this is a resort, I was expected she would at least give some info to me regarding the things to do of benefit as the resort fee paid to. Unfortunately she was not bothering give me any detail. I was also surprisingly knowing as a globalist member of Hyatt, I only get a breakfast, there is no lounge or anything I get as promised by the term. It was supposed that I got 2500 points when no lounge when it was Gold Passport, sigh. Anyway, when I moved to my room. I was confused with their room lock, it seems like reject the card by

Not the relaxing experience we were hoping for--Room (#711) smelled like urine, only 3 bath towels for a family of 4, pool slide closed at 5:00 so due to lines during 4:00 check in kids couldn't use slide, no golf balls in putting area, broken glass shards in pool area, expensive parking (should be included with resort fee) $16 sangria (one glass)--for the same price I'll spend my money elsewhere.

Staff here is excellent. We appreciate the dog friendliness but kind of bummed about having to be near the family pool because we have a dog. It is LOUD by the family pool. Otherwise our stay was great and we'll hopefully be back. The pools and amenities are wonderful. Great restaurant. Clean gorgeous grounds. As with most hotels here, be prepared to pay extra for parking, resort fee, dog, etc. Worth it.

Disappointed the phone didn't work for my wake up call. I had called on that same phone to set the call so it did work when I checked in. The AC was not working, difficult to sleep. Upon check out I informed the front desk and they did not offer to compensate anything for my troubles with both the phone and AC issue. Just disappointed. We stay at Hyatt hotels often. This is the first time we've had an issue that was not taken care of in any way. Even the smallest effort would be nice - a free bottle of water - anything! But with no effort, that goes even further with how we remember a hotel. We still like Hyatt hotels, just not this one.

In February my husband and I decided to book a trip  to Newport Beach. Friends of ours told us to stay here at the Hyatt Regency. When we checked in we felt very unwelcome it was not kid friendly at all. My kids wanted to go straight to the waterside when we checked in they told us that it would be open the next day. When we got up the next day to go they told us it was broken down. So we never got on the waterslide we ended up canceling our 4 night stay to a one night staywent to Disneyland instead. It was not close to the beach which we thought it was. And it was very  unaccommodating to families .

The Staff was absolutely amazing from the front desk to housekeeping.   The was an emergency in my room. Security handled it remarkably.   The Staff was always friendly every I ran into them.   The housekeeping was fantastic.

I spend over 300 a night only to be put by the pool area. I had to walk for 5 min to get to my room. Parking is 36 dollars a night. (Valet) there was no food or beverage available in the room and the beds and pillows were really terrible. Probably the worst experience I ever had in the hotel. The nicest people were the valet.

Rooms were nicely updated, but the property is also very spread out. My room was far away from the conference room location. Nice walk, but not too convenient. Also, if you're in the Lido building, be prepared to hear the lawn mower all the time, practically daily it seems. Long lines for check-in and out.

Long wait time to check in. Given a room in a busy corner (625 Bay). Guests walk up and down that corner to get to the bar/lounge-very disruptive of sleep. Food good, for room service, housekeeping staff did not remove tray left outside the whole day. Jacuzzi out of service Good location.

The catering food and service was great. I had to give a poor rating for sleep quality as the beds were fine, but the connecting doors are not insulated or sealed (light shone through around the door) and all the conversations and noise from the adjoining room is amplified so you hear everything loud and clear from next door through the night. Sleep quality was greatly diminished with that intrusion.

This is my 15th year coming to the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for the 3 day jazz event. The show was off the chain, but the hotel was excellent also, the staff, rooms, & restaurant are Great, for a great experience stay there.

Staff and services were very good; however, the accommodations (rooms) don't live up to resort price. Balcony dirty sliding door difficult to open/close. Balcony rail and furniture dirty no trash receptacle in suite; had to ask for bag for trash.

Being a member has no benefit when you stay for this particular weekend (jazz affair).  You can't use your points, you can't get in to the concert venue any earlier than any other guest, you can't get a discount on the room at all and you can't get any upgrades.  The Hyatt in San Diego will be hosting a 3-day affair in early July which I will be attending. They allow points to be used towards the rooms and their rooms are significantly less expensive.

We had a great weekend. We always enjoy this hotel. The venue at the Hyatt was great for the jazz festival. We are definitely coming back next year. The experience our family had this weekend was one of great memories. We'll be back for the summer series concerts this summer.

The grounds are well manicured! You must visit the pool areas! Shor Resturant has great food! I was there for the Hyatt Newport Beach Jazz Festival.  The concert was nice; there were two stages. I stay at the property for ease and convenience.

Staff not on same page with event taking place there False and incorrect information that I would term "Bait and Switch" which is not only illegal but morally disturbing  Promoting PACKAGE that includes entrance into event then finding out from event personnel that it wasn't  This was a question I asked upon booking room and then 2 months later asking hotel event coordinator (Shelly) who CONFIRMED YES and day of checking in by FRONT DESK also CONFIRMING YES WOW???

Summary Heading: Hyatt Newport Beach for Jazz Festival
Summary: The hotel itself and its staff were the best.  My wife and I were their for a jazz festival on the hotel grounds for 3 days and couldn't think of a better place to be.  Service was off the hook.  Food was always good, fresh and hot.  Rooms was clean and easy to get to.

Newport Beach is a fantastic location and the hotel had a wonderful atmosphere for this weekend - Newport Jazz Festival, however the rooms are not large enough.  Need separate bedroom area from entertainment area.

I  attended the annual Jazz Festival weekend. The options for food and beverage were plentiful and the staff attentive. The grounds were beautiful and lots of activities on the property as well as close by.

I had an amazing time!!! The accommodations were excellent, the  atmosphere was wonderful and the collection of jazz artists impeccable I had a wonderful wonderful time. I be back next year!!!  Well done  Hyatt !!

Front desk personnel needs training in "How to treat every customer"...  Maybe they can be sent to the Marriott personnel training. The amount of money being spent on the rooms deserved trained personnel who knows how to treat guest at a minimum.  Unorganized chaos.  They appear to want your money yet, you will get nothing in return even if you were asking for directions or events at the hotel.

Not a great place for a family of 4, unless you reserve more than 1 room.  Rates are steep for a 1 room, 2 double beds, gives a very cramped feel.  Would consider coming back if it was only the Wife and I.

My family and I love this place! We travel to Newport Beach frequently and have stayed many places.  Hyatt Regency is terrific for our needs! We have 3 young children and the hotel has fun things to keep us busy.  The restaurant is delicious. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The rooms are quiet enough so that the outside noise doesn't wake the kids and they kids don't disturb others.  Walking distance to Balboa Island and up the street from Coast Highway, it's a great location!

It's was perfect for my birthday getaway! Room was perfect and the view was awesome! Just wish the front desk staff would have made it feel more that a home being in a world of Hyatt member! But oh well

Summary Heading: Wonderful high school reunion with best friends
Summary: we met at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for three days and two nights.   Really enjoyed  chatting by the pool at the fire pit.    Beds were super comfortable    We had a  View of the bay  from our rooms.    Thank you Hyatt for a wonderful time

I had a great time over the weekend at the Hyatt for Mother's Day weekend. The hotel was able to check us in early at 10am and place my two other friends in rooms close by. To get the early check in we did have to forfeit a king size bed for 2 full size, but I was ok with that.   The pool area was nice. Super kid friendly. The drinks and food was delicious. The options for pool side food was average. Some of the options were Quesadillas, sandwiches, hummus, burger, shrimp cocktail. It seems like the typical pool food. There was only one pool staff available that day working 3 pool areas so ordering did take a while. Hopefully they hire more pool staff for the summer.   The Mother's Day Brunch was superb. I believe it was $85 pp for AYCE and bottomless mimosas. The options seemed

Highly enjoyable hotel with a great location, close to the Balboa island, Fashion island, UC Irvine. Excellent food, excellent service and very friendly staff. Great for work and pleasure. A place to come back to.

Summary Heading: Good thing I was more tired than this hotel.
Summary: 11:30p after a long work-day.  Checked in and sent to an outlying building, in the dark, with several flights of stairs to navigate with luggage.  Room unlivable.  Saga.  Wait on hold for reception - 15 minutes.  Wait for maintenance to come and confirm that there is an actual water main break (didn't believe me?) - 15 minutes.  Moved rooms (remember, it's now 12:45a) but the guy didn't have keys for me.  Do I want to come get a key at the front desk 1/2 mile away?  Um, no.    Next morning go to coffee (1/4 mi), get key.  Back to room (1/4 mi) do the keys work?  No.  Back.  More keys.  Back to room.    By the way, each trip to reception was easily a 10 minute wait because of poor staffing.  Ridiculous.

What a place to stay in Newport Beach!   We were there for 9 nights for business and it was perfect for us!  Rooms were nice and clean.  Pools were great too!  3 choices of pools from Family fun with a waterslide, to a quiet pool with a hot tub area.  Bar and lounge were cool and comfortable with great food, drinks and service!  Outdoor patio area with lounge seating and an awesome 'firepit' that was about 20 feet long!   If I go back to Newport, this will be my home.   Thanks Hyatt!

I recently stayed at this Hyatt during a short business trip.  The rooms were very clean and the bed and pillows ultra comfortable.  The grounds were very pretty and well kept. Lots of flowers and well manicured lawns. The weather was a little chilly and we enjoyed sitting by the fire pits. The staff was absolutely wonderful across the board from front desk to housekeeping. One morning I was having issues with my cell phone. The waiter who served our lunch the previous day not only recognized me but also noticed that I was having a problem. Right away he offered to help. He was not even on the clock yet!! The meals I ate the hotel were tasty and reasonably priced. Drinks however were very expensive. $15. for a Bloody Mary seemed excessive. Thank goodness I'm not a big drinker.

Will never stay at a Marriot again - had to pay $27 to park my own car a 1/4 mile down the hill behind the garbage bins. Also had to pay $25 for tennis and golf facilities that I never used! Online price was $220, ended up being over $270. Room was awful design with tiny desk for work, bed 15 ft. away from TV, aging scuffed, chipped woodwork, useless tiny fridge. Staff tried to charge me for breakfast that I paid for online - never read my reservation. Etc, etc. Total rip off.

Summary Heading: An Oasis in South Orange County
Summary: Made a last minute decision to stay at this lovely hotel when we had to come in for a funeral. Starting with Helena, the Customer Service representative, all the way through to the housekeeping staff (who found a pair of missing earrings), the staff was superb.  The rooms were very nice, the pool complex just right, and the food in the restaurant very good. The proximity to PCH and the beach scene is just right, particularly if traveling with families and not needing a "beach front" hotel.  Also appreciated its proximity to Fashion Island.

We chose this hotel to relax after 4days in San Francisco then 4days in Las Vegas it was a good choice after a long drive from Vegas check-in was a breeze  Room was great in the bay area of the hotel overlooking the pool  Resort fee a little bit on the expensive side $25 per room plus $27 per day car parking might be because I'm English and not used to paying resort fees   Hotel is a great place to relax and see the beauty of Newport and surrounding areas  The staff are a credit to the hotel all work so hard to make your stay hassle free  There was every you need in the room, Safe coffee maker iron ever a list of things you could take with you hence resort fees eh!

Honestly, the beds were uncomfortable, the walls were paper thin and the Wi-Fi was totally unusable.    However, the staff were lovely.  From the front desk to the valet to the restaurant to the rec facilities, everyone was friendly and went above-and-beyond in every situation.

Beautiful location with stunning grounds this hotel was a pleasure to stay at. We stayed here for a conference and enjoyed every minute. Gorgeous rooms with comfortable bed and plenty of space. Our room was right near the massive pool area and a short walk to the front foyer. The staff were lovely, prompt and professional and check in/check out was a breeze. The conference was great and the food was absolutely fantastic with plenty of vegan options to choose from. Short drive to shops and an all important star bucks! Thank for a fabulous stay...

Very nice place third time staying here,staff isexcellent,grounds are awesome our second favorite place to stay will be back for sure,the rooms are large with a great view very quiet and sechluded,thank you Hyatt of Newport beach

Summary Heading: Great place to relax and unwind.
Summary: My wife and I just finished a week long stay at this property which encompasses 26 acres.  It is not a high rise hotel but most rooms still a have great views of the back bay because the property is on a hillside.  The rooms were up to the usual Hyatt standards.  The hotel has a free shuttle from the Orange County airport about 10-15 minutes away.  Also there is $10 a day resort fee but that includes a daily round of golf on their short 9 hole golf course, longest is 100 yards.  Also includes bicycle rental which is great as riding along the back bay was fun.  There is free shuttle bus to the Fashion Island shopping center (5 mins) where you can shop till you drop or dine at any number of great restaurants.   What sets this hotel apart is the courtesy and friendliness of the

First time visiting socal! Literally picked the hotel flying in from New Jersey on the plane. It is literally ten minutes from the John Wayne Airport and centrally located to all the famous beaches, like laguna. The front desk attendant was super helpful, he even suggested where to go and mapped it out for us! Off the bar/restaurant enjoy a cocktail on comfy couches near a nice fire. Can't say enough about this hotel.

Had the chance to stay here for four days. It was great. A few things to keep in mind. If you are tall (over 5'9") you may not fit under the shower head. This is an older hotel and they didn't change the location of the shower heads or use a telescoping shower head which would've changed the game entirely. Our room was huge. Nice balcony. Big TV. Storage was kind of weird. Could tell that there used to be a sink inside the bedroom, but was converted to large open storage, but a great place to stow your suitcases. Closets were huge. Definitely room for a second wing chair and ottoman, but not one, so only one of you can sit at a time unless you sit on the bed or at the desk. No microwave, so don't count on heating leftovers (by design I am sure, to limit smells) but there is a

The Hyatt in Newport is located within walking distance to both Fashion Island and Balboa Island. The hotel has a shuttle system that runs to both locations so if you're not up for the walk, you can certainly get a ride. If traveling with young children (and need easy pool access), try to get a ground floor room by either the main pool (with water slide) or the pool right off the Lobby (I think the room numbers are 720-730). Keep in mind, if you want a patio, you do NOT want the rooms closest to the Main Pool. You will want to ask for a patio, otherwise your door opens into the walkway. Near the Lobby, there is a really fun, shaded area with shuffle board and a huge chess board for everyone to enjoy. Make sure you make it to any of the pools and ask for Shannon! She's the nicest

27 dollars to park the car is just mental. Nice place, nice staff. Rooms need some updating. No place for the gouging when you are paying good money for a room. Unless it changes I would never return.

Summary Heading: soap with hair on it in the shower
Summary: Hotel staff was friendly. Room was musty and bathroom had not been cleaned. There was a bunched up towel on the rack and open soap at the sink. I called and housekeeping removed it. Then later when I got in the shower I discovered another bar of soap with hair on it in the shower!!! Manager came and moved me to another room (who knows if the housekeepers even change the sheets after that experience).

Very nice scenery.  Rooms very spacious. Nice patios. On the back bay. Bar is nice and lots of room. Hotel has a lot of pools and recreational areas. Good for business or pleasure. Close to the mall and restaurants.

- Rooms need better sound proofing. Not cool waking up at 8 am on your vacation because of the sound of a golf cart?? driving around outside your room......... -Wake up 6 am to go to the washroom.... water leaking from above... need to switch rooms. Pack up everything right now... -27$ a night for parking really pissed me off too. There are no other parking areas close by. You HAVE to pay. - Staff was very friendly hence the 2 stars and not 1.

My partner and I stayed as part of our honeymoon. The hotel is a beach resort style complex with low rise buildings set around 3 different pools. Rooms are modern and a reasonable standard....although Bathrooms are extremely small! if I was rating the hotel alone i would of given 4 stars but what makes this hotel is the staff. specifically Chloe (concierge) and Ben on reception. They looked after us and made our stay special. I would highly recommend this hotel if service is just as important to you as a good room.
