wonderful grouinds with views onto newport and balboa.  didn't eat there but looked pretty decent.  large piece of property with easy parking.  room was bright and with small balcony on the ground floor.  enjoyed the fresh linen and remolded room.

Drive up from San Diego for a night away and loved this resort! Pools were clean and nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. Upgraded to a balcony room and enjoyed the tranquility of the hotel grounds. Would definitely come again!

I thought surely this was going to be a great stay, and I was disappointed on so many levels.   First, when you arrive the parking for self parking is in a poorly labeled lot down a hill and around a corner from the main entrance.  That means when you park and are lugging your luggage to the front desk to check in, you have to go up a winding property up hill and up about 4 flights of stairs.  Then when I checked in, she said there were 3 rooms remaining and ended it with "I assume you know where this building is, here is the key" and looked away.  Umm, ok, I will find it on the map.  So I drop my bags in my room, head back up 2 flights of stairs to the bar dining area, and seat myself at a table, conveniently there was a menu on the table, I flip through and find a couple of

Beautiful property, excellent staff, but paying $17 for a hamburger is Crazy. There for a conference, food was supposed to be included, the hours served were inconvenient. 9-1 & 4-6, very limited selection.

Housekeeping left personal belongings from the former room occcupants uncleaned in my room amd when my significant other met me after i had been there one night amd discovered them, it left me in a really bad situation.   The hotel brushed off the problem and didnt even try to make the sutuation right or discuss the matter with the housekeeper who had cleaned the room.  Pathetic situation for that to happen in the first place and pathetic they wouldnt deal with it.

The hotel food, rooms and staff as well as the setting and grounds are exceptional.  The environment in spite of various events was very peaceful.  The only down side which is a benefit to many is the very cool fog in the morning.

The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff was so nice!  It was a great stay and I will definitely stay there again if I am ever in Newport Beach again! Not only was the room nice, but the pool area was also awesome.

loved our stay , very clean and friendly staff who cares about your experience. Every expectations was meet with exceeding excellence and the food was delicious. We would recommend to family and friends. I loved that they had family friendly games, pools and activities throughout the resort. Our kids loved playing around and enjoyed the family friendliness of hotel staff.

The resort has pros and cons.    I will start with the cons.  I get super annoyed when hotels charge their guests to park on their property.  It would be like charging a guest who is staying at your house to park in your driveway.  I could see if it was a tiny hotel with limited parking in Manhattan or San Francisco but this place had a huge parking lot.  Not only was the parking fee outrageous but the parking was far away.  For the rate they charged it should have been closer and they should have at least washed the car.    Another thing that is annoying is when a resort charges a resort fee, especially when they charge parking.  It was nice that they had bike rentals and golf but if you weren’t using those things then you were parking a steep rate for the internet and a couple

Main desk called twice n out in hold n disconnected twice. Upgrade ended up being next to ice machine. Door unlocked n ajar when I come to it. Room service timely n yogurt w fruit n granola good. Self parking quite a walk away in isolated area

from first driving onto the property, I was struck by the beautify and sense of tranquility the landscape and lobby presented. the room was heavenly, the bed, garden patio, bathroom and bedroom amenities were beyond par.

I'm a Hyatt diamond so stayed at a ton of hyatt hotels. From PH to HH/HP. This location is 3-star at best, it's very noisy and room feels old. There's nothing exciting about the facility. Good thing is that they cover parking and breakfast but it was a lot of confusion from the front desk person. I will not return, in fact, I just booked the Westin in Costa Mesa for next week. Not recommended!!!

I stayed one night for business. The grounds are very, very nice and well-kept. The rooms have recently been updated. However, this is an older property that's better days are behind it.  The first room I was given, in the Bay Building, was like a cave. There was almost no natural light. The little there was came one small window by the door, looking out onto the exterior corridor, offering no privacy if open.   I requested a change, and was offered a room with a balcony overlooking the golf course. The room had two full-size (not queen) beds rather than a king bed.

Summary Heading: Updated rooms that need better cleaning, don't let them put you on the first floor
Summary: I'm Explorist status with World of Hyatt, so I stay at Hyatt properties whenever possible when traveling for work.  This is one I regret.  The entry is confusing, the staff, though professional, was pretty unwilling to work with me on room choice.  I don't like staying on first floor rooms because they are less secure and can be noisy.  This room opened right up to the outside world, didn't have a security bar on the sliding glass door, and it sounded like there was a herd of elephants staying in the room above.  Worst of all, the floor above me creaks like an 1800s saloon.  So it sounded like this herd of elephants was going to come down on me since about 4am.    I like Hyatt as a brand, but when someone says they don't like first floor rooms, and you have a lot of rooms

I stayed 2 nights and they forgot to clean up my room although I let it early in the morning and came back at 8:oo pm. When I checked out the following morning I was promised to receive an email from house keeping to find out why it was not done but nobody has contacted me so far.

The hotel and the grounds are gorgeous.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  I did have a negative experience though...my last day there I awoke to the sounds of crying and screaming kids from the room next door at 5:30am and was not able to get any more sleep due to the noise.  The prices of the room are high and I would expect them to be soundproof.   I was also disappointed to pay $27 PER NIGHT just to park my car (even though I was a paid hotel guest).

It's was ok not the greatest , the lido side could use a much needed upgrade it felt like a motel than a hotel , Newport has a certain style and feel not sure it was well represented , it's not the worst but it def wasn't the ooooh ahhhh feel

Very nice and clean hotel , nice location and the staff are helpful and friendly. Check in and out was very easy . Rooms were ready in no time. Food is really high quality and tasty . God bless everyone working there.

Attended as part of a conference.  I requested a microwave since the rooms do not come with one and it was delivered within 20 minutes of my arrival.  The walls are thin so I heard much of my upstairs neighbors but the rooms themselves are quite nice.  The in-room safe was roomy enough for my laptop. The conference included lunch, which I requested a vegan meal - they were some of the best vegan meals I have ever had.  Well done!  I walked to the boardwalk (about 1 mile, uphill both ways) and it was a nice downtown.  I would recommend Hyatt Regency Newport Beach to anyone going to the area.

Summary Heading: Average hotel if you're not staying for the resort amenities
Summary: We stayed two nights, a Friday and Saturday, using a certificate earned from my company for 15 years of service. Use caution during the wedding season as we were placed very near one of the areas used for receptions. And while I am happy for the couple and the wedding guests I am VERY unhappy with the the VERY loud disruptions running up until 4am each morning and the very little sleep we were able to get. From the lobby there are many stairs to navigate with your luggage depending on where your room is located.    The hotel charges a separate high resort fee for everyone and also a separate high fee for parking. It would be nice if the resort fee were optional for those not wishing to use it.  The rooms, at least ours was, could use a deep cleaning and unlike the basic room

The shuttle service hours are terrible. The rooms look very cheap. The refrigerator does not keep food cold and the air conditioner worked poorly. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  It's not in a good location.  You have to take taxi less than a mile to get something to eat and that will cost you $15 or more.

So happy I was able to attend a training here - really a fantastic place, more resort like than a hotel. Luxurious rooms, amenities and a wonderful staff. Newport Beach and Balboa Island steps away (though the available shuttle service was very convenient). A wonderful oasis in a beautiful spot.

what a great location to enjoy Newport. bike ride to Balboa etc. Lovely staff who really cares if your happy. I cant complain about to much besides i hate tubs with curtains.  This is a 4 star hotel and its location and staff make it more like a 5 star. Pools are also quite nice and grounds are lovely.

Just wanted to thank tonight's Manager Shay Steele. She went the extra mile by helping us out in a tough situation.  We were in a room that was near a loud party going on across the street(not on property).  But even though she could have easily said there's nothing she could do, she went out of her way and placed us immediately in another room that was much quieter.  She took a potential unhappy customer and turned us into a happy return customer.  Thanks again and my son thanks you as well by making his 6th birthday memorable.

Stayed at the Hyatt for a conference. The location is great except you hear airplanes flying over several times during the day. I never heard it in the room while sleeping. I stayed in the Bay building. It seemed a little older and run down. There is a nice seating area with a fire outside the lounge in the lobby. This was a great place to unwind. The shuttle sucked. I was told their bigger shuttle broke down so they had to use a smaller one. At the 630pm shuttle to fashion island there were probably 100 people waiting for a 15 passanger van. I felt like the hotel didn't plan well enough with 2 conference going on at the same time. It was easier to uber places after that. Overall the hotel was great!

Overall, our stay was good. This hotel provided a great experience for our family while on vacation. The staff were very friendly and accommodating during our stay and assistance finding local restaurants to explore. Only two concerns regarding our stay. 1.) The quality of the breakfast buffet could be greatly improved. For example, very little fruit options. A handful of berries were sprinkled over the pancakes and French toast each morning. This left the berries dried out and seemed very cheap of the hotel. For this price, additional berries should be left out as a fruit option. 2.) I was double charged for 2 rooms the morning we checked out. I had previously paid for the rooms on Travelocity but discovered I was charged again a few days later. Other than the items mentioned

we have three rooms unfortunately one room was next to a jackhammer the continued all  A jackhammer eas drilling all day long for five days also none of the vending machine worked and there were large raccoons at night that roamed the property the size of small dogs

this was the best place I have gotten to stay at. There is a small wedge and putter 9 hole course. Shuffle board large size. A twenty by twenty chess board that you walk around on. Three pools a water slide. just an overall great stay.

Summary Heading: Family Friendly Resort with Comfortable Beds
Summary: We highly enjoyed our stay at this Hyatt. This is a family friendly hotel with comfortable beds and nice, updated rooms. There is a kid friendly pool with a slide and a fun water feature. There is also a quiet pool, gym, a shuffle board, giant chess board and a pitch and putt golf course. We enjoyed the bike and running trail behind the hotel in the morning. The restaurant at the hotel and pool food were good.They had kid friendly options and prices, which we appreciated. We just wish the restaurant was a little more lively. It was sterile and nobody was in it so we ate our dinner in the bar area. We also enjoyed the coffee and croissants in the morning at the "bar" area. The hotel is also close to beaches, shopping and many restaurants.   The $27 parking fee seems over the top

I have stayed at this property several times principally because of location to business. I have had mixed experiences each visit, with consistency lacking from one team member to the next. At times the staff are authentically friendly and welcoming and other times they just want to go home. The hotel really smacks a big punch by charging a separate high resort fee for everyone and also a separate high fee for parking. I wonder why they don't absorb the fees into their daily rack rates. As if you are only using the hotel for business the resort fee doesn't make sense and leaves a bad taste. The rooms are struggling to stay fresh as the design is certainly not modern. I expect that this would be good place for families who want to stay a little away from the beach but enjoy

This is the second time I've stayed here. My first stay was fantastic. But this time I'm in the Bay building, which is really old and decrepit. The room smells like mold. The walls are dirty. The sheets are stained. And they can't move me. It is truly disgusting. Didn't stay here.

Hotel location was very nice.  Staff was very helpful valet was great. We had a great experience.  Everything was very good I specially liked Starbucks in the hotel which turned into a bar at lunch. Amazing time and great scenery.

Stayed for our sons wedding and the the location was perfect. Property offered numerous activities for the guests with numerous pools, great water slide, bikes to use, golf course, marina,life size chess board, and shuffleboard. Shuttle to Balboa Island and airport made it convenient to get around.

The Customer Service Supervisor Ms. Ashley Rivera was great in following thru with my accommodation requests prior to my arrival.  Upon registration, to my dismay my booked rooms were re-assigned to someone.  Ms. Kristen Lucero Manager went out of her way to make it right and made our stay a pleasant one.

Summary Heading: Newport Beach Hyatt - Fun realaxing get away!
Summary: The Newport Hyatt is a great place for a staycation.  The Friendly staff makes for an awesome stay. The grounds are beautiful and the pools are amazing.  I would recommend this hotel for a get away.  The rooms are very spacious and the beds are very comfortable.  The hotel is in a great location.

Shower did not work properly and the tub was clogged. Other than that the service was very good and the facility was very clean and quite. The cocktails and we're very expensive $17 for buliet bourbon, really.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with a friendly staff
Summary: The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach is a lovely hotel. They boast a helpful and friendly staff who made my stay pleasant. The grounds are beautiful. They even have an outdoor chess board and a shuffleboard court. I did not have children with me, but if I had they would have been entertained for hours at the family friendly pool with the water slide. They have shuttle service to the John Wayne/Santa Ana/Orange airport, which was handy.

The Hyatt Newport Beach is a property we return to every year. We reliably receive great service every time. Friendly and accommodating staff, very clean and comfortable rooms. Lots of fun activities for kids and families. Great pool and excellent fitness center.

I recently visited the Hyatt in Newport Beach unexpectedly as our reservations at another Resort were mixed up.  They were so gracious in welcoming us and every person on staff that we met was amazing.  I don't get to stay here often enough but when I do, I'm reminded why I need to make time to return.  The pools are so fun for the kids and the proximity to the beach is perfect.  Thanks to everyone for making our last minute trip a huge success.  You guys rock!!

Pleasant stay. Great location! After all it's Newport Beach. Lots of outside seating areas by the pool and cocktail area. Room seamed outdated and cramped. Very clean though. Need another stay for true assessment. Not long enough to enjoy it

Summary Heading: Not worth the price. lots of junk fees
Summary: Lots of junk Fees not worth the price in addition you get slamed with expensive parking.  Try to fix a cost that is not yours and you get routed to billing somewhere back east.  I was charged for both Valet parking which I didn't use and self parking.  for the money not worth it.  Beware of the per night rate it is almost double by the time you leave with junk fees

This was an ideal place to have a wedding! So many places to have functions for the wedding parties. Bring your own wine opener as they do not bring to your room when asked. The Hyatt also provides splendid weather.

Very convenient walk to Balboa Island and short drive to Fashion Island, both of which we always visit when we stay here. Convenient there is a fridge in the room. Wi fi is strong and convenient. Good family pool area.

The hotel was beautiful and the staff was extremely accommodating and friendly! The beds were comfortable and we were close to all sorts of fun activities in Newport Beach! I would most definitely stay here again in the future!

We enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt Jubilee and will look forward to returning in the summer.  The location is excellent and the overall atmosphere at the hotel was great.  Only inconvenience was the distance to self park, but we will get a room closer to parking on our next stay.

This is a great property. Location could not be better, close to the beach, harbor and airport made for a wonderful venue. The staff was amazing, very attentive and aimed to please. The food onsite was very good as well, much better than your standard hotel fare. Only thing I could knock them for was the rooms seemed a little dated.

This is a nice enough Hotel, close to Fashion Island. Surrounded by hills on the outskirts of Newport Beach,off Jamboree Rd. The base price of this hotel might look attractive, but when you add up Parking fee. $27 and service fee $25, it will amount to an additional $52 per day. Nothing is within walking distance, so you will need a car. The Hotel is two story with a nice pool, including waterslides for the kids and a Jacuzzi. The rooms are average for the price and not the Luxury you would expect from a Hyatt. Their staff is friendly, and their food is tasty, however I will give this a miss for future travel

Our large wedding party came home and were very loud. We were asked to move to the lobby and were told we could continue to make noise there. We stayed up chatting, dancing and drinking untill we got tired and went to bed. Many other hotels would have told us to stop enjoying ourselves. The post wedding celebration was epic. We are greatful. It is often this group of people gets to see each other.

Great place to stay.  Clean. Nice location.  The bed was comfortable and the room was clean.  It was quite, couldn't hear a lot of people roaming the halls which is nice when you need to get some sleep.  Everything was in working order, plenty of outlets to hook up to, WiFi worked well, bathroom shower was hot and towels soft!  I would stay here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel to have a Grat time
Summary: Stayed for a business Conference. Beautiful place to stay with great accommodations. Staff was friendly and fast. The landscape was so colorful and peaceful.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New Port. Hope to stay there again.

To make a long story short, we were given keys to an incorrect room (the one next door to where we were supposed to be), and these keys were never changed.  We had access to an occupied room for our entire stay.  Luckily we aren't creeps and didn't do anything to those other guests, but it made us feel quite uncomfortable since we didn't know who had access to OUR room.

The hotel grounds were absolutely beautiful. The landscaping was lovely, there were great views and great outdoor spaces to enjoy. There were three pools, the largest one seemed to be the 'Kids' pool it had a slide and was very crowded with lots of families. The two others were quieter. So definitely something for everyone. There was an app to order drinks delivered directly to the pool, which was a nice feature. The room itself was clean, the TV was very large (if that is important to you). The bathroom was huge, though the main portion of the room was a bit cramped. The air conditioning unit that was in the room was very loud, as were the guests who were occupying the pool after hours. The staff was excellent and very helpful. Some improvements could definitely be made, but

Summary Heading: Great value for a family vacation
Summary: I used a "free night" certificate to stay at this hotel, and I would return as a paying customer.  The room with 2 double beds has a sofa bed, which made this very convenient for my family.  The location is close to great food and the beach.  I didn't use the services that are included in the resort fee - shuttle, beach gear, rentals, etc. - but they seem like a nice perk.    I usually like to stay at the Hyatt Regency in Huntington Beach, but in comparison (for price) the Newport Beach location is a great alternative.

Nice three day  stay with our dog while the house was being fumigated.   Need to improve check in; everyone seemed to have an exceptionally long time getting into their rooms.  Great staff, nice areas for outdoor walking along the back bay, great food overall and prompt room service.   Very relaxing stay.

The most logistically challenged hotel I have been in. We had to drag luggage down two flights of stairs to get to room. Room was dark and dreary; towels were ok if I were in a Motel 6. Self parking was a long way and uphill to the hotel

Went for conference and extended for bit of get away. Staff very nice, cocktails and appetizers in bar actually excellent.   Room not in great condition. Torn screen to outside  they delayed our check in to enable them to fox/ Never did., even after checked us in and told us they had. Air conditioning worked and didn't work. Bed not greatly comfortable. Several of  bath towels were threadbare.. Took photo of them.

This solid hotel resort has much of expected Hyatt Regencies high quality.  The hotel resort is spread through scenic, lovely, spacious grounds.  Even during very busy times, you can always find a place that is quiet, private, and restorative.   The rooms are large, well appointed, and with a particularly comfortable bed.  We stayed in The Lido which suited us fine as it is away from the main action (and noise) of the hobby lobby.  The room with a balcony is definitely worth the extra money.  Views aren't fabulous  but nice to sit on the balcony to relax.   There are several buildings spread around the grounds, but everything is close enough to be easily traversed, yet provides a much greater sense of privacy.  The hotel fitness center (also in The Lido) is better than most in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel very soon!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: My wife and I have stayed here on numerous occasions, Anniversaries, Birthdays and Great Jazz Events just to name a few. The staff are always helpful and accommodating to our needs. The lounge area is a great place to have a drink and some pretty good food. The location is perfect for shopping (Fashion Island) or exploring the local hangouts (Balboa Island) It is surely one of our favorite weekend getaways.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards, Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Extra charges on my credit card
Summary: I am still trying to figure out why my credit card was charged twice. Once for the correct amount on the day I checked-out, another one for a much higher amount on the day I checked-in which was returned five days later to my credit card. I was NEVER informed about it that this amount is going to be charged OR if it was a security deposit. Because of the currency exchange I lost a few dollars when they returned the amount. But the main problem is that I can't trust Hyatt Regency because of the misuse of my credit card.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. I believe the Front Office Manager has been in contact with you in regards to this matter. If you would like to discuss it further, please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.   Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Credit card was charged for an additional hefty amount.
Summary: I am still trying to figure out why my credit card was charged twice. Once for the correct amount on the check-out day, another one for a hefty amount on the check-in day which was returned five days later to my credit card. I was NEVER informed about it that this amount is going to be charged OR if it was a security deposit or something. Because of the currency exchange I lost a few dollars when they returned the amount. But the main problem is that I can't trust Hyatt because of the misuse of my credit card.

Great hotel, clean, rather quiet unless your next to the pool...but its a hotel :) Staff is wonderful! very friendly and professional. Food is ok, a little pricey, but great restaurants nearby. Beautiful location. Would recommend to friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards, Ashley R.

Summary: we had an initially poor experience with getting the rooms right - we had requested adjoining rooms - but once we worked that out everything was great.  I love the location of this hotel and the variety of things to do.
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards, Ashley R.

Summary: I recently visited California for business and was booked into the Hyatt.   It's nice but, in my view, seemed just a little bit tired. Nothing major - it just gave me the impression that it was due a freshen up.  The room was large and beds pretty comfortable but mine was a bit dowdy.  I'd stay here again but preferably after a facelift.

Hotel has great customer relations.  Staff is always on point.  Food is good.  Hotel is very clean.  When you forget something, hotel always gas what you need.  HI tel grounds are impeccable.  Everyone greets you upon arrival and check out.

The stuff at the hotel made everything so smooth and they accommodate all my requests... very happy with our overall stay.. conveniently located close to Balboa island, shopping mall and great restaurants.!

We had a very relaxing stay! Staff were all very friendly and it was clean and beautiful! Would definitely recommend and will visit again! The hot tub and pool was so relaxing and having a small balcony outside of our room was also relaxing!

You definitely get what you pay for. A well trained attentive staff.. One of the best I have had the pleasure of being served by. Many hotels should send their staffs here and observe what real customer service is.

My husband and I stayed 3/26-29/17. The Hyatt Regency has an excellent staff.  They are all warm and friendly and very courteous. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in Newport Beach.

Stayed for a wedding, didn't have the room ready knowing the wedding was at 5. (Book with the wedding promo) Bathroom was dirty and clock was broken in the room. Felt more like a motel 6 hotel Amenities were poor too

Stayed three nights as our first destination after crossing the Atlantic. Reception was friendly and efficient at checking us in. The room was spacious,well equipped, and the beds very comfortable. The "garden view" was more a view of the front entrance. Bizarrely the  sliding bathroom door didn't  close completely and left a gap of about two inches between the door and the frame- a hotel of this standard should do better. The grounds and three pools are stunning and well maintained. The hotel is well situated for an easy walk to the delights of Balboa Island. The downsides were: a) noise from the room above was a problem from early morning to the small hours; when we commented on this to the person at reception shrugged and said they were fully booked b)the restaurant where

Amazing hotel, amazing staff one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. very nice and clean property and the rooms are very nice with the balcony I will be back, great food and shopping in the area and close to the beach

Rooms are basic view was nonexistent and I had a balcony too much money not enough reason for it one word overpriced the employees were also nonexistent and the parking was 27 dollars that's crazy then the taxes were  All together 50 dollars crazy

Both my husband and myself stayed here for 6 nights as part of a 2 week tour of the US. We stayed in the 'Bay area' room 650 overlooking the main pool with children's slides, comfy sun loungers and a warm jacuzzi! Our room was fantastic......air con, king sized bed, room safe, mini fridge, tea and coffee making facilities, hair dryer and a double walk in shower. The only small criticism would be the noise of the airplanes flying over from around 7am-22pm but unless your a really light sleeper or constantly sitting in your room you get used to it. The hotel lobby, bar and outside terrace had a great atmosphere and was very well presented with comfy outdoor seating although got a little busy with a constant flow of business reps. We didn't eat in the hotel but be prepared to pay

The visit was good. Staff was great and building was clean. The room service did not clean the toilet the entire week we were there. Could use some improvement in this area. Food and drink prices were a lirrle high.

Overall, the hotel grounds are nicely landscaped and the property is well located.  However, if noise bothers you, beware of what room you end up in.  I stayed here recently for work and was put in the Bay area in the back of the property, near the pool with the slide and kiddie play area.  No big deal for me since I wasn’t in my room during the day, but if you plan to be around during the day, it does get noisy back there.  And as others pointed out, there are also planes that fly right overhead throughout the day until late at night.  Plus, the walls are thin….especially, if you are on the lower level below a room that is occupied.    All of that would have been fine since I travel with a sound machine and ear plugs, however the last night I was there they had an event in the

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you are a Hyatt reward member
Summary: The hotel is moderate at best when it comes to other Hyatt’s in the area.   If you are a member of Hyatt’s World of Hyatt benefits program, stay somewhere else as they don’t care about your status at all.   The Hyatt in Huntington Beach or the Hyatts by Disney are much nicer and way better at customer service

Summary Heading: Always Enjoy My Stay at This Resort
Summary: This resort is always relaxing and the grounds are beautiful. It is not the fanciest Hyatt Regency, but I like the way it feels. I have stayed in several buildings and enjoy them all. The little pitch and putt golf is a good way to relax after a stressful workday!

I was impressed by the room quality, the work out room, the Jacuzzi, the swimming pool, and how the staff accommodated the business conference I attended.  The valet parking was great also.  Epic up keep of the grounds and the complete hotel facilities!  Great team!

Summary Heading: The nicest property, Hotel Managers and Dinning Staff
Summary: We go to this hotel every year to celebrate our Anniversary. The managers: Christine and Jessica were both so helpful and kind.  They made us feel so welcomed.  Rob in the dinning room was very kind, attentive and gave us amazing service! The rooms are clean, peaceful and pretty.  We had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel!

We've stayed here many many times over the past 3 years.  I love the grounds of the hotel and the pool areas!  The location is very convenient and I enjoy getting my coffee in the morning and letting the kids check out the grounds, whether they want to play chess or hide and seek!  The family pool is large and the slide is always a hit...as well as the ping pong!  Staff is always friendly and I felt treated very fairly after an issue was pointed out.  The resolution was above and beyond my expectations and I will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Not at all like most Hyatt Hotels
Summary: One of the more "run down" Hyatt Hotels. Nothing like I expected. Especially in Newport Beach!  Beautiful location and grounds but older looking rooms. Not good value for the rate at all! I wouldn't stay again.

Very nice hotel: location excellent, food excellent, staff service excellent. The check-in process was swift and efficient, room was cleaned everyday, room service was as promised. Super experience overall.

Great Staff! The rooms where very clean. The grounds is amazing. Love the views and golf course. Closely located to the beach and stores. Had an amazing time with our convention. Highly recommend this place to anyone for conventions or just a get away.

Hyatt Regency Newport Beach is a great hotel with nice rooms and great service!  The location is wonderful it is close to many restaurants and shopping.  They also have a shuttle to get you  and from several local areas.

The room and the Nice QUIET AC unit in my room was a welcome surprise.  Very first world attitude from the front desk and everyone else working there.  The Large Tranquility pool made for quiet peaceful memoralble experience unmatched by most hotels. High Classy quiet reserved..GREAT !

Open Air hotel with amazing amenities. You won't regret staying here.   The bed was very comfortable.  There is a free golf course. Free bicycles. 3 swimming pools.   If you like outdoor living, this hotel is for you. The breeze flows through the entire lobby. The firepits are lovely.

Hotel is outdated, friendly staff. Expensive Parking. A beautiful neighborhood, and worth the drive to Anaheim convention center. All in all a potentially good hotel if/when renovations will take place.

The staff, service, food, amenities and comfort were fabulous.  Generous interest in meeting our needs, terrific, fresh buffet foods and very comfortable beds made for a wonderful conference.  I would highly recommend the Newport Beach Hyatt for your meeting.

The Hyatt was a great venue for our convention. The grounds are beautiful and the facility is top notch. Our room was clean and well appointed. The location was convenient to local sites as well as the airport. Staff was great. I would stay their again.

Summary Heading: March at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach
Summary: We were in town for a national sales forum in last week. The facilities, hospitality staff, food and beverage, even the weather were as good as one could expect. Beautiful resort-like setting with amenities galore. Our event was a huge success thanks in part to the excellent facilities, staff, and management at the Hyatt.

Summary Heading: My stay at the Hyatt Regency in NewPort Beach CA
Summary: Beautiful Hotel and grounds....Great food. Rooms were clean and comfortable .   The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful to get where you were wanting to go.  The location was close to shopping...other great restaurants Disney ..plus so much more.

I went to this Hyatt on a business trip in January, however I took my wife Jessi with me as it was a longer conference so I am able to give you a  review from Business and Pleasure Perspectives. Resort style hotel that is spread out into different areas. Don't try to save money by hauling your own luggage, grab a bellman , they have golf carts to take you to your room. It Is a beautiful property and has a great potential for a romantic getaway. The property is older and could use some updating but has some cool history ( John Wayne used to hold Weekly dinner/poker games in the Private club back in the day). The high ponies are the Beautiful grounds,pool, tennis court layout, a complementary pitch and putt 9-hole executive course, great outdoor amphitheatre with a awesome  summer

I have stayed here several times for university-related business.  The staff are quite helpful and trying to provide a high end resort experience.  Hotel bar and restaurant staff are friendly and enthusiastic.  The airport shuttle to SNA is appreciated.  However, there's a series of challenges: the check-in / reception desk area is very small, and even a group of 10-12 people arriving on the shuttle will block passage to the hotel bar.  My room was on the first floor, near the pool; not great when there is a conference reception (beer / wine) at the pool.  Shor restaurant is good, not great (see separate review).  Apparently, my Hyatt Passport number got deactivated.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, will book again if im ever back to Newport beach
Summary: The hotel was nice, good reception, resort is beautiful, a couple of swimming pools. Rooms are pretty good in size and clean but could use some new carpeting and redecoration. Staff are super helpful and friendly. The only downside is the 25$ per night hotel charges, i think it is overpriced compared to other hotels. Overall, i recommend staying in this hotel. Thank you,

I first tried to check-in around 1:00pm and was told room was not quite ready.  I gave them my cell number as requested and they told me that they would call when the room was ready...they said it wouldn't be too long.  Left property to check out the area.  came back to the hotel around 4:30pm (check-in time is 4:00pm).  there were about 4-5 guests in line so I decided to hit the bar and wait for them to call. (HA!)  Around 5:30pm when there was no line, and 3 front desk people behind the counter chatting away, I decided to go and check about my room.  I went to the front desk and the gal asked me, "How Can I Help You?", (this is the same gal that checked me in at 1:00pm).  I asked to see if my room was ready, and she asked my name, which I gave her, and as she was pulling up my

Summary Heading: Good hotel in Anaheim...dated rooms...Big suites...Great breakfast
Summary: I stayed at this hotel at the end of January 2017.. for two nights...The lobby of the hotel is huge once you walk and it is well decorated with palm trees and glass... I checked in at 1 AM and had to wait quite a long time for an agent to help me. Agent gave me my diamond amenity, and explained my stay. The room I had was a king suite, it was a very spacious room with a living area and a bedroom. The whole room was aging the furniture was old and weathered, but it got the job done. The bathroom was OK the showerhead was pretty rusty. But the highlight of the stay was definitely the the breakfast, it was a big buffet with amazing waiters and an amazing omelette station. Service was impeccable every morning and the food was pretty good too. Overall I would say that if you want to

Summary Heading: Very Dated as another poster said "living off yesterday's reputation"
Summary: I am and have been for a long time a top tier Hyatt FT and my first time at this property. First the wait line was much much too long I had to complain to get more people out checking in. Very little customer experience at front desk  The property is fairly sprawling through several two story buildings. Their conversation and or last refresh was fairly well done. Still some wear and tear going on here.  Food service is OK remember this is the original "Shore" that is at or at least was at the Honolulu Hyatt. Marginal in taste, service good.   Bar like restaurant highly over priced.   I think they need some better training in handling their FT'er's Over all would suggest another property.

Valet and front desk understaffed.  Pre check is inefficient as you still stand in check in line. Staff unable to resolve other guest complaints? Thus causing more wait time.  Bar was efficient.  Room was clean. Reservations agent was extremely helpful and accommodating.

Nice hotel with nice grounds. For the most part the staff was very accommodating and friendly. Good luck on parking. Very expensive. Great location and easy to get to anywhere in the area. We will stay at this hotel again.

Summary Heading: Great location, upgraded room, good food
Summary: Stayed for a weekend and had a good time at the hotel. The bar is a nice place to mingle and the food and drinks were plentiful and delicious.  The food in the dining room (breakfast) is also very good and the atmosphere (especially near the windows) is very relaxing.  Rooms are upgraded with nice design and amenities.

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay at the Orange County
Summary: I stayed here for a couple of days during a business trip. It was a pleasant stay, location is great close to the water, with almost a direct access to a jogging/biking path of some 5 miles in length along the water.  I would recommend the hotel for a business stay, but would re-think going back for leisure trip.

Back in the day this hotel was amazing. Today not so much. For the money, I was expecting more plush amenities. Towels were tattered, small and thin. The conference room stunk like stale sewage. We had to leave the doors open or all 100 of us would gag. Food is way over priced. $30 for breakfast is redicilas. Staff was amazing and the grounds looked beautiful.

Spent several days here while attending a wedding. The location could not he been anymore convenient. The hotel/resort has just the right amount of amenities one could ask for. From multiple pools to golf and tennis, the resort caters to your every need.

This is always a beautiful place to stay...great accommodations, friendly staff and centrally located for anything you want to do, shopping, great food place to go, the beach and lots of entertainment options.  Hyatt Newport Beach is a great place and highly recommended to all.

The hotel was nice.  What I didn't like was the parking fee of $27 a night and its a long walk to the parking area.  Also was told smoking was OK on the balcony with the door closed when we booked. On of our group smokes.  Later was told it wasn't allowed.

clean & comfortable. there are many pools, and the property is large and nicely maintained. No idea what the resort fee is for or what makes this a resort. We didn't have anything that we've received at a budget hotel for free (wifi, pool). self Parking $25/night. on top of the $25 resort fee. breakfast is available for a very high price. We booked through a 3rd party, & were given the room furthest from the lobby, that was fine it was quiet.

Summary Heading: My first and last visit, it was terrible
Summary: Well, I am always staying with Hilton's chain and it was my first experience with Hyatt Regency - as the location was convenient. Now, leaving the property after 2 days, I can tell you - I will never return to this property. -- Firstly, rooms. Be ready that a view from the balcony may be very bad. Okay, I am the type of person for whom the view is important - even if it is not an ocean view - it have to be clean at least! I was given a room on the 3-rd floor - with a view on a dirty roof behind me on the 2-nd. Changed the room. Well, the same 3-rd floor, the view on other side but the roofs of the small buildings near the pool still looks dirty. Well, not all the rooms are the same. But use some small white stones to make the dirty roof looks better!!!  -- Secondly, the

We spent three weeks at the resort and truly enjoyed our stay. From the easy reservation process, the friendly shuttle driver picking us up at the airport, the quick and efficient C/I by Ben, the FD agent to the housekeeping, the  servers and the helpful concierge; a very nice hotel. The spacious room (Lido #280) was well appointed, clean and quiet. The short 9 hole golf course was well maintained and fun to play. While it was not warm enough for us to use the pool, all three pools looked well maintained. While we thought the Shore Grill and Lounge menu to be somewhat limited (we missed a good clear chicken-noodle soup), the meals were actually well prepared and served by qualified staff. The breakfast counter is well stocked. The shuttle service to / from Balboa Island and

Room was great, go double bed which also included a sofa bed, so we had lots of room to sleep. Hyatt is always my first choice, because every things just feels right, nice classy hotel, staff are always superb, always enjoy their breakfast buffet. You never go wrong when booking with Hyatt.

Summary Heading: Never go wrong by staying at the Hyatt
Summary: Hyatt is always my first choice when traveling. If I can find one near my destination, I always choose it over any other hotel. Because the service is top notch, the staff are always helpful with a great smile. Especially if you are a gold or platinum member, it is always a plus.  You are treated extremely well and they always find ways to make your stay very enjoyable.

Loved our recent visit. Enjoyed the beautiful relaxing environment. The staff was excellent, very friendly and went the extra steps to make sure your visit memorable. We enjoyed the restaurant and lounge.

Summary Heading: Yes, location -- but oh the staff!
Summary: We have stayed here for various events and "stay-cations" over the years.  The remodels to the property have been great, and teh rooms are very comfortable.  BUT, the staff makes this property special.  From the door attendant, to front desk, management and restaurant staff, they truly go out of their way to help you enjoy your stay.  I highly recommend this property!

Both the food and the service was of the highest quality.  Couldn't ask for more.  My room was great.  It was large and had a lovely view of the bay. I stayed at the Hyatt for a conference and then some vacation time.  I highly recommend for both.

Geat value!  Great customer service! I'd go here again.  Th bed was comfortable as well.  Nice environment.  Close to Whole Foods and many popular shops. Very quiet at night, comfortable bed.  Great staff.

Sand bags all over. Puddle all over. Staff not so friendly. The restaurant was very slow in getting orders and delivering orders. Room door was so hard to close. You taught it's already close but you can still open it without the card.

A very nice hotel and very popular!  The weekend my wife and I stayed here they had 3 weddings and 2 conferences.  The bedrooms were nice, staff was friendly.  Everything you want in a hotel stay.  Cons:  The parking fees/resort fees add up.  Requested a golf course view and got a parking lot (in all fairness, the golf course was to the FAR left and you could see cart path).

This is the perfect location to have a more laid back experience than staying across the street in Fashion Island.  Great food and beverage options, yet just five minutes from the excitement of Newport Beach and Corona Del Mar.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Newport Beach!
Summary: Great location - helpful & friendly staff - close to all things in Newport and OC - very CLEAN and a great place to hold or attend conferences!  lots of on site amenities - pool - outdoor sitting and nooks are cool!

My one night stay at the Hyatt Regency Resort in Newport Beach showed a hotel that was inconsistently aesthetic and thoughtful at best. The hotel feels like a hotel that was built a number of years ago and upgraded to a "resort" but the upgrades don't go all the way.  The good: There are two really nice pools with accompanying jacuzzis, the golf course (though I don't play) provided a nice view from my bedroom, the grounds are nicely landscaped, and the bathroom decor is aesthetically modern.  Also, the food I was served at the reception I went to was quite good, though I can't comment on the quality if you order in the restaurant or from room service. Finally, the concierge was very helpful in locating a store where I could get a swimsuit.  The disappointing: The sink is

First time stay and never come back , breakfast was great but when looking for concierge to book transportation to airport nowhere to be found. End up ask for the cab to airport, they make us wait for 15 minutes then came a tow car , it was nice I though but over charge $160 for lax , what a ripoff... Credit to Parker and valet.

Summary Heading: Beautiful resort, good for meetings, lots of swimming pools, not close to the beach
Summary: My group scheduled a conference for the Orange County area, and they selected this hotel for our meetings.  I stayed here 3 nights.  The facilities are nice, the location is good and my room was just fine.  Newport Beach is a beautiful area, and when I come back, it will most likely be for vacation and not business.    Location. The hotel is located on the other side of the Pacific Coast Highway from the Balboa Peninsula -- the main beach/surfing area of Newport Beach.  The hotel is a really too far away from the beach to walk. The hotel is walking distance from the Newport Center -- a nice shopping area.  And, it sits on a marina on Newport Back Bay. Overall, the location of the hotel is pretty good.  Grounds. The hotel is a campus of buildings spread-out along a hill.  The

Loved the resort feel but access to nature and shopping. Very family restaurants on Pacific Coast Highway. Enjoyed the executive golf course and chance to improve my short game. Friendly staff from valet to desk and service people.

We have stayed at this hotel several times and always enjoy our stay!  The hotel is in a great location and the staff is friendly and helpful.  Our recent visit was a little unusual because our shower was broken.  We may have notified the wrong staff member, but no one ever got back to us to change rooms or fix the shower.  We also mentioned it on checkout.  We only stayed one night so it was okay.  However we would have loved to shower!  Otherwise, the hotel was very pretty and everything else went well.  We will try again!

Fantastic staff, the grounds, room and amenities are top notch. It's also centrally located from the beach, fashion island, restaurants, night life and activities. Plus the views are amazing! I highly recommend staying at this Hyatt

If they try to assign a Bay room to you say no. They overlook the pools and it's very noisy.  It seems to be the older part of the hotel. The ceilings are low, the bathroom shower area is dark, sink didn't drain well and the toilet ran.  The grounds are beautiful. The staff is friendly. It's close to Fashion Island. That said, not worth the price tag.

Lovely multi 2-storey structures property in a garden setting overlooking Newport's Back Bay with two huge pools and other outside activities.  Was upgraded to a vast suite with Murphy bed for the kids. Room clean and comfortable but your typical tiny Regency bathroom. Low ceiling lobby where a bar and restaurant are located. FD staffed by a lovely lady who upgraded us without asking.  As Hyatt loyalty members, we were offered breakfast buffet with was very good. They also took eggs orders for the kitchen to prepare. My wife ordered sauteed spinach and mushrooms with her fried eggs and it was all done with a big smile. Excellent service.  This was lovely quiet stay that we enjoyed it in early December - this must be a very fun and happening property in the summer months. Overall

I can't believe the incompetence we encountered at check-in. We booked through a third-party reservation and they claimed not to have our reservation in their system. Good thing I had the confirmation and emails. It took 30 minutes to resolve it. The woman working had to get a supervisor, who was rude and seemed annoyed with me. There was really no apology or anything offered, other than a free cup of coffee. Gee, thanks. Add $55 for resort fee and parking. Not sure why they charge for self-parking, when it is far from the rooms. Resort fee gets you nothing you don't get for free at most other hotels. Rooms were clean and comfortable, but not worth the price and all the extra fees. Food and drinks on-site were way over-priced. Don't pay extra for a view of the Bay, not worth it!

This hotel is trying to hide its age.  My room and its furnishings could not.  It is convenient to John Wayne airport with about 10 minutes travel time with normal traffic.  It is a resort hotel and not fit for business travelers.  The self parking is awful.  For the privilege of paying $27 per day you will park your car and walk 10 to 15 minutes to your room through several levels of guest rooms or around the trash dumpsters and loading docks.  Be prepared for lots of extra charges and taxes to compliment your room charge - resort charge, local and state taxes, local and state tourist fees, etc.

Summary Heading: Best stay at this location yet!
Summary: I've stayed at a lot of Hyatt locations and particularly at this location multiple times. On this most recent stay, staff they completely blew my socks off at the level of personalization and attention they provided us.  I felt appreciated and that there was a genuine effort to get to understand me and reason for stay and serving accordingly.  Well done staff and until next stay!

The hotel grounds are spectacular with lots of outdoor pools and activities. The rooms are clean and the service is friendly. The bar has fabulous Bloody Mary's and good service as well. I would stay here again if in the area.

My room was clean, comfortable and quiet.  I was there for a business conference and the food was fresh and well prepared.  The staff was professional, helpful and courteous.  The meeting rooms were OK, not great.

Stayed here while on business in Irvine.  Rooms are clustered around pool, noise and foot traffic at night, folks talking, walls and doors not very opaque to sound, so don't plan on sleeping well.  Food at Shor was good and a bit pricey.

Summary Heading: Aged Hotel, Poor Restaurant, Remote Parking, Good location
Summary: This is an aging hotel and the rooms show it. We had a large room, bit it was almost empty of furniture. The feeling was old.  The restaurant food and service were 2 star at best. Toast with parma ham was inedible. Lamb meat balls was ok Fired calamari was mostly batter.  Self parking is about a 300m walk from the hotel down a hill. It's bizarre. Imagine if it's raining.  The location is ok, with a nice pool, and some view to beaches.  All in all I would never go back there.

Overall good hotel. The on-premise food at the bar was marginally good, so if you have a chance to eat somewhere else that's your best bet. Shower in the room was in need of repairs -check it before you go to sleep so you don't have any surprises when you're rushing in the morning ;)

The resort is lovely, and I certainly will consider it as an option when in the area again. The room was comfortable and the staff gracious, warm, and hospitable. Staff, responded quickly and professionally to any request that was made.  A microwave would have been nice.   The guest room was clean and dust free.  The floors were well kept and appeared incredibly clean, including the hallways. My room had minor issues (e.g., curtain wand used to open and close the drapes came off), but nothing that would deter another stay.

I had a conference to attend here at the Hyatt, the hotel layout is great and the location is great location close to the airport The facilities are great and well organized. The food at the hotel qas also great as we got breakfast and lunch here The hotel has a unique style to it and its great.  The staff was great at checking in and everything was ready

This property is in an excellent location and has a lot of things to do on the property.  We took bikes and went Ina nice bike trail which was located right outside the property.  We also took advantage of the small golf course they have on property.  I will definitely stay here again!

This place is an excellent place for a meeting vacation.  The staff was excellent, friendly, and helpful.  All questions were answered and all services exceeded my expectations.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

Summary Heading: Be sure to sit with 'Juan' in their restaurant!
Summary: My wife and I had a terrific stay there. There were issues with our toilet (repaired the same day) and a noisy air conditioner (always beeping), but we were so happy with the people outside of the room, that we would definitely stay there again.   Everyone from the check-in folks, to the valets, to Barbara and Juan at the restaurant were warm, friendly, and just a pleasure to deal with.  In particular, I want to give a shoutout to our server "Juan".  (I think his last name as Mejia? -- I asked him but have since forgotten). He was always smiling, and simply did a great job.   What was really interesting was that my brother and his wife joined us for breakfast -- and they remembered him from when they stayed there -- and that was perhaps 5 years ago. What's even more interesting

It is a great place to stay for either vacation or business. Staffs and foods served at restaurants and bars are exceptionally superior. The outdoor environment are tastefully decorated and landscaped with beautiful local, native shrubs, flowers, and  trees.

Absolutely amazing experience and first class treatment by ALL the staff.  Extremely friendly and were always willing to assist with any questions and needs of myself or other guests.  Rooms were open and very clean.  I would definitely stay here (no doubt about it) if I were returning to this area!  The food was wonderful and the presentation was just as good.

The rooms were quiet and well maintained. The staff were very professional, friendly, and willing to help. The location is close to many attractions and houses many activities on the premises for active individuals and families.

Summary Heading: A Nice hotel for those who golf and summer time
Summary: it was mostly like a resort than a hotel, lots of swimming pools and Golf facility. unfortunately, the time we were there it was rainy and all the carpet in the corridors were wet and water was leaking in the walkways from the eavestroughs. Rooms were nice and with a good balcony. The main building that was attached to the lobby seems to be well maintained but the other building needs an update. Restaurants were very good but a bit overpriced.  the staff was very friendly and helpful. Parking was ridiculously expensive, and self-parking was way-way far from the residences.

Stayed at this hotel for WDI 2017 conference. For conference attendees, the staff was very accommodating and gave us two free drink tickets for being Hyatt Platinum members upon check-in courtesy of Ben. Being from east coast, our first day was just getting adjusted to the time change. We arrived hungry and went to the bar to cash in our free drink tickets and appetizers. Calamari was great! We also had quesadilla and my husband loved that too. The bar area was occupied by mostly business travelers so there was plenty of space for networking. The property is quaint and the fire pits were very cozy.  Hotel room was clean and very well maintained. The only complaint and it's a petty complaint, but nevertheless, the sliding doors to enter the bathroom are DIFFICULT to open once

Summary Heading: Mother/daughter respite after colorado powder skiing!
Summary: Relaxing fun time! We took advantage of a few great amenities here with our daily resort fee ( complimentary shuttle, bikes and hot tub with our free "delivered to the door" matching white slippers we used to walk to the very close hot tub and then fitness center!  Our room was quiet and cozy with a little patio facing the well groomed golf course! ( maybe next time!!) it was not busy Sunday night into Monday but by the time Wednesday rolled around and we had to leave it looked like the reform had picked up s bit! Believe me.. We lived the peace and quiet and private hot tub sittings etc.  The Newport Beach Laguna and crystal cove beaches were all very beautiful for us east coasters who aren't use to rocks and mountains and ocean at the same time! We went out using the bikes to

This is a nice hotel. I'm not sure I would rate it at a 4 star hotel, but it's fine. The staff was friendly. The lobby bar was nice and has Starbucks and a nice drink menu. The walls are exceptionally thin and I didn't find the beds to be very comfortable, however, I would likely stay there again if I was in the area.

Everything was top notch.  The accommodations, the property and especially the amenities and the staff were awesome!  Chloe who was on staff in the lobby was so helpful.  We took a family trip with our 2 teenage boys and stayed 6 nights. For the long stay we received some comp coupons which we used at the lounge bar and at the breakfast bar. There are complimentary bicycles on the property which we rode into Balboa Island. It was a great scenic ride. In the morning my wife and I took long walks/ runs along Back Bay where there is a nature trail for several miles. There is also a par 3 golf course which is nice and costs just $4 including clubs!   The property is a short ride to Laguna Beach. The Nixon Library is 20 minutes away and is a very interesting place to visit,

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, could have been a lot better
Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. Check-in went very smoothly and the staff was very nice and polite.  The room was a "pool-view room" which was very spacious and suitable for 1-2 persons. However, the walls between the rooms are very thin, if you are unlucky and you have a noisy neighbour, be ready for a bad nights sleep.   This hotel has one restaurant, however snacks and food is also served at the bar. The food is nice and the drinks are well made, with a borad selections of gin.   The hotel has a very big garden and golf area, definitely worth visiting if you are staying for a long time. However, the gym is very small and doesn't have all the necessary equipment (Eliptic & treamills are there though).  In general this is a nice hotel if you are staying in Newport beach,

I'd rate this a 4 star not 4 star facility based on the rooms.  Rooms have blackout drapes, safe, iron and board, full length mirror and mini fridge.We appreciated the motion activated floor lights at both sides of the bed.  We did not experience night noise, but the bedside table has eye mask and ear plugs.  The bed was fine.  Bathroom a bit small but fully functional, shower in bathtub.  Room with king bed was amply large, we had a small balcony that was pleasant to sit upon.$20 taxi fare from airport if your timing is not consistent with the facility shuttle.  30 minute walk to CdM if you like to walk.  Facility has multiple pools and hot tubs and a nice workout room.  We did not have a car so I cannot comment on valet service.  Restaurant had good breakfast and lobby bar is

Summary Heading: Good choice if this hotel is near where you want to go
Summary: This hotel was chosen by the planners of a nearby meeting at UC Irvine, so that we could get a somewhat discounted rate.  The grounds are nicely landscaped, the facilities are clean and up to date, but with this hotel, you could be anywhere in Southern California.  The bar just off the lobby has a wonderful IPA on tap, so that's a real plus for me.  The staff are friendly and the rooms adequate with good coffee.  I have no complaints.

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach for a sales conference.  Everything was well organized.  The staff was very friendly.  My room was very well kept.  And although I didn't get to the beach, I understand it is very close by.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Wonderful stay in spite on the on and off rainy weather. The special touches, like the umbrella stands, made the stay so wonderful, I loved the outdoor fire pit, and we had fun playing shuffle board. The food was excellent, the staff attentive and the ambience was perfect for our conference! And thanks for the free shuttle to and from the airport!!

Summary Heading: Great venue for a business meeting
Summary: The location was very favorable (close to Fashion Island, the ocean, etc.)  The staff was exceptional - very friendly and professional. I coordinated a meeting for 200+ sales professionals, and without question there was agreement that this was the best venue we have visited to date!

The staff was great.  The pools look nice.  However, note that there is a mandatory $20 per person per day "resort fee," and parking is about $27 a day.  Makes your "good rate" for the hotel less good.  The fancy restaurant is good.  There is no casual restaurant on-site or any within walking distance.  The bar is very average and doubles as a Starbucks in the morning.  The lobby is not much to look at.  The Concierge desk is not staffed regularly, tho the front desk staff tries to help.  The rooms are very average and aging (we had AC trouble the entire week we were here).  It is a long walk (or more likely a car ride for most people) to Balboa Island, shopping and the beach.  We expected more of a luxury hotel and this was not it.

Had a great stay at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. The room was great.  The breakfast at the restaurant was amazing!  All of the staff was so friendly and accommodating.  Ben, at the front desk, was amazing.  He made our stay!

Summary Heading: Awful overnight stay. Awful enough to make me write a review about it. And I'm lazy.
Summary: Usually, I only write reviews when things are exceptionally above par, or exceptionally below par. This is cause life is full of a list of errands that fall higher in priority then writing about "great or good experiences or even bad ones." What cuts the cake is when you HAVE to take the time out of your day to BLAST company online about the standard of service you received.   Hyatt Regency is Hyatt's "higher end brand"  The Regency in Newport Beach was supposed to fall under this category.  Nope. Hyatt failed. Big time. I was given an awful room upon checkin, and didn't realize it until multiple things went wrong. (You don't realize how bad it is to be right next to the maids and carts and elevators. I thought someone was knocking at the door 9-10 times.  Jesus Christ I want a

Had a lovely experience at the Hyatt on a recent trip to southern california.  The staff were very friendly and helpful with all of our needs.  We had an issue with the room and the staff made sure to fix the issue and gave us a free breakfast for our inconvenience.

Summary Heading: Old, poorly maintained, expensive, but good location
Summary: This hotel charges a fee for everything.  They even charge for internet and parking, which is ridiculous.  The worst part is that the hotel is old and smelly.  The bathroom door did not close, and it we had to hold it shut with a rubber band.  They were well-aware of this, because the rubber band was already there.  The location is good, but that is about it.

Summary Heading: A not so good night couple of days sleep !
Summary: Alarm went off every hour during night ...Was told it would be fixed the next day . They never looked at it . After engineering arrived following evening ( very late to change room )it turned out it was a problem they where fully aware of and rented room out anyway !!!!

Hello,   I stayed in this property for a few days over Christmas break. My overall experience was positive.  Pros:  - Quiet - Clean - Good Service at front desk - Tennis Court - Golf Course - 3 heated pools and a Jacuzzi - human size chess outdoors :-) - Hotel location in Newport beach - Good restaurant with excellent servers (Shor, i think is the name? It's the only one) - Bar staff in the lobby are nice and courteous. - Airport shuttle (SNA) - Water bottles in the room everyday :-)  Cons: - A bit older rooms/bathrooms - Cleaning staff lacks the attention to detail. We came back one evening from a full day away from the property to find out that only the bed had been made. Everything else, including the bathroom, were the same. Towels were not replaced or anything. We called

Pretty property with lots to do. Was cold and rainy half of our our visit so we didn't get to take advantage of the two pools. Highlight for our daughter was the s'more making one evening; highlight for hubby was free golf. Used hotel shuttle to get to Balboa Island but realized how close hotel was and walked back!  Pleasantly surprised by size of room, which had pull-out twin-size sofa bed. Should have asked for roll-away bed, though, because sofa bed mattress very thin.  Restaurant was noisy for dinner but food was good.  Lobby bar became breakfast bar in the a.m. so take-out Starbucks (+muffins, oatmeal, yogurt) available.  Concierge very helpful booking whale-watching trip and off-site restaurant.

Thank you for a wonderful NYE. The hotel was amazing, the staff was attentive and my overall experience was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that is looking to stay in Newport CA. Thank you

It was the most horrendous Buffet ever.  Everything was ice cold, plus the price was outrageous 26.00 for cold food.  Would never ever do the buffet at a Hyatt ever again.  You could get a better meal probably at a McDonald's.

I have stayed at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach at least once nearly every year since 1988.  That first visit was for business but most since have been for pleasure.  The grounds are magnificent and extensive, the rooms are very welcoming and what you would expect from Hyatt Regency.  The food is good and the staff has always been amazing.  The location has easy access to all that Newport Beach, Corona Del Mar and Laguna Beach have to offer.  After somewhere over 35 stays I still look forward to my next visit.

Older rooms in Bay building with bad beds and tiny windows.   Be careful where they put you-- Bay building also very noisy with screaming kids.  Golf was nice.  Restaurant is terrible and doesn't compete with most locals quality places

Beautiful grounds, really nice hot tub and pool area.  The free bicycle rentals were a pleasant surprise and we were able to get bicycles with kid carriers on the back so we could tour Newport Back Bay.  Very central location to the best parts of the Orange County Coast.  I tried to order two milks for the kids for room service and the hostess just told me to come down to the restaurant and pick them up for free. It's nice to get free things.  They also gave us a complementary access to the breakfast buffet for one of the two mornings. The food was good and the service even better.  We'll definitely come back another time.  My one complaint was that the toilet ran for a few times so I had to jiggle the handle and the shower head leaked a little at the connection.

I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel.      The hotel room was nicely set up, up to par with other nice Hyatt venues worldwide.   The overall hotel looks older (as other reviewers have mentioned), however, the hotel room is nice and that makes up for it.   Hotel feels very cozy and the staff is friendly.   Highly recommend.    One more tip.   To visit Balboa Fun Zone, consider taking Uber from the hotel.   It's a short Uber ride that costs only like $12.

already stated read previous Paper thin doors and walls, kids stomping above us day to night not a relaxing trip, poor sleeping conditions, pool dirty had to request it be cleaned, pool gate key not working entire trip Also survey is repetitive

Have used hotel when in area before for work and decided to spend holidays here with wife and my daughter who is a University sophomore. Room was in a quiet spot in lido building and is ok given the reasonable room rate. Paid extra for view of bay which was pleasant. Staff at hotel are friendly in most areas especially dining and bell hop's. My first minor gripe is the reception staff two in particular who seem to be more concerned with making calls despite fact you and others are stood there waiting. Hotel has nice garden areas and pool spaces which are maintained nicely. Was mixed weather so didn't use pools but they are heated in winter. Hotel is walking distance to Fashion Island giving you food and shopping on doorstep. There is a shuttle but oddly for 2nd small gripe runs

Room is very nice and clean. We just check in today and are already ready to leave.  From 6 pm to 10 pm, we had to deal with kids and parents screaming in the hallway - it was too difficult for them to close their hotel room and clearly wanted all of us to be part of their lives! After 10 pm, all we could do is hearing screaming and loud drunk upstairs! We called the front desk...nothing they can do...First time staying at this hotel...and we will NEVER go back! If you are looking for a quiet getaway to enjoy family time, stay away. Hotel staff is nice and professional, but this hotel seems to attract a bunch of inconsiderate people.

Summary Heading: Relaxing Stay in Hyatt Regency Newport Beach
Summary: We had a wonderful night's stay on our way to our vacation destination.  The hotel was beautiful.  Our room was great.  The staff were efficient and friendly and very helpful.  We were offered options for our room location.  We had to wait a short while for a particular room, and it was ready as quickly as they said it would be.

A large sprawling resort in a faux hacienda style. Pools, golf, fitness center make this a class act resort.  Beautiful landscaping, paths and palms make this a real California experience.  It is sprawling, with a number of buildings. The far away buildings are a bit of a hike. If you have trouble walking, ask for a room in the main building.  We had a lovely two room suite which was spacious with two nice patios. The room did seem a bit dated, but it was comfortable.  Staff was friendly and always helpful. The lobby was festively decorated for Christmas.  I would gladly stay here again, our family enjoyed our visit here.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but high additional fees
Summary: Resort fee of $25pd as well as a $27pd parking fee. Too high of a price to pay AFTER you've paid for the hotel already I think. The staff were great. Beautiful grounds but ultimately will not come back because of the extra fees associated with this hotel.

We love staying here at this Newport Beach location really gives you the feeling that you're a million miles away from everything. Stayed at many different Newport Beach location hotels but this one is definitely my favorite.

Summary Heading: A trip that we will never forget!
Summary: When we arrived we were greeted upon checking into our room. The room was very clean and comfortable with a wonderful view of the bay. The staff was also friendly each time we arrived back to to the hotel. The location was very convenient from everything!

Summary Heading: Good location with great bay view
Summary: This hotel is much less expensive than the Hyatt on PCH in Huntington Beach. It is also quieter as you don't have Coast Hwy traffic. The bay view rooms are very nice, with a large balcony and a full wall of windows/sliding glass door.l

I would have liked to give the hotel four stars but I had to take a star off coz of the noise. We were assigned a room with shared door to another room. And the adjoining room had kids screaming throughout the day starting at 6 am. It was really loud in our room. Poor quality noise insulation. When you select your room please make sure you have one without the shared door.   That issue aside, it's a nice hotel with good facilities like bikes, games etc.

Summary Heading: The service and hotel are excellent.
Summary: From the moment we arrived to the time we checked out our stay at this location was amazing. Beautiful landscaping. No glow in the dark golfing as we were told, but nice chip and put course. We are definitely going back

The bed way hard and uncomfortable. The air conditioner did not work after asking for a new remote. We had to leave the slider open for air which was loud and hard to sleep.  Not what I would expect for a Hyatt!

Did not sleep. Had to be an elephant in the room upstairs, every step was very loud and we could hear his music all night long. Any time anyone entered the hall we could hear the total conversation from inside our room.

Christmas party family/ employees.  Amazing hotel/resort. Check in very easy and  accommodating   They arrange so family rooms could be close as possible.  The rooms are very  spacious, clean, with all the  necessary amenities

Summary Heading: Great experience, would consider bringing family here
Summary: This hotel was chosen by the conference (that I attended in the area) organizers, so I didn't have much choice. That said, I have forgotten how great it is to stay at a Hyatt. Super comfortable beds, quiet room, tasty food at the restaurant. And of course I was treated royally although I don't have any particular perks/membership! The café/lounge bar was a very nice area to hang out. I didn't try the pool as it is winter time, but the area around it seemed nice including for children. If I decide to bring my kids to Disneyland, I would definitely consider staying here. And WiFi worked great.

Summary Heading: Fantastic location! Fantastic Staff! Delicious Food!
Summary: We recently stayed once again this year at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach.  We are always delighted with the positive and genuine nature of the staff and how well they take care of you. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast every morning and enjoyed the warm ambiance with an outdoor fireplace in the evening for wine and fantastic appetizers.

My wife and I arrived early on a Wednesday and were greeted first by a smiling shuttle driver at the airport and then by the valet personnel who never let us open a door ourselves.  The front desk was then very helpful in telling use of surrounding attractions as well as the free shuttle they offer.  Our room was very spacious, clean and modern.  We stayed for several days with a little confusion on one day where our room was not cleaned while we were out.  This was addressed immediately by the house keeping supervisor who apologized for the mistake.  It was all in order when we returned from dinner.  The bar staff were also always ready to please even with all the functions at the hotel they were also there to help.  Thanks and we hope to return.

Great choice for a peaceful stay just a short drive to Disneyland.  Front Desk was quick, food and service was awesome and Bell and Valet staff were great.  Entire staff was so friendly!!!  We had a problem with our rent car and the hotel made arrangements to get our family to Disneyland while it was being repaired.
