We have stayed twice in 2016 and plan future times at the Newport Beach Hyatt  During 2017 we  plan at least 3 additional stays for 5-7 days on each visit. Additional family members will join us for Disneyland and the gorgous beaches surrounding

Exceptional service throughout the ground floor FOH & lobby.. the team here at the front of house are so engaging & so happy to help & make you feel welcomed. We were checked in by Ben who made our week.. he was just first class, chatty & professional rolled into one as well as Myara (not sure if spelt correctly) in the bar.. she was just lovely.   Good, well appointed rooms, comfortable beds and work space.   Our only disappointment was the rooms were not cleaned to a good standard, on checkin the room was great, it was every day after that the bathroom were not re.cleaned during stay (sink & bath), no additional toiletries supplied even when fully used & in the bin & the sheets were only changed once during the week, i wouldn't have minded too much, it was just the beds were

I cannot begin to describe my experience with Chloe, the concierge. She was so incredibly sweet and friendly, and she felt like a trusted friend. Her above-and-beyond attitude truly made my stay so special, I teared up on my last night!  She made sure that I knew of all of the great restaurants, how to get there, and if it would be a fun place to hang out. One evening after telling her about the restaurant I went to, I returned to my room to find dessert waiting for me because she knew the place didn't have dessert.  It was so thoughtful!  I loved seeing her smiling face every day when I returned from work, it made me feel like I was home (and not staying alone in a hotel for two weeks!).  The rest of the staff was wonderful as well, the bartenders in the lounge were always kind

Apparently Marilyn Monroe stayed there, as well as JFK!  Nice rooms, updated!  Only complaint was noticed the small fees tucked in here and there, such as the wifi. For instance, when you connect to wifi, it automatically pops up for 9.99 for 24hr access; however if you scroll down there is complimentary wifi available. So it's a nice place, fabulous location, comfy beds, clean rooms; just be aware of small fees here and there!

Stayed here a few times and it was again a great stay.  Comfortable and inviting.   Great place to exercise and walk.  Close to shopping and Balboa Island.  The staff were wonderful.  From renting bicycles to a small golf course it provides a lot for you and family.  Top rate fitness center.

Rooms are good but common.  Not what you expect from a Newport Beach resort.  Friendly staff that shows they care about your visit.   Room service was great.   Overall, a decent place just not up to my expectations.

the place is good and area around it (Newport beach) is amazing. however, you have to pay for everything starting from the resort fee, parking, breakfast if it's not included, internet. the service there is very good

If you use Hotwire watch out for $25 per day fee. Parking $27 per day. Can't park in street cause you would get a ticket. Beds are not comfortable. They are small and hurt my back. Location is great with access to Balboa.

We have been visiting the Newport Beach Hyatt since 2012. We love the resort feel, the accessibility of the Back Bay (birder's paradise), and the many pools on site. We think the restaurant is great. It's our home away from home.

We  enjoyed our stay.  The rooms were very clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. My only complaint is that there is both a resort fee and self parking fee.  There is plenty of space to self park in the parking lot is always from the rooms. I think if someone is willing to South Park they should be charge for it.

Hotel was nice and well kept. Staff was very cordial and made sure we had everything we needed . The location was in an ideal place in Newport Beach. We enjoyed our stay. We will stay again when we come visit our family.

Summary Heading: You can do better in the area.
Summary: Even though we are Hyatt Platinum members we were treated poorly at check in and given the worst room 204.  Fine, whatever. You can't always be special. However after unpacking and reveling in our view of the parking lot we discover the  sink's drainage is slow. And the Toilet over flows. Slow response to the situation causing us to be late for dinner reservations with friends. Even though we remained calm and pleasant the front desk response was unacceptable. They ended up giving us a drink voucher for our trouble. One drink voucher for inconvenience to Two people not to mention our friends waiting for us for dinner.  There are too many choices in this area to put up with this treatment by the front desk.

Loved this Hyatt.  Came down Thanksgiving week to look at various colleges and spend Thanksgiving with the family.  Not a high rise which was nice, only 2 and 3 stories. Great amenities and kids loved the pool, volleyball, shuffleboard and the new fitness center!!  (animal friendly if have pets, did not bother us)  10 minute walk to Balboa Island\ferry or 10 minute drive to Newport Beach area - which is beautiful!!!   Bed comfortably and rooms very clean, but a bit out dated.  Food was good, however only ate in bar area and breakfast buffet. Easy to get to from airport.

Summary Heading: Good place, needs some improvements though
Summary: Overall, the property and the experience was good. It is easy to tell that the property is old. Many parts of it have it been updated. We had a problem our first night there with the people next to us smoking in there room. There are doors that go between rooms that let in all the smoke and loud noise going next door. It was obnoxious to say the least. We had to change rooms and the staff was very polite about doing so. The property is said to be non-smoking, yet people were smoking all over the place and no signs were posted saying not to smoke. The prices for food and drink are too high and more of the property needs to be renovated. The walk to self parking is pretty far. The location is great though and service was very good. Overall a good property and I would recommend.

Stayed 2 days very impressed with pool/slide/hot tub. Room and staff very pleasant. Great for family with children. A few minutes from balboa island and pier and beach. The only downside is cost of parking and that you have to drive everywhere.

This hotel is very kid friendly and super welcoming. The staff was wonderful and always trying to make sure we were having the perfect time.  We have been here four times now and plan on coming back again

The hotel is in desperate need of upgrading. Also full disclosure of the resort fee (other  then the front lobby, which is too late) and parking fee prior to reserving on the site. Customer service average to be overly kind.

We loved our vacation with the family for the holidays! Everything was perfect.  Location is great.....Staff was really nice! Valet was totally on it. Drinks were spot on. A little expensive but worth the travel .

We have not been disappointed on any of our visits here. Staff friendly and helpful. All requests were handled beautifully.  Lobby inviting. Love that the bar turns into a full service Starbucks in the morning. Rooms very comfortable. Very pet friendly. Overall a lovely place to stay.

Overall, a wonderful experience! Beautiful, well kept and maintained facilities and grounds, a staff that is second to none as far as friendliness and welcoming goes, we all enjoyed our stay and will stay with you again in the future.

Summary Heading: A dated hotel with great employees.
Summary: We stayed one night as our place was being fumigated.  Upon arrival, they did not have a king size bed available for us and we were told that we were "upgraded" rooms and were placed in the Catalina Building.  The gentleman behind the desk seemed genuinely sorry as we are Hyatt Platinum members so he gave us a $35 credit (basically to cover valet parking) and a voucher for free breakfast.  There was one elevator to our rooms and the floors creaked during our walk to the room.  The room was simple with two double beds (yes, king bed promised to two double beds), television, sliding door to the restroom, and a double sliding glass door to the balcony.  There is a coffee machine and a small refrigerator.  There are two bottle of water but when we opened it, the lower half of the

This is a nice hotel...except for the daily $27 self-parking fee, the additional non-negotiable daily $25 resort fee, which pays for two bottles of water and internet, and the zero benefits attained from being a Platinum level member.

I have stayed at this property many times and always find the service and quality to be top notch!   The staff is great and they really make a difference with excellent attention to details!  I highly recommend staying here if you find yourself in the Newport Beach area.

Summary Heading: Local Author stays at Hyatt Newport Beach
Summary: I hadn't stayed at the Hyatt since the 1960s when I worked for the LA Office of KPMG Peat Marwick. They have retained the same charm and I ran into a one or two who worked there back in the day. Very motivated and fine people. They love where they work and it shows. Congratulations!

Not sure it's worth the resort fee, but the grounds are nice. My teenage girls and I enjoyed playing shuffleboard, big size chess, and lounging in the various couches etc around the pools. Even better, it's a short walk to paddle board rentals at the bay. Would've rated higher but our room had some mechanical issues that, once alerted, the hotel claimed to have fixed but didn't. So we didn't sleep well. They gave us coffee vouchers to try to make it up but lost sleep isn't easily replaced! That said, I would probably stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice quality and convenient in-room fridge
Summary: In town for a wedding. Unlike a lot of nice-ish hotels, instead of a mini-bar, the room had a refrigerator for us to use as we pleased. Self-parking was easy. Didn't need the fitness center but it looked quite decent, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here when I did need a fitness center. After we left hanging clothes in our closet, it took little effort for us to request the staff send them to us.
Manager Response: Good morning,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. We are happy to hear you were able to utilize the refrigerator in the room. Hopefully next time you come back you will get a chance to utilize our fitness center.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: A Quiet Retreat in the City
Summary: Although my stay was very short, the Hyatt Newport Beach is a quiet retreat in a busy area.  I am looking forward to my next visit, which will be several days longer, and using some of the amenities that the hotel offers.  The shuttle service to the airport is scheduled and reliable.  However, I would like to see the first hotel departure at 0530 instead of 0600.  Security lines at JWA, like all other airports, tend to be unpredictable and the CAB fare to airport is $30.
Manager Response: Good morning,  Thank you for the great review. We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay. We will definitely take your feedback into consideration.  We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel previously, and was happy to return.  This time I stayed for 5 nights with wife and our 2 year old daughter.  As expected from the Hyatt chain hotel was clean, classy, with tons of amenities available on demand.    Room was spacious, with balcony and had a large flat screen TV with all channels available in HD.  Internet was quick, but having to sign in every 24 hours on each device was a bit of a pain.  Hotel has a nice restaurant, which also prepares meals for room service.  The restaurant can prepare meals off the menu, has great choice for kids, and waiters are extremely friendly and helpful.  If it wasn't for abundance of options in the area I would have been completely satisfied if I was eating at the SHOR every day.  Now the negatives:  1. I

We picked this hotel due to location to the greta shopping right near by at Fashion Island. It was a great stay overall. The check at the front desk was fast and friendly. We even got free wine passes. The valet guys were so nice and patient with the crazy gals that kept running back to the room to change outfits and then going right back out! The coolest part was the bar/cafe concept (it was a bit trippy if you haven't had your morning coffee yet)! The room was cute and we had a fun pool view. It was quiet and comfortable and very clean. The only draw back was the bathroom set-up; the toilet was not private and there was only one vanity. It was rather an awkward set-up. The overall property was very cute and very pretty!

This was weekend trip for  Style Convention in Costa Mesa. We chose this location due to the location near the Fashion island shops. I was super impressed with the staff, the check was fast and friendly. We even got free wine passes for the bar! The room was cute with a nice pool view. the bathroom was set-up a bit awkardly but the toilet open to the main area and only one vanity--it was a but tight. The hotel is a bit older, but kept up so nicely. The coolest feature is the area that is the hotel bar turns into the morning cafe (you really have to see this a bit trippy if you  haven't had your coffee yet)! The best was the Shor restaurant. The menu was labeled nicely with Gluten free options, but also the server was very knowledgable. The risotto was by far my favorite anywhere

Summary Heading: Nice Service, Good location,  Rooms need upgrade
Summary: We enjoyed the hotel.  Great service! The hotel dates back to make 1960-70's, well maintained.  The rooms are in need of renovation to be at Hyatt Regency brand level in my judgement.  The hotel as variety of facilities, like pool, executive golf.

Great stay. Came to California with my wife. Stayed here not knowing much about the hotel or the area, but we had a great time and it was a great place to stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful, and we'd definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Couldn't get connecting rooms for senior Mother that I was assured were no problem. We were asked to come back later the rooms just needed to be cleaned. We we returned at 9:00pm connecting rooms were not available. The rooms we were given to my 86 year old mother are at the 4th level with no elevator access.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We apologize that we were unable to accommodate your request. We typically try our best to accommodate guests based on their preference. One of our Front Office Managers will be following up with you in regards to this matter.   Thank you again for your time and we hope to welcome you back again soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Easy check in nice room and then around midnight loud groups of guests gathered near our room until 2:30. Also selling drugs in front of our room called front desk twice to send security not sure if anyone came was too afraid of opening door. Awful experience and very disappointing for a Hyatt. Was given our points back and no charges for parking. The front desk tried to do what they could but really selling drugs? No excuse.....ramp up your security so your guests feel safe.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for sharing your feedback. We apologize that you had such a negative experience at our hotel. We definitely do not condone that type of behavior at our hotel. Our security did address the other guests who were members of a wedding party also staying at our hotel. We were unaware of any illegal activity. If you would like to discuss this matter further, please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.  Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary: I was quite please with this hotel.  Staff from the valet to the cleaning staff was very polite, friendly and helpful.  the hotel was from the guest rooms to the surrounding grounds tranquil, relaxing and made me feel like I was in Hawaii.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Beautiful hotel. Fantastic location. Rooms very tastefully decorated. The pool is very nice and even has a children's slide. The gardens and landscaping on site are also lovely with perfectly manicured lawns. An easy walk to the nearby lagoon for an early morning stroll. Wish I had more time to Explore but sadly only stayed the one night.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Food at conference was great....much better than what is offerred in their restaurant or bar. Noisy rooms and poor a/c and heat.  Staff pleasant at check in and at valet. Valet too expensive. Experience was average at best.

our couch was covered in stains, how many times do you think housekeeping noticed it and did nothing about it? Pretty lazy housekeeping when your spending $250 a nite! Hotel needs a face lift. Parking is 35 a nite to valet Christ who is retiring off the valet charges? poor value.

I stayed at this Hyatt for probably the 8 or 9 times.  The rooms have been updated over the last few years and it remains a great place in a great town.  Lots to do in Newport Beach and beyond in Laguna and the other beach communities.  Pool remains sparkling and the lobby is a great place to relax, along with the outside fire.

My husband and I went to the Hyatt Newport for a  Medical Conference and were very pleased with the facilities, location, and mostly the staff.  The rooms are large and nicely appointed. The staff is very friendly and helpful.  They had a nice coffee bar and good restaurant.  We will definitely return for a personal trip

I went to a 3 day conference in early November stationed at this hotel.  They could not have been more accommodating, helpful or friendly.   I thought the food was wonderful.  Offered steel cut oatmeal with all the fixins, gluten free breads for those who care , and great home made granola bars, bagels with all sorts of toppings, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, granola, juices, teas, great coffee, lots of fruit.  Lunches were diverse and healthy and also tasted great. One day was a do it yourself taco station, also salad, and small delectable tamales, with spicy guacamole, wonderful salsas.  The next day, another wonderful salad, with fresh fruit, a curried peanut  bisque that was appetizing, free range chicken that was prepared flawlessly, a sweet potato/banana mash that was a great

Summary Heading: A Good Location for a Quality Hotel
Summary: If you are looking to book a conference event this is a great place for it.  A lot of options, great catering and close to a lot of attractions, walking or a short drive.  Can walk down to the island and all of the shopping and restaurants.  The resort has a small 9 hole Executive Golf Course so all you need is a wedge and a putter.  Only 1 restaurant and a small bar area that gets full quickly with the number of guests that are normal at this hotel.

Nothing is worse than being sick on the road and having to take care of yourself. I was sick during my stay and the hotel staff went above and beyond to take care of my needs and getting me over my illness. World class services

This resort is in a wonderful, upscale neighborhood in Orange County, California.  Amid tall pines and other gorgeous grounds, the hotel, though old, seems well maintained.  Our room was clean and quiet.  The parking attendants were wonderful.  And the room service was quick and yummy.  However, there were a few problems with plumbing in the bathroom and front desk and check in staff.  This did not feel like the Hyatt Regency properties we are used to.  A few miles up Pacific Coast Highway, there is another Hyatt Regency in Huntington Beach ... which is much better!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel- run poorly and understaffed- too expensive for this level of service
Summary: Attended a recent conference and requested adjoining rooms months prior, with the understanding that my request is subject to availability. A week prior, a manager contacted me to verify my request *(so far so good). Upon check-in, there is no record of my request and the manager on duty was clueless. They did get us close though. That was the highlight! Hundreds of people attending and 1 person staffing breakfast and lunch as well as coffee (no coffee in rooms).  Everything was a line and a delay. Upon my feedback, I received a generic "we are sorry".  I enjoy Hiltons far better and will not be staying in a Hyatt again. I have also suggested to the conference organizers that they look for a more hospitable venue.

Very clean and good accommodations.  Housekeeping was a little lax with details.  I wanted to have Bfast room service, which is easiest with the door handle tag, but that was only offered on my first night.  Called the second night, and did my own thing after that.  :-( Otherwise, a great location, very attentive and helpful employees, and a pleasant business experience.  Free shuttle to local/airport locations was great.  Bar prices a little high...

My husband and I stayed at this property in late October 2016.  Checking in was quick even though there was a big conference at the time. I requested a quiet room away from elevators and ice machines. Our room was on the first floor. We had a neighbor above our floor that seemed to stomp around; other than that it was quiet. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our room was was clean and somewhat spacious (it was a standard room). We were provided a coffee maker, refrigerator, safe, and a flat screen television. In addition, the room had a patio with a table and two chairs. This property is close to many restaurants and the famous Fashion Island mall. The only complaint I have is that this hotel has only 1 restaurant and a very small coffee shop. We literally waited about 25

I was in Newport Beach for one night for a friend's memorial.  Everyone at the Hyatt Newport Beach was most accommodating; recepetion gave me an upgrade, my key did not work and one of the housekeeping personnel gave ne access to my room.  My room was 330 in main building (Catalina I think) it had a balcony and overlooked one of the three pools.  The room was quite spacious with such a comfortable bed and linens.  I opted to just eat a quick breakfast the morning I was leaving in the cafe in the lobby.  It's a walk up bar with hot breakfast sandwiches, oatmeal, muffins, bagels, etc.  I took the shuttle to the airport which is complimentary if you are a guest and it took me 25 minutes total to get on the shuttle, get to airport, stop for a boarding pass, go through security and
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. We are glad you were able to enjoy our resort amenities and hope to welcome you back again soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: My go to place in OC
Summary: When in the OC for business and for vacation I often end up at the Hyatt Newport Beach. It has a perfect location - walking distance to Balboa Island and Fashion Island very close too. The staff are friendly, the lobby bar/restaurant easy, pool nice.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad you enjoyed your stay and hope to welcome you back again soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: We loved the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach.  Great location, attentive staff, beautiful grounds.  We did not complain about the parking and resort fees, since they were plainly stated in our reservation.  The resort fee included several perks, from water to newspapers.  We did not eat at their restaurant, but it looked lovely.  The check-in personnel were so friendly and helpful and later supplied some free items which I had forgotten.  We would love to come back in the future as we were only here three days and it was not enough!
Manager Response: Good afternoon Linda,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Well-maintained hotel on lovely grounds. Friendly staff. Excellent room service. I slept soundly and loved the shower. The motion-detecting under-nightstand light is a nice touch. The grounds are beautiful. Recommended.

This hotel is really nice.  Its spacious and has a feel of class about it around the grounds.   The room was large, the bed comfy and the bathroom nice. There are several pools about the grounds which split the guests across the hotel so the pool areas seem quiet which is nice.   We wanted to eat in the main restaurant one evening but it was absolutely dead with no atmosphere so we drove down to the seafront instead.   Breakfast was nice.  The gym was ok - a bit basic.   The location is good - 10 minutes from the sea front with more places to eat and drink.

Summary Heading: Nice grounds, adequate rooms, a long walk or short drive to the beach
Summary: The grounds and common areas of this resort are very pretty, while the rooms are typical, comfortable, and unremarkable. We enjoyed two of the outdoor pools but were disappointed that we misunderstood the distance to the beach, which required a drive (and was definitely worth it). We arrived late and so snacked in the lounge, and we dined at the restaurant for breakfast -- both pretty good, but we had a better time eating outside the resort later in the stay. The manager on duty was kind enough to switch us to a quieter room, upon request, as the noise from a nearby waterfront festival was throbbing through the walls of our first room. We switched to a poolside location, which was pleasant and quiet.

Summary Heading: Most absurd costs for parking!  Valet is 35 buck and self parking where you park your own damn car and walk cost 27 buck
Summary: We won't be coming back to this location just on the simple fast of parking costs.  No hotel is worth 27 dollars of self parking.  Where is this money going because the property isn't outrageously nice.

THE hotel is nice but the food in the restaurant is pretty bad.  We should have gone out to eat, wasted money. Convenience shuttle bus to Balboa Island and Fashion Island.  it's also within walking distance from the Newport Dunes.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Tiana,  Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you did not enjoy the food at our restaurant. If you're willing to discuss your experience with one of our restaurant manager's please call the hotel directly at 949-729-6140. We would be happy to welcome you back.  Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Great business stay in Newport Beach!
Summary: Excellent location; near shopping, Balboa Island, Balboa peninsula and Disney. Terrific accommodations and very friendly and attentive staff. Upgraded rooms make the stay very nice. Superb location for a conference. Food has been terrific.

On one of many stays, my wife and I were welcomed and treated as though we were long-lost relatives.  Service was excellent, and a little updating in our bathroom room would have made our visit "perfect".

Summary Heading: A Hyatt Regency in name only
Summary: This is an interesting property with a 1970's motor lodge feel (as many of the rooms including the one that I stayed at open directly to cool deck surrounding a swimming pool). The many and varied buildings that make up this hotel are situated both near and far from the main lobby and have the feel much like that of a home that started out with 1,500 feet under roof, but after four or five remodels/additions made over many years is now 6,000 square feet. The positives are that the staff is exceptional and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The restaurant on property serves "a mean breakfast", and the small lobby bar is inviting. If a laid back California Dreamin' beach feel is what you are after, then this is your place.If you are thinking about staying here

Hotel grounds are lush. Rooms are clean, well lighted and very modern. The staff is absolutely wonderful. They pampered us with extra deserts and coffee drinks. The great staff made our business trip seem too short. Thank you Hyatt Regency.

Summary Heading: Not up to Hyatt Regency standards
Summary: This is a quirky hotel with lot of steps and separate buildings, which makes it challenging to navigate with luggage. Also, it needs better lighting after dark. Dark, poorly lit walkways with steps in unsuspecting places. Rooms are pretty small. A room with two beds is a double-double -- tiniest double beds ever. This is a quaint hotel, but definitely not up to the standards of a Hyatt Regency. The upside is a nice pool.

Very clean Hotel.  Grounds are very pretty.  Nice patio or balcony. Staff were amazing in service.  They do a lot of events including concerts so it can be noisy.  Good for families.  They have three pools - all nice.  They have a plastic chest set and shuffle boar and a water slide.  We ate at the SHOR restaurant on site which was not very good.  I would stay here again.  Oh and they have a nice shuttle that goes over to the big mall Fashion Island.

Summary Heading: Relaxing Weekend at the Updated Newporter
Summary: Although, the Old Newporter has been The Hyatt Regency for many years now, it never disappoints. The staff is very accommodating.  Updated rooms with a Bay View are lovely. I was quite disappointed with the Shor Restaurant on-site.  The menu is very slim, not much to choose from at either lunch or dinner.The hotel grounds are beautiful and a quick walk to Balboa Island.  I will return soon.

Went for business. 3 nights. Hotel was quaint but very busy. Had 1 shampoo for 3 days for our room. Asked to bring more, but never showed up. Food at bar lobby fishy. No free coffee in lobby. Self serve coffee $3.87 daily.  Beds were made daily....  I suppose that's a plus.

Rooms are old, pillows and bed not that comfy. Service in bar area is slow, and was incorrect. For the rooms you  need to call and request things like robes, mouthwash etc - not standard in the rooms.  Location is ok to Fashion Island and Balboa.  But better hotels in the area.  Front door staff very nice.

This is a place i usually prefer to stay when in OC. Great food. Bar is reasonable and proximity to some OC venues is perfect. Kids love it and beach is a short walk/drive away. Outside of the hotel dining, it is also very near to some high end places to enjoy an excellent meal with friend and family.

We missed the once an hour shuttle so we had to take Uber.  Then our room smelled like a wet dog.  Bathtub drain was clogged and maintenance was called and pulled out a wad of hair.  Also found a piece of sharp metal in our bed.  This is not what I expect from any Hyatt let alone a 4 star Hyatt.  I've had better accommodations at Hyatt Place.

We reserved a room specifically for attending the Jazz event (Boney James). I have difficulty walking long distances so that gave me a room right upstairs from the event. They were so supportive. Great team there.

Summary Heading: Quality Hotel in beautiful garden settings
Summary: This hotel is well maintained throughout with diligent staff. Rooms are cleaned daily and restaurant service is second to none with friendly, helpful staff. A free shuttle service is available and there is a 9 hole golf course in the grounds. There are three pools with plenty of sun beds and towels provided. Self Parking is charged at $27 per night which is a downside and something to bear in mind re finance. Overall though, a lovely place to stay.

The staff were great and very helpful. We stayed for 12 days and loved the amenities - pools, gym and bikes.  We took advantage of the beach cruisers (bikes) most days to get around.  The hotel is in a great location.  We were lucky enough to be staying there when they had the summer concerts tours and got to listen to 2 concerts. Will stay there again if we visit Newport Beach.

An older resort-type property, I was there for a convention as a committee member overseeing the show. The place is well maintained, but shows its age when hauling luggage around - big chunks of the complex are accessed only by stairways (unless there are secret passages I didn't find), so think twice if you're wheelchair bound. Service was at usual Hyatt standard, although I've been more impressed at other properties. Convention services got the job done inconspicuously, and the food was quite good.

Summary Heading: Like a German car - everything is extra
Summary: Why does this place get a good rating? There were a few issues during our stay at this hotel but, while it is always better when there are no issues at all, they were dealt with reasonably and sensibly and that's how it should be. Service was good throughout, rooms are clean and comfortable and value for money, given the deal on offer, excellent.   The problems - let's start with the deal. Having booked through Expedia breakfast was included in our package, or so we thought. On check-in we were informed otherwise. While at some hotels I would happily pay not to eat, the breakfast here is a big deal and well worth having. On sight of some paperwork the Hyatt was happy to honour the deal (even though the whole thing had to be explained again on check out). A sensible judgement to

We stayed here for four nights and had a great time. Staff were really friendly and the pool was great for sunbathing or swimming. Our room was on the ground floor and had a view over the local water. Happily come back again, only downside was it was a bit pricey but to be expected in Newport Beach.

Love this property but the $35 daily valet parking fee is way too high and the $27 self parking fee is also insulting. The location of this Hyatt is fantastic with a lot to do in the immediate area. Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Beautiful clean hotel great location  by the beach.
Summary: Visiting my sister for her birthday,  we stayed over night @ THE Hyatt Regency and had an awesome time!  We arrived at the hotel a little early and were allowed to check in.  The pool was perfect, and the jacuzzi was great! After getting ready for dinner,  we drove to Billy at the beach and celebrated her birthday! We had an awesome  get away!!!

we loved staying here, very pricey and the cost was a bit confusing (still not sure what a resort fee is and why we had to pay for it)  loved the grounds , the employees were wonderful and so accommodating in every way

Stayed overnight. It was very nice. Wish we could of stayed longer to enjoy pool with the kids. Overall very nice!! Plan to stay there again in the future. Would totally recommend to family and friends. Close to the bay and nice views.

I rated housekeeping a 2 because of the poor service from the housekeeper for our room. The very first time I left a hotel and did not leave a substantial tip. We did not receive service until after 4:30 pm,  the trash was not emptied, towels were not left, did not replenish coffee and waters, they only came in and made the bed. I had to walk down the hall and ask for water, coffee and towels. Everyone other staff I would rate a 10. Overall the hotel is nice...just need to up their housekeeping staff.

Summary Heading: Go during the Hyatt Jazz Summer concert series!
Summary: We stayed at this hotel and attended two concerts this year. The room was excellent and the food at the hotel is great. Fun times, at the bar and the restaurant! Our room service was excellent. We will be back next year!

The hotel and staff was wonderful. Friendly staff and happy to help with whatever needs we had. Highly recommend this hotel and will be returning next year. Best hotel stay I've ever had and I was in the travel business for over 25 years prior to retiring so I've seen my share of hotels.

Wonderful property! Food was excellent  Meeting room (round one) was so pretty. I had a wonderful villa with a. Huge room. Grounds are miticulous and all staff is truly professional. Gym sufficed for a workout
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards, Ashley R.

Summary: The first room we were given was very dreary, with a trundle bed, which we hadn't asked for, taking up much the space and a louver door in the bathroom, which didn't make for much privacy.  The second room was only marginally better. That said, the front desk staff was very helpful.

Stayed here as a participant of the Newport Beach Triathlon...the grounds were beautiful, staff friendly, food amazing and the trip very relaxing.  The location was great and very easy to get to Newport and Balboa.

I spent three nights at the Hyatt Newport Beach and had a wonderful time. The grounds are stunning and spotless. The buildings are quintessential Southern California (two or three stories with many featuring outside hallways to enjoy the sun. I'm in agreement with other reviewer that the service here is exceptional for the price-point with valets, front desk and bar tenders all outgoing, friendly and always helpful. My room overlooked the main pool area and featured a comfortable bed with modern bathroom - loved the huge TV with HD channels! This hotel will be at the top of my list the next time I'm in Orange County!

Summary Heading: Wonderful vacation spot for the family
Summary: We booked the hotel based on family friendliness, and the Hyatt NB exceeded our expectations.  We were able to fit our family of 5 into 1 room.  They booked my family and friends that spent my "50th birthday weekend" right next door to our room.  The pools were great and relaxing.  The oversized chess game was a hit with the kids.  I loved that we walked on over to the back bay to rent kayaks.  I ran the backbay trail each day.  I have family that live nearby.  The hotel made it easy for them to come spend time with us while we were there.  Each morning, we all met up at the coffee bar.  Easy, lovely, and relaxing.

Myself and four other friends decided to check in to enjoy a 3-night stay while taking in a segment of the summer concert series they offer. The hotel location and room views couldn't be better! Staff attentiveness to detail was impeccable, i.e.:    1) I rushed out of room and left $170.00 out on dresser. Room was cleaned during my absence and money was all there still in tact upon my return.     2) There were 5 of us in my party and one of the ladies had problems walking distance and one of the staff people heard us discussing how we would all like to go over to visit the property gift shop so they immediately asked us if we would like for them to ask permission to drive us over in golf cart. That was such a wonderful accommodation for our handicapped travel mate!    3) We

Summary Heading: Extremely family friendly. I have a 3 and 11 year old. And they were both entertained the entire stay. Pools are warm.
Summary: Recommend valet. Only bc everyone was complaining about how far self parking garage is... compared to valet. It's only 8 $ more and it unlimited each day. Pool ran out of towels. But it's no big deal. Bc the wait for more towels was a few minutes

Adjacent to a secluded bay which is perfect for swimming if the hotel pools are not enough. However, it should be noted that the various pools had something for everyone from couples wanting to enjoy a quiet day in the sun to families making a splash on the water slide. There are nearby trails for both biking & running. I was happy to see the fitness center had clean & new equipment. 4-star dining & shopping options within a couple miles (ref. Fashion Island).

A great hotel to stay in when competing in the Newport Beach Triathlon.  It's very close to the event.  The staff and facilities are great.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.  The pool area is especially good fun for children, as there are plenty of waters activities.

Summary Heading: Always at the top of their game
Summary: I stay at this particular Hyatt often when I come to my home office.  I am also so impressed with their service and the facility itself.  They go out of their way to be accommodating.  The rooms have been remodeled and are so very nice.  The grounds are outstanding with beautiful views and pools.  I would recommend to anyone traveling with family or on business.  I travel several times a month and out of all the places I stay, this hotel is by far the best.   Located by PCH and several wonderful restaurants and also by Fashion Island.

The hotel was overpriced. The extra fee's at check out didn't help. The hotel was an older building - the hallways had a bad order. The room was clean but small for the price. Self parking was far away.

My sister and I visited for two nights and returned for the second time as the location is great and the services are a big plus.  The shuttle service to and from the airport is very convenient ..we also went to the mall and did some shopping.  We viewed Smoky   Robinson concert from our room because it was sold out.  We met some really friendly people there on the terrace..food was great...all over a very wonderful experience.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Virginia,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay and the Smokey Robinson concert. We hope to welcome you back for another show soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Run down pool and bad service. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.
Summary: Run down pool and bad service. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. Long line for check in. Almost no service at the pool. We were there on a Saturday and they had one person working at the pool.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. We apologize that you felt our pool service was poor, if you would like to discuss your experience with one of our Hotel Managers please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.  Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary: There were two things about my stay that really bothered me.  First, the ac in room 722 is so loud it can't be turned on at night or if you're wanting to watch TV.  It's deafening.  Secondly, I was alarmed to see that I was charged $27 for self-parking my car.  There were hundreds of parking spots available in their lot...maybe now I know why.  $27/day is outrageous especially when you're not even in a property constrained location.  Truly disappointing.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Steve,  Thank you for your feedback.  We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. We will follow up with our engineering team in regards to the noisy air conditioner. If you would like to discuss your stay with one of our Front Office Managers please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.  Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary: Hotel was OK. Would not recommend, staff was not attentive and did not care. Watched and allowed someone to cut me at check in and did not attend to me although I was next. Many better places to eat in Balboa compared to "The Shor". Was charged "resort fee" for using exactly zero of the resort. Do not plan on sleeping during their outdoor concert series.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Josh,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While we wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We would like to get a little more information from you in regards to your stay. If you would like to discuss your experience with one of our Front Office Managers, please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.  Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Great Accommodations and Jazz Concert Venue
Summary: Stayed the weekend after the Friday Jazz Concert. Very nice accommodations with concert located just outside our room. Staff is very pleasant and room was great. Although there were several other activities happening at this hotel, it did not feel crowded at all. Convenient access to the bay as well.
Manager Response: Good afternoon John,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We hope to welcome you back for another concert soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: We were given a balcony room overlooking the cafe - site of the Smokey Robinson show. GREAT ROOM! Nice room and easy to get to. And what a view of the show - WOW!! real nice bed - clean, too. The drink coupons were a real treat (Gold passport DOES pay off!)
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Excellent hotel!  We had a very nice time the restaurants were great the room was great it was quiet serene beautiful surroundings excellent waiters it was a great way to celebrate my birthday and also to see the smoky Robinson concert
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We hope you enjoyed your birthday and the show. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel very soon!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Bedding and amenities were good but the room feels old and the walls are thin so anyone next door can be heard. I expect more for a Hyatt Regency and in Newport Beach.  The staff was attentive and friendly but that just doesn't make up for the room.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While we wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. If you give us a chance to earn back your trust, we can assure you that we will do our best to give you the great hotel experience that so many of our guests have grown so fond of.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Whale watching and Hyatt regency stay
Summary: Just recently stay at the Hyatt regency Newport Beach California , nice hotel clean , arrived just after labour day the pool area was nice and quiet cleanish the food was not the best and drinks quite expensive but would return there as staff where very pleasant and the area is not far from balboa island which is a really nice place to visit and walk around , visited this area to go whale watching .        Went whale watching with Davey locker , first trip was not as good as the second plenty of dolphins to see but no whales , on the second trip 2 days later we saw and followed 1 hump back whale  ( from a distance)watched it surface while plenty of dolphins and loads of seals and some very comical seals trying to climb on people anchored boats .  The staff on Davey locker second

We chose this hotel, as it was 30 min drive from Disneyland, and 5 mins from the beach. Also for the boys it had nice pools and a safe and relaxing compound environment. Well the Hyatt catered for everything we needed. The rooms were of a nice size (AC a little old), the pool and surrounds were well looked after like we expect for a resort. Staff were friendly and helpful. If you don't want to pay for a full breakfast they have a "café" style area near the foyer which we liked and was better for us. There is a big difference in price from Valet Vs park yourself. I recommend Park yourself as the car park is very close. This is location location !! and very safe!

This is a nice resort style hotel, located closed to Fashion Island, a 10 minute drive to the main Newport Beach area.   Rooms are large, well appointed and comfortable (although my particular room smelt damp.). Service was friendly and helpful in true Southern California style.   If quiet and tranquility is what you are in search of, check to see if there are events at the outside amphitheater during your visit as the noise from these events can be heard throughout the Hotel, inside and out.   By no means 'high-end' or 'low-end' but somewhere in the middle, as you would expect from the Hyatt. S
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you were disturbed by one of the events at our hotel. We hope you come back soon and get to enjoy our resort amenities.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: A great place for an annual convention
Summary: Beautiful setting with great indoor to outdoor seating and eating/drinking areas.  Our convention attenders came from around the US, Canada, Mexico and Chile.  Nice meeting room with great breakfast buffet and lunch.  Hotel staff were helpful and friendly in a nice casual atmosphere.

Expensive! Location is ideal for visiting Newport Beach and vicinity. Free shuttle bus close to Balboa Island a plus..uphill walk home not for physically impaired people unless you wait for the return shuttle. Grounds are beautiful!

I was not impressed the night I stayed here. Kids were running around screaming. Once they went to bed the crickets were so noisy I don't think I slept all night. Also, the nickle and dime you for everything. You have to pay for parking which is $35.00. I'm pretty sure I paid the resort fee through Hotwire and then had to pay it again with the hotel. The last thing...I received two charges on my credit card statement both over $100. One I was aware of the other I was not. I'm still trying to get it credited back. Overall I'm not impressed.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. If you could please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234, one of our Front Office Managers can discuss the charges with you.  Warm regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Great hotel for easy access to Balboa shopping and food.  Short ride to many great locations.  Love their free shuttle.  Very firm beds.  Elevator building best rooms.  Very expensive to eat or drink at hotel, but exceptional service.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for your review of our hotel. We are happy to hear you enjoyed our amenities and service. We hope to welcome you back again soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Rooms - Our room was a corner room on the third floor. It was really big and had a balcony overlooking the pool. It's a true four-star room.  It was nice and clean, but did not have the amenities or perks of a 5-star room.   Parking - There is a resort fee for parking, which we did not know about. It's either $27 per day to self park or $34 per day for valet. We chose to valet and think it is the way to go. You can call from your room before you head down and by the time you get there, your car is waiting and ready to go.   Golf - There is a golf car on-site. With the hotel fee, your first round of golf is free. There are no tee times and club rentals are just $4. I found this out on the very last day or would have made time to play a free 18.  Pool - The pool is pretty big and
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel. We are glad to hear you had a chance to enjoy our golf course. Definitely come back again soon for another round!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: A great place to stay.  Noisy out side of the room but that is the drunken visitors fault mostly.  The wifi is strong and the room is spacious.  The pool with the water slide looks great but I am not into swimming anymore.

The great staff is the reason my husband and I return to this hotel whenever we are in town.  Beautiful gardens and pool area.  The room was modern and tastefully decorated with a laid back feel. Excellent location.  I highly recommend this hotel.

Came to the HR Newport for my cousin's wedding and noted in the reservation that the room was for the bridal party. Upon check in, there was no acknowledgement of HGP status nor were any of the amenities explained. Returned to the front desk a second time to specifically inquire about the benefits before they were offered.  Hotel room furnishings (used Diamond suite certification) were awful and outdated. One of the doors of the tv cabinet was falling off and even after notifying front desk, it was not fixed despite being told maintenance would come look at it.  This property was the most underwhelming in the Hyatt portfolio and absolutely detested the non-existent customer service that we had our reservation changed and left after the first night.

Summary Heading: It Ain’t the Hyatt in Huntington Beach but it will do.
Summary: If you want something new, modern and fresh then you should go elsewhere. If you want an older hotel in a great location in Newport Beach then this will do. Some of the rooms have been updated but because the resort is so big, inevitably there can be lots of noise nearby from children running up and down the halls, people coming back to their rooms late night, etc. There is a huge pool with water slides and a smaller pool that is much quieter. I was very impressed with the restaurant food. The breakfast and lunch were both very good. A good choice in Newport Beach but just know in advance what you are getting.

Summary Heading: Very mediocre, right under flight path of John Wayne Airport
Summary: I expected a more luxurious room but it was rather bland and small. Noise from the airplanes taking off from John Wayne Airport and some sort of meeting spot for hotel staffers distracted from the stay. I would not stay here again, especially considering the $300+ a night price tag.

The service was not very good from the bell hops to the check in. The bartenders were a plus, but the rooms bathrooms don't close fully; they slide mostly closed with a terrible barn door style of an opening / closing. I would not recommend this place to anyone with more than one in a room.

We had an amazing time !! The hotel was very clean and the staff was great!! If I needed something they were right there!  The rooms were very clean!  I would definitely recommend staying here! The good was also great!  And the girls down at the coffee / breakfast area in the morning remembered what I was having each morning I went down to grave coffee and breakfast!

My wife had a Sola Salon event on Sept. 12th at the Hyatt and she asked me to join her and get some beach time in. Stayed Sept 10 through the 13th. Room #210, near the main entrance and the pool. Overall really liked this stay, all staff was helpful and friendly. Need to make special thanks for superior customer service, Anchalee. (I do hope I spelled her name right) She was our waitress two evenings,  her personalty and professionalism are indeed an asset to the Hyatt family. Regular room noises, no big deal. Nice beds, linens and pillows. The grounds were very clean and well groomed. The pool was not crowded during our stay and was a great relief after a day biking.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We will share your great comments with Anchalee and her managers. We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: This resort is beautiful. As well as being a resort, it also hosts weddings and concerts!! It's walking distance from Balboa Island where the million dollar houses are (well worth a look) and just a short drive to Fashion Island, where there's loads of shops and restaurants, including Cheesecake Factory.  The resort is huge with lots of different pools and blocks. We were put in the Lido. As a couple travelling alone with no children, we didn't think we would be placed in the family section of the resort with lots of children. We had arrived on Labor Day weekend though so there were loads of kids about. The family above us were quite noisy and from 6am as we could hear every chair scrape and the kids arguing and crying.  On the subject of noise, the resort is on the flight path
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel very soon!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: If you're looking for a hotel and considering this one, I'll cut to the chase and tell you this is a safe bet and you'll most likely have a positive experience as my husband and I did. We're not hotel snobs really, but have been fortunate enough to stay in some really fantastic ones. So that being considered, there were some down sides to this hotel that didn't ruin our experience, but might for some other people if you're in the particular side. For transparency, I'll note them here: 1) elevator was small and old--you could only fit comfortably two people with luggage, and there's only one and it runs a bit slowly. There's a stair nearby and there isn't any help from the front desk to bring your bags to your room unless requested I think, so this might be an issue for the
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel very soon!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Great resort for families or business
Summary: This resort and staff are fabulous!  I have been staying here for almost two years on a weekly basis. All business travel so I never really was able to use all of the fun things they have to offer but love the location. The staff is amazing. Myrna in the lobby bar is the best!!!  Food excellent. Great jogging trail right out the back door. Wonderful concert series if you can take advantage. I could go on and on. Thus Hyatt was a home away from home and it was because of the wonderful staff. Highly recommend!!
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel and thank you for letting us be your home away from home! We are glad that you enjoy staying with us and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Our family of four, two adults and two children (13 and 11) recently stayed in this hotel for 8 nights, August 17 - 24 (inclusive) .  We were in two separate standard rooms, pool facing and were delighted with the cleanliess, space and facilities in the rooms.  The rooms were immaculately  maintained during the full duration of our stay.  Both restaurants were great, although we found the breakfasts a little costly and would recommend that a package that includes this be considered.  All staff in both restaurants offered a great service, were friendly and efficient.  The reception staff were outstanding, extremely professional, helpful and friendly.    The pool was worthwhile, however, the lounger covers are very grubby and in desperate need of replacing.  The children and I
Manager Response: Good afternoon Cindie,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are happy to hear you enjoyed your 8 night stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: Was there for a wedding and it was a beautiful venue. The food was good and the service was excellent. Our room was a little musty smelled like mold. We would stay their again and would plan a big function there.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Susan,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon for another event.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: We love taking little escapes to the OC and staying at the Hyatt Regency.  The grounds are nicely maintained and the staff is very courteous.  Breakfast outside is such a great way to start the day.  While the valet parking is fairly steep, they are swift, helpful, and very polite.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: The Hyatt Regency knows how to spoil it's clientele! We enjoyed the laid back feeling of the hotel and the excellent service and kindness of the staff!  The pool(s) offer you either a quiet interlude or a fun time sliding down a water slide.  Fun for all ages.

Try to book a breakfast package, otherwise it will be pricey to eat there. Nothing close by except higher end restaurants at Fashion Island. Impressive grounds with fun activities- 3 pools and it was relaxing just sitting on the balcony, enjoying the weather and views!
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: The bathroom and counter were small hard to share with someone else. AC unit was loud and outdated, vents were facing bed making it uncomfortable to sleep causing dry throat, coughing and restless sleep.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Michelle,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. Please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234, if you would like to discuss your stay with one of our front office managers.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: We had a great time at this hotel, the staff was wonderful, our room was remodeled and clean, we enjoyed the quieter pool areas, and the resort fee is well worth it if a person takes advantage of all the resort has to offer. We played golf, rode bikes, used the shuttle and the pools. We enjoyed the sunset views from the property and the food at SHOR is excellent.

PROS: Excellent service from Manon at the front desk and Ariane at concierge. Thanks for making my husband's birthday stay at your hotel special! *Wonderful experience with reservations and help from Manon at the front desk for assisting me with booking the right room. I told her we were arriving early and were pleasantly surprised our room was ready when we arrived. She is so sweet and pleasant to deal with. *Ariane at concierge went above and beyond and helped me with getting balloons and decorating our room for my husbands birthday. The butter cake was delicious and the signed card from hotel staff was nice. She also gave restaurant recommendations and set our reservation. She was a pleasure to work with. *The pool at the Balboa building was a nice place to relax and hang

This hotel is a nice oasis and decent value in the heart of Newport Beach.  Probably the only knock on the property is it is located directly under the flight path of jets taking off from  John Wayne Airport so it can get a bit noisy.  Not the hotel's fault to be sure but a bit irritating while relaxing at the pool.

The hallway smelled like they were masking smoke smell and the room had a different odd smell. So much that some of my clothes still have that smell. Otherwise, it's a decent place but far better places in the OC. The Hyatt Huntington Beach is much nicer!!

Decent hotel but the parking is pure larceny! Otherwise the room itself was fine if unspectacular. So it is the parking that leaves a bad taste in one's mouth... Location near John Wayne airport was a real plus...

Summary Heading: Charming California Classic with less than Hyatt level of service
Summary: We enjoyed this nostalgic vintage property with gorgeous grounds and loads of charm. Service was below Hyatt standards especially at the front desk, no smiles, no eye contact, not really interested in being in  hospitality industry. Shor restaurant and room service was 5 star. Very pet friendly place.

Such a underwhelming experience. Food was fair. I really didn't like that the hotel advertises the water slide when it is the weakest water slide ever. Front desk girl needs to learn to smile too. AC unit started pouring out water - took awhile for someone to come fix it and it was never the same after that. Front desk girl didn't offer us a new room. Will not stay here in the future.

A must stay! They are family friendly and have the sweetest staff, your close by movies, mall and beautiful beach. My boys love the water slide and of course the ping pong table. Beautiful property and nice size rooms

Great staff. A full resort experience. The food experience was five star for sure. Great location to for the Newport area and Fashion Island for shopping. I would reccomend Uber rather parking on site. The valet is vry expensive and self parking requires a VERY long walk to most rooms.

Summary Heading: Sprawling, dated buildings, with some updates
Summary: PROS-  nicely updated room, large resort property, shuttle to airport Nice lobby bar and outdoor space- very popular since far from other options  CONS-  not on the beach and not walkable to other places. Old sprawling property with lots of buildings and low ceilings Lots of groups using gardens etc - couldn't open our balcony doors because of a loud wedding reception

Summary Heading: Nice place, but get the right person to help you
Summary: We have stayed at many Hyatt resorts. Perhaps because this was a holiday weekend, but the check in was rough until we found a person that would actually help. Had to move twice to find a quiet place. Seemed very disorganized.

🙃 People may be confused when they book this hotel...Throwaway your preconceptions of a large Hyatt hotel... This is a relaxing VINTAGE RESORT... 🌴 Trendy laid-back and easy. It took a few minutes for my husband to adjust too, it is a bit of a culture shock when you are expecting a typical Hyatt Hotel🏩.  The staff here was very accommodating and friendly. 🎀 We stayed in the Lido building, I was skeptical given a few reviews I read on trip advisor from 2015 about the Lido building... I was totally prepared to ask for a different room, but I was pleasantly surprised 🎉when I walked into the room; it is a recently renovated room, smelled wonderful like spa and large in size overlooking the golf course and bay!  There are three pools 1) 👨‍👨‍👧‍👧 a family pool with a slide 2)
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: I'm giving the hotel a 3 star rating, because I think the hotel should be rated between 3 & 4 stars. The hotel itself is nice and clean. We enjoyed our room which is well decorated and also a good size. My husband and I also enjoyed the pool area on our first day, relaxing on a large day bed in the sun.   My problem with the hotel really comes down to the service. It wasn't all bad (we had a great experience at the lobby bar and once at the concierge desk) but overall, it did not live up to my Hyatt Regency expectations. When checking-in, I felt like the front desk staff felt inconvenienced for me to be there. Then, when we checked into our room, we were missing some basic toiletries. The following days, housekeeping didn't really clean the room. For example, we had a hand towel
Manager Response: Good afternoon Katie,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. If you give us a chance to earn back your trust, I can assure you that we will do our best to give you the great hotel experience that so many of our guests have grown so fond of.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Not up to Hyatt Regency standards
Summary: Very disappointed by the quality of the hotel -- all my prior experiences with the Hyatt Regency brand had been very luxurious, but the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach feels like an oversized motel, old and tired, with loud maintenance work going on, families yelling at each other, and the parking down a steep hill by dumpsters. Just a very strange, very disappointing experience. Bed was comfortable, but everything else about the stay was extremely underwhelming.

Summary Heading: Great relaxing vintage Newport Beach stay!
Summary: Historic Hyatt Regency Newport Beach Hotel provides great customer service at a great price! Love the three pools and 9 hole Back Bay golf course. Not for elderly as property is large with many stairs.

A very welcoming hotel the staff are fantastic nothing is too much trouble. The three pools were great each with a different emphasis. The restaurant ( Shorr) is great with a good menu and very open to getting a dish to your taste.

We have been there for 14 nights. You have to know that the rooms around the swiming pool are not the same that those with balcony near the golf course. The firsts are smaller and the bath has not a solid door. It has just a grid, wich it has not the better privacy. Hyatt is a very good hotels chain,, but in this case they did not cleaned the room for two days and the main door did not close right and left opened just because the janitors did not push it firmly. The restaurant, very good, the waiters, very good.  We used to go to Hyatt Huntington Beach Regency, wich is different.

Summary Heading: Very attractive and comfortable hotel with all of the amenities
Summary: Hotel staff throughout the hotel are wonderful.  Restaurants have excellent food, rooms are very comfortable and the options for pools, working out, golf, and other activities are great.  Will definitely return.

Summary Heading: Really great hotel - perfect for access to Balboa island
Summary: The hotel has been around for over 50 years and at times you can notice it in the decor. The rooms are a good size but do need updating. You can tell that the hotel has been expanded over the years as there are what seems like 3 sections to it.The good thing is each section has it's own pool area.  The staff and service are great although don't ask for a cocktail at the main bar as they have no idea how to make an espresso martini.  The gym was a decent size but 3 out of the 8 or so cardio machines didn't work.  The food and the breakfasts in particular are great here.I get the sense that this hotel has become a real part of the local community; we stayed 4 nights and on 2 of these nights there were community events being held. One was a jazz night and another was a charity

very nice hotel, older, but well kept.  rooms are pretty small but clean and updated decor.  it had been over 25 years since our last stay at this hotel, so it is an older hotel, but again very well maintained.

Had a great 5 night stay at this hotel.  The staff was very polite and friendly.  The hotel grounds were very well maintained and the condition of our room was excellent.  There was a lot to do with in the hotel itself and felt like we should have stayed longer.

Best hotel experience to date. The staff could not have been more courteous, the grounds more beautiful, and the food any better! STAY HERE!  I travel for work and stay in a lot of hotels. This easily was not a hotel, it was more like a resort. I will be staying at this hotel every time I visit Newport from now on.

Don't be fooled by the slightly tired exterior. This resort hotel is special: clean remodeled room with lots of space, comfy bed, excellent food at Shor, great friendly service, nice pools with full service, convenient location, beautiful landscaping, family friendly yard games around the property, live music on the weekend. We would love to stay here again.
Manager Response: Good afternoon Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon.  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary: This is my second time staying here for business.  I would not recommend this place.  The walls a paper thin. I could hear as clear as day every single thing the people in the next room were saying and doing... So disgusting.  If you're a business traveler and want to get some sleep beware ... this is also a tourist hotel so drunk, obnoxious, folks yelling outside your room is going to happen.  The doors are on the outside of some of the rooms in the hotel.  Feels like a Motel 8 walking to your room and the some of the tourist clientele both times I've stayed seem to have zero respect for others.  Feels like a hotel in Cabo with a bunch of young, drunk people who don't care about others.  This is like no other Hyatt that I've ever stayed at.  I am supposed to be able to get a
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While I wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. If you could please call me at 949-729-1234, I would like to apologize and discuss your stay with you.  Warmest regards, Ashley R. Guest Experience Supervisor

Summary: The hotel offers the perfect "getaway" from Newport Beach / Balboa Island.  If you stay at this property you will most likely want a car.  We drove to the beach during the day and dined off property at night.  Close to the property is Newport Dunes.  A campground in a lagoon.  They offer a "waterpark" and paddleboarding activities.  Not a bad spot to check out.  Multiple pools at the property.  Kids enjoyed the slide. Complaints about filthy pool deck chairs at the "kids" pool (slide) are legit.  Throw a towel over it and you will be good.  I requested a pool view room on the 2nd floor or higher and this accommodation was met.  Staff was out of sight but readily available if anything was needed.  I would definitely return.
Manager Response: Good afternoon,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We hope to welcome you back to our hotel very soon!  Warmest regards,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Perfect Way to Enjoy the Beach in Luxury
Summary: The beach is across the street and can be accessed by a hotel owned bridge.  When you get to the bridge, there are employees who provide umbrellas and chairs.  If you want to have a bonfire in the evening, they provide all of the amenities.  The staff are well trained and help to make you feel so welcome I did not want to leave.  And, they are pet friendly. So we were able to take our dog and she had a wonderful walk around the grounds. There are late evening live music opportunities and a coffee house on the premises.

We went for 2 nights, and enjoyed the beautiful grounds and facilities!  When we weren't happy with our room, we were upgraded to another room without additional fees.  We love the location that is close to malls, town, Sawdust Festival and Balboa Island.

Hotel is very convenient both to Newport and Laguna.  Rooms are large, service excellent, facilities very good.  We have stayed here before and will do so again.  We really enjoy the area, and have found this hotel to be a best buy!

Just not really "wow"ed by anything there except the parking valets were extremely polite and helpful.  They have a very late check-in (4pm).  We checked in with the front desk at 2:30 and were not ever given the promised phone call when our room was ready - had to stand in the long line of 4pm check-ins and finally got a room - handicapped accessable which was not requested.  A/C unit from room above dripped on us which was a little annoying on the patio but otherwise clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Good morning,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. While we wish you had a better experience, it is feedback like this that we learn from and use to improve. We work hard to deliver an exceptional guest experience, and it's apparent in this case that we fell short. If you would like to discuss your concerns with one of our front office manager, please call the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.  Thank you,  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Great time at the HyattNewport Beach
Summary: We attended the Kenny Loggins concert at the Hyatt. We had a skybox room with a great view. Food was amazing. Service was terrific. Stayed overnight and the room was comfortable, clean and very p,wasn't. Overall great evening!
Manager Response: Good morning Suzane,  Thank you for your response. It's great to hear that you enjoyed the Kenny Loggins concert, as well as our skyboxes. I see you left us a 1 out of 5 rating. Was there something you were unsatisfied with during your stay? If so, please reach out to the front office directly so we may better assist you.  We hope to see you at a future concert. Thank you very much for choosing Hyatt Regency Newport Beach.  Ashley R.

Summary Heading: Dumpy Hotel Rooms Need To Be Demolished
Summary: We checked into the Hyatt Regency because our home was being fumigated.  My mom had stayed there the prior Christmas and had commented at that time that the hotel was unusually old and that the rooms weren't very nice but we had been to the lobby area and gardens and thought it was attractive and updated. Upon check-in we realized the rooms are more like Howard Johnson's but the price is 4 star. The first room was next to the kiddie pool.  The door opened to an outdoor walkway and the pool.  It was very noisy and dark.  The second room had high water doors with low-cut carpet so you could see right through to the hallway and hear everything.  Smelly food left out by the room next to us was not picked up for 12 hours. We ate at the lobby bar outdoor dining and it was pleasant.
Manager Response: Good morning Nancy,  Thank you for your feedback. We apologize that you were not satisfied with your guest room. Our food and beverage management team has been made aware of the food left outside of the room for such a long period of time. We will make sure that this does not happen again in the future. If you would like to speak with one of our managers about your experience please contact the hotel directly at 949-729-1234.  Thank you for choosing the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach!  Ashley R.

Summary: This is an above average hotel for Hyatt Regency and is really more like a resort than a standard hotel. Unfortunately this includes a resort fee, but the hotel is worth it. Firstly, the staff are excellent. The valets remember your name and have your car ready before you ask. The staff everywhere in the resort are helpful and friendly.  I had an upgrade to a suite. The room was very spacious. To my surprise it also included a private pool. There was also a kitchenette which would be handy if staying for longer.  There was a decent iron in the room. Internet was working well. Room was very comfortable.  I was very impressed and will stay again next time I am in the Irving area.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel but needs some improvement
Summary: We finished our 2 weeks US road trip in Newport Beach, we picked up the Hyatt because of its location and the multiple swimming pools. On the god sides: great location, and beautiful views from the balcony. The staff is generally kind and willing to help, the pools are well maintained and very pleasant.
