The areas to improve: rooms, and hotels areas need to be renovated at some point. They cater many weddings and when you are a regular guest you are a bit lost and they really seem overwhelmed (we had to wait one hour past 4pm before getting our room, but I must say we were largely compensated). Finally the room service (we tested the breakfast) is a ripoff: we payed 80 bucks for 8 toasts, an orange juice and some coffee!!!! This is our most expensive breakfast ever in the US!

After our seminar meeting on 8/13, I went to the hotel for dinner. With such a gorgeous view in the back of the hotel---I thought--it would be amazing for you to build a restaurant in a higher level where you can see the view in a restaurant. How amazing that would be as well when you have your jazz series. Don't understand the having table near the valet? Your valet crew have no customer service---my waiter in the restaurant---spending 150.00 for dinner---forgot to bring out our appetizers--Candles in that room would make a difference. Candles that smell good at the front desk check-in too.   Our meeting held on 8/13---My catering manager and all the staff were fantastic! We love having our meetings at this venue.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel too bad only for one night
Summary: Great hotel with amazing staff.  Room was very nice and clean.  Bell staff was excellent and provided us with a roll away bed before I had to ask.  The grounds were nice.  Several pools that are good for family or others for quiet time.   There is a resort fee and parking fee so that will add to your cost.  The resort fee includes greens fee for one round of golf at the course for the hotel.  You need a car you will not be able to walk to any restaurants or beach.

I was really impressed of how the rooms look. its so cozy and everything looks new. My family really enjoyed the swimming pool that they have there. It is definitely for family environment and my kids cant wait to go back. Overall, I love this hyatt comparing to other Hyatt hotel.

The room are not very nice for the price you pay and the for at the Shor restaurant doesn't have a very good selection and it is way over priced. I feel that this could be upgraded and cleaned up and get what you are paying for as I paid extra and was very disappointed again with this stay.

No towel bars or hooks in bathroom, or elsewhere in room. Not convenient. Had to throw towels on floor everytime we used them.. waste of water and money. Could not put wet towels on bed, and they don't want you to hang outside on patio. Rooms old but very nice.. all the amenities

Older poorly constrcuted hotel which is only slightly concelaed by some fresh paint. Staff gives the impression of not caring take it or leave it. Peoplerunning up and down the halls all hours lots of out side noise Nothing good to say about our stay other than we will not be back.

Lovely hotel with chilled out Californian style. The pools are all lovely. A fantastic place to bring kids, they will definitely be well entertained. The rooms are spacious. Service was really good. The breakfast was super tasty and there was so much there with good choices. The resort has lots of amenities.

Rooms in the main building were much bigger than those around the pool. All staff were very friendly and helpful and rooms clean but slightly dated.  We had the pool are to ourselves on the occasions we visited it. Grounds spacious but if you struggle with mobility you may find it tricky as there are quite a few steps between pool and main buildings/car park.

I would recommend this hotel to everyone (Families, couples or singles)!  This hotel puts out exactly what they promise plus more!  Their intentions are completely to make your stay comfortable and satisfying which they successfully do!  AMAZING!

This hotel had great facilities, three pool areas, one designated for serenity, one for children with a water slide, one with relaxing music playing. Each pool area had jacuzzi pools as well. Rooms were very comfortable and the staff went out of their way to accommodate.

We rented a room in the Lido section of the resort. The room was nice, comfortable bed, nice television. The open design of the resort added to a noisy stay. The buildings could use some work. The pools were nice to lounge around at. Parking was interesting, pay one fee and walk a bit or settle for valet parking. The resort is in the flight pattern of the Santa Ana airport, so expect to hear jets all day. Overall, a nice place to stay if you don't mind hearing jet noise from 7 am till 10 pm.

We took a trip to the USA in July. Three weeks traveling from Chicago, to Salt Lake City to Moab, to Vegas and San Diego and in between. It wasn't cheap. We travelled from Europe. We stayed in self-catering, hotels, VRBO, motels. This hotel was on the more expensive side of our trip but as it was coming up the last few days of our trip we decided to splash out a bit. So we booked 2 rooms - one for Hubby and myself and one for our two sons. Our room was fine. Not big deal. Not for that money. Sons checked into their room. About an hour later our oldest son messaged us to say that there were ants crawling out of the wall and onto their beds.... Yuck. He went to reception where, to be honest, he was treated with a bit of disdain. I think the receptionist thought he was some preppy

Summary Heading: Bayview room more of parking lot view
Summary: Check in was fast and found EV charger out of far end of the self parking. 2 tesla charger vacant, 2 120V only one working, need bring your own charger. Swimming pool was empty which was nice but the water was cool. The supposed to be upgraded (we paid for the upgrade) bay view room was facing parking lot and a little corner of small bay.  The bathroom is small but looked remodeled. It has sweaty smell.. Here for 1 night on Monday night, since no one at the pool, no service, went to Shor to pick up to go for the kids, chicken strip was 6.95 but the orange juice was $5.  Had dinner at the Shor, will be the last time, took server 15 min to notice that we were there after we were seated. Maybe 5-6 tables of people but they claim they run out of menu, the bread came but claim the

I experience a relaxing and hi-end stay at a premium resort within a big city.  These guys rock, took good care of my family and I.  Plus the grounds were manicured well just like being on the islands. Kudos to Hyatt! I will be back

The Hotel is spread over quite a large area which meant our families were split up, the hotel has 3 different pools, the rooms were spacious and clean, the staff were helpful and friendly and very efficient.

Summary Heading: Good hotel - but not worth the high prize
Summary: I have been at the hotel for a conference. It has good services and a nice location with swimming pool. But for such high daily rates I would expect free WiFi and parking. It is unbelievable that hotels still charge for WiFi while it is more necessary than coffee, which is free in the rooms. Also I recommend more "green" behavior, e.g. only taking away towels which lie on the floor.

Summary Heading: Valet gave our rent car to the wrong people!
Summary: This is the third time we have stayed here and it was like a completely different hotel this time. Housekeeping was not like it was in the past (we did not even get housekeeping one day we were there, so at 5:30 we just asked the housekeeping lady in the hall for clean towels). It was also inconsistent (they would leave more coffee but not more of the sugar/creamer packets). We also had a maintenance issue with the AC leaking in the bathroom and when they were finished repairing it they just left the panel to the AC hanging down instead of putting it back up the right way. But the most upsetting of the entire visit was on the last day when we were leaving and headed to the airport, we went down to valet and after waiting almost 15 minutes, we were informed that they had given

My room was hard to get to with heavy luggage. Bathroom mat had mold. Staff checking in and out was nice, prompt and courteous.  Hotel a little dated therefore thought overpriced.  I would say ok for one night, but disappointed with the mold for a name brand hotel chain.

Wonderful setting along back bay of Newport Beach, centrally located to shopping, beach, sailing, and restaurants, still need a car though ... it's California ; )  Keep in mind this property does require additional cost for parking and resort fees.

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach, a wonderful, iconic Southern California luxury resort. It is at once elegant and casual, luxurious yet authentic. The resort was large, and had several wonderful features. The restaurant, SHOR, is quintessential California cuisine. Delicious! I love eating California style...outside in the cool evening, kept warm by heaters and braziers. Fantastic.

Summary Heading: Great location for a family trip!
Summary: This June we returned to the Hyatt Newport Beach for the third summer in a row, and I'm so glad we did! My husband and I travel with my mother, who is in her 70s, and our two sons, ages 6 and 9, and the resort offers something for all of us. There are three swimming pools, including one with a giant water slide, and all three offer meal service. The kids' meals are reasonably priced, and my kiddos loved having chicken fingers or grilled cheese and the best french fries EVER by the pool. The resort also includes amenities such as a giant chess set, shuffleboard, bikes, mini golf, ping pong, par three golf, etc., so the kids would have been happy even if we hadn't ever left the property. This year my mom was in a wheelchair, and we found that the property has wonderful wheelchair

Let me preface this review by saying that 3 years ago I stayed at this property and had a wonderful visit.  However this time around was a very different experience.  Beach trips for my sisters birthday have become an annual occasion for our family.  So the idea of revisiting a destination we previously loved seemed like a no brainer.  Much to our dismay this visit proved to be disappointing.  First off our rooms were located in the back of the resort nearest the pool with the most kid friendly features.  Not a good move for a group traveling without children.  2nd the bell captain informed us during check in that they'd experienced a bad wind storm earlier in the day. Thus explaining the unkept look of the property as we arrived.  However the grounds were not cleaned or made

This hotel is very nice, albeit a bit old. It has some nice amenities for all ages. The interactive chess board was a favorite of the kids. The pools and pool areas are lovely, but the slide was for very young kids only in terms of fun. Staff can't be beat. Food is quite good also. I would recommend a stay here for sure!

Price and location of the Newport Beach Hyatt is very good. For a nice view, I recommend staying in a 2nd floor room that overlooks the bay or one of the pools on property. Rooms are nice but walls are a bit thin so it isn't to difficult to hear folks staying in other rooms. If you enjoy golf and you aren't too serious of a golfer, this property has a par 3 golf course. Note that if you have a car you will have to pay $25+ for parking and parking is approximately a 3 minute walk from the hotel lobby.

Summary Heading: Lots of activities, property clean but dated
Summary: We did a short stay-cation at the Hyatt in Newport Beach last weekend.  We stayed in the Bay Building, which has a 60s motel feeling with the doors to the rooms opening to the outside and all rooms facing a large family pool.  Hyatt has done a decent job with upgrades to the bathrooms, but the overall feeling of the building from the walk-up to the low ceilings in the rooms is a bit dated.    The property has lots of activities for kids, everything from movies by the pool to crafts (like a summer camp).  There is a "golf course" - NOT for serious golfers, but a decent distraction.  It is a pitch and putt, no tee times needed, you hit off of mats.    If your expectations are set properly, you can have a nice time at this property.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, shame they couldn't control some of their guests!
Summary: Nice Hotel in a decent location. Room 701 refurbished recently and close to a very quiet pool location (there are three pools). Parking and Resort fees expensive and don't help the overall experience. Staff very nice at Check in. Back in February at the time of booking we asked for a quiet room on the first floor. We actually got a room on the ground floor and were stuck right at a door entry into the building which was less than quiet. To make matters worse we were subjected to the noise from the guests in room 702 who thought it was ok to let their kids run wild in the corridor till midnight. Despite advising reception no action was taken. Other guests also complained but with no success. We checked out early next morning disappointed. Raised the matter with the Duty Manager

Very nice hotel in a very upscale area. Food & drinks are great and staff is very helpful and courteous. Make sure your room is on the top floor, otherwise very noisy. They need to purchase new towels, threadbare does not fit with the quality of the hotel.

Such a lovely hotel with amazing staff. For my family and I we found this hotel a brilliant place to stay, comfy beds, clean and tidy and great facilities. We came to Newport Beach about 3 years ago and stayed in this hotel, we are now back in Newport Beach and staying back in the Hyatt as we loved it that much.

Tired facility in dire need of repairs and remodel.  The only thing worse is the service and 30 minute valet waits.  When asked to see manager they said didn't have one.  Easy to believe given the state of the resort.  Food service was adequate.  No hospitality service in suite so don't expect to entertain quests or business associates.

We searched all over to find a resort style place to stay that was easy to travel along the coast with.  We opted NOT to stay on the ocean as most nice places were too pricey.  We like the Hyatt name and booked a week here to attend a family destination weeding in Laguna Beach, but wanted to pay it all up front so we would get the best rates and not have a bill at the end of the trip.  That DID NOT work out.  We were charge $27 a day for parking the rental car and fees that were over $300 bucks.  VERY upsetting, but they didn't make it as clear when I purchased upfront.   The resort was lovely, lots of places to hit the pool, free bike rental for a couple hours a day, with a great nearby river path.  We'd walked it and road bikes that week.  The bed was nice and our room was

The Hyatt is very, very nice.  The staff is all extremely friendly and helpful.  The pool area where we hung out was beautiful, lots of palm trees and a water slide for the kids. It's also across the street from the Back Bay, which made for a nice morning walk, and a great place for little ones to play.

This is a very nice hotel.  The level of customer care is one of the best that I've experienced.  The grounds are very relaxing and had activities for both adults and children.  In fact there is a water slide by one of the pools.  If I was staying with children I would request a room by that pool.  I was there with a friend for a girls weekend and stayed in the Lido building.  It was a little far from the lobby, but very quiet for adults.  It also had it's own pool which was very nice.  The rooms were clean and fresh.  The free shuttle service to Fashion Valley Mall and Balboa Island was very convenient.  This is a terrific hotel and I felt like I was on a tropical vacation, but close to home.

Clean, no surprises. Staff are polite and greet you as they see you about the property. Good food choices for vegetarians in the restaurant. Air port shuttle a plus! I would stay here again. My only complaint was the very loud music at the pool (my room was overlooking the pool) with very very bad lyrics (F word and worse very very loudly for what seemed like a long long time.)Otherwise a great place.

I was very dissapointed with my stay at this location. While it was beautiful and the staff were great, it was the loudest location I've ever been at. The slamming hotel room doors and kids running up and down the halls screaming made it difficult to get sleep while there.

Summary Heading: Dog friendly, Great Service and Nice Property!
Summary: We needed a dog friendly hotel and they really were!  We were given a nice ground level room with a grass area near by.  The grounds are extensive and wonderful for long walks. Location is excellent! Near Amazing shopping, beaches and great food.  Last but not least and the reason I would go back was the staff! Everyone was friendly and made our stay perfect.   Requests: ground level for dogs, you can also request rooms away from kid friendly pool area.  The property is very spreadout so it offers a little somehting for everyone.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but casual approach to customer care-minor point perhaps
Summary: This hotel is well appointed located close to the harbour area of Newport Beach. The hotel character is typical of good quality beach hotels in Southern California. You can't quite put your finger on it, but you feel relaxed when you arrive and step into the lobby area- which is quite the most informal I have experienced.  Rooms are very comfortable, many (as mine) lead into grassy or pool areas via sliding patio doors. Air conditioning is mandatory during the hot season- which is really all year round! The bed is very comfortable- crisp sheets and a mattress topper make your sleep guaranteed and sound- even if you are jet lagged.  The restaurant is laid back- sometimes the serving crew forget they should approach tables to ask for orders but a gentle request is responded to

Summary Heading: Nice for the price we paid
Summary: We left a terrible Airbnb and checked into the Hyatt.  The floors were thin so we heard the people upstairs and had to call and complain.  Beds are small and pillows are too soft with zero support.  BUT, on the flip side, for the price we paid nightly, we had nothing but pleasant service everywhere from the valets to the Shor restaurant.  The water slide was great for my child.  Room service was fresh and fast.  Pool service was fast and well priced.  Would return.  Not a luxury experience, but a good family resort.

Summary Heading: The room in the shadows at the end of the line
Summary: We were promised a second floor room and got a first floor room but got a first floor room with a big maintenance garbage can across from our front door.  When we asked for a different room they said there was none available.  The next day we got moved to a nicer room but with a king bed only so our son had to sleep on a rollaway bed.  Adult pool has now shower so you can't shower there after you swim.  not a great experience.

the grounds are amazing. the rooms in the lido building are small and old looking. the grass outside of them near the volleyball court is dead and dry. but the rest of the place is nice. **warning do not eat at the Shor Restaurant unless you have a good 2 -2 1/2 hours to spending waiting for food and service

We truly enjoy staying at hotels. This hotel was top 3 by far! Our room was immaculate and the staff was wonderful. They were always so helpful and accommodating. We will definitely being staying here again!

Summary Heading: I usually stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Hotel & Spa, but
Summary: I usually stay at the Newport Beach Marriott Hotel & Spa when I come to Newport Beach for work, but I always noticed how the Hyatt was a bit cheaper and seemingly similar hotel. All and all it's worth the savings to stay at the Hyatt.  The staff was extremely responsive.  I arrived late then realized I forgot a comb and brush and they immediately supplied.  The receptionist was unusually happy for a midnight check-in so that was really great.  She asked me if I wanted valet or self park.  I told her self park but I was way too tired tonight (on east coast time still).  She gave me valet for the self park price which was an unexpected perk. My room was on the third floor facing the ocean.  It's a beautiful view with a nice terrace. It was very quiet.  The minus one star was the

Summary Heading: Solid, family friendly hotel resort in OC
Summary: We stayed here for a short family vacation.  Room was fine, spacious, and most everything in working order. It did have a bit of a musky odor, so we opened the sliding door to the balcony as much as possible. Check in took a little longer than usual, so the front desk gave a voucher for free appetizer and drink at the bar, which was very appreciated. The pool and water slide was great.  Though our toddler was a bit too young and small for the water slide.  They also had some kids craft activities by the pool as well, so our toddler made a bracelet.  We also reserved a separate room for my parents, but even after checking late at night, at least two different people with keys entered their room later that night. Apparently the front desk system showed their room available even

We stayed here four nights.  Our room overlooked the pool.  We enjoyed lounging around the pool and even went down the waterslide.  It is very close and convenient to Balboa Island, Fashion Island, Corona del Mar and Newport beach restaurants, marina and beaches.  We found it to be an ideal location and a great place to stay

As a Hyatt passport member I tend to try & stay at Hyatt Hotels wherever I can, so it's very hard not to compare this with other recent stays I've had at other local Hyatts (last yr at Huntington Beach Hyatt Regency & a week ago at the Hyatt House in Carlsbad). For me this stay just lacked some care & I came away feeling a bit disappointed. As well as my specific comments/feedback below I just felt the resort lacked an atmosphere. There were no real areas that families could congregate & hang out at (other than the pool). The family rooms are 2 x double & this is obviously because of the size of the rooms, but when you've come from a King or Queen (from home or other hotels), it's very cosy (in bed & in the room). The bathrooms lack thought in storage - there was no where to

Stayed here for 6 nights. The room was over looking the golf course, so nice and quiet. It was a bit dark as the sun didn't filter our room/ balcony.  The room was clean with average decor and it did smell a bit musty the bed was comfortable even tho I think the cleaner never changed the sheets but just re tided them. The  hotel itself reception/ bar nice but too small, we used the pool once that was nice and the grounds are well kept. Overall a nice average hotel.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but far from anything by foot
Summary: Very nice upscale hotel. A lot of facilities. They charge $25 dollars per day as a vacation fee. It is not shown when place the order. You also cannot waive it. You must have car or use taxi to get anywhere near. There is one expensive restaurant at the hotel. Other places are far. Unlike the Marriott, which is in front of a shopping mall.

Overall the hotel is acceptable.  Had difficulty finding a room without issues.  The 3rd one worked.  Hotel is showing its age, and did not feel it could meet Hyatt's standards.  We were on a bed and breakfast package.  Breakfast and service in restaurant very good.  Problems in checking out as the bill was not properly prepared.

This Hyatt is in the perfect location.  It was mine and my husband's first visit to Newport Beach.  Everything is within reach...tennis center next door, Hertz rental car on site, and tons of restaurants all around.  The staff is great and very helpful.  If you are visiting in the summer, request the bay view room on the third floor.  They host this concert series at the hotel and you can literally enjoy this concert on your balcony.  No worries, you won't lose sleep.  The rooms are sound proof and the concert shuts down long before you sleep.  We will be back for sure.

The Hyatt in Newport Beach is a beautiful property.  It is a reasonable walk to Balboa Island and a reasonable hotel shuttle ride to and from the airport.  I would love to go back for non-business visit!!

Great place for a family holiday, plenty to do or just relax around one of the pools. Nice room and friendly staff. Beautifully landscaped grounds. Loved riding the bikes to Balboa Island and Newport via the ferry.

Beautiful and spacious.  There are a lot of great amenities. I was there for business so was unable to take advantage of the pools, but they look beautiful and well maintained. The gym is small, but updated, nice equipment.  Reliable and fast internet.

The hotel is understaffed and provides mediocre service.  I was double billed each day for 5 days on valet parking - and it has yet to be corrected - I am told their system ins down and it may take 48 hours to get it back on line. I find it hard to believe. I was also charge $50 for a bottle of when whe i only ordered a glass. Be sure to check your bills carefully

Summary Heading: Amazing getaway, can't wait to come back
Summary: We did a last minute romantic getaway from San Diego and found a great deal on this resort and it was dog friendly so we gave it a shot - very impressed! A great location that is an easy walk to balboa island and the ferry to the peninsula (bring good walking shoes) or honestly you could just never leave the resort and be happy. Three pools, shuffleboard, table tennis, cornhole, water slides, tons of fun! Great lobby bar and even poolside drink service, we were super relaxed! Our room was nice too and had a view of the jazz concert Friday night which was an added bonus. A short drive to many nearby restaurants and a free shuttle to fashion island or balboa island was great too. We hope to come back soon!

as an added amenity, i was very happy to have the ability to play tennis at the club attached to the the hotel.  I also enjoyed the location of the hotel.. lots of restaurants and other interesting places to shop ...  lots of beaches to go to as well..

Summary Heading: A wonderful stay at a beautiful resort
Summary: We enjoyed a two night stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach over the 4th of July weekend. The resort is gorgeous. Rooms are large and comfortable. The amenities are superb including three pools, fitness center, a 9-hole golf course, a delicious restaurant, and most of all the most friendly, welcoming and helpful staff. My wife is recovering from major knee surgery and has a difficult time with walking, using either a cane or walker. The staff was always there to assist her. We are most appreciative and look forward to a return visit.

The AC Unit fan would not change from high, to medium, to low, to quiet.  It sits in front of bed so it was hard to sleep. Sheets were dirty and blood stained.  I will never plan on using this hotel again.  The staff were friendly and the valet was spot on.  My wife complained and they took the resort fee off.  My wife and I did not get much sleep in the 3 days we stayed there.  The price was close to $385 and then resort fees and parking fees.  Over $400 a night and did not sleep well.

The Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach is a hidden gem and has something for everyone. Albeit a large resort, you do NOT get that feeling when you are staying there. I have stayed 50+ times and have been there a few times during the busiest times. I never felt like a "number."

Three pools; water chute; bean toss, ping pong, shuffleboard and large chess board.  Loved the games and will keep kids and adults amused all day long.  Look for special room rates, though.  I don't think a night's stay is worth $300 - and don't forget that pesky "resort fee" of $25 per day, plus Newport Beach visitor "tax"  and parking is $27.50 per day.  The hotel is clean, staff were very friendly and helpful and there is a free shuttle that takes you to Fashion island and Balboa Island for shopping and dining.

Stay was excellent, this review however is mainly for the staff. Austin at the front desk went above and beyond our expectations to welcome us. He was friendly, helpful, and really made it a special occasion for my wife and me. Thanks!

Highly recommend, hotel is clean and freeway access is good. They have a shuttle to Disney if you are crazy enough to go there :) this is our 3rd stay here and we absolutely love the pool area. Real nice! Oh yes, you can have a romantic setting here as well in the evening the bar has a decent wine and drinks selection

Summary Heading: Clean, modern rooms, great for family
Summary: This hotel was great for my young family. They have three pools. I only used two of them as I believe the other was an adults only. The only negative to these two pools was that they were rather cold. I wish they had a heated option for at least one of the children's pools as well. The rooms were very clean and staff was friendly. We needed a crib and they delivered rather quickly, it comes with free travel size baby soap/shampoo/baby powder (its the little things that count) When we arrived we asked to be moved to a room with a view of the pool and they accommodated this request. They immediately sent somebody over with our new room key and we were able to move across the hall. I can not say anything about the restaurant because we didn't use it. The restaurant seemed a little

Excellent resort/hotel.  Highest recommendation.  The rooms are clean, well appointed, the bed is amazing.  We were with a group of 25 family members and everyone had the same excellent experience at the Hyatt.  So many amenities available, and the location is great.  It's Newport Beach!

Initial impression of the grounds and facilities: clean, well kept, and peaceful. We very much appreciated the relaxing ambiance walking the grounds, the lobby, and other outdoor sitting areas. The lot for self-parking is very spacious and well lit. Check-in was a breeze, staff were friendly and accommodating to some last-minute changes. Checkout was equally just as easy.   Room: During 2 different stays, both rooms were spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable and linens were always thoroughly washed (no stains/leftover old crust from prior users, etc.) A/C units maintained temperature and had no ice-up issues (a typical problem in rooms with older units) Bathroom was very clean and was stocked up with more than enough toiletries for our stay.  Room Service: The actual

This was our 2nd stay. Everything was wonderful from the location and room to the resort pools and friendly staff. Definitely plan to come back again!! Much prefer the room in the main building! There is a shuttle to Balboa Island as well as plenty to do on the resort. The staff were very accommodating to our needs and helped freeze ice packs that were necessary for medication. We felt very accommodated and comfortable here!

Summary Heading: Big disappointment in service and management
Summary: I just returned from a long weekend with some friends from around the country.  We requested adjacent rooms with balconies so we could spend time hanging out.  We were put in motel-like rooms overlooking the incredibly loud kids' pool.  The water slide was just outside my room and the noise was intense.  The hotel agreed to move us but took hours more than they'd planned.  We waited in line at the front desk a total of 6 times including the final check out (at which point we discovered SEVERAL incorrect charges).  There was no staff member who seemed really great. The bell hop emptied my room and left behind my purse.  The front desk staff did not seem empowered to do anything.  The miscommunication meant that a bellhop cleared our old room, thinking the new one was ready.

This resort is literally a home away from home for me, they are always very accommodating with some of the best service I have ever been blessed to receive. I highly recommend this resort as it is located close to the very best attractions & landmarks the OC has to offer.

Pros: Location close to Fashion Island was great and the lobby was nice. The onsite convenience store was handy. Cons:  The converted motel feel cannot be shaken. The walk and stairs (no elevators) got very old and tiresome. The rooms felt humid with carpets were damp. As others mentioned, the walls are paper thin and you hear the shower run next door.  The hill climb back and forth to the $27 self parking lot was a hike. With all the added fees per night, the hotel is pricey for what you get. Hyatt should re-label as Hyatt Place, which is more applicable to the value.

We had 3 rooms and a pretty nice visit!  The hotel grounds looks a bit dated but overall it's well kept.  The resort fees included usage of the putting green and bikes, which is a nice added touch.  We stayed in one suite and two other basic rooms.  The staff and service was excellent though.  With our family breakfast, servers made sure to put us all together and even put us in a semi-private area to dine.  Location is quite nice as well.  Would certainly recommend!

It's hard to believe that a pool (tranquility pool) at a resort in Newport Beach doesn't have a water dispenser (nor does anyone offer Any). When I saw someone who worked there and asked about getting water, he said he'd check...and he never returned. The servers st Oasis Pool weren't at all friendly and waitress gave me incorrect change. Furniture in Lido building is dated and non-balcony/patio side of buildings looks like a Travel Lodge. Small bathroom. The gym should have a stair master.  Food st Shor restaurant was very spicy. Great location though and pretty flowers. Lots of nice outdoor seating areas with fire pits.The bellmen and front desk help were very nice and helpful.

The hotel was ok, not what I expected.  Buildings and grounds are dated.  The rooms have been upgraded.  The executive golf course and bikes were a plus.  The location was easy to get to and not too far from Fashion Island.

Our room had a used shower cap hanging on the back of the bathroom door(it had hair in it), the restroom door had red stains all over it that I cleaned once we got there and the luggage tags from the previous guest were found on the floor throughout the room which made us feel like our room was not cleaned before we got there.

Summary Heading: It wasn't great but it wasn't horrible.
Summary: We have stayed here before years ago, live in the area and like a staycation every now and again. It's a great location with lovely staff but, the pool and bar area were very dirty with trash that looked like people left hours before. The pillows in the outdoor bar area were very dirty I did not want to use them.  The room a bit small and average for the price but ok we were only there for 1 night. The resort fee and self parking ($27!) in my opinion are a bit pricey.

This hotel is far from beach and other tourist sites. Basically you need a car to go anywhere. The only onsite restaurant and coffee bar is very expensive for the quality. Self parking cost $27 per day for hotel guests.

This property is dated but management is updating the rooms.  But o what a great property!  The grounds are beautiful complete with a 9 hole golf course. The staff rates a 5 *+. They were amazing.  When the refit is done this will be a 5 *!  Would I come back?  Absolutely!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel and grounds. Loved it!
Summary: We were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel and the rooms. We had a King room in the Balboa block overlooking the golf course. This was lovely with a small balcony with furniture. There is a small fridge in the room for storing drinks or snacks and there is a good room service for food and drinks and also any forgotten items. Nice, clean modern bathroom. We walked down to the bay which was around 15 minutes and this was lovely. We ate in the hotel restaurant that night, 2 people, 2 courses each with 2 glasses of wine each and this was around $120, great value for the area and the food was excellent. would stay again without hesitation. We wish we had more time to make use of the many facilities. Like the way the hotel is broken up into different blocks for

Summary Heading: Nice relaxing hotel near Fashion Island
Summary: We stayed here on our recent trip to Newport Beach (6/10-6/11) for a short vacation. The hotel itself is west of the freeways and not far from the water, but the hotel rooms don't have ocean views I believe. The property only has 2 floors and I would say it's rather old, but the rooms are nicely updated for the most part. We actually got to see several room for the following reason: The first room they gave us (#617) was close to the pool, had a nice big bathroom, but the bed made my wife and I break out in an itchy rash. A call to the front desk allowed us to move to room #117, but this room had a handicap enabled bathroom which we didn't like, so we were moved a few doors down to room #123. This room turned out to be a nice standard hotel room, with a small but nicely updated

Stayed here at the backend of our time at Disneyland. Beautiful property and pools. Was comfortable and a great experience for our family including our 4-year old twin boys. We also met other families here from SoCal and it was an ideal location for everyone. Some highlights:  -Pool areas were generous and accommodating, with a great slide for the young kids -Room service (a must have for our family) was excellent and accommodating -Front desk and bell staff were great -Very convenient to Orange County airport  We will stay here again. Being at this hotel after a subpar experience at Paradise Pier hotel, what a contrast.

Summary Heading: good jazz facility, but very average hotel
Summary: Very good and convenient for the jazz festival, however the hotel would be far from our first choice if it weren't for the festivals held their.  The hotel itself is old and tired, however the rooms were updated and fairly spacious.  The bathroom was small with no counter space.  For the $ spent, we didn't see the value......

The place was laden with beautiful plant and trees and the hotel staff was very attentive.  The facility was very nice and I would love to return someday to this venue for any future business conferences that were offered at this location.

This is one of the most well rounded hotels we have stayed at in all our travels. I really didn't want to leave! The grounds were clean, the staff was very friendly. And then it happened. They went so way and above the call of duty, we are a fan for life.  We had a very bad experience at the Hertz Rent A Car location on their grounds. Needless to say, a very dishonest business man was running the location. Not once, but twice he tried shoving down our throats very filthy rental cars. I kept my old car cleaner, as a 16 year old kid, than this location did. It was disgusting, and appalling. This scoundrel costs us about 2-1/2 hours of our vacation by wasting our time.  In to 'save the day' was Bridget! The wonderful and personable manager of the Hyatt. She took on our issue and

The hotel was nice, buffalo wings were tasty, nice area, good atmosphere, decent people to talk to, the Newport Jazz Festival was great and look forward to going again next year. That's pretty much it until I come back again, it's affordable and the rooms are nice, staff is friendly.

Pros: the food & service in restaurant was very good.  Cons: At check-in, the receptionist "Beverly" was very rude.  We had a pool side room #426. The refrigerator & TV did not work. The person who brought our luggage was able to fix the problem. The room was very small.  The pool area was very dirty. There was rabbit poop all around the pool. There were dead leaves all around. The lounge chairs were extremely dirty.   This is only part of it. We will never stay again.

Summary Heading: Perfect Spot to Stay in Newport Beach
Summary: Location, location, location. Not only is this hotel close to the airport, but Balboa Island is walkable and Fashion Island is super close. I have stayed here many times and we are always welcomed back by the staff. The breakfast menu has a great variety and the servers are very friendly and do a great job. I like the fact that this hotel is in Newport Beach, but doesn't feel snooty. The beds are comfy too.

They Hyatt Regency Newport Beach is a casual/ laid back nice.  The Hotel has nice grounds to walk.  The Hotel is older but well kept up.   The rooms are large and nice. The staff is very nice.  The Hotel is close to PCH and to Balboa island so it is a good location.  There is a Jazz festival and series that takes place on the Hotel grounds.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and great location.  Close to shops, restaurants and the beach.
Summary: Friendly staff, wonderful pools and beautiful hotel grounds. The hotel is very close shops, restaurants, Fashion Island mall and very close to the beach.  Crystal Cove beach is about a 7 minute drive and is a wonderful place to visit.  Make sure to visit the Beachcomber restaurant.

This Hotel is very accomidating for Family or Just a Romatic get away. One of the best Hotel I ever expeince, here and abroaded. The best Staff ever, and great food and afforable. The surrounding area is awsome. so beautiful & friendly. The Newport Beach Hyatt id top on the Line at a great price for the money.

This is a great place to stay during the Newport Beach Jazz Festival. The rooms are very nice and the staff is also great. You can't beat it for the convenience during this annual event. I would stay here if visiting the area.

Summary Heading: Not the best - Not the worse
Summary: While I have stayed at the Hyatt Newport in the past, I was never met with room accommodations that were less than favorable.  The room was disappointing at best and was not fully presentable by any standards.  Hoping management responds to my email to ensure that housekeeping does more than dust off table tops.  There is so much more to ensure guests are comfortable and within a cleaned environment.  Sparing the details, this was not the experience one would hope for.

Summary Heading: Comfortable room, but on the Orange County Airport flight path and poor insulation.
Summary: The rooms in the Hyatt are first rate - comfortable beds and furnishings. The A/C works well and is quiet. However, we were able to hear the TV from the room next door and beginning at about 7am there was a steady stream of aircraft flying overhead - they're impossible to miss.  The hotel is close to Orange County Airport and the aircraft noise is oppressive. However, there must be an ordinance that prohibits late night take offs because we didn't hear any planes during the night.  When booking a room, pay close attention to the extra charges: $25/night resort fee and $27/night for self parking (a long walk), or $35/night for valet parking.

We stayed here over Memorial day weekend and it was just lovely.  Their three separate pools made it nice if one was too busy to move to the next.  My girls and husband fully enjoyed our one night stay.

Found the hotel very clean and quiet. The surroundings were not cluttered and were very clean. They were very accommodating to the conference and the nurse group was very satisfied. I would choose to stay at this hotel in the future for business and pleasure.

This hotel is really nice. The grounds are beautiful  and the staff is friendly and  professional. The bar area is nice and the staff is really attentive. The rooms are really pricy, not sure if they are really worth it. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family however, I would let them know it's pricy

Came to attend a wedding on the memorial day weekend. Very pleasant staff. Hotel room was big and spacious. Shortage of housekeeping on the holiday weekend. Breakfast was excellent. Conveniently located and central location.Do yourself a favor and stay here. You will find it a pleasant experience.

Summary Heading: Grandparents you will have a great time here & families too!
Summary: We have stayed here over 5 different times and have had a great time...The Hyatt in Newport Beach is my favorite hotel. Lots to do- it is excellent ! A par 3 golf course, ping pong, shuffle board, a giant Chess set outside, one pool has an activity area for kids with face painting, beads, dive in movie PM, & ect. Thank you to all ...we  had a great time! Always a pleasure with Tracie at the coffee breakfast area...Thank you!

We've stayed at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach several times now even though we're only 45 minutes away. We love the hotel, service and the grounds are amazing and tranquil. It has always been a peaceful getaway.

Summary Heading: Hyatt should be ashamed to put their name on this motel.
Summary: The grounds and location of the hotel are fantastic.  However the condition and quality of the rooms was terrible.  I have stayed in at least 100 different Hyatt Regency hotels in the past 15 years and this was by far the worst experience I have ever had.  There is no way this location should have the Hyatt Regency brand on it.  The room was just aweful.  It looks like someone took a 1980's motel 6 and added some updated tile in the bathrooms and called it a Hyatt.  8' popcorn ceilings, single pane old windows that you could here everything outside of your room. single unit AC systems that didn't work.  We had it cranked down all night set to 64 degrees and still sweated all night. I swear they were blowing out the air warmer than it was coming into unit.   Then there was the

We had a King bed in a large, slightly musty, room on the 2nd floor (#202). Adding 2 cots didn't make much of a difference, as we had so much floor space. Each cot same with a baby pack (talc, baby soap, shampoo, and nappy rash cream). The balcony overlooked the main entrance, so we had constant car noise. The room also backed into a lift, which was insanely noisy in the evening when you were in bed trying to sleep. Think  loud whirring and clunking. The bathroom was fresh and seemed recently refurbed. The toiletries were basic.   Ate dinner at the Shor Seafood Grill. Big portion sizes, and good quality food. Had calamari to start with, followed by pan fried salmon. My wife had prawns. Kids ate spaghetti & meatballs. I added sides of asparagus and broccoli. Plus 2 glasses of

Summary Heading: Nice enough hotel, great staff - Not very peaceful
Summary: The basic rooms have all had a recent face.ift and are nice enough. If you're looking for peace and quiet this is not the place. In large part due to it lying directly under the flight path of nearby John Wayne Airport. Sunday morning between 7 and 8:30 roughly 20 jets took off. So much for a sleep in. In the afternoons there is a lot of noise from the pool areas.

Summary Heading: Beautiful grounds and rooms with excellent customer service!
Summary: This hotel is absolutely beautiful from the minute you turn into the driveway!  Everything is immaculate and the flowers and shrubbery are beautiful!  We were there on our annual girl's trip and stayed for 5 nights and had such a great time! The customer service is out of this world!  Everyone from the bellmen and desk clerks to the servers and bartenders were all so very nice and helpful.  The only negative experience we had was the Hertz rental car agent on the grounds which was absolutely horrible- DO NOT rent from them!! (that is for another review).  However, we went to the manager, Bridget Portier, at the Hyatt and told her what happened at Hertz and were pleasantly surprised!  She took care of everything!  She contacted the regional manager for Hertz who promptly

This hotel has not changed its comfortable and relaxing atmosphere in the years i have been staying here. Although the faces has changed to younger employees, they still have a great employee in Robert DiNunzio. If you come across him, it takes you back to the past where the guest are the most important to a business. He made our stay and anniversary great !

Summary Heading: Clean modern rooms, flower-filled grounds, happy staff!
Summary: Saw a hummingbird outside my window! Flowers everywhere I looked, three pools for relaxing and enjoying the water. Adjacent golf course (didn't use but saw people who were). Exercise room has a big picture window so it's like you're outside when you're inside. Didn't eat here, but nice to have a coffee shop in the morning. The self-park lot is a hike up the hill, so ask for a golf cart to help you haul luggage up to the registration desk (and back).  Also love the in-room menu of "did you forget something" that offers general items (nail polish remover, shampoo, toothbrush, etc.) and helpful items (tea kettle!) to use during your stay. Robe and slippers included in the closet - so nice!

Summary Heading: Great location - looking forward to jazz series
Summary: Great location in Newport Beach near Balboa Island, Fashion Island and the Back Bay. Rooms were recently updated and we had a nice view of the Back Bay. Great service in the lobby bar! Quick breakfast options in the lobby each morning. The family enjoyed the kids pool and the adults enjoyed the adult pool. Looking forward to the jazz festival and jazz series this summer!

We came to the Hyatt as part of our family spring trip. We booked a four night package and showed up mom, dad , kids, grandma , and the family dog. We were welcomed to a great family environment. A nice par three golf course bikes to ride, shuffleboard all there to enjoy. With Balboa island so close and the beach it was perfect. With 2 teens it's always hard to get everyone going in the same direction. At the Hyatt you don't have to worry.  Mom and I could go to breakfast, grandma walk the dog, and the kids could sleep in. We all would meet up at the pool. The ordering app was a hit at the pool. While the rooms are a little dated they are comfortable and clean. The grounds more than make up for that. The location was great for the Disneyland day. We had such a nice stay we

Summary Heading: Great location for visiting Newport Beach
Summary: Stayed here for two nights visiting with some friends and thought it was the perfect choice. Though slighting dated everything was very clean. Nice view of harbor and pool with balcony.   Enjoyed the bar and restaurants and had fun one night hitting balls around the par 3 course. The location was perfect. A short walk or quick ride to Balboa Island or bars and restaurants along the harbor.   Stayed in a 3rd floor harbor view room in the main building. Did use the pool but it looked OK and would have been fun for kids.

Traveling toward lax Wanted a higher end place to stay near Huntington Beach. The last time we were in the area we noticed a beautiful Hyatt just outside of  HB so we called to make (same day) reservation there. However, Central reservations made us a reservation at the Hyatt regency 15 minutes away in Newport! I described the place I wanted "near dukes in Huntington Beach "she said it was "close indeed" When we arrived and realized it was not at all the same place nor caliber, we tried to switch it but the Hyatt resort and spa nearer HB we wanted was fully booked ( I felt Hyatt just wanted to keep our business within Hyatt and stuck us there and we were deceived) As far as this property is concerned, felt and looked like a motel 6 with an attempt to spruce it up with

We came in here about 2 days ago and I loved the placed as soon as I walked in! The pool and spa are right next to the room and resort offers a million other sport activities like golf, tennis and gym.  The resort is about 15 min drive away from balboa island and 20 min walk to nearest beach. Though I was under the impression that beach is much closer when I booked. But overall I loved the stay and look forward to visiting again.

Summary Heading: Not a Regency, more of a motel feel
Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights while our house was being treated for termites. The location is perfect for us as it is close to our home. I travel to Florida often to visit family and stay in Hyatt Regencys there.  This hotel should not be classified as a 'Regency" at all.  It was originally a motel and still is structurally a motel. The walls are extremely thin and you can hear conversations clearly. The grounds are nice but nothing special.  There is a $25 per day resort fee which I imagine is just another income generator since this is no resort. I was over charged at check out and had to have them correct it at the desk.  I am also now advised that there is a $150 charge on my credit card from this Hyatt that is not on my bill and is another mistake on their part.  I live in

Hotel sits in flight pattern of John Wayne airport take off and landings.   Plane Noise was horrible.  Had to stop conversations every few minutes while planes took off or landed because they were so loud you couldn't hear people speak. The planes also keep you awake at night and wake you early in the morning

I had originally made reservations from a Hyatt email that advertised about kids-eat-free at this resort. I made the reservation using payment and points combined. Upon check-in, the Hyatt rep. told me that there was nothing in the system that indicated I had purchased a kids-eat-free package. I was very disappointed. The Hyatt rep. said he would comp me a free breakfast for two but that's all he can do. I appreciated his efforts but still was disappointed w/ Hyatt's reservation muck-up. Also the beds are too soft, mattress is old and squeaky.

We were looking for an affordable hotel near all the beaches in Orange County. This hotel was perfect. Pretty, clean, great pools, great service. We had pets and you could not tell we were in a pet room on the  ground floor overlooking the golf course. They have tennis too. We plan to visit often and will stay here again.

Room was relatively ok; however, with extremely thin walls at the point where I could basically follow the TV show that my neighbour had the courtesy to watch almost the entire night! The food was terrible and portions extremely BIG. I disliked the fact that all the pools where surrounded by a locked gate that you and that u had to use your room card to enter in to. I disliked the feeling of a "gated community" when simply trying to relax at a swimming pool between meetings.

I enjoyed it so much that we are going again in June for business and vacation everything we needed was available.  The employees were wonderful.  The rooms were clean.  The food was good everything outside was kept up.

Summary Heading: Nice resort hotel, can't really complain
Summary: This is all you would expect from a Hyatt hotel. This is a large property with golf course, swimming pools (3!), gym, spa, nearby tennis, boating, shopping. There is also shuffleboard near the lobby and a jumbo sized chess board with pieces that are about 3-4 ft high. The service is excellent. Good WiFi in the room, in room empty fridge, coffee maker. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. There is on site parking, but it costs $25 for self park. The lobby has a few Apple computers for general use, a coffee shop that serves Starbucks, a reading alcove off to the side. The only downsides were the bathrooms--shower only, toilet didn't flush well unless you hold the lever down for a while, the toilet shower area was quite cramped. However, the sink and vanity area were quite

The hotel staff and grounds were amazing. Tons of things to do or just lounge by one of the 3 pools and do nothing. The hotel room could be slightly modernized with Queen beds for a family of 4 but overall experience was amazing!

I had to spend 45 minutes and talk to 8 different people before I was able to upgrade my room with my points. The room which I had reserved was not available when I went to check in.  The manager could have cared less about my problem. The AC in the room was very loud. The carpet in the room were sticky.

I used to visit this hotel once/month for 2+ years as I was in a leadership group that met there. Such an amazing location with great service and views. It's super accessible to everything - just a walk to Balboa Island, as well as Fashion Island mall (though they have a shuttle that will take you there).  Wonderful stay every time!

Not on the beach - but has pool with very nice slides. Hotel is so big, it takes a while to get places. Self parking is down a hill and far away - 27 dlls a night for a hike. There is also a $25 resort fee (internet included) tacked on to everybody per night.   It's ok, but not great.

I was surprised at the quality of towels provided at this hotel. very thin and hard. When I inquired if there were other options I was to no. I had to go out and purchase my own set of towels for the stay. I know that some hotels offer gold star members added amenities, they should give other guests the option of upgrading in certain areas, much like the airlines do.

It was OK.  There was no wait staff at the pool.  Up and down all day.  We are a family of 4 and had a regular room.  The bed size is only a full.  The self parking is on the other side of the hotel.  I did have a problem getting out the first time because my card wasn't coded correctly.  They re-coded new cards and waived my first nights parking fee without even asking!!!

Summary Heading: Perfect Location for Your Next Event
Summary: The staff was very welcoming, accommodating and went above and beyond the expectations of attendees. They met all of the food requirements as well as A/V needs. The hotel was easily accessible, fit the needs for all sessions and even provided umbrellas when it rained - allowing attendees to go from one venue to the next. Highly recommend this hotel from your next Conference, Event and/or Meeting!

very nice hotel, in a good area - not by the sea though. Very close to newport beach (almost 10mins) and to fashion center.  the room was clean and comfortable.  Lobby and the swimming pool were beautiful.  One of the negative points was that the bathroom door was too thin and could not prevent noises or smells coming from the toilet. I cant say that if this is the case for all the rooms.

Your staff is excellent.  Consistently looked for what I might need; clearly the mark of an excellent organization!  The property is obviously older, but very well maintained and upgraded where needed.  Well done; I look forward to a future visit.

I am from Newport Beach and visit several times a year. I ALWAYS STAY AT THE HYATT REGENCY NEWPORT BEACH. There is virtually no staff turnover. They remember their guests and treat them wonderfully. It is perfectly situated to beaches, Balboa Island, shopping, etc. the hotel has numerous tennis courts and a pitch and putt golf course. There are 3 pools and hot tubs. The grounds are perfectly manicured. Can't say enough.

Clean, quiet, and very friendly staff. I will be back. Hotels grounds were pleasant to walk around and explore. Only a few minutes from the beach. Housekeeping did a fantastic job cleaning up my mess! Thank you.

Extensive resort property. Rooms are large  but not logically laid out. Bathroom is weird. Ate at the restaurant, the bar and had conference food. All three were way too salty. Steak served at the conference was way too rare and vegetarian plates came 30 minutes after the rest of the food. Bathroom was not well cleaned. Conference facilities had too few bathrooms.

The proximity to the race and price of the room, made this hotel the best choice for the 2016 OC Half Marathon. Clean room with a large tv and a surprisingly large bathroom and shower were a great surprising addition to my hotel experience.

The ambience is delightful, and the hotel food at the meeting could not have been better.  The gardens are beautiful, and the only complaint are the many stairs without elevators.  The location near the coast and the airport is most convenient.

All staff were friendly, polite and helpful. Beautiful pool beside Balboa building with comfy chairs and loungers. Room was updated, very clean and comfortable.  I was a bit concerned with the lower rating for the hotel but with all of the renovations it is a beautiful resort.

I staid at this hotel as part of a conference.  The hotel's layout feels like a restful resort and offers many indoor and outdoor sitting locations for socializing or relaxing.  It has excellent rooms for conferences and the customer service is outstanding.

Summary Heading: A very nice hotel with good service, but a bit pricey considering the ocean wasn't that close to the hotel.
Summary: This is a nice hotel but the ocean is not that close. I was there for a conference so the tab was on the Corp card. Not sure I would pay to stay here as for a few dollars more, you can be much closer to the ocean or have an actual ocean view from your room.

The grounds and staff here are the best! Visited for a conference and was greeted by friendly and responsive staff. Throughout my 5 day stay here, the staff provided the best customer service. There are several pools here and many activities on the grounds. The weather was perfect and I am happy with my trip.

Stayed here for a conference and received a room in the Balboa wing. I had room 752 and I thought I would be on the seventh floor.  Was I wrong.  I was on the bottom floor, so the numbers mean nothing. I think there might have been a third floor in one building, but it is a very low profile hotel, not a high rise.    Each room had an outside sitting area with two chairs and a table. As mine overlooked the parking lot, I did not utilize the space.  The rooms are a nice size, very modern and clean. The bed was not overly comfortable, but I slept well. Earplugs are always a must when staying in a hotel.  There is no choice but to accept the resort fee.  Yes, that is annoying. It would have been cheaper for me to pay for internet and drink a bottle of water. My advice it to try to

This is Hotel California. Beautiful grounds with flowers of all kinds, three pools, Spanish style architecture, and beautiful views.  First class rooms. The hotel has excellent conference facilities with a variety of rooms for classrooms, vendors, and banquet.  We enjoyed lunch on the tiered lawn with tables and umbrellas to shade the sun, where there was a small ampitheater for presentations and performances. This would be an excellent location for a wedding.

The hotel was awesome hotel.  The room was great, large and clean.  The staff were friendly.  The pool areas were nice.  My teenagers enjoyed playing table tennis, shuffleboard and chess that were onsite.

Summary Heading: My stay at Hyatt Newport beach
Summary: It was a nice stay. There are lots of things to do for kids. close to John Wayne airport and can hear planes over head. At check out the front desk gave me attitude because I challenged the bill. Food on expensive side.

This hotel is very well managed, organized and clean. The location is optimal for individuals traveling with a family. My kids enjoyed the heated swimming pool, slide and games. Friday night they played a movie for the kids poolside. You won't have to second guest yourself if you decide to stay here. I will never endorse any hotel just so I can score points. I want to share my honest opinion so the reader(s) can feel comfortable selecting this hotel as your vacation/business destination. Enjoy!!!

Summary Heading: One of the best family staycations
Summary: Our family enjoyed the pools, local shuttles to fun attractions, and excellent customer service. Would definitely do it again and highly recommend to others. Food is tasty although limited menus. Add Parking to the budget so you don't have to think about the cost. :)

I found this property because it had a Tesla charger, which was critical to my long distance trip. The hotel was recently remodeled and the rooms were large, modern and new (even new bathrooms). You really could not tell the rooms from those of a newly built hotel. The pool areas appeared recently remodeled and were as nice as any resort I've visited. The only complaint is the nagging Resort Fee in the fine print.

I went with my 10 year old and my husband on a family vacation. Excellent customer service from the front desk to housekeeping personell.  My son loved the fact they had chocolate chip cookies at the reception and that he was giving a cup for unlimited drinks for him during the stay. He also noticed the bar turned into a coffee shot in the morning, excellent idea. The Hotel was very clean!!!

I stayed here directly from flying in from Scotland. Staff were very friendly, very helpful. Food was good and the bed was big and comfortable. A nice easy 20 minute walk from Balboa Island. I slept for 12 hours the first night !!

Summary Heading: Better not be staying at the lido wing of this property
Summary: The guest paid $25/night parking lot is a 1/4 mile from the hotel room. Bathroom seat have one with the back facing the entry. The Lido building itself is no better than an updated Motel 6. Location is fine relative to the city. TV checkout did not work during my visit. This is an antiquated property with one or two updated newer buildings.

My wife and I stayed here when we visited our sons. The hotel is very elegant and beautiful and the grounds are immaculate. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and can't wait to come back. You really feel like royalty when you stay here. There is so much to do in Newport Beach so staying here is the best thing to do.

This resort was renovated last year and is very smart. The pools are well looked after.  It is well placed for Balboa Island and Fashion Island if you want to do shopping. The staff are excellent. The Shor restaurant is great food with great relaxed service.

This is a nice property. Make sure you valet your car or unload luggage before self-parking, as the parking lot is a long way and many steps from the front desk for check-in. The spa that we used only had 3 working jets. The restaurant was nice, but the portions were small for the price.

For our first trip to Newport Beach we selected the Hyatt Regency, we were not disappointed. The resort has 3 outdoor pools the Serenity pool was next to our well appointed disabled room and for the first time during our trip round the world my disabled wife was able to get in and out of both the pool and the hot tub on her own. I cannot tell what confidence this gave her. The food was very good and plentiful as you would expect in the USA. The hotel supplied a shuttle service to the local shopping mall, Balboe Island and John Wayne Airport which ran every hour ( every 2 hours to the shopping mall). The concierge (Robert) arranged a private full days LA limo tour for us which was the best service we have ever had from a limo driver.  Next time we return,which we will, we intend

First time to Newport - how different to the rest of LA. The hotel has everything you want, great pools, excellent food and spacious rooms. A shuttle to nearby Fashion Island and Balboa island. If you are planning a two night stay, come for four it's that good!!

We ended up at this hotel for three nights when our travel schedule was disrupted by weather.  The location of this hotel cannot be beat - as it is super convenient to not only SNA but all of the beach towns in OC.  We really enjoyed the layout of the hotel and the variety of activities that they offer.  The staff truly went out of their way to ensure a wonderful stay. We wanted to say an extra thank you to Joe with the bell team who was a delight to converse with and was so genuine in his hospitality - along with the whole team.

Hate, hate, hate the decor. Cold as an ice cave!  White, grey and black!  Paper cups for coffee!  Bed as comfortable.  You have to request any amenities you may want - i.e shampoo Didn't like that people walk right by the window on the walkway to get to their rooms - so curtains need to be kept closet.

Beautiful location for a Hyatt Hotel.  Unfortunately the design is from the 1960s.  Concrete block low-rise.  No privacy for the  toilet.   (Same room as the sink and shower)  Not enough electrical outlets.  Broken toilet flush mechanism.  I expected much more for the location and price.

Wanted to thank Jhosselyn at the front desk for making our 1 night stay to celebrate our anniversary a wonderful one.  She promptly checked us in to an upgraded room with a view of Newport Bay, delivered a nice Happy Anniversary card and bottle of champagne to our room while we were out to dinner. We were very appreciative of her kind gesture which truly made our stay. Thank you, Jhosselyn!  P.s. take advantage of the free bike rental and ride down to Balboa Island!

Stayed at the Hyatt Regency while visiting the Newport Beach/ Balboa Island area. It was very close to all the local sites... and offers a free shuttle to Balboa Island and the Fashion Island shopping mecca.  It has 3 lovely pools, with above average deck furnishings.  It borders a nature preserve where you can bike hike or drive. Just minutes from Laguna Beach as well.  Rooms have lovely balconies with wonderful views of the gardens and pools.

Hotel staff are very friendly, helpful. If you forget anything, they have it for you to either borrow, buy or keep.  I was able to borrow a steamer and a clothes drying rack. Housekeeping staff are prompt and friendly.  The bathroom in the King Bay View was fine, just a bit small. Not cramped though. The grounds are beautiful.

Lovely hotel but parking fee is not so nice!!  Love the view of bay beautiful surrounding.  All the staff is wonderful and helpful.  I really enjoyed our stay the pool was great.  Check out the shuffleboard game!  I felt that the parking fee was really high.

I travel frequently to this hotel for business and have found the staff at this hotel is one of the very best. A nice gym, wonderful grounds, three different pools to choose from... what more can you ask?

Summary Heading: Clean hotel with good amenities and great location
Summary: Perfect hotel for two families of four (each with 2 teenage boys), lots to do on the property and great location to launch daily activities from.  Staff was available when needed and out of the way when not. Will stay at hotel again in the future.

Visited for 2 weeks over easter/spring break with one child, one teen and my elderly aunt. We had a beautiful room (129) in the main building on the ground floor and were very pleased with all it had to offer. Our terrace looked out over the amphitheatre and the bay behind it. The included wifi was strong and easy to use, the fridge was large and the beds very comfortable. The staff were all very helpful and friendly and the amenities were great.  The pools were lovely and my kids favoured the one with the slide! The hot jacuzzi pool made a nice addition for use on cooler evenings.  The grounds were well maintained and extras like the fire pits or archways made it all the more special. The location is excellent, with fashion island, bayside shopping centre and balboa island and

Summary Heading: Dated property in a pretty setting
Summary: This hotel is spread out in several low rise buildings in a very beautiful setting. It was enjoyable sitting on our balcony and enjoying the scenery. I didn't have a chance to use the pools, fitness center, etc., but our second room was in the same building as the fitness center and it looked very well equipped. We had several service-related issues during our short stay. I say "second room" because even after I specifically requested a quiet location--and have this specified in my Gold Passport profile as well--we were given a room directly overlooking the giant chess board and shuffleboard court. When we asked to be moved to a quieter location we were accommodated, but I have to say I found the front desk staff competent and not inviting. Our second room was located in a

I came here for a 3 day conference with my company and was impressed by the service, amenities, grounds and rooms.  The grounds have several nice recreation options including multiple pools, shuffleboard and golf.  The rooms are very comfortable and spacious.  The staff here provide great service in a prompt and friendly fashion.  The room service menu offers refined food at a reasonable price.  Overall, I was favorably impressed by the Hyatt Regency and would stay here again.

The Hyatt in Newport Beach is a stunning, relaxing property. Their renovation was a huge improvement and everything was very modern, beachy, boho and cozy. The property is nice a quiet, tucked in Newport Beach. The resort has 2-3 pools which were never overcrowded, the rooms had beautiful natural lighting and wonderful amenities. The Shor restaurant in the hotel lobby has a delicious breakfast menu & buffet. We also loved sitting on the lobby patio with the firepit and heat lamps. The only complaint I have is that the staff was not very friendly. Valet was always obliging and helpful, but the front desk and housekeeping staff are a little stiff and cold. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and I would definitely revisit.

This hotel has the location to be a a great hotel.  Instead it is old and tired.  Too many issues from poor reservation system to paper thin rag like hand towels.  On second floor noise level outside was a problem.  However, breakfast choices were good and food was good.

It was my first time here, I came with a friend to have a stress free weekend and it was anything but. The floor above us stomped around all night. We even called the front desk to complain and nothing changed. What a waste of $300 to not sleep. Won't be going back.

The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach remodeled this 1961 property a few years ago, and they did a wonderful job. Rooms are updated, bathrooms are sleek and modern (with Toto toilets - the best!), and the grounds well maintained with a mature feel (trees large, beautiful landscaping). Banquet food was wonderful (breakfast the best), and the staff were absolutely great ... attentive, caring, efficient, and you can tell they love their job and truly cared about our well-being and happiness. I would recommend this to anyone planning a meeting (superb meeting accommodations) or a romantic getaway (get a balcony room). I will return and bring hubby next time.

This hotel needs to be torn down and start fresh with a resort deserving of it's location.  We booked what we thought was a suite.  When we checked in we were a bit surprised by them calling this a suite.  All it was was a large room with a gigantic conference table in the middle of the room, an awkward sitting area and a tiny bathroom.  It had to have been the loudest hotel I've ever stayed in.  You could hear every person walk by, talk or even drop a pin for that matter.  This is essentially an old Motel, with a Hyatt label on it.  The worst part of all was the large pool with the slide for the kids was not heated.  It was supposedly broken.  In fairness to them, they did credit me 2 nights of my stay.  But they did not credit me for the resort fee, nor parking for those

HAPPY HAPPY JOY JOY...fgdshdfhdfgretydfbgdvbcvbcvb...dreatydfghfgvbjfghcxh..gbfgfgdfgdfgdfgfg.....cvnhgvfxchghgdfhgdfhgdfhdgfsh..I don't want to write 200 words!  Great location great staff, thank you for another great visit

Excellent Pet Friendly Hotel. The staff and service were excellent. The hotel location is great. Many activities to participate in. We will continue to spend our Newport Beach vacations at the Hyatt Regency NewPort Beach.

I went to this property with the Tone It Up Retreat 2015, which for those of you who don't know, is a women's fitness retreat. Basically, cheer camp with 400 women. I'm a mom and wife and was excited for a special fitness getaway down by the beach. I have to say that although the TIU Retreat was a nice experience, I found the hotel just "meh." I luckily had one of the nice, renovated rooms. It was a clean, contemporary design. No amenities in the room at all. Not one. Don't know if this was an oversight, or if they just don't give them to you. Walls seemed paper thin. Heard a mom screaming at her child next door....pleasant for my mom-getaway, lol! Met a woman from the retreat by the pool and saw her room area....she was in an area almost like an annex that looked like a motel

Summary Heading: Best all around Hotel in the area
Summary: Great location, great friendly staff.. you pay a bit more, but you have everything you need to access Balboa, OCH and the beaches. Also an Oasis away from the hustle of a "business" hotel., very good for families, and kids of all ages.

Beautiful place to stay. The grounds were amazing.  Felt like a resort and not a hotel.  They should offer up free internet. They don't need to nickel and dime you for something like that. Great location in Newport beach

Summary Heading: Good hotel but not great bargain
Summary: We stayed at this hotel last weekend for a quick getaway. We paid $250/night. It was not worth that. The rooms were very humid. The rooms and hallways spelled like a dentists office. That said the stay was not bad. Facilities were good. Property was really good. Service was great. Valet service especially. It was Easter weekend and they were slammed. Vince in valet was especially great. He remembered us by name and greeted us every time we arrived. Overall I'd stay here again but not at $250/night. If you're looking for the really nice Hyatt regency property, this is probably not your pick but it's still a pretty good spot to stay.

I didn't want to leave!  I showed up stressed with an important business deadline to meet. I started off not caring about my surroundings.  It didn't take long for me to relax. I then focused better and my work was done in no time. Love the place. I had some unexpected time for FUN!

Used points for a weekend in Newport Beach and was given the worst location at the hotel.  Right outside our door was the towel bins and extra roll away beds.  The hotel looks newly renovated but by that I mean a new paint job and nice landscaping.  The rooms were nice but ours smelled musty and room deodorizer did nothing to take away the smell.  AC located near ceiling... blew directly at our faces.  Had to turn it off and slept in a warm room.

Summary Heading: Nice, Resort-like feel for an older property
Summary: Came here for a weekend in March and enjoyed our stay. Booked with cash + points so got two nights for a very reasonable redemption. The front desk was friendly and very clear about the resort fees and what was included. The building that our room was in surrounded a swimming pool and had a very "apartment" building in LA feel. The room was spacious and the bathroom was nicely updated. The bed was comfortable, and service from all staff was good as expected from the brand. It was easy to find, on Jamboree, and we would stay here again!

I stayed in the main building, room 303.  It was on the third floor and had a lovely balcony that had a partial view of the marina, I could partially see the pool, and it was very nice.  The room was nice and the bed was comfortable.  The shower in the morning was refreshing, as the showerhead had just the right force.  Went to the bar the night before, and the food, drinks, and ambiance was great.  The bartenders were entertaining.  All in all, it was a pleasant experience, and I will be back.

The room was nice but a little musty.  Also lots of bugs but there was space around the door, which can be easily fixed I think.  Food at Shor was very good but pricey.
