Considering the availability of great restaurants in the area, I'm not sure it was the greatest value - other than that I didn't have to leave.

Aside from a knock on the door at 3am to bring towels and sheets we didn't request, a black hair at the bottom of our ice cream bowl (ick), and facilities that are in need of updating, the stay was adequate.

Summary Heading: Check your credit card for extra charges after checking out!!
Summary: We just checked out of our room today and about 8 hours later we received a fraud call from American Express.  The Hyatt charged us an extra $498.54 over and above the original room charges.  I promptly called the Hyatt and spoke with a manger who looked into the charge.  Apparently they charged us the $500 "by accident".  They were supposed to charge Expedia this charge and not us.  Sounds like a scam to me.  So take this as a warning to make sure to check and double check your credit card statement or they will try to fleece you for some extra cash.  Our stay wasn't terrible so that is why I only gave this a POOR rating.

I had the pleasure of staying here for two nights during the 2016 Acute Leukemia Forum. The property and facilities here are gorgeous. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful, including at check-in and check-out, and at the lobby bar. The room was clean and well-maintained, and the bathroom was particularly spacious, with an invigorating shower. Food served at the conference and in on-property restaurants was excellent; I was a fan of the tuna. Valet and self parking were very easy. The only very minor drawbacks included slightly thin walls (at least it seemed as such in my unit and mildly sluggish free wireless internet. However, I was so pleased with how well the hotel handled the conference and with the conscientiousness of the staff during my stay.

I can't tell you how much I appreciated the way the staff took care of us. After having a horrible experience with the place we rented through Airbnb, the staff was amazing. My son got a horrible bloody nose after we rented two of the bikes and rode them down to Balboa Island. They completely took care of us and them and returned them to the hotel. It was a huge relief to have such amazing customer service. From a single mom, it was greatly appreciated.

I stay at the Hyatt Newport Beach because they treat me well.  I feel that the hotel offers a peaceful setting and it's not ostentatious. The beds are comfortable and I feel safe.  I also like that there are families and children playing in the pool.  They have a nice little gym and offer water bottles, coffee, and tea in the rooms.  The valet is kind and the front desk takes care of everything pleasantly.

Summary Heading: The unexpected can be a good thing, can be a bad thing.
Summary: First of all the property is older, but beautifully refurbished. Frankly whomever design the update deserves an award. Rooms are spacious and nicely appointed. The bath was small, but again beautiful.   The downsides are the noise from being under Orange County Airport flight path, and the propensity of the doors from the rooms slamming. But the real wake up call is the $25 a day parking with the $25 a day resort fee and over $30 a day convention and visitors taxes.   My advice is to take the $80 bucks, add it to the cost of this room, and stay some place better. While a great place to stay, a poor value.

We expected more from a Hyatt Regency hotel. First, the hotel staff was not overly friendly. We had requested a King bed room, checked in and got to our room and found it was a double bed room. Had to call and get switched and the gal seemed overly inconvenienced by our request. Our new room was by the kid pool, which was loud of course, but the other issue is the walls are paper thin. You can hear everything going on in the rooms. The rooms and the layout of the hotel, especially certain areas (lido) look like a refurbished Motel 6. Many areas of the hotel are dirty, the hallway carpets are torn and in need of replacement. Several areas need to be repainted. The beds are horribly uncomfortable and the sheets are like sandpaper. And the hotel is directly under the flight path of

all services good.  Note that all of my responses were excellent, until your software stopped me 3 times to demand answers in a section that was listed as "Optional",  so this block is evaluated as "good" only.

I have been to this hotel twice now for a conference.  The hotel property is very nice and makes you feel like you are on a resort in mexico.  Staff are very friendly and willing to help at all times.  Location is good as well close to many things to do when on break.

If your business or vacation travel take you to the greater LA area, this is a great place. The rooms are clean, though not particularly modern. Get a room away from the main pool if you want to optimize seclusion and quiet. The grounds are beautiful. The John Wayne airport is close, which means you can bypass the gross experience of LAX. It also has a conference center that will host around 200 people. Lastly, it has a Hertz rental site on the premises.

Beautiful lobby.  Great staff - very helpful.  Delicious and fresh food.  Airport shuttle driver was super informative.  I especially enjoyed relaxing by the pool while I awaited on the conference to begin.  For business conferences: GREAT place to host!!

Newport Beach is a wonderful getaway and the Hyatt with it's spectacular grounds, and something for everyone resort amenities is a lovely place to stay.  The staff is very helpful and friendly and the rooms are spacious, tranquil and comfortable.

My commendations to the staff and management of this facility.  From the moment I entered to the time I left, I felt that the staff was sincerely invested in customer service.  Excellent across the board!!

Very pretty hotel in a good location for our trip.  The staff is extremely nice but the rooms are noisy.  Doors slam shut loudly and can be heard throughout the hallways.  In addition you can hear water from the bathrooms in the rooms beside and above you.

I loved my stay here.  I travel a lot to Jamaica to the all inclusive resorts.  I honestly felt like I was there.  The property is beautifully laid out.  I wish we had warmer weather so we could have taken advantage of the lovely pools.

Summary Heading: Expensive resort hotel with no breakfast and bad wifi connection in room
Summary: The New Port Beach Hyatt is an expensive resort hotel with lots of amenities (3 swimming pools, tennis, gym 24h/24) but with no included breakfast. My wifi connection in my room (not in the lobby) did not work.

Summary Heading: Stayed here for a Business Conference
Summary: The hotel is a bit dated and smelled a bit musty. I was in the Balboa Building. There was a party a few rooms down two nights in a row (called security once). I ordered room service twice and both times the food was below average (and expensive). The grounds are beautiful, the lobby is lovely. Room cleaning was average. water bottles in room was greatly appreciated. In-room coffee maker was below average. Overall I would have no desire to return to that hotel, but it sufficed for a business meeting. If that was my vacation hotel - I would have been disappointed.

Very nice hotel and room .The overall feeling  was positive,great breakfast but very expensive if you not on business expenses.You pay 25 dollars each day to park and pay a resort fee.Try and negotiate.Position of the hotel very good for the beach  and other attractions inc fashion island

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel for the price - good location
Summary: We had a room on the top floor in the main building overlooking the pool.  The balcony was nice - nice grounds.  Clean room and friendly staff.  The room was up to Hyatt Standards.  The pool was very nice.  I appreciated that the hotel seemed to be proactive in reducing excess noise as several signs were posted indicating the 'quiet hours'.  I thought the selection on the breakfast buffet was mediocre - especially for the price.  Also, no beverages whatsoever were available on the buffet.  Thus, the wait staff had to run around just to fill people's water glasses.  That's just silly.

This hotel gets 5 stars from me because it was very clean! The private patios off of the rooms are a nice amenity. The landscaping is well maintained, making walks along the paths pleasant. Staff is friendly and accommodating. The only disappointment is that someone removed the geocache.

The hotel grounds were beautiful. The rooms needed some TLC. You could hear people in the next room. The pools were nice and the staff was very accommodating. Nice hotel and great location very close to Balboa Island.

The Hyatt Regency hotels have high standards in hospitality; and this hotel certainly upheld its traditions. Quiet, comfortable room, spotlessly clean and well maintained public areas and scenic views. Self park was nice. Did not use internet or any resort facilities, as we were just there for the night for a wedding party- but had to pay the resort fees nevertheless.

Was there for a wedding. Overnight stay. Used my Hyatt points to book a room. Checked in online early. Was assigned the worst possible room in the facility! Lido Room 175 looks part of a cheap Motel 6 tired old wing.  Entrance to the room was dark and hidden behind a wall. Backyard view was of a 10 foot slope going up!  Was the farthest point from the Terrace Room where the wedding was to be held!

Hotel is average at best. Ballet and restaurant people are good but some of the people in the front desk are indifferent. we have asked for late 2pm checkout, not granted but several of our colleagues had been granted until 3pm.

Stayed at the Hyatt in Newport Beach on a business trip. Service was prompt and friendly, especially check in and check out. The resort is spread out -- there are several different buildings where the rooms are located. That's just to say you might have to walk a bit from your room to the main lobby and restaurants. The rooms are clean and well appointed. There's a hotel resort fee.

I used this hotel for a quick weekend get-away in the winter. It's an older property relative to most in the area, but well maintained and very pleasant. The rooms have an almost Caribbean decor & feel to them - very open with lots of light.   I enjoyed this property immensely. The hotel has several nice sitting areas outside, a beautiful pool, and outdoor fire pits that are enjoyable in the cooler winter evenings. There were several events going on the weekend I was there - a wedding & some other social gatherings. That said, I barely noticed it outside of the lobby area and the guest rooms were perfectly quiet.  It is located in the center of Newport Beach, across the street from the major shopping areas and only a few minutes away from the actual beach/Balboa island area.

This Hyatt is beautiful. 3 Pools, nice fitness room, very polite staff, and many other amenities. Only bad part is not much in walking distance (less that 1 mile). Has a nice selection for grab and go breakfast if you don't want to spend the money in the restaurant.

During the Thanksgiving holiday, I stayed at this property when my favorite hotel was booked. I was assigned a room in what appeared to be an older, neglected section of the hotel. After a long trek in the dark to my room, I unlocked the door with much trepidation. Given the exterior, I fully expected a dingy, old, dank room with a drippy, ancient air conditioner. What I got was a wonderfully modern and spotless haven! Large grey tiles defined the entryway and led to a plushly carpeted room. The bed was covered with a plump duvet and lots of fluffy pillows. A desk and chair was on the far wall, very suitable for serious work, should the need arise, and thankfully it did not! A comfy chair was tucked in a corner with a perfect little table next to it for secure placement of a

Summary Heading: Is It A Hotel Or A Remodelled Motel?
Summary: Great staff and good coffee but the place isn't great quality. My room was out back and it looked like I was staying in an old two storey hotel. I had to carry my heavy bag up the stairs.. Not good  It's clean and the rooms are ok but it  is below the standard I was expecting.

This is one of our favorite spots in Newport.  It's tucked away with an awesome pool and a variety of room choices!  The main pool view is awesome, but the rooms are smaller and when we travel with the kids, we like the larger rooms of the main building or the separate building (name escaping me right now).  The grounds feel like vacation every time we pull up...and that's just what we like!  Close to so many things, yet you feel like you are a world away!  Love enjoying coffee on the back patio while the little guys enjoy playing tag in the grass.  Peaceful and the rooms are all updated and comfortable.

The hotel was very very noisy that night. I had to call in the middle of the night to get something done. The next day the lady at the lobby did not care. I had the diner at the local restaurant. Could not finish my meat, it was really not good.

Not what I expected from a Hyatt and for the price I paid.  Definitely not worth the stay for me.  Staff is very friendly and location is great.  But the rooms are really ran down and in need of a nice up grade.

I was here for a conference and the hotel was clean and up to date for the most part.  It was typical over priced bar and food for a hotel.  $15 for pancakes was enough to discourage me from trying out SHOR.    I had a first level room that had a patio that looked right in to bushes and trees so it wasn't very inviting.  I don't think they should call it a golf course when you can see 5 hole flags at one time.

Nice hotel, only nearby highway is noisy. Rooms good and spacious, corridors smelly due to lack of ventilation. Location good but away from shore. Great view over hills at back of hotel and nice vegetation and other plants.

Summary Heading: Older Elegant Hotel in good Loacation
Summary: I have been to Newport many times and wanted to try out this hotel.  They run a jazz series in the summer, but there was no show the night we stayed.  The grounds are very lush with plants and flowers.  Our room was by the far pool and overlooked the back bay.  We enjoyed a nice view of the sunset.  We were charged the resort fee so we took advantage of bike rentals and pedaled around the back bay which was beautiful.  The staff is very friendly and eager to help.   The only negative was that the hotel looked old and there was a scent of "old" in some locations in the hotel.  Overall I would still stay here again, though.

This was my second time in Newport Beach and 1st at the Hyatt.  Check in was easy and our room was ready at 3PM.  There are many buildings in the complex; I was in the Balboa and would recommend it.  It's close to the lobby and had a nice room with a patio in front of the pool.  Rooms are comfortable and spacious; refrigerator was appreciated.  Resort fees are high, but if you take advantage of the amenities (executive golf course, bicycles) it's not too bad.  The location is good for getting to the Coastal highway and Balboa Island and to Fashion Island Mall.

Great food we came back from other hotels for it 2 great heated pools and my room was like a linae right off the pool on the first floor the bell man told me there are 720 palm trees Also it is right next to a salt water marsh sanctuary and so you can walk there but the best part is the birds visit the hotel early morning with their songs Love it

This was our third visit to this hotel; Jan 2015, Aug 2015, Feb 2016. Each time we stayed 3 nights to visit a family member.  This hotel is spacious with nice outside seating areas and great customer service from every member of the staff. Everyone there is pleasant, helpful and authentic. At times we felt badly having an extended talk with a waiter or front desk person thinking we were taking them away from other work. That is how engaging they are.  The hotel wasn't very full last January during our first stay, and seemingly ⅓  full mid-February of this year. It was packed last August. But the service felt all the same, empty or full.   It's a pleasant and mostly quiet place. It all depends on who are in the rooms near yours. This February we had very active people on either

The Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach is a perfect launching pad to vacation activities in Southern California.  Be mindful that the hotel lacks modern amenity, service and infrastructure although charges guests a resort fee.  Seemingly there are employee and customer management challenges plaguing the Hyatt at present.   An unfriendly hotel stay.

The hotel offers a free shuttle to the airport, balboa island, and fashion island.  The resort fee covers the use of bikes for 2 hours, beach gear, and green fees.  The room was a little outdated, I would have expected it to be nicer.  There was a patio/balcony (we had 1st floor), which was nice.  They have three pools, shuffle board, giant lawn chess, and putting near the pool with the slide.  Overall the grounds are nice, it's a good location for balboa island, but the outdated rooms are a negative.

The Hyatt has a great shuttle service that picks you up from the airport, and it also goes regularly to Fashion Island and to Balboa Island. We used the shuttle quite a bit and found it on time with friendly drivers.  The bed was of average quality, and I missed my Tempurpedic greatly! The food at the restaurant was below average, but the conference catering was excellent.  The pools and hot tub were clean and private. All service was excellent.

This hotel was dirty, loud, and of poor quality! The outside entrance made the room feel like a "Super 8" motel.  The location was abysmal and I felt trapped--absolutely nothing within walking distance.  Rooms are not ADA accessible.  Staff did not seem to care.

With the few pools throughout the hotel, and the low rise buildings all around, I felt like the day spent here was a tropical getaway! The privacy and proximity to surrounding tourist joints was fantastic. Thank you to the wonderful staff for always having positive attitudes....they truly do make the difference!

My first time staying in a Hyatt. I stayed in the Balboa building and I thought the room was lovely and large. I didn't have a great view, but the room had a patio with chairs. It had everything that I needed, except a microwave! ADD MICROWAVES! The check in was easy. The staff was very nice and helpful. I did have to call for service on the shower. They sent someone up and they took care of it very fast. At one point I was looking for a taxi, but they set me up with a towncar and driver to ride me around. I felt very special having doors opened and closed for me. Oh, there is a hotel shuttle to and from the John Wayne airport, Fashion Island, and Balboa Island. The shuttle was always on time when I used it. There was a bar in the lobby, a restaurant on site, and a little gift

I have stayed at numerous Hyatt properties and this has to be one of the worst Hyatt Regency's basically:  Negatives  - old and poorly maintained rooms - poorly trained staff - inconsistent service - 'heated' pool not heated told repeatedly 'plumber will be here tomorrow' - glorified Motel 6  Positives  - beautiful grounds - good location

Hyatt Regency-Newport Beach absolutely incredible. All staff - are friendly, great service, available, and helpful. Usually you bump into one or two at a hotel but absolutely everyone of the staff were top notch, A++. Hotel is easy walking distance to Balboa Island. Highly recommend this hotel for any occasion.

VERY satisfied with the Hyatt Regency resort and would recommend it. The staff was very friendly and helpful to our needs. The amenities were exceptional as well as the service. The hotel was centrally located for easy access.

I stayed at the hotel for business.  Loved it.  My room sat on the golf course, in the mornings I ran outside (one day in a nearby canyon, the next, Balboa Island).  The bar and restaurant are great.  Service was awesome.  Only suggestion:  need a microwave in the room.  :)

The Facilities were great, the service was very good and friendly. The facilities were very clean and maintained. Fitness center well maintained varsity of equipment. The vending machines for sodas, were either empty or non functional. Staff made sure sodas we're available when informed at no charge with an apology.  The prices in the bar for conventional drinks was more than necessary. Just because the community is known for high prices is no excuse. I also found the day bar tender fast with change money. The Thursday arrival I ordered a 12 yrs old scotch , 15.00 fair, put on room, with receipt. Second drink a shot Don Julio tequila. I errantly paid with 100.00 bill . I was quickly slipped 48.00 in change with no receipt, money stacked no counted back and bartender became

Summary Heading: Wonderful ambiance, terrific staff and breathtaking view from my balcony!
Summary: I needed to escape from the cold in Chicago. I work really hard and I'm a student pursing my Master's degree. I came to the Hyatt Regency at Newport Beach to relax and disconnect from my every day, busy, and hectic life.  I got so much more than I anticipated! The view from my balcony was spectacular, breathtaking even!  My room and bathroom were very clean.The staff was so courteous, professional, accommodating, and friendly.  Most of the staff remembered my name. The woman at the breakfast bar remembered how I take my coffee, early on during my 9 day stay. Everyone made me feel special!  The staff added such a personal touch to my stay! I cannot say enough nice things about my stay. I will definitely return, and I will highly recommend this location. Thank you all for making

I have stayed at this hotel a few times.  It is in a good location in Newport Beach.  The last time I stayed however they put us in two rooms overlooking the valet parking lot (when i requested a bay view).  The sheets on the bed were dirty and stained....they came quickly to change them but yuck!  I would consider going back to the hotel because it is very nice but I will check the sheets before 10:30pm next time!

Summary Heading: Great room, Great staff, Great property
Summary: I love staying at this hotel.  Large comfortable rooms with great amenities. Within walking distance of some great restaurants. My first choice when staying in Newport Beach. The breakfast at Starbucks is a quick and tasty meal.

We stayed one night for Valentine's, selecting this location under the assumption that a Hyatt in Newport Beach would be beautiful.  Unfortunately it was far from that.  The grounds and rooms were very old and frankly run down.  Seemed more like an old motel than a Hyatt brand.  That said, I have to give the staff credit as they were great.

I have stayed here three times and the experience is always wonderful.  The food is great (and healthy) especially the burger.  The hotel staff is helpful and kind.  The room was very clean with all the amenities.

I stayed here one night. I am a Hyatt member. I liked it here and would stay again. The grounds and room I stayed in, are very well maintained and fresh. There is ample parking, although a bit of a walk to my room. It was quiet at night.   We swam in the 82 degree pool, which is large and clean. They have a good workout  room, in my area. (The layout is over a large area, with different buildings)  Overall, just nice pleasant, clean and rooms are great.  I am a Hyatt member, but am under no direction or obligation to submit posts to TripAdvisor. My options are my own.

Summary Heading: Great hotel but not much sleep
Summary: Great hotel, great food, great location, average staff when it comes to service.  Biggest challenge was large groups in the hotel were loud and obnoxious in the hallways late at night repeatedly.  Greater care should be taken by sales staff to work with large groups to set expectations of behavior and also to ensure while in house that they behave in a respectful way, I did not appreciate the nightly wake up experiences between 2-3am

The staff is very welcoming. They always remember me and make me feel like part of the family. I've been staying at different hotels for business for the last 8 years and I can honestly say this is my most favorite.

Summary Heading: great location/service but cleanliness and quality lacking
Summary: Property very nice.  Rooms leave something to be desired.  Toilet/shower area is very cramped.  Somewhat updated features.  Wall in vanity area had water damage (bubbled out).  Air conditioner unit was filthy dusty and dirty/moldy.  AC drenched carpet area, about 20sq ft  didn't realize until late without shoes. Somewhat not well insulated room from noise.  especially if you get a ground floor room

I recently stayed here for the third time and it was much nicer now that the renovation is complete (or at least it appeared complete to me).  My room was very modern and clean.  The gym had a wide variety of equipment.  The grounds are just beautiful and all the staff I interacted with were very friendly.  I was there for a conference and the food I had at the conference but prepared by the hotel was just awesome, and I might be the pickiest eater in the world and typically find hotel food bland.  The shuttle, while not always convenient if you are impatient with waiting, is a nice bonus.  My only slightly negative experience is that I had to wait 2 hours for my room after the person I checked in with received her room.  Granted this was before check in time, but I don't know

We have been using the Hyatt Regency as a family meeting place for years. We like the Hyatt service, the spacious grounds, the views and the unique location. The room fees are reasonable for Newport, but budget for the parking fees for yourself and visitors.

A lovely venue for a conference. We extended our stay for a few extra days. Rooms are quite pricy. Service is adequate but inconsistent. The shuttle driver went above and beyond to drop us at a select restaurant. Housekeeping was very helpful and friendly. The concierge wasn't so helpful. We emailed several days in advance of our trip for some specific information and didn't get a response until a few days before our trip was done. I also left a ring by the pool and went back but the pool was closed. I went to the front desk for help but was told to wait till morning. We ended up hopping the pool fence to retrieve my ring. In the end all worked out it just wasn't 5 star service. Overall it was a great place to stay and a great trip.

The Hyatt Regency was a fabulous place to have a conference.  Facilities were excellent.  Food excellent. Grounds and ambiance outstanding. Although it was a business trip the atmosphere promotes relaxation and vacationing.  Close to Balboa Island which has lots of activities. great restaurants. nearby.  staff extremely helpful and courteous..

Summary Heading: This is a nice getaway place
Summary: This is a nice getaway place with a lot of entertainment and eating options nearby.  It is clean and there are no musty odors anywhere.  They are dog friendly which is a big plus.  We live only  100 miles away and use this place for quick retreats from daily life.

The room we had was located on the back side on the resort.  It felt we were far away from everyone and everything.  However, with the morning and evening sunsets over the water made it worth the extra steps.

Summary Heading: My stay at the Hyatt Newport Beach
Summary: The Hyatt in Newport Beach is beautiful and scenic. Staff was so welcoming and really cared about me as a guest. Lots of things to do---shop, bike ride, beach sitting, and great restaurants. Also make a trip to Balboa Island from the Hyatt--about a 15 minute walk.

Summary Heading: A very nice hotel with good service, but a bit pricey considering the ocean wasn't that close to the hotel.
Summary: The room was lovely but getting to it a bit awkward.  To get to the bay rooms, you have to walk through a lounge and down a flight of exterior stairs.  It's not horrible but the lounge was crowded and despite what I heard, I was pretty sure I wasn't going the right way so I turned around somewhat puzzled.  Thankfully the lounge staff saw my confusion and assured me I was headed the right way (kudos to them for seeing a puzzled traveler and jumping right in).  The room was wonderful, very modern and spacious and despite being right in the flight path of SNA, due to their flight schedule stopping at 11:00 pm and starting at 7:00 am, I had a couple of good nights' sleep during this business trip. It's a little out of the way but I had back to back seminars/meetings in Newport, one

Summary Heading: not as good as the Monterey branch.
Summary: We stayed here for the one night, just after we'd stayed at the Hyatt regency in Monterey, I much prefer the hotel in Monterey as it was a more relaxed environment with much more friendly and helpful staff as well as a great sports bar.

Having to wait over an hr for a shuttle from the airport wasn't a great way to start the trip. However the hotel check in was very smooth, the room was very nice, and almost everyone I came in contact with at the hotel was helpful and wonderful.

Summary Heading: Pricey for Basic Room and Service
Summary: nothing special to be honest, just a costly hotel in Orange County, CA. Lobby bar is small and cramped.  There is no coffee at the lobby, so i ordered a coffee at the bar and paid $5 plus $2 tip. Coffee wasn't very good.  There are a lot of pools  but its rather sad because California is in a state of emergency drought.

Had my first stay at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach after having tried several others in the area. While the rooms have been recently renovated, the buildings themselves are downtrodden, dated, and in need of a lot of maintenance (scuffs, scratches, nicks, dents pretty much throughout). The service was fine: not great, not lousy. The restaurant is extremely overpriced for what it is.  Most annoying is the mandatory "resort fee" which is just a scam to make the room rate look cheaper than it really is. You don't get anything for it that another hotel would build into the basic room rate.  The Hyatt is better than the Fairmont up the road.  The Island Hotel is much better than both of them.

I was here for two weeks and really enjoyed my stay. It's a very nice hotel, and every staff member I met was very kind and helpful. For example the guys at the Shore restaurant heard me cough and brought me hot water with lemon and honey.  Multiple pools and hot tubs which is nice too. Would recommend for a friend. Thank you!

After a nice shuttle ride, the front desk was waiting for us when we arrived to check in.  We got a nice room on the ground floor with a beautiful view and nice area to sit outside.  If the weather had cooperated we could have enjoyed more time outside.  The breakfast buffet was amazing and the restaurant had a great selection.  I would highly recommend this place, unless you are handicapped, there are a lot of stairs to go to different parts of the property.

The toilet was dirty upon my arrival which is always a very big turn off.  The resort fee was pretty high at $23 that should have included internet for up to 6 devices.  The internet didn't work in the room on any devices.

This was a great place to stay with very nice rooms, clean and large.  The food was amazing and it had all of the services I needed.  Very quiet and it was easy to relax at the hotel.  Parking was wonderful and the pool was nice.

it is a garden type of hotel versus a tall building. beautifull sourandings , many activities to do; near the beach and laguna. Close to high end shops and mall. lots of restuarants around. we stayed only one night on the first floor . It was a bit noisy because it was close to the parking lot.

Entire resort is not ADA friendly, food is outrageously expensive, staff wasn't helpful.   Rooms are the size of a closet and don't have real doors on the bathrooms.  Not a fan, glad I didn't have my kids with me.  Too small of rooms, weird bathrooms.

This is a great hotel and a wonderful place to bring a family, the resort fee is a extremely reasonable, $25 payday, and that's for the room. The bar is excellent, and the hotel overall is extremely well appointed. We'll be back for sure.

The grounds had a relaxed campus feel with high quality rooms in a great location.  The staff was helpful and available day and night.  From the business perspective, the check-in and the online check-out process was seamless with an accurate itemized bill emailed immediately upon completion.  I was attending a conference and the food was first class in every way.

First things first... some of the buildings are older. As such, there's a motel or 70's feel to them, with outdoor walkways and little soundproofing. There are newer buildlings, and they are actively renovating and remodeling, so be weary of construction.  But they do what they can. The staff have been great. Rooms are comfortable enough. Shor Restaurant has great food, though a little high-priced for what you get. Diamonds, you get your breakfasts at Shor, which is a great amenity (any entree + beverage).

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Newport Beach, CA
Summary: The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach offers a quaint, select and uplifting ambience.  The amenities and location of this property are ideal for business and leisure travel.  Located just around the corner from Pacific Coast Highway and Fashion Island Mall makes this a great place to stay.

We stayed at the Hyatt Regency for 2 weeks.  Our room was very comfortable with a great view from the balcony. Because we were there that length of time, we needed a few extra items in our room...microwave, magnifying mirror and robes.  These three items were only a fraction of what amenities were available for our use if needed.  This is a pet friendly property.  Our two small dogs had a great vacation, also. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and genuinely hospitable.  The grounds are nicely manicured and lead to the back bay where bicycles available for use can take you on a delightful ride ( or great walks).  The bar area is welcoming and surprisingly versatile...turns into a 'Starbucks' in the morning!  The restaurant offers many different dishes for all tastes. The

We have stayed at several Hyatt's and have NEVER encountered one in such bad shape!  The upholstery in the lobby was stained and couches overused. The paint was chipped off most walls and inside the elevators and the carpets were dirty everywhere Our room was in OK shape but we were really surprised with the lack of upkeep and won't return to this Hyatt.  It did not feel like a Hyatt at all but it did feel like a run-down motel!

The Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach is a "real" resort a mile from the quaint beach town of Balboa Island within Newport Beach. The resort has all the amenities of a high end beach resort except the ocean view. You must have a car to get anywhere - lucky for you there is a car rental office on property!  The rooms are pretty standard hotel rooms. Some are definitely better than others - view wise. All of the buildings are adjacent to a swimming pool and hot tub. If you are traveling with small children (during warmer months) I would recommend the backside of the hotel adjacent to the main pool - with the splash pad, water slide and larger pool. I don't think these pools/features are heated - or were not nearly as warm as the other two pools. If it is during cooler months ask for

Nicely remodeled hotel lobby area.  Hotel located in a very nice area. Unfortunate and inexplicable lapse in cleaning my room by half past three in the afternoon on the second day. Never got an explanation for that.  An old mini refrigerator in sad shape.

This Hyatt Regency has an excellent location in Newport Beach -- a nice neighborhood near Fashion Island.  The hotel is casual, friendly and reasonably priced.  It has a Hertz office on the premises and also a free shuttle to John Wayne Airport -- 10 minutes away.  The décor is a little quirky... but so are we.

Good value for money spent. Clean room and friendly staff. Close to Newport and Laguna Beaches, awesome restaurants and shopping areas! Would recommend this hotel to friends and family for sure. Would come back!

Convenient location. Rooms very nice--recently redone, but, overall hotel is somewhat dated....small lobby; old design... Still, a great stay at a very good price.  Amenities very nice...restaurant not so nice.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Resort but Could Use a Face Lift
Summary: We stayed for 5 nights over New Years from 2015-2016.  The staff were all very friendly.  The first night, we had problem with the TV and had issues throughout.  The staff we spoke to (we don't think they were the managers) gave us comp movie and other things just to apologize.  We were impressed that the staff had the autonomy to decide on things to keep customers happy.  The pool area was huge and very well kept up.  The place was clean but you can tell it's an old hotel  We stayed through the New Year's Eve and the weekend after with both weekend nights booked with several weddings.  The place was fairly quiet and we were not bothered by the extra events happening within the hotel.  The Lobby area was clean, looked new and comfortable with lots of chairs to lounge in.  The

This is the 3rd. tme we have stayed at this hotel. Perfect location near Balboa, the beaches, the coast, Fashion Island, and golf. While the hotel itself is feeling a little bit dated, it is a great valuse for your money. The staff is wonderful

Place has amazing property with pretty neat pools/hot tubs. Rooms were quite dated: old fridge, carpet from 1980's. Shuttle to Balboa island very unreliable and will miss critical pickups for hotel guests dependent upon shuttle to avoid walking 3-4 miles at night. Daily resort fees of $25 per day gets expensive if you don't golf!! Wifi failed to work as promised and the bar/lounge so affordable to any hotel guest. Recommend buying groceries at local Pavillions grocery story to save $$. Overall, a decent hotel compared to options available in very expensive town.

My favorite place to stay in Newport Beach. Beautiful grounds, excellent amenities, superb service and caring employees. The hotel is designed with lush landscaping, several pools so most rooms have great views, and soft, tropical music by the pools, which are surrounded by palms. All makes for a very relaxing stay.

Bought a Groupon for 3 nights at this 'hotel' which looks like a motel from the 50's, several 2 story buildings in addition to main building. Rooms have apparently been updated, the large bathroom is great, however...door had no weatherstripping so cold air poured in and we had to stack pillows to keep it out because fan on heater made so much noise it couldn't be used at night.  My bed had huge dip in it, very uncomfortable. Clerk at checkout had sour attitude and although he did comp some charges, his perfunctory 'sorry 'bout that' was annoying. Probably not his fault, must get a lot of complaints. Breakfast at Shor was good, love the coffee, but pricey. Although the location is great, will not stay there again..even at Groupon prices, in my opinion not a good deal.

First, understand that you will park 1/4 mile away and "down a hill" if you are staying here.  Our room was on the second floor of the Lido building and we were shocked to find that there is no elevator and our room was access outside.  So it's a glorified motel!! Parking is 25/day, you pay 20/day in resort fees that get you 2 bottles of water and lame coffee.  The bartender was the only good thing about this place.  Our walls were so thin that we had a conversation with our neighbors!  Literally.  Would never stay here again.  Our three day trip cost $800 and we got a workout just to get in and out of our car!

This hotel has a great location, and it is reasonable priced with a fair amount of activities for the kids to do.  There is good shopping just down the road and lots of activities on Balboa island.  The staff are friendly and overall very helpful.

I would say that the hotel has done a nice job remodeling the rooms and our particular room was updated.     I liked the facilities and the location, having stayed here many years ago I liked the hotel grounds as well   I would recommend self parking and not using the valet simply for the principle of it

an obviously remodeled property that is sprawling and a low rise hotel.  service was very good and helpful.  room was standard but clean with nice linenns.  not on the ocean so can't compare with such properties but its got a nice clubby vibe and is close to the bay.

We upgraded to have a bay view. We found that all buildings do not have elevators. I cannot go up stairs due to a heart condition. They were very nice and refunded us our money and a complimentary breakfast. We wanted to see the bay. It was Christmas. We might as well had stayed inland. Our room was fine. It sounded like elephants were running above us until midnight. The service and people were wonderful.,It is just a very old hotel and if you do not have a view, it is nothing special.

Absolutely a fantastic experience! Not only is the hotel beautiful, the staff was amazing! Great food, friendly and helpful in all aspects, very accommodating! During our 4 day stay one night was spent at the Hilton in downtown San Diego. Oh my what a huge disappointment. We were so excited to return to the Hyatt for our last night. Definitely will be back!!!

My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency on a fun sightseeing trip. The property itself is very nice with a newly remodeled main lobby, lounge and restaurant. The property is enormous. It really depends where you stay in the property. We were in the Balboa building where there rooms are ok and slightly outdated. The walls are very thin and you can hear everything from conversations to toilets flushing in neighboring rooms. Regardless the room was comfortable with a nice bed and was very clean. The gym was very subpar for a Hyatt with a few cardio machines and limited weights. The property does have an array of pools and has nice views if you are staying on the harbor side of the property. Overall, its a good value due to reasonably priced rooms and a convenient location to all

$300 hold on my card AFTER I prepaid for the room, $35 for parking AT the Hotel, they charge for wifi, besides serving saltines still in the wrapper with the fish dip the food was waaaay over priced as well as the drinks......    Think before you book with these guys.

Please choose a different hotel. The rooms are very small with double beds rather than queens. The staff is rude. Parking is often 1/2 a mile away and is an additional $25 per day. There is a "Resort Fee" of $35. The decor is from the 80s.

Two of my friends from Germany were coming to Socal for their first stay here.   At my recommendation, they booked and prepaid a stay at this hotel for 8 days.  When they got to their room they found the bathroom had not been thoroughly cleaned - the toilet was dirty and the windows had dirt all over them.   They went back to the front desk with photos.   An apology was made and housekeeping came to the room to rectify the situation.   Over the course of their stay, my friends found many small things that did not seem fitting for a 4 star hotel.   They said nothing and tried to enjoy the facilities as much as they could.  I visited them at the pool area the last day and was appalled and disgusted at what I saw.  There were tears and stains on the chair coverings and large bird

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel But noisy Neighbors ruined the stay...
Summary: The hotel is quite nice despite a $25-$35 parking fee per day.  The neighbors above were very noisy and getting away from the noise above was impossible.  No sleep and a $500 stay do not equate.  I would stay here again but would ask for a 2nd or 3rd story room to get away from the noise above.

We loved this hotel.  The rooms were clean and comfortable.  The property was beautiful and so well-maintained. The work out facility was fantastic.  We were able to explore Balboa using the hotel's bikes.  I cannot say enough about the staff!  Everyone was so friendly and patient.  The complimentary shuttle was a huge plus!  My son forgot his toothbrush and housekeeping delivered him a complimentary one right away.  When it was raining, the hotel provided umbrellas. Overall, a great stay!

The hotel charges a resort fee of over 20.00/day.  This paid for internet; there is also a shuttle to the airport.  The hotel is nice and has been remodeled since I was there last.  The Lido rooms are away from the main buildings, which I was initially disappointed by but turned out to be a good thing; the hotel was full of convention/meeting people having noisy meeting in the public spaces.  The rooms are good, the coffee is 'disposable pod-like things in a little plastic tray', but the lobby has a decent and not over-priced coffee bar until noon.  There are no extras in the room like robes or slippers, and I was too lazy to order one.  The Lido building's walls are extremely thin.  The first night I could hear the neighbors fighting, the second night the other neighbors got to

beauftiful grounds and really fantastic food. Rooms were clean and staff was friendly. Room rates were very fair and the conference rooms we used for business were very well accomodated as well. Will definitely stay again!

Stayed here years ago and wondered if they could match the stay.  Not only was it a good stay, but far exceeded my expectations.   The attention to customer service was top notch.  Room was clean and quiet and very comfortable. The fitness center was up to date and functional.   Access to the bay trails and Balboa Island was definitely a bonus.  Highly recommend this location.

Summary Heading: Beautiful property, very festive in December.  Lots of restaurants in walking distance
Summary: Went there for a quick weekend getaway.  Big, beautiful outdoor wreath, the have a sand exhibit in the lobby area made with 2 tons of sand (pics attached).  Santa with a surfboard taking pictures with the beach in the background.  Walking distance to the pier and Main Street

This was a special trip for my husband's birthday. I would suggest this hotel and location to anyone. Matter of fact we will be coming back for sure.  The food and drinks were very good.  The room was nice and roomy.

Smelly halls.  Rooms small with two double beds pressed against wall.  Friendly front desk.  Bellman first class.  Breakfast with rip off prices.  Great location.  Balboa Island just down the street.  Close to Fashion Island.

The pillows were some of the most comfortable I have slept on.  The spa stays open til 10 or  11, that was nice.    There is a waterslide for kids.  Self parking is a bit pricey at $25.  the internet was fast and I was able to watch Netflix on my device.

I will not recommend this hotel at all. Every stuff told us different things. You need to find someone willing to help you. Otherwise, you will not get you are supposed to have. There are many better hotels. Much overpriced.

Was in town for a seminar at this hotel and was very impressed with high level of customer service provided. I stayed on the 600 floor block that faced the pool. The view was not bad but the room was a bit noisy.   The Staff's friendliness and handling of my requests was the trade off (for me). Would stay here again!

Summary Heading: The beach property is showing its age...
Summary: The Newport Hyatt Regency should be an iconic property for the Hyatt chain, but unfortunately, it's getting to be a worn out and beaten up property that's getting embarrassing. The floors are very thin, so make sure you get the top floor or you'll spend a lot of time phoning in noise complaints. The restaurants are still top notch and the pool areas are still in decent shape, but the rooms and suites are in need of help.  Beyond that, this is the only Hyatt I have ever stayed at in which the valet service blatantly ripped off my car. After an enthusiastic complaint, there was never any apology from the head of valet or the hotel.  It is disappointing that this beautiful location appears headed to being sold off due to major renovation costs....

This hotel is very classy.  The room was very nice and the king sized bed was very comfortable.  We had booked though Priceline and had a double bed, but Khristian at the front desk upgraded us and it made our day!

Nice location, good (recently renovated) guest rooms, three swimming pools and courteous, helpful staff. The area is nice, a lot of water sports possibilities and a large shopping mall is across the street.

This area is very nice, a lot to do at the hotel! The pools were amazing and the staff serving at the pool was great!   They could use new mattress in the double/double rooms they were in rough shape  but other than that it was great!

You cannot beat this location. I've stayed here many times & as always enjoyed this hotel immensely. The staff are wonderful . I love the pools! I so enjoy their breakfasts as well.  They have a great bar. All in all wonderful service

Don't bother wasting your hard earned money on this enormous rip off. The first thing you see when you walk in is a sign of a GUN with a red line through it. A no WEAPONS sign at a hotel? So, does this mean unsavory characters who carry weapons are actually bringing their pistols in???  Sure, the place is nice and clean, but there is no workability. It's a sterile, sprawling ordinary hotel with nothing special to offer yet they charge you an extra resort fee (to USE the place???) and a huge nightly parking fee. So they tack on an extra fifty bucks to your bill. And what do you get for it? Pretty much nothing. Everything in the room is the very bare minimum. ONE tea bag of Lipton, the cheapest crap..not an assortment of decent quality herbal teas. One tube of conditioner ( no

Great hotel good location if you like the Fashion Island area.  i went on business several times in the last couple months and is always a great experiance.  there is a good golf course on site and many restaurants within short drive.  very safe high end area

The worst Hyatt I have ever stayed at in 30 years of staying at Hyatt's. I agree with one of the other reviewers that the rooms felt more like a Motel 6 than a Hyatt.  Staff was not all that friendly either.  This Hotel is in a fantastic location but needs to be torn down and rebuilt.

This hotel is average with respect to its rooms but the location and layout is very peaceful and relaxing.  The design is low rise with the rooms spread out across the resort.  The grounds are beautifully landscaped with creative use of outdoor lighting.  The fitness center is well equipped and open 24 hours.  The staff are very helpful and friendly.  The hotel is located right off a busy road and easy to find but quiet.  My one complaint is that the walls of the rooms are paper thin.

The grounds and the service staff were very nice, but the internet service in the room was terrible. I had to go to the lobby for a decent signal. The room service menu could offer more options, but the service and food quality were good, despite the salt shaker being caked shut. There were insects in the room, and the wrong pillows were delivered when we called to ask for foam instead of feathers. There is a nightly service charge, which is fine, but the cost for self parking is outrageous. Add $48 to your nightly bill every night for those two things.

Excellent place to stay, awesome food, friendly staff. Enjoyed my stay there. I would definitely like to visit there one more time. One of the best part was the golf course had a lot of fun there. Overall great experience.

Summary Heading: Nice quiet resort we stayed with a conference
Summary: We come to a conference every year as speakers and this is the second year in a row it was located at this property. The staff is very friendly and the resort is nice and quiet. It has a few pool options which is nice and we were upgraded based on my diamond status. I would be happy if the conference was located here again next year.

Stayed for leisure trip. The staff were awesome. The rooms are more like a motel instead of hotel. Paper thin walls. Paid extra for a "bay view" that mostly included a parking lot with a bit of water and some boats visible between trees. Much better places in this area. Overpriced for a motel with upgraded fixtures.

Summary Heading: Return visit to a well run hotel
Summary: I arrived late due to traffic from LAX on the 405, no problem, gave me an upgrade, the valet staff for the car did everything  I could have asked for    My room for a single person was great (could have done with more coffee pods for machine)  I took breakfast in the proper room not the fast counter..no complaints service good   I might have had to have a few more nights due to a family problem   the Reception staff could not have done more to help...I felt the staff where better than on my last trip

I frequent the Hyatt Regency in Huntington Beach, but I figured I would give this location a try. It was terrible, but it wasn't that great either.   The front desk staff was by far the rudest I have ever experience at a Hyatt. They told me there was a mandatory $75 deposit for "incidentals." I work at the front desk as a resort so I am familiar with incidentals, but I also know I have never been told it is a mandatory fee when I have stayed at a Hyatt. When I brought this up, the agent tried to fight with me and say it is a mandatory fee and "any Hyatt he has worked at has required it and he didn't know where I was staying at that they didn't require it." But when I asked for a manager he was magically able to check me in with no incidentals deposit.   The rooms were just

The location was close to Fashion Island Shopping and minutes to the Newport Beach Pier and Beach. My grandkids loved the pool with the slide! We had a level one room that was noisy overhead and outside. The room was clean and the grounds were lovely. The self parking lot was quite the hike to the room.

We were disappointed in this hotel.  We have stayed at other Hyatt Regency hotels and have been blown away with the  luxurious and resort like feel of the hotels. The lounge are felt more like it was a Hyatt Place.  The bathrooms are very small. Not the romantic get away we were hoping for.

My husband and I enjoyed 3 days/nights at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach and loved every minute of it, so much that we did not want to leave!  The staff was so nice, friendly and efficient, from check-in to valet to restaurant servers to maids.  The bed was VERY comfortable!  The Shor Restaurant was very accommodating to my gluten free dietary needs.  Location is excellent!  We had a family wedding to attend at Newport Dunes, only 10 minutes walking distance.  Visited Newport Pier and Crystal Cove and enjoyed both immensely.  Can hardly wait to return!

Summary Heading: Lovely resort with lots to do
Summary: This resort is absolutely lovely, with three different pools and lots to do, including a putting green and bicycle rentals included in the resort fee. It's only a few blocks from the water, so you can easily get pretty much anywhere in the Newport Beach area. And the staff was so helpful and nice, even though they were swamped with a conference starting.

Summary Heading: Lots of swimming, good overall ambiance
Summary: A hotel that deserves its 4-stars. It has a great location, the rooms are clean and the service is quite nice. I was there for a conference and did not get to explore the hotel property much.  It's a very nice value and I would recommend this to anyone in town for a weekend.  I simply love Newport city! It's one of my favorite places to hang out in Orange County.

Summary Heading: A Great place to stay in a Great City
Summary: The hotel's reception is very clean and elegant looking. The room is spacious and the beds comfortable enough to want to stay there more. The food has unusual flavors but is good as any. The pool and property is very fancy,and even has some neat events areas.

Don't believe any of the negative reviews.  I have been staying here for over 10 years - back before it was a Hyatt when it was the Newporter.  This is a real California style hotel.  Nothing like it in Newport.  I'm an expense account traveler and can stay anywhere in Newport - and I won't stay anywhere else but this hotel.  Great service, great location on the Back Bay, incredible property - great amenities.     Food is good and Todd at the bar is a welcoming personality for business and pleasure travelers alike.  You are crazy for staying anywhere else.

The Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach is just an amazing place to stay. The layout is wonderful, all staff members are extra courteous and valet service was perfect. The decor is beautiful and the lawn where they hold their Summer Jazz Festival is just absolutely gorgeous. I hope to get married there someday soon. Room Service was impeccable and the food there is delicious. I can't recommend this venue more. It's within a close distance of everything you'd want to go in the area and the experience is unforgettable. I simply cannot wait to return.

Summary Heading: If Tenting or fumigating your home....
Summary: If you fumigate/ tent your home in the area stay at the Hyatt. We live just a mile away from this Newport Beach location and needed an area close to home that allowed pets.  The reservation manager Morgan Williams was most helpful in providing a room that was most accommodating to clients with pets.

Summary Heading: Glorified Motel in a Great Location
Summary: I came here for a much-needed night away with my husband. The grounds are nice and parking (albeit expensive), was easy. We unfortunately had to change rooms 3 times because the first was right next to a main elevator/stairwell with two large weddings happening the same night and we didn't want to hear guests going up and down stairs all night. The second room was in the 'Lido' building which is literally a glorified motel (2 stories, wrought-iron railing, non-descript pool), AGAIN near a staircase with some large family literally standing outside our door laughing and have a loud conversation. A hotel's guests actions aren't the hotel's fault, but still, we were looking for relaxation, not a frat house. The third room again in the main building but further away from the

This is not about the beauty of the grounds, nor the closeness of the property to Fashion Island, which are all pluses.  This is about what I have come to expect from my many stays at various Hyatts all over the world. I have been a Platinum member of Hyatt for several years, and stayed at this hotel to keep up my platinum level status, and complete some business in the area. This was by far the worst Hyatt that I have ever stayed at. The valet prices at $34 per night are higher than any other Hyatt in the area such as the Hyatt in Garden Grove which is $24/night.  They have a very high priced Valet company working for them here.  The pillows were flat and put my neck out. (I had to go to my chiropractor the following day) and Reception was not friendly nor helpful. There were

First of all, let me say I now know why it got a lower customer rating than the Marriott Newport Beach.  While the grounds are nice and the location is good, the rooms are dated, but large.  Maybe it is the AAA rate that got us a room in a poor location with a view to large pipes and fans as well as a constant humming noise that required ear plugs to tune out.  All in all it's just average as Hyatt properties go and I would pick the Marriott next time. Staff was very friendly and helpful; everything was clean and the gardens are very nice for a stroll. However, the free shuttle to Fashion Island and the airport is a definite bonus.

The hotel is in close proximity to Fashion Island and the beach, however the hotel itself isnt that impressive. The pools were mediocre and the food was the same. I will say I always enjoy staying at Hyatts nationwide, so even though this place was "okay" I would still go back.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Grounds and a great location
Summary: We frequently stay at this property to visit family that live close by.  The hotel is very close to Fashion Island as well as Balboa Island.  Freeways are easily accessible.  The Newport Bay Ecological Reserve is a short walk from the hotel and is idea for walking or jogging or take a bicycle and ride.   We find the staff to be courteous and friendly.  This is a hotel we are comfortable recommending.

Our experience at the Hyatt, Newport Beach proved to have wonderful settings, great accommodations, fantastic service, attentive staff, lovely grounds, great food... shuttle to Fashion Island and Balboa Island, and even a nice gift shop. A1 and 4 star in my experience

I couldn't of been happier with our say. We attended a wedding for a friend of mine at the hotel. Staff was fantastic, great food and beverages and an awesome atmosphere made the entire stay worth it. The shuttle pick up for the air port and activities around the area were great and the free bike rentals were a huge plus.

Summary Heading: Beautiful grounds, serene setting, older rooms.
Summary: Contrary to some opinions, this property is far superior to Motel 6's and Super 8's.  And as a Hyatt property, it should be. Most complaints center around the older rooms, and the fact that some refreshing is probably in order (particularly the updating of its older, noisier, wall heating and a/c system) keeps this property from being a 5-star property, like the nearby Hyatt Huntington Beach property.  Having stayed in suites in both properties, I can certainly said that the Huntington Beach property is superior -- but it also usually costs more too.  Still, this property has significant charms, such as the beautiful, serene grounds, and the relaxing pools.  The rooms themselves, while not modern, are fairly roomy and do have the Hyatt beds with the high-thread count sheets and

Summary Heading: Hotel cafe closed by county health department?
Summary: I'm here for some business meetings, and found these notices on affixed at the pool cafe / restaurant.  Hmmm....    The premises otherwise seemed nice and clean.  Self parking is a bit overpriced however.    Had dinner there as well and the food was good, notwithstanding the closed pool cafe.  But I asked for chocolate syrup to go with the ice cream they served and they couldn't find any.  Who serves vanilla ice cream without chocolate to back it up?  Just saying...

Very large resort with numerous areas that have their own pool. Very long walk from the parking lot, up a hill to the rooms. The staff was helpful, restaurant below average. There is a hotel shuttle to take you to the shopping mall and Balboa island. However you have to wait , if there is a run to the airport inbetween. You don't go to Balboa island, but to a random shopping mall parking lot up the street.Very high resort and parking fees. Needed to meet family and this was conveniently located. Probably would not stay again.

Rooms were delightful and spacious. Bed was very comfortable and closet space was appreciated.   We were both impressed with the layout of the hotel grounds.  Well executed, well tended (tropical) and it made it seem more like a "resort" than it actually was.  Great set up for conference rooms.  Also saw a wedding set up get started as a testament to the beauty of the hotel.  We enjoyed the pools and fitness rooms and appreciated that we were not charged extra for the gym.  Staff was exceedingly friendly at every turn.  Great location, within walking distance of an estuary with great bird watching for nature lovers.  Also for shoppers, close proximity to large upscale mall.  We will stay again next time we are in Newport.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable and close to water
Summary: We stayed here on a business trip. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the lobby bar a few times and received great service. There were lots of amenities that we did not have time to enjoy including a small golf course, multiple pools, and its adjacent to the back bay and a short drive to shopping.    Good stay - would consider for family vacation.

Our recent stay in Newport Beach was great. The Staff were very friendly and efficient. Hyatt Hotels have THE MOST comfortable beds.  Would definitely stay here again.  Clean rooms, excellent service.  Kudos Hyatt Newport Beach.

Nice rooms, great service!! a great place for a conference....Meeting rooms, and catering right there so no mess, no fuss the conference was a big hit, and the location was part of it. Easy for the speakers to get in and get out. things for the family to do while you are in your meetings.....

This is an older property...reminded me of the Madmen era in ways, so not as luxurious as some Hyatt properties.  The location is pretty good.  Not on the beach, but probably a 10 minute drive and close to shopping and restaurants at Fashion Island, Balboa Island, and up & down Pacific Coast Hwy.  Our room was absolutely huge, but kind of sparse in décor.  I think it was one that hadn't been redone yet.  Lovely and sprawling property with several pools and lush foliage.  I liked the surfer vibe of the lobby and small restaurant area where you can get coffee, smoothies, and snacks.  Service was very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great time at Hyatt in Newport Beach!
Summary: Really nice hotel, 3 outdoor pools to pick from, free shuttles to Fashion Island and Balboa Island, free 2 hour bike rentals.  Friendly staff, overall great time, stayed for 5 days and 4 nights. Will go back!

But for a place to stay for a day or two, there are better locations in my opinion.    It was a nice hotel, the grounds are beautiful and the rooms well appointed although ours was quite small.  The location was peaceful and quiet, but that was it.  The location of the hotel was just ok, not near anything but not too far away either.  The staff was accommodating and helpful but overall I cannot see the value in this place.  As I said in the title, if you are attending a small meeting or retreat it is probably an excellent location (a great place for a small wedding), but as a place for a couple or family to stay for a few days there are better options out there.

Nice hotel, pricy ,food on site.  Comfortable beds, could use updating in parts of the hotel, where I stayed, actually.   Looked a bit like a motel.   Grounds are lovely and well kept.  Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating.

Summary Heading: Pretty grounds way overpriced and not on the ocean.
Summary: I spent 4 nights at this property for a fitness retreat.  To be clear this was a great property for that kind of event.  They have lots of space outside and had nice areas for the nightly parties.  The hotel itself is nothing fancy.  Apparently you just pay an obnoxious amount to stay there because it puts you in Newport Beach.  Details: Let me start with the good.  The grounds are pretty and lush and the pools are very nice.  The food was also above average for a hotel.  My room had a great location in the main building and my patio led right out to one of the pools.  The main areas are kept clean and the front desk staff was great.  The not so good: the smaller pools were closed almost all the time for private events.  The hotel bar is small and VERY overpriced.  I travel a

Cannot fault this hotel one bit.  Rooms lovely. Pools are lovely. Food was lovely.   We stayed with Virgin, only thing that let it down was the parking and resort fee. Its quite high, but if you book with virgin then you don't have to pay the resort fee of $25 a day. We had to pay parking but we knew this.   Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. bathrooms are huge! No bath, just a shower but cant have it all! Pools are lovely. Favourite pool was the quite pool with the seating and cocoon bed. Hired a cabana for a day also. Well worth the money. You get fruit, cold water and towels and its topped up throughout the day.   We stayed 2 weeks, and this was our base for travelling LA.   Breakfast was absolutely lovely. Choice of cereals and toasted items every day. Muffins peanut

The room was not clean at all and I fould fleas in my room. No manager took care of the situation and contacted me back. After requesting I´ve got a room move. While doing check out the front desk assistant was not aware about the fleas problem. There is a big lack of communication at this hotel!

If any of the following applies to you then you will probably be very satisfied with the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach: i. You have literally never stayed in a hotel before and are content to marvel at the fact that you don't have to make your own bed in the morning. ii. You are on expenses and just want a bar to get drunk in and somewhere to sleep. iii. You are a massive fan of popcorn ceilings (extra bonus: the ceilings are so low you will be able to stroke that lovely popcorn without even having to stand on your tiptoes). iv. You are the kind of selfish cretin that enjoys wandering through hotel corridors at 12:30 am yelling your head off; you'll fit right in.  For everyone else, you may find yourself a little disappointed at paying the extortionate rates this establishment

This motel, yes, motel, charges for its location. There is absolutely nothing luxurious about it. It is outdated and in dire need for a face lift (this is Orange County, so they should be perfectly used to it :)).  We reserved a room with guaranteed balcony and a king bed. At the check in, we were informed that we were "upgraded" to a king bed with balcony!?!?! The balcony overlooked a dilapidated roof and all a small, open utilities area. Not something you want to look at while hanging out in the balcony. The room smelled damp. The bed was comfortable though. This was the only positive thing about this place. The hallways have really low ceilings and a greenish sort of light; it feels claustrophobic and shabby. We were tempted to just leave, but had tickets at a concert near by

Bed sheet and room smells. Libby smells. Very Filthy vent on AC in room. My face got about 10 insect bites after sleeping two days on their king bed. Can't believe they charge $191 for this horrible quality. Nothing close to hyatt regency level, not even hyatt house level. Stay away!!

The rooms were so noisy from the hallway traffic, above room stomping of people, the next room conversation so loud they sounded in the room, slamming of the closet in above room, the TV was not loud enough to combat the air conditioning.  There is too much to add.  Disappointed beyond belief.

Summary Heading: Overpriced, rude securuty guard, and mediocre rooms
Summary: This place was kinda ridiculous for the price.  The shuttle: comes every hour to the airport because they only have one shuttle...why?  They can afford another shuttle, why do they only have one? The room: The room was run down and had quick renovations to make it seem nicer. The mini fridge was old and rusty on the inside.  The mattress was old and ripped.  The shower was not lit (so it was dark). I mean, this place is charging 5 times what it should be for a room.  Rooms at this place are worth at most $100/night for the area.   Food: For such a fancy place, why is there no free continental breakfast.  The restaurant has $14 breakfast burritos if you really get hungry though (which is way overpriced).  There is not even free coffee in the lobby.  A Days Inn would be better and

I love this hotel.   This is our 2nd conference that we've attended here.  The staff is always helpful and friendly.   I had a couple of issues with the cleanliness of the room but it was taken care of right away.   I would stay here as a get away anytime.

Overall great stay staff was courteous, except the front desk. Maybe it was my luck I was greeted with by receptionist with a bad attitude. Not very stroller friendly if you have children. Overall great location and lots to do.

the overall hotel is very nice and the staff seem to be caring.  I did however find that the lounge had difficulty dealing with the amount of business on Friday and Saturday evening.  The service was slow and frankly the drinks for many of us  seemed "watered" down.  I assume that this was an honest mistake and the one time I pointed it out my drink was promptly remade.

I stayed with a group of 600 for a business conference. The rooms were clean, staff was extremely helpful, shuttle service prompt. The pools were great. The grounds have beautiful palm trees and flowers very well kept.

Summary Heading: Nice but small things detracted from our stay
Summary: I stayed here with my wife for a weekend.  We reserved a standard room.  The hotel location and atmosphere are really good.  There are a couple pools, one with lots of kids and one a little more serene.  The bar is nice and open.  I would come back again.  The only thing I would be careful of is the room selection.  My room was on the second floor overlooking the main pool.  I apologize but I cannot remember the room number as that would have been helpful.  For the rooms in these wings around the mian pool, all the foot traffic from the main entrance goes through the bar/restaurant area, down one of two joined outside stair cases, through a foyer, and then either left or right on an outside walk.  My room was right on the corner near the foyer.  This meant everybody walked by

Summary Heading: Good enough to return every year
Summary: We came for business and pleasure at about the same time twelve months ago.  Sevice is good, the rooms comfortable and the facilities fine.  The bar is pleasant and the martinis pretty good.  Food in the restaurant ia pleasant and helpings enormous if you like that kind of thing.  It is a good location for a long weekend for couples or families with young children and not bad for business.  Rooms in the main building with balconies overlooking the ocean are best.

Great property and value.  We stayed as part of a wedding party.  The front desk was very accommodating and immediately placed our rooms near each other. The resort has 3 different pools that were all clean and comfortable to lay out at. The resort is 1/3 mile to PCH.  The drive to Newport Beach was about 10 minutes. Uber to laguna Beach was $10-$15.

I've stayed here a few times now and have enjoyed it both with and without family.  For family trips, the huge outdoor chess game and pool with water slide are a big hit with the kids.  For us, it is close to shopping and restaurants, but it is nice to just hang around the pool.  For work, there are many lovely outdoor and indoor settings for meetings-or for just sitting and talking.  Staff is friendly, rooms are comfortable, although be prepared to walk around the property a bit as the lay out includes many steps to get around.  All of the food we had on this last work trip was fabulous, too.

Summary Heading: great service, friendly staff, wonderful environment
Summary: We arrived from the East Coast tired and grumpy after a long day's flight to find this little oasis in Newport Beach. So, nice room, friendly people, but heh there's a little chip and putt 9 hole golf course; free clubs and balls and we're off and chipping and putting our way into a very good mood!  The concierge gets us reservations at Reddo. One of the very best meals I've had all year. The next morning we are befriended by Barbara a staff member at the hotel who takes it upon herself to make sure we are having a great time. She even sends us a bottle of wine and snacks so we can sit on our balcony and hear the concert playing on the grounds below us. Every morning she checks in with us at breakfast and we always have a nice chat. So lovely, genuinely gracious. There is a

Staff was very outgoing and friendly.  My wife and I both felt the bed was uncomfortable and we got a poor nights sleep both nights as a result.  Room noise from hall and room above was loud, mainly in early mornings.  Room service food was great, but not worth the cost.  Valet parking is $37 a night!!!  Self parking is $25 a night and a long walk.  Pools are nice, and there is free golf.

We flew in to LA from Sydney and arrived here around 9am. What a great hotel, friendly staff, love the cafe which has fresh healthy food during the day and becomes a bar at night.   Great for kids. Three pools, midsize waterslide, mini water play area.  Beds were extremely comfortable too   N

Summary Heading: Awful experience, overcharged !!! Avoid this hotel
Summary: I went there with my girlfriend for her birthday on Saturday 10th October. Even though she made a reservation beforehand for a Bayside view for King room, when we got there they gave us double room. We had a very bad experience throughout night as there were a lot of mosquitos in the room that they ate us all night long and didn't make us fell asleep. On top of that, room cleaners started knocking our door 9 in the morning, came back at 10 am, 10, and10 30 again. The maids were very loud to get into the other rooms that woke us up. In addition, they charged us 425 dollars for one night when we checked out. It was overpriced as I checked the prices for the same room for another Saturday night. It was 269 dollars. We are unsatisfied and mad about this hotel. Definitely avoid

Summary Heading: How did they get to be a Hyatt?
Summary: I selected this hotel for a post-anaheim convention relation stay of 2 nights.  I honestly don't know where to start on this review except to say one good thing and that is the front desk person that checked me in was very accommodating in letting me have a room early in order to make a conference call.  I believe based upon the room descriptions it was an upgrade from my booked room, but thats where things go south.  The overall resort looks like a motel. all rooms are located in several buildings of 2 stories each.  The room I was given overlooked one of the pools.  it was adjoined on 2 sides by other connecting rooms and the noise from each side was evident by the sound of the maid vacuuming.  Add to that the neither the door nor window to outside sealed properly it was just

We had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful hotel Sunday 10/04 & Monday 10/05.   This was the  final hotel on our 10 night 5 hotel visit to the beautiful state of California, and it was a great way to end our trip.  From the moment we drove up and were greeted by the very helpful hotel staff we knew we had chosen a great place.  Our room was in the main building, third floor room 329 which is right opposite the concert venue below.  The view was magnificent....the arbor below had gorgeous purple climbing flowers covering it so when we looked down that's what we saw.  Just behind that was the bay where we saw an amazing sunset our second night.  The sliding glass door pushes right into the wall so it opens up the room completely to the balcony.   The room was very modern and

Our room was very nice and clean.  We overlooked the golf course.  The grounds at the hotel are beautiful.  They have 2 pools, each with a hot tub.  It was quiet and very comfortable.  Food was all very good.  A great location for a conference or business meeting.
