Stayed here for 1 night out of 3 that we booked. Room was dark ground floor. All rooms open out into public walk past area so not  standard hotel setting. Did not feel comfortable. Staff friendly rooms clean but the hotel just not to the standard of the usual Hyatt name

Stayed here for a few days on a biz trip.  I even upgraded my room to a bay view.  While I kind-of sort-of could see the bay, the value was rather meaningless.  The room said seemed like 1975 to me.  I had a 1 1/2 inch gap under the door.  Fortunately I wasn't on a ground floor or I would have moved.  TV kept losing signal, so I figured it was overcast.  When I looked outside, it was clear as a bell.  Wireless internet would never let me log in.  Event catered food was "so so".  I never had a piece of beef that tough.   Sorry to say, but I really wouldn't stay here, certainly not for the price, which was supposed to be somewhat of a "discount".  But I've become picky as I get older.  Swimming pool was great.  Hot tub great.  Staff was great.  Just like an good but dated

very nice stay.....nice clean rooms, nice pools, golf course was fun. just be prepared to pay for parking and resort fees which comes to $50/day.  Can really add up. unless you eat at the resort, you will have to take shuttle to restaurants or drive.

This hotel reminds me of times back in the 70's with the shuffleboard, the large chess set, and the three pools, and all the walkways. The staff is very friendly and the grounds are very well kept with numerous gardens.

Summary Heading: Would stay here again if visiting Newport Beach
Summary: Nice property with beautiful landscaping and 3 pools as well as 3 separate buildings on several acres.  A little dated, but clean with very pleasant staff.  My daughter and I stayed there for a wedding and really enjoyed the tranquil surroundings and the pool and spa.  Because the property is large, you have to walk quite a distance to get to your car, however that was because we chose self-parking and valet parking is available.  There is also a bar/lounge on site and a good room service menu.

Summary Heading: Good hotel and resort, needs some facelift
Summary: A reliably good chain has a reliably good real estate in Newport Beach. Nothing less, but nothing more either  Pros:  - comfortable room, everything is in its place - very nice service, everyone is smiling - cool pool areas - grat seafood restaurant, awesome tuna steak for example  Cons: - the motel design of the building is somewhat tired and would benefit from a renovation - takes ages to get a taxi   Overall, good quality at high but in line prices, not very exciting though

Summary Heading: Great hotel and very friendly staff
Summary: We have been delighted by our choice of hotel. We have stayed here for a few days before a cruise and have been very impressed and totally satisfied with the Hyatt Regency at Newport Beach..  Apart from being exactly what we wanted in terms of lovely gardens and the facilities such as many pools, golf course, tennis club, etc it is the friendliness of the staff that makes it stand out.  Although a large hotel it is very personal. Morgan, who checked us in was cheerful, helpful and friendly when we arrived tired from travelling.  Sam, the manager of the restaurant and bar was also so friendly and helpful and we we're so well served by his staff, Jose and Cecily, when eating in the restaurant and bar. We could not have been more satisfied at the service we received nor the hotel

It was OK ... but not great.  Location wonderful, but service  less than expected.  Rooms were just ok .  Food was good, but again, service slow. the hotel seemed to be understaffed.  I doubt if I would go back

Lovely place, wonderful service from the service people. Room close too pool, and was a nice room. Only downside was the concert that was held there one of the nights we stayed, was loud and we werent too interested in hearing the noise after a busy day...please be mindful of other guests.Also there wasnt alot to do around the area, utilize the shuttle to where you can go, but would suggest you hire a car to see what you want to see.

Summary Heading: Lovely property, nice people, BEWARE bogus room charges!
Summary: Checked in here for 3 days.  Used Southwest Airlines to book hotel. Was given the handicapped guest room although I am not handicapped and did not request a handicapped room.  Through SWA my room was paid in full in advance and the fee I was billed was comprehensive and was supposed to cover my stay.  At checkout I requested my bill and discovered that the hotel had added $23/per day for a so called "Resort Charge" that was not included in my comprehensive already paid package.  When I questioned the charge I was told it was a standard resort fee that everyone has to pay.  I said I was paid in full when I checked in but the clerk said all rooms have to pay it for "hotel amenities".  Told the clerk that I did not use any amenities at the hotel as I was in conference all three

Summary Heading: Location allows a 3 Star to charge 5 star
Summary: I have known this place for many years.  Really disappointed.  While rooms are large, very dated, popcorn ceilings, only one chair, minimum support products in the BR.  Common areas nice, no view, and the outside staff had the hand out prior to actually doing any service.  Front desk staff and coffee shop staff very nice, but overall, there are several other places in the Newport area that would offer a better experience.  Guess they survive on the events they host.

I  recently stayed at this hotel for a fitness retreat and there were 400 of us girls and the staff was always kind, respectful, and gracious to us. The hotel offers free bikes for 2 hrs to ride around the area, nearby bay, or bike trail, which I thought was awesome! Fashion Island (mall) and Balboa Island are only about 1 mile walking distance from the hotel and the beach is an easy, close cab ride. The rooms are pretty nice, the lobby is modern and updated, the courtyard and golf course is beautiful, and the pools are pretty too. I don't think there's a bad view from any of the rooms! I highly recommend having the bellmen take care of your luggage. Some parts of the property have a lot of stairs and no elevators, so taking your luggage to/from your room is a big task if you

I stayed at this hotel as a part of a recent conference and I was very pleased with everything about this property.  The layout of the hotel was spread out but also very cozy due to all the unique "zones"! Multiple pools, cozy "library", amphitheater, shuffleboard, giant chess board... you get the idea. It definitely felt like a destination resort rather than just another hotel.  Room service and staff were prompt and friendly, and we enjoyed the bar and coffee area in the lounge.  Our room was actually located in the Villas which were especially excellent. Could host a large family if you had a whole villa...and each villa has it's own pool and outdoor area of you have the bottom unit!  This hotel is close to the back Bay Area with stand up paddleboarding and the marina if you

2nd time at this property, even better this time. Nice hotel with great selection of different pool areas. Restaurant could be better. Lobby Lounge is perfect through out the day breakfast, quick meal or a drink in the bar.  Would go here again.

This location is beautiful but not only is the property in a great place. The staff is so accommodating but they have seriously the best customer service. Anything we needed as a group of 400 and they went above and beyond to make it right every chance they could. We had no issues but they were on top of everything to make sure we were all happy during our stay. I would absolutely go back 3 pools and newport dunes behind the resort 10 minutes from newport beach 5 from fashion island and a beautiful bike trail with free bikes to rent as well as a beautiful fitness center! I can't wait to go back!

The Hyatt in Newport Beach is a beautiful hotel, very tranquil and in a wonderful location.  The 3 pools were spread across the property so there is one close to each grouping of rooms. Our room had a balcony overlooking the golf course so it was very quite and private feeling.

We went for a jazz concert, stayed in Rm.204.  Due to it's proximity to the lobby bar, the elevator and the stairwell it was very noisy, you could also hear every time the person in the room above moved.  The was a constant noise from some kind of machinery that could be heard all night, and even my wife could hear it without her hearing aids.  The room overall was comfortable and very clean.  The jazz concert was awesome.  Very friendly service.  Bar scene extremely lively.  Bar food was disappointing--good cocktails, very good burger, but the fried calamari had absolutely no flavor, nor did the romanesco sauce accompanying it.  very pricey Wifi at $9.95

My husband and I travelled to the US in Set 2015 and stayed at the Hyatt Regency.  The warm was clean and comfortable.  Hotel amenities very good and the staff were so friendly, a special mention to Rob and Jose in the restaurant, they could not have done enough to help us and we were extremely grateful to both of them.

I found ants in my room on the second morning of my stay. I lodged a complaint with front desk immediately while I worked a conference all day. When I got back late in the evening, I was told the ant problem was dealt with. I got back to my room, and found at least 20 ants crawling around. They didn't hire pest control, and had obviously just used regular cleaning staff. Knowing my feedback was to change my room, this really bothered me and shows a lack of experienced staff and customer service. Upon lobbying another complaint, I was put into a different room. At the end of the day this was a failure on behalf of the hotel staff, and ultimately I won't stay at this hotel in the future. I hope pest control, or a proper cleaning company was hired to rid the ant problem for future

Exceptional service, scenery and amenities close to the property. Enjoyed the restaurant, pool and just strolling the grounds. Appreciated the complimentary (included in resort fee) shuttle service to both Fashion Island and Balboa Island~ would definitely stay again!

This is a familiar property and one that I use often.  It's close to anything you want and easy access to awesome sunsets.  The food on property is good.  Self parking is overpriced, but no big complaints.

Stayed here for a wedding this past weekend.  We decided on this hotel first because I am a Hyatt Platinum Member and have always been treated well at all of the other properties which included either a room upgrade, club access, or a complimentary amenity.  This Hyatt is definitely an older hotel and the renovations were not extensive in the rooms.  I was assigned a room above the villas which had a steep staircase and we were at the back of a very small room with no balcony and it was quite disappointing.  We contact the front desk and were told that there were no other rooms available.  I would not likely return to this property any time soon.

Summary Heading: Although I didn't get to enjoy the amenities it is a beautiful property
Summary: I was there on business but the feel of this resort is like Hawaii.  Very large.  Lots to do.  Comfortable and spacious rooms.  The rooms are a little dated but still very nice.   It is a great family resort.  Here are the add-ons:  $25 for Parking and $23 Resort fee. So factor that in when making a reservation.  The only thing that I noticed that was a major turn off for me was the air conditioning vent was filthy and needed a good cleaning and new filter.  Otherwise I can't really say anything else negative.

We stayed for 3 nights at the hotel.   First the room was quite small fora family of 4 - the hotel should not advertise the particular room we stayed in as a room for families.   Second, we found fleas on our dog on return (who stayed with us in the room).  Makes me wonder what Hyatt is doing with the $100 fee they charge for  pets. I would have thought that they treat the room for parasites etc. but that does not seem to be the case.  Third, the housekeeping and room service was very slow.  it took housekeeping over an hour and a half to get some teabags for us.  Fourth, the hotel charges all types of additional fees -- parking ($25/day), resort fee ($23/day) though there are not too many resort amenities, etc. So when one counts all the additional money one ends up paying,

Summary Heading: Smaller room but such an elegant place to stay
Summary: I loved this resort. It's not big but it has some vintage feel and luxury feel at the same time. Close to beach, shopping mall, three pools and nice fitness. Wonderful outdoor terrace with lights and ocean breeze. Stop by newport beach mall in 5 mins away.  Close to great restaurant and everything.

My husband and I had a wedding to go to in Newport Beach so we, along with 4 other friends, stayed at the Hyatt as it was close to Lido Island. What a great hotel - it felt like we were in Mexico at a resort! We were about 2 minutes to Fashion Island (amazing shopping) and our room backed onto the nice little golf course they have. The pool outside our room never had anyone at it, so we basically got a private pool everyday! We had some late night meals and drinks a couple of the nights and we really enjoyed the food they had at the bar (kale & edamame salad and the baked potato bites were delish!). Every morning we ate breakfast on the patio in their restaurant and our server was always delightful and the food was great - lots of options and many are very healthy. The only

Excellent customer service. Beautiful renovations! Awesome gardens, valet parking employees so efficient and courteous. I highly recommend this resort. Breakfast in the lounge is a new and great addition.

The place is located in the best part of Newport Beach! Very close to Balboa Island, and right next to Balboa Bay!! They have complimentary bike rentals where you can ride over the bay out and back (7 miles total), very flat, so good for everyone! Service was excellent, and their food is to die for! Although the hotel is updated, it still looks a little outdated. Didn't like the daily resort fee, but I still loved their over stay.

The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach was in a great location, close to everything. The front desk staff and concierge were great, especially Ron, Thalia, Helena, and Beverly. Dave the lead Bellman, was a wealth of knowledge about the property. They did a wonderful job, of updating the lobby, eating areas and library. The room was large, and updated, but was very dark, upon entering the room. Enjoyed my stay here.

Summary Heading: Great hotel with a noisy guest above us
Summary: We normally really like that Hyatt brand, but we always request a top floor to avoid a quest above us keeping us awake. Even though I am a platinum member, I was not given the upgrade to the top floor as I was told it was not available. Of course, the quest above us was very noisy.

Summary Heading: OUR STAY AT THE HYATT REGENCY NEW PORT
Summary: We stayed one night, the grounds, lobby and staff were amazing.  we wished we could stay another night.  we will stay there every time we come to Costa Mesa Newport Beach.  we suggest you stay here when in Newport.

We spent four nights at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach last week and the visit couldn't have been better.  Great helpful employees.  Nice room, great beds, refrigerator & coffee maker.  Huge wonderful pool with lots of chairs and umbrellas.  Starbucks on site.  Super location.  Shuttle with friendly staff to nearby shopping center.  Bikes available with nearby paths.  Golf on site.  Lighted self parking.  A flawless visit, actually and hoping to have the opportunity to come back.

The amenities are excellent with beautiful rooms and great location. However, the rooms are quite noisy - you can hear people above and next to you. Whether it's a TV, shower, toilet, or patio/bathroom doors, I could hear everything.

Check in drop the car and you are set for the day. Pool (with waterslide) and restaurants are awesome! Hotel was clean and neat.   I didn't love the sliding barn door for the bathroom. It was hard to close and made a lot of noise at night.

Summary Heading: Resort hotel, good for business travel too
Summary: The hotel is truly a resort. I stayed here for business, so it was a nice option to be someplace that felt like a vacation resort.  The property has many buildings and views.  I stayed in the Balboa building facing the swimming pool.  This could get a little noisy, but it didn’t bother me.  It was only crowded during the day, so the noise was not loud at all.   The room itself was very spacious.  It had 2 double beds and a couch.  There was a fridge, flat screen TV, and usual hotel room amenities.     The bathroom was clean and nice size.  It did NOT have a ceiling vent.  That made the shower steam fill up the bathroom and room.  My room had a private balcony overlooking the pool.  I was on the 2nd floor so it’s not a mountain type view.  Only 2 floors in this building.  There

have stayed here every time i have raced the Newport to Catalina outrigger Champs race.  very convenient to the race launch, nice comfy beds for before a big race, friendly helpful staff.  water refilling station is definitely a plus with the drought we are in

I was only there one night, in town for a race.  Wish I could've stayed longer!  Room was comfortable, clean, well organized.   Pool was amazing, the food was excellent.  The front desk was very helpful with my minor requests.  All around great experience.

Excellent facility and friendly staff. Got a good rate with group discount. Parking is expensive. Good internet. My room was a bit noisy but overall I was happy with how comfortable it was. Nice beds and pillows. Lounge offered a bar that had good breakfast menu. Restaurant by lounge offered nice menu and good service. Ice was located too far.

A hotel is only as good as the people who work there and this review isn't really about the hotel, because it's just fine.  Probably a 3 or 4 Star Hyatt.  Nice clean rooms, comfortable beds, over priced food and beverages, decent pools, and good views of the Newport BackBay/Pool/Golf Course (depending on the room).  Blah, blah, blah.  Pretty normal stuff.  This review is really about a couple of people who truly make this hotel a terrific place to stay and almost single handily put it head and shoulders above the plethora of similar hotels in the area.  FYI- I'm not related to any of these people-just feel very strongly that their excellence and "above the call of duty" professionalism should be recognized, because they are what really makes this hotel a great place to stay, and

In general, very convenient to restaurants and activities in the area.  Nice property but ask for a room on the third floor if staying in the main building, otherwise you will hear every footstep the room above you makes.

The Hyatt Newport is a great place to stay for business.  Excellent restaurants  near by in Fashion Island.  The beach is close and the back bay just behind the hotel is a great way to start the day with a run or walk.

Location is close to Fashion Island, Balboa Island, Newport Beach and Pier. Resort has 3 pools, golf  course, bike rental, exercise gym, restaurant, gift shop and running bike trail. The resort has separate buildings  and not a high rise. There is valet or self parking available.  If choosing self parking suggest unloading suitcase in lobby at check  as self parking is a walk to hotel rooms. I stayed in the main hotel section it had a view of the pool or harbor. Thint this was the best location. Our group arrived around 1:00 and was able to check  in early without any problems. There  is a free shuttle to Fashion Island that runs every 2 hours. Bike rental is free because there is a resort fee. There is two free water bottles in the room with a robe to use in the closet. The

Summary Heading: All was well till I lost the confidence in Hyatt!
Summary: The hotel is situated in one of the pristine locations in Newport Beach. Literally right next to the Balboa Bay, and so close to the Balboa Island! The premise is very tranquil and very neatly kept! The restaurant serves very good food. The staff were very friendly! Except for the housekeeping manager's honesty! I had left a emergency pouch which holds some cash and all my emergency contacts. It's the pouch I carry with me when I go for road ride, and in case I'm found unconscious or need to call a taxi. If I get a flat or in these circumstances, the pouch comes into play. I checked out, leaving the pouch in the safety box, locked. Few days later, back home, wanting to go for a ride, I noticed the pouch was missing. And I knew right away that I left it inside the safety box.  I

Stayed at this hotel after a backpacking trip on Catalina Island.  The property is beautiful and is located in a very nice area of Newport Beach.  There is a mall with shopping and lots of dining options about a mile away.  We stayed in a standard room that was clean, comfortable and had a nice little patio area looking out onto the golf course.  The grounds were beautiful and we all wished we had more time to enjoy the property.

I have stayed at this property several times over the last 3 years.  It is across from Fashion Island and right near Balboa Island so there's lots to do.  This Hyatt is refreshingly quaint.  It is a series of 5 or 6 two-story buildings.  When you walk in the front doors, you are already at the reception desk.  VERY pleasant front desk staff and valet parking attendants.   My teenagers loved staying here- they can roam around, ride bikes, play golf, play ping pong and lounge by the pool.   We rented Duffy boats and toured around the Newport harbor one evening. I love the upscale casualness of this hotel.

Summary Heading: Disappointing weekend stay...Would rather have stayed home!
Summary: My dissatisfaction with my stay flowed primarily from the fact that the entertainment system in the room was broken during my whole stay.  Not only was the television signal flickering in and out constantly, the on-demand entertainment was completely out of commission the entire time I was there.  The entertainment system problems were compounded by the hotel’s poor response.  While for most guests these problems would be a minor inconvenience, the purpose of my stay was to spend the weekend in Newport and to relax with my wife with some in-room movies, room service, spa, etc.  We live in Los Angeles but love to travel up and down California and stay at nice hotels/resorts for 1-, 2-, and 3-night weekends just to unwind.    Given the purpose of my stay, the entertainment

This hotel, although it appeared nice in the beginning was filthy.  The pool area was beyond dirty with food, cups and things on the ground.  No towels available at night (pool was still open).  Not enough chairs.  The maid service didn't show up until after 2 pm when we called to complain.    Lobby bar/restaurant tables were filthy.  We will not be returning and/or recommending to anyone.

i would like to check out the golf course next time.\ over all the hotel staff was very friendly, the pool was excellent, location is good, my family enjoyed the stay.the room service can be a little more fast and efficient

location location location!  The Hotel is located in the heart of Newport Beach and offers free shuttle service to all of the "hot Spots".  The service is superior and very attentive to your needs.  Our room was recently been upgraded with modern decor and very comfortable and clean.

I was dropping my daughter off at college and we made a side trip to Newport Beach and stayed at the Hyatt.  They upgraded us to a nice room with a bay view which made the experience with my daughter fabulous.  Thank you for making the last day before college such a great day with incredible memories!!!

We love staying at the Hyatt at Newport Beach.  With beautifully landscaped grounds, several beautiful outdoor pools and other outdoor venues, it's more like a luxury resort than a hotel.  This active family loves the Newport Hyatt!

I stayed here on business but it turned into for pleasure. It is close to everything including the ocean, restaurants, shopping centers, and the airport. I had to make last minute adjustements to my reservations and the staff was very understanding. Room service was quick and very polite. The rooms a very comfortable and clean. Enjoyed my stay

We have just returned from a trip to Southern California where we spent 8 nights at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. We had an absolutely fantastic stay!   We booked a bay view room (Lido building) which overlooked the back bay and some of the golf course and enjoyed seeing the sun set each evening. The room was great - spacious, modern and the bathroom very clean with good amenities. Beds comfy. The location of the room was very peaceful.  There are three pools but with a small child we spent most of our time at the pool with the waterside! The slide was fabulous as was the pool which had a good sized shallow end for children. Also by the pool are water cannons, mini golf, table tennis and horseshoe which we enjoyed. The pool service was great and very friendly. The grounds /

This hotel has well kept grounds and clean, though slightly small for a family of four, rooms.  There is free water everywhere which is nice when you're active and don't feel like paying $4 a bottle! The property has three pools which are nice, and has a place to paddle board behind the property.  Because it was a surf trip for us, this hotel was a perfect distance from some surf spots to visit each day.  There are lots of great food options in the area as well. We would come back if we got adjoining rooms!

Hyatt Regency is a nice hotel and complex. Good for kids, leisure or business stay. Near shopping, restaurants, ocean and airport. Easy access in/out.  Staff is efficient and courteous.  Hotel restaurant, fitness center and running trails.

This hotel was beautiful yet one of the least expensive brand name hotels in the area. The rooms were updated and the lounge inside and out was modern and beautiful, including a large fire pit. Three pools, tennis courts, golf. Very quiet in the Lido area.

Wow, we thought, great hotel.  Room was not ready till 4pm, very busy.  Self parking at $25 w valet in the $35 range, really??  Our room was in the further location of this property.  The room was very nice, clean and comfortable, just a tad far away from main dining.  Front desk staff was very pleasant. Lastly, a resort fee as well. It was an experience, but not going back.

You get what you pay for. Hotel was clean, good service, decent pools. Staff were very friendly and always willing to please. Rooms were clean, bathrooms were good too. Fitness centre was pretty good lots of equipment. Hotel was near everything. 30 mins to Disney 15 mins to the beach lots of malls everywhere.

This Hyatt has the charm of resorts in days past with the conviences of today. The layout is expensive and the grounds immaculate. There are three pools to choose from and one is geared towards children so you have the option with kids or without. I suggest the Lidos section, nice balcony with harbor view and very quite. The bar and open lounge patio are terrific and provide a most relaxing environment. The Shor restaurant is far above average for a hotel.  The service is also above average on a consistent basis. I would definitely recommend and will stay again if in the area

I stayed for one night for business. I was put in a bay room which overlooked the main pool with the waterslide. Needless to say, the room was really loud due to the pool noise. Also, the room led straight outside, therefore making this hotel feel very motel-like. The bathroom had been renovated, but otherwise, I felt like I was in a motel room, complete with a popcorn ceiling. I would have given a 2 rating, but the staff were friendly and the pool amenities were nice.

Summary Heading: Great spot near the coast and new Fashion Island
Summary: If you're on business and want to be 2 steps to the beach, 2 steps to Fashion Island and 2 steps from John Wayne. This is the place. It's more like a resort than a hotel. Big grounds very spread out and sits on an inter coastal bay. Like it's own private lagoon. Much better than staying in Costa Mesa or Irvine.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at Hyatt Newport Beach!
Summary: Checked in last night from a long week on the road. The valet staff that greeted me were so worm, welcoming and authentic! Got right into my room and rested. Love this property.  In the morning, the valet crew were spot on again!  Easy check-in, Easy check-out!

Service was great. Staff went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of, providing free beach chairs, umbrella, bikes were free to ride, free green fees ect. They really offer a lot. The property is well maintained

Rooms are over priced  and the valet parking price is ridiculous. No spa facilites. Elevators not available in the right area. If you are elderly or handicapp--good luck. I will not be returning to the Hyatt Regency in Newport. I only stayed because of the concert series which is the best thing on Friday night.

Total relaxation a short drive from home--felt like we were with the rich and famous by the way we were pampered.  Wonderful facility; Courteous staff; Superb bar/lounge experience inside and outside around the fire pit!!

I really liked this hotel, the customer service was outstanding.  The lobby and rooms have been updated recently.  The only thing I did not like was that the kids pool needed some updating.  I also didn't feel like the hotel was all that family friendly.

Outstanding Resort, great $26 breakfast buffet on the weekends with individually made omelettes.  Crystal clear pools (three), ping pong table, free bikes to ride around the Back Bay of Newport and a nine hole golf course (free clubs) with resort fee.  Beautiful rooms - get the third floor overlooking the back bay, if you can - great view!  Super location for a couple or with a family!

Wonderful experience.  Small resort feel.  Wonderful amenities.  GREAT location.  Walk to Balboa Island.  Management staff welcomed us with strawberries and champagne, totally unexpected.  Had problem with room but they changed it w/o hassle

I have stayed at this Hyatt every year in NB and come back because of the location and friendly service! the staff goes overboard to be helpful. Their service and attention to our needs are amazing even before we ask!

Summary Heading: Friday - Monday Weekend in Newport Beach
Summary: Very friendly staff.  Vince was very prompt in retrieving my rental car from valet parking. Nice bar area for drinks and nibbles.  Beautiful pool behind bar lobby.  Complementary Back Bay 9-Hole Par 3 Golf Course with free rental clubs and balls was also very nice.

Good location if you have business in and around Newport Beach - very convenient to John Wayne airport. Great staff. SHOR Seafood restaurant is excellent, the chef has some very creative dishes going on.

Summary Heading: great vacation spot for kids and families
Summary: We're coming back!  If you can't have fun here, "youve got some splainin to do", we enjoyed every moment of the space and told all our friends, can't miss!  Don't miss the Saturday night movie on the golf course.

Our experince there was amazing from the room to the food to the pool to the live jazz music. At first I was hesitate because there were alot of families but the children have a seperate pool and the pool we used was very tranquil. The view of the bay gorgeous and you can even walk down to the bay which is much better than an ocean to me. This is our new getaway for sure.

We tried to check in yesterday, around 2 , but the room was not ready. The receptionist did give us a complimentary drinks voucher which would give us a house wine or a house beer. We elected to have some thing different, $21 for a glass of wine and a bottled beer! Am I getting old? Anyway, we went back to reception at 4 , check in time, the room still wasn't ready. The receptionist, joscelyne, I hope I spelt it correct, was very apologetic and attentive over the next hour or so. I mentioned we would be getting room service for dinner as we were tired and had been travelling since 8 in the morning. She took this on board and when our room was eventually ready, she came to us in the lounge with the keys and a big smile stating that she had spoken to her manager and the dinner was

Summary Heading: Hyatt dissappointment.......from a Hyatt Gold Member
Summary: I have never had a bad thing to say about a Hyatt property, but our two night stay in Newport Beach left us exhausted and disappointed.  This hotel felt more like a motel.  We arrived during a Jazz concert and were not even greeted at the door.  We intended to valet and had to call the guy over.  We paid $35 per day for valet and it felt like a motel anyway. We just came back from a four star resort in Maui that only charged $15 per day.   Most of the staff we encountered were friendly, the rooms were clean and the Decor looked like Hyatt property.  Once we sat on the bedding is was moist.  We realized the room was not airconditioned, but it had some sort of swamp cooler in the wall that made the room cool but extremely humid and wet feeling.  The walls and floor were so thick

We had read a few negative reviews before we arrived but am pleased to say that we had an amazing stay at the Hyatt!  Our room was in a quiet location, overlooking the golf course next to the Lido pool.  We had a 2 bed room and it was clean and well furnished.  We had plenty of toiletries given to us and housekeeping was of a good standard.  The recreational areas are lovely.  There are 3 pools and we never had a problem getting loungers and umbrellas, although the hotel is noticeably busier at the weekends.  Service of drinks etc is available around the pool. Some times it can be a bit slow but there are 3 pools which are quite spread out that the staff look after.  The lounge bar and restaurant are also great.  The servers in the restaurant are very friendly and we had a

Summary Heading: Under the flight path of Orange County Airport
Summary: It had been a long time since I'd stayed at this particular property, so I was really disappointed with this stay given what I had remembered from before.  Enjoying outdoor amenities is difficult with roaring jets constantly overhead.  They are loud and I do mean LOUD.  The hotel attempts to provide good room sound-proofing, but this meant that sitting with the slider open was not an option.  The condition of the room was sub-par.  Air vents were full of crud, the room safe was locked in the closed position, and the basics seemed to be missing.  I dropped a note off for the manager on duty, and received an email back later that day saying the issues would be remedied.  They were not.   Room service tray was void of a single condiment and the food was not very good.  For the

This hotel has a friendly staff, great 24/7 fitness center and the on-site SHOR restaurant serves outstanding food at reasonable prices.  Easy to access shopping and interstate/PCH1 for travel to Los Angeles, Huntington Beach, etc.

Friendly staff.   Beautiful grounds.  Comfortable rooms. Could use a little updating but that is minor to the overall experience.  Very nice property!  Bar is excellent.  Take a stroll and enjoy!  Self parking is a hike but worth it.  Great coffee bar.

I stayed here for the first time and really had a nice time. It's a busy place with probably the best overall customer service I have experienced. It's a really fun resort with three separate pool areas to choose from, a busy bar area in the lobby, 9-hole chip and putt golf, and a nice restaurant. But the most impressive thing is the customer service from attentive staff, like Thalia, the Concierge, and the other concierges- the front desk people, and even the engineering/security staff who went out of their way to find me a DVD player for my room (don't ask). I work in hospitality and it was nice to experience it again.

The hotel has been updated.  The staff is very accomodating.  Rooms can be a bit small but very clean.  They seem to make a great attempt at keeping the noise to a reasonable level at night-greatly appreciated. Food is good, servers go out of their way .

Summary Heading: Older, charming hotel but still fun!
Summary: Vacationed here with wife and three kids July 4th weekend. We all managed to fit into one room, but rather tight.  Only options are King or two doubles, no double queens, which is a bummer. Hotel gave us a cot for free, and the couch pulled out but was very thin and not comfortable…we put down a lot of extra blankets to make it bearable. We overlooked the golf course and it was very quiet. Decent sized fridge, and they gave us a microwave upon request. Nice flat screen TV, good lighting throughout.  One of the few remaining “resort-type” Hyatts where you can use your free night rewards (Category 4). The outside of the buildings, and overall feel of the resort, pool and surrounding areas reminds you of the 70s-80’s, but the inside of all the buildings have been remodeled and feel

The Hyatt at Newport Beach bills itself as a resort, but, the amenities fall short. The jets in the hot tub were not functioning, the parking gate was not functioning, and resort staff were very casual about responding to guest concerns or requests.

A great place for the family to stay and something for everyone. The staff was very helpful and definitely will go back and stay at this hotel. The rooms were large and had a wonderful view out the window. The food was very good and even the picky eaters were satisfied with the restaurants. A great place to stay and visit.

Summary Heading: Not up to Hyatt Regency Standards from my Perspective
Summary: We love the Hyatt Chain, have been  Hyatt Gold members for years, and count on them for superior  facilities and service, especially for the Regency and Grand Hyatt properties.  This one let us down. The reservation was made about 2 months in advance, King bed, early check in which is never promised but generally accomplished.  En route I was assured the early check in was available.  We arrived and checked in, hauled ourselves over to a lovely room off a hallway with a delightful outdoor patio area.( In looking around later, it appeared that  most of the units on the property had these outdoor sitting areas.) Unfortunately, this unit  had two beds--no king..  I called the office and said we'd been sleeping together for 60 years and didn't want twin beds on this trip.  Also,

Customer service!!!! Excellent! Hats off to Julio at shorr restaurant.. Welcomed us each morning.. Smile was very enchanting!!! Shannon at poolside gave us prompt and professional service.. Room service was awesome...gave us plenty of shampoo conditioner towels upon request... Service at desk was great.. The landscape beautiful. The location is perfect. Hotel offered free shuttle every 2 hours to fashion island balboa island. Drivers were so sweet... Parking was great. Cost money but not far from lobby. Gave us bottled water. Do not stay at the Lido side. It's empty and quiet. We stayed at bayside. Kid friendly pool. A must stay hotel in newport. Loved it

This property looks dated in many areas. Lobby area is very nice as is the bar and outdoor seating for the bar. Three pools to choose from, one very festive with water slide. The layout is huge and confusing; I highly recommend you use a bellman to bring your luggage to the room! Self parking can be ridiculously far away from various rooms, some building have no elevators which made lugging large suitcase up two flights of stairs not very fun. Resort fee, plus parking, taxes adds another hundred dollars to an already high summer rate! I stayed there for one of the summer concerts, which was fabulous...great small venue offered at the Hyatt property.

Summary Heading: Leave you rental at airport take über
Summary: Nice hotel. Good staff. But when it comes to leaving your car the $35 a day and you can not even call it up from your room. The first time trying to get our car took 35 minutes and made us late for dinner. We new it was bad then so we used uber for the next 2 days. Then on the last day going to the airport. No lines to get the car took 45 minutes and we were the only people waiting for a car. In order to even get your car you have to turn your ticket in person to the valet booth while plenty of valet people are standing around. Then we booked are hotel with breakfast on hotels.com and the hotel would not honor it. What a bunch of crap. After spending a couple grand in the spa you would have thought they would have honored the free breakfast we were promised. Bad experience

Summary Heading: 60's vibe, beachy, good service, long walk to parking
Summary: This hotel was built in the 1960's, which you can tell by the sheer size of the trees, and it's retained that relaxed vibe that Ms. Monroe and Mr. Wayne enjoyed.   I've stayed here multiple times in the past few months. The staff are friendly and remembered me from day one, and my drink. The ambience is relaxed, and I usually take dinner outside on the patio where I watch the sun go down. One down side is the long haul to the self parking lot, but it's workable.

We booked this hotel on line for a 5 day stay. The room allocated  was dark and basic. We had to upgrade for an extra $100 a night. Watch out for all the extras such as "resort Tax" and local taxes. The over cost was $1000 more than on our original booking. However the hotel was clean and the staff friendly but the hotel was very busy and noisy with weddings and other functions. Not the place to go for a relaxing trip.

We were only there for a short time but really enjoyed the resort! Friendly valet and check in. Beautiful grounds and Friday night Jazz festival. Kids loved the waterslide and pool. Amazing Food and beverage that were provided and so close to John Wayne airport and things to do in Newport Beach. A Must try!

We were in Newport Beach for 2 nights to visit an old friend. This hotel was perfect for our stay. The rooms are spacious with excellent bathroom facilities. The rooms were spotless and all the areas of the hotel were the same with well tended grounds/gardens. parking is secure as you need your room key to exit. The pool area was excellent - plenty of space, beds, brollies and towels. The staff were all friendly and attentive to our needs. We had some snacks in the bar area one evening and they were great.  Be aware there is a resort fee charge applied to your bill.

Great hotel, in a lovely setting. Checked in was told there was a resort fee which included unlimited wifi for up to 6 devices, unlimited refills for kids drinks, bike hire, golf and 2 bottles of water per day. We weren't aware of this however we paid a reduced rate and was happy with this. We stayed for 5 nights. The pools are lovely, we stayedmon the balboa block near the quieter pool which was nice, the pool with the slide was fantastic too. There also a pool near lido block where on a Saturday night they play a kids movie called the dive in move night, it was great having a swim or just chilling on the sun bed in the dark. Pools seemed to be open after 10pm which didn't bother us was nice letting the kids have a swim in the evening before bed. The hotel food particularly the

We stayed here while we were in town for a wedding.  Everything was wonderful--staff was great, rooms were spotless, food was delicious, the property was beautiful!  Charging Starbucks to the room was pretty nice...used the free shuttle service several times which enabled us to not have to rent a car.  Everyone was professional and I just had a great time!  I would absolutely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Hotel is a little dated but nicely refurbished
Summary: We stayed here at the end of our family vacation and enjoyed the stay. The hotel has been recently refurbished and rooms and restaurant are nicely done.  Kids really enjoyed the water slide at the pool. But overall the hotel has a distinctly 1960s feel due to the motel-like layout which isn't quite my taste. Service at the restaurant was consistently very slow.  Location is good, close to most attractions in the area. We most enjoyed sunset dinner at Ruby's Shake Shack, Joe's Crab Shack and the amazing waves at The Wedge beach.

This hotel and all of it's staff members welcome you and treat you right.  The rooms were very clean and updated, great service from everyone, good amenities and overall a great stay and close to the beach!

I am basing the following review on the fact that my husband and I are Hyatt Gold Passport members, which doesn't seem to mean much at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach! Having just stayed at the beautiful Hyatt Piñon Point for a week in Sedona, we could not have been more disappointed in this hotel! For starters, Hyatt Regency is considered to be at the top of this brand? Unbelievable, really.  The disappointment began as soon as we checked in. We were early because we drove down from LA, and we were pleasantly surprised when the young man at the front desk told us that our room was ready. I asked him if we were getting a room with a nice view since the hotel sits on Newport Bay. He grimaced, and said "not exactly, but you're in the Balboa building, and the rooms are larger, and

We stayed two nights during the week seeking relaxation. Room was assigned but not ready at check-in so I was asked for mobile number and told I would be notified when it was ready. Front desk staff were not particularly engaged or caring. I also had to inform them of the characteristics of my booking -- which they were able to view on their computer screen but apparently hadn't bothered to do so until I raised a question. We went to the lounge to wait, and wait, and then I finally went back to the desk to discover that sometime during the waiting the room had become ready but they hadn't yet tried to contact me. Overall, the hotel is fine but not up to what I have come to expect from similarly-priced properties in the same area. Based on this experience, we will return to one

I attended a conference here and my wife came along for the trip.  The hotel was interesting, it looks like 3 separate properties combined into one?  We stayed in the Balboa building which we were very happy with, quiet and a good sized room overlooking the pool.  the other two buildings were motel style.  The lobby area and outdoor lounges were really well decorated and there were a lot of sitting areas scattered around the property to relax.  Service was excellent, from the check in desk, to the bar and restaurants.  I must mention the shuttle driver we had on the weekend, a really nice older gentlemen who explained the schedule and good places to go, he went a step beyond.  The hotel is not really close to anything but the shuttle takes care of that going to the Fashion Mall

I had a very comfortable stay here. I requested a quiet room and was very satisfied with a room overlooking the tennis courts next door. The pool nearby was quiet and serene, since most kids were at the other water slide pool below. Maid service was prompt and valet service efficient and friendly. The bartenders were friendly and talkative, Jeff suggested a delicious corn and black bean soup I had for a light dinner. Very enjoyable. I will return.

A great place for a Business conference. Excellent food and service. Nothing was missed as far as I could tell and the staff were very helpful. The beach on the lagoon was very nice and the trip from the airport was easy.

We stayed 3 nights and loved every minute of it.  Our room wasn't ready by 4:00 so they promptly gave us free food and drinks from the lobby lounge.  Rooms were roomy and clean.  The pools were beautiful.  It was a really wonderful experience.

Look, other reviewers talked alot, it is outstanding as a fun facility but here is an advice The room has a sofa bed so if privacy is not an issue the room will get you and your kids The suit will serve u exactly as the room but with an extra door for the privacy and 50% more in price so think of what you exactly need From my prospective, i was upset when i was leaving after checking out from the bell boys, they did not organize my stuff, i had to take a bag to  re arrange it and came back to the car i had to take most of the baggage down and re arrange them , they were looking no help , u know what, 5 min earlier I tipped them with twenty dollars for the luggage and they would not help me re arranging themSo watch out ,, they do not deserve a high tip

If you can comfortably afford it, the Hyatt is like any high-end resort--beautiful pools and hot tubs, well laid out eating areas, relaxed atmosphere, good locations.   The rooms are clean, bed comfortable, food very fresh and tasty.

Overall a nice hotel but rooms are pretty plain. Nice pools and ammenities.  Wish they had a better coffee maker. It is nice to have the Newport Dunes beach right across the street. Good parking but kind of pricey with $25 a day self-parking. Very nice staff. Good location and seems very pet and family friendly.

Bottom Line Upfront: Great hotel for families or couples of all ages!  Pros: Great Resturant on property. Pool cabana service was fast.  Cons: Only that our two rooms didn't connect with a door - hotel was busy due to jazz concert.  Recommendations: Ask for Chris in Hotel Resturant - he is a great waiter!

Summary Heading: Good location, but needs some updates
Summary: We spent a week here in June on our babymoon.  While the location was excellent, our room was just ok.  We stayed in the back building, which had extremely thin walls and was pretty loud on weekend nights. This particular building seems to be a renovated motel where the doors open to the outside.  I did not like the fact that there was no keycard access required for this area, and just about anyone could have come through. Combined with the resort fee and additional parking fee, I do feel a bit like we overpaid for our room. That said, the location was great for us - we were close to Fashion Island and within walking distance of Balboa Island. It was also an easy home base from which to drive to LA and the beaches.

Great hotel with great service from the staff. Everything from the service to the hotel grounds were immaculate. Rooms were clean and well kept. My only complain was that the walls seemed to be a little thin. I could hear the people next door having a conversation. Maybe it was the area I was staying. Other than that I would love to be back.

Summary Heading: Great beach and tennis get away
Summary: Best hotel in Newport if you have interest in tennis.  Connection to the Palisades tennis facility is great.  Minutes drive to the beach or free beach cruiser bikes available at the hotel made for a fun adventure with the kids.  Great value

visited the hotel for the jazz series and stayed overnight...great idea...swam and relaxed before...and after the concert and the next morning...great mini vacay... spending the night allowed us to not be a part of the  crazy lines for valet  or encumbered about the drive back to LA...

Summary Heading: Too expensive for what it was
Summary: My family stayed here one night and with the room cost and fees it cost over 500. Dollars. For a standard small room. Resort fees internet fee, parking fee, not worth it! It was nice but not that nice. We are at the fish restaurant at the hotel which was " ok" also. The price there was normal though.  We also came in at 3pm for check in and the room was not ready , they said they would call me to tell me when it was ready and by 5:30 I went to the desk to see what was wrong and they said , " oh, sorry someone should have called you ?" But they didn't ...? I was given a free appetizer for my trouble. But we could not have a late check out the next day? We swam at the pool which was ok, but not that great. For the price I was expecting better.

Loved our stay. We stayed last year had not idea there was a shuttle. We utilized it to go to Balboa. Brought back a lot of childhood memories. Will go next year. The fish tacos were to die for on the outside patio. Fresh Swordfish. My Greek Yogurt in the morning with fresh fruit and granola hit the spot. Lovely resort. Do not hesitate. Very close to everything. Don't forget to visit Rogers Gardens during your visit.

Summary Heading: This place needs a major upgrade
Summary: Our room was just "ok".  AC unit didn't work for sheet.  They tried to fix it once and failed, so room was super hot.  Kids loved the pool area with the water-slide. Be aware while we were laying poolside, my wife and I ordered some drinks.  When the drinks came there was a room service charge!  I didn't order room service?!  I later asked about the weird charge and it was removed.  That's shady!

I stayed at this hotel as part of a retreat in September 2014.  It was great for the retreat as we were able to utilize all parts of the resort.  I had a great room with a view of the bay.  The resort is quite big, therefore the rooms are sprawled out in different buildings.  However is still felt quaint and boutique-like.  The service was great and the staff were wonderful with responding to our needs.  I'd go back for sure!

Summary Heading: Not worth the money. Avoid the moneypit
Summary: You are better off choosing a hotel a few miles down the road and saving $150+.   Pros: Nice property. Lots of trees and flower bushes.  Cons: Where do I start? The hotel is on the flight path of the Orange County Airport. So, be prepared to hear the Loud plane noises from 5AM. Thats your wake up call. In the summer, kids are in the pool at 8AM and they are loud because of the water slide. WiFi is horrible. If it connects for more than 2 minutes, consider yourself lucky. Self-Parking is $25 and half a mile away from the resort with lots of Steps. Valet is $34. Need I say any more? Breakfast is not included, even though they charge arm and a leg for a room. The rooms are like caves. No natural lighting. The layout of the building looks like apartment complex. My friend stayed

We only stayed 2 nights to explore Newport Beach. It was just a 10 minute walk to Balboa Island from the hotel. The self parking lot was a little distant from the hotel rooms. The rooms were fine, the balcony was great. The one elevator is outdated; stairwell smelled bad. I rate "very good" because of the super friendly staff and the location and the overall appearance of the property, which includes the patio area and the nice lobby.

Summary Heading: Not too upscale, yet welcoming and safe
Summary: Families welcome.  Dogs welcome.  Bunnies and ducks.  Excellent customer service.  Privacy. Peace. Location. Quiet setting, yet close to any noise you might need. A restaurant or bar down the road then back to a safe, lovely retreat.

Summary Heading: Look like you're from Newport to be treated like you're from Newport
Summary: Although the rooms and grounds are beautiful, if you don't arrive via Mercedes or BMW you're immediately made to feel uncomfortable. The check in time is 4pm which is a huge inconvenience and to make it worse our room wasn't ready until nearly 5pm, we were instructed to go for a walk by the very rude girl at the front desk with her fully aware it was pouring outside, when the room was ready it was the wrong room with one bed for me and my father... Instead of moving us to a correct room I was given a roll out bed to sleep on. The shuttle was at least 15 minutes late each time we caught it over the three days. I've had better service at super low budget hotels. Hyatt regency Newport Beach has left me with a sour taste in my mouth... I will never be back to this area.

Summary Heading: Good alternative to area airport hotels
Summary: We chose this Hyatt based on the location within 5 miles of Orange County Airport. This Hyatt offered a much sweeter location overlooking the Back Bay. It was formerly The Newporter Inn, a beloved luxury family resort of the 60s, with the likes of Richard Nixon and John Wayne frequenting. It has been managed by the Hyatt for 25 years. We found the room and facilities all nicely updated. Our room on the 3rd floor of the Catalina building had expansive views of the back bay beach and Marina. It was perfect for morning coffee and evening libations on the lanai. The fitness center was small but adequate. I rested by the quiet Lido pool and ate 3 meals in the restaurant and all were good. The friendly lobby bar poured good solid drinks. We enjoyed or stay. The only caveat fellow

I had a room by the swimming pool with gorgeous view and very spacious. Room service, front desk, concierge and housekeeping, all very good. The only thing which frustrates me a bit is a constant weird hitting sound from the room throughout the day and night. I do not have sleep problems but it is still disturbing me a bit when it is quiet at night. I also had a problem with the internet connection (it is paid as part of the resort fee) and it never worked even though I called the technical service to help. They helped reset something but it was never resolved. I have my own router with me so I didn't bother. Overall a good hotel.

Summary Heading: Great stay at the Hyatt Regency
Summary: Had a fantastic stay in the open air style hotel. The Hyatt Regency features big rooms, a beautiful pool and fantastic staff. The golf course is a par 3 course at best so don't expect a full sized golf course. They have great breakfast options in the morning at both their restaurant and at the bar. Overall it was a great stay!

Summary Heading: Overall the area of the hotel is impressive
Summary: I was staying in the Marriott as this hotel was full. I was down here for a conference. Although I stayed in Marriott I was practically here all day and been using all the facilities.   Overall the area of the hotel is impressive and designed more over in Nature loving fronts. Lot of their areas were open. We were placed in their different hall and rooms for lectures, training and seminars. Their facilities are update with technology.   We also eat at the hotel and I found the servers and cleaning staff to be very attentive and friendly to deal with and the food served by the hotel was quite nice and up the standard.   The staff at the door were very nice as well, as I dealt with them for calling taxis all the time and they were quick to help out.   The washrooms were always

The lobby is very new and fresh along with the rooms. The pools and Jacuzzi's are very clean and nice. I was very impressed with the amenities that the resort fee included. It Included Golfing, Biking, internet, Bottled Water, Shuttle Services and Beach Rentals. Overall a great hotel the is very close to the beach.

Summary Heading: Comfortable place to stay with lots of amenities
Summary: We stayed at the Hyatt Newport Beach for a weekend. We were in town for a wedding. Staff were super nice and helpful, rooms comfortable, and there is  a lot to do on site -- pools, shuffle board, etc. Not a high rise hotel, but  2- and 3-floor buildings on a beautifully landscaped property. But it is not without a price tag. On top of the nightly room charge there is a hefty "resort fee". And there were LOTS of kids and the lobby is bustling all hours of the day. So if you want peace and quiet, request a top floor room away from the action (which by the way we had to pay an 'upgrade' for). We didn't have a car and we were able to easily walk to Balboa Island and over top the peninsula, or take Uber to our destination. So all in all, it's a GREAT place to stay!

This hotel is a great venue for business conferences and/or weddings. The grounds are beautiful and there is ample space. I would not stay here for a vacation. The location is odd, it isn't near anything so you would have to drive anywhere you want to go. The online pictures make it appear as if it's on the harbor but it isn't. It's across a not-so-easily accessible street from what appeared to be a private small boating area and small bay inlet/swimming area. It is not in the main part of Newport Beach nor was there clear access to this "beach" from the hotel. The food was okay-a bit over priced for how good it was in my opinion, the rooms were very clean, the pool area was nice and the staff were extremely friendly and attentive.

The hotel room was clean and spacious. Updated amenities and multiple on-site activities were available. Room service was prompt, hot and delicious.  I plan on returning with my husband for a leisure trip.

Summary Heading: Great until we discovered FECES in the waterslide pool
Summary: Checked in for a weekend getaway on a Friday.  Based on reviews from TripAdvisor this was a good choice. Started off well Friday, clean, very modern room. Happy with our choice at this point.  Went to the Oasis pool Friday afternoon was good, had a fun waterslide for our kids.  Saturday afternoon went back to the pool about 6:00p.m. and after about an hour of swimming our kids decided to use their goggles.  It was then they discovered a large log of feces at the bottom of the pool.  Totally disgusted they got out and my husband went to find someone to notify them. We tracked down a young girl who then went to inform someone as she confirmed it was in fact feces. We were there for about 20 min. And no one had shown up yet before we left. We thought for sure they would put a sign

We arrived at 12 midday expecting to check in and were told our room wasn't ready and by the way check in isn't until 4pm, so you're early.  What!  OK, they then say they will call us when the room is ready and didn't.  I had to go ask and was told, oh yes you're rooms been ready for ages...thanks for telling me.  We stayed here for a wedding function and the rooms were nice enough, we had a room overlooking a pool, with a nice green tree lined area around the pool.  The wedding function was initially held in a function room, then outside beside a huge fire pit which was a nice touch given the cooler night.    The staff were friendly and attentive when we needed them.  Wireless internet was included free, nice touch, though onsite parking was the usual rip off price.

The price of this hotel is too high for the quality of service and experience that we received. I had higher expectations from a Hyatt. I felt like I was staying at Holiday Inn and have actually been treated better at a Holiday Inn. The shuttle service basically takes you to the hotel and drops you off close to where you want to go and you have to walk. The beach is much further than they advertise.

Summary Heading: Amazing Recently Refurbished Paradise in a Great Location!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 2 weeks back in March 2015 (I know... so late with this review!).  We live in the UK and have stayed in LA City Centre previously, however this was our first time at Newport Beach.  LOCATION - Phenomenally good.  I note that some reviewers have mentioned that it is not a beach front property, entirely true, however it is just a 15 minute walk to the stunning beaches down at Balboa Island (via the cool ferry).  Oh, yes, Balboa Island is incredible - packed full of restaurants, bars, shops, amusement rides, games and enormous beautiful golden sandy beaches on both the east and west sides. Definitely worth a visit!  One big benefit of not being immediately beside the beach, the resort offers an oasis away from the general noise, activity and mix of

This hotel was great! I recommend that you bring your own pillows because theirs are a little too squishy. The cookies will forever be imprinted in my memory because they were so dang good! The hotel room was impeccably clean. I was disappointed in the magazines offered to guests. I huge plus was the location. The location of the hotel was perfect for my business trip. I would not complain if I was sent to stay at this hotel again.

Hyatt Regency Newport Beach is a great hotel. The location is not as great, however. Yes, it is pretty central to everything, but there is no competition between this place and the location of Hyatt Huntington Beach, just a few miles down Pacific Coast Hwy. No beach access. Pool is great! They have movie nights there pretty often which is fun for the kids. Our room was on the 2nd floor, which I surprisingly loved because you only had to go down one flight of stairs to get to the lobby!(they had an elevator but I preferred this way). Great vibe to the place. Employees are outstanding! All went out of their way to make sure you had a pleasant stay. This is how every hotel's employees should be nowadays, but unfortunately some have rude employees. This is not the case!!! You can't

We have stayed at numerous Hotels across the Country and Hyatt Regency Newport Beach was the worst experience ever. From Dirty rooms with stained towels in our room and people partying above our room all night and we could not sleep. Jordan the hotel Manager was so rude to my wife Saturday morning and told her sorry for your luck and also when we waited down at the pool with the water slide and mind you we stayed here just for our kids. There were no lounge chairs available Jordan said sorry we can bring you a regular chair to sit on and refused to bring beach lounge chairs. There were many chairs with towels and people just trying to hold them and not be present. The 4th of July BBQ was $50 a person for dry over cooked plain hamburger and baked beans. I will never stay here

Previously, I had had some unfortunate experiences with Hyatt hotels.  The Hyatt Regency, Newport Beach has not simply cleaned the slate, it has set a high bar against which I now compare hotel stays.  Staff were friendly and engaging.  They ensured my stay was comfortable.  As someone who must be gluten-free due to an allergy, they went out of their way to ensure I had tasty, balanced meal options, not just salads.  For frequent travelers with dietary restrictions, this is a big issue.  For the most part, the hospitality industry has not caught up with dietary concerns, but this Hyatt has.  The hotel itself is lovely.  Built cabana style, it is open and breezy with several pools and beach views.  The rooms are good sized for a single or couple, with a dressing area/bathroom

We selected this hotel for the convenience and past recommendation of being a kid friendly hotel.  I think that the kid friendlily part is limited and there could be a lot more to accommodate children.

We are return guests for a reason..love this hotel and staff..Newport Beach and walking to Balboa Island a plus.  Kid and pet friendly. The pools and water slide fun..kids never wanted to leave pool.  Great view from our rooms for fireworks.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay at for the 4th of July
Summary: Staff was amazing in helping us get a room to view the firework displays, the room was very clean, the pool was great for the kids, good selection for both adults and kids on the room service menu, i would highly recomond this proerty to other for there 4th of July holiday, the overall stay was exellent

Our 12th year return for 4th and still a wonderful experience.  Kid friendly,great pools, view of fireworks..always nice rooms and walk to Balboa Island, restaurants and Newport Dunes.  The staff wonderful in all departments..helpful, friendly and accommodating..Special thanks to staff members..Morgan Williams, Jorden, Charlene,Bridgett, Quanting, Jeremy, Erin..you all were great and so pleasant and helpful.. We will see you soon..Carol Tyrrell and family

We stayed here for the July 4th weekend. It was wonderful. The staff was excellent and provided us with great service. My 13year old son loved the slide in the main pool area and the bike ride as well. This is a very clean resort and kid friendly.

Beautiful property! Very nice rooms. Our first night stay saw some frustration with a broken toilet and almost an hour and half wait for a maintenance worker to make repairs combined with an on duty manager who wasn't rude, but didn't seem to grasp the idea that the problem needed to be addressed somewhat quicker than what we experienced. The next morning saw the in room coffee maker not working. Ron at the front desk completely "owned" the situation and moved us into a very nice suite ( at normal room rate!) he threw in two complimentary breakfasts and turned our Hyatt experience around for the better! I have already recommended the property to others and plan on returning soon myself.  Three nice pools- garden like grounds-plenty of fun activities available. The coffee bar in

Looking to celebrate our son's 40th birthday we wanted to take him and the grandkids to a place that everyone could enjoy together.  The Newport Beach Hyatt was the ticket - and we enjoyed it immensely.

Summary Heading: Gross! You may like it if you are a smoker.
Summary: I will start this review by saying the area is ridiculosly expensive and you are going to have to pay more than you are used to for a decent hotel room. However, this hotel is gross! The lobby is nice but that is it.  There are no elevators in some of the buildings and basically it kooks like someone took a 1950 california motel and slapped some stucco on it. The building we were in had dirty carpet on the exterior stairs. The riom we were given was musty smelling and bland. As I sat down on the incredibly unconfortable bed a huge piece of the popcorn cieling fell on me. There were pieces of the floorboard missing. Most of the people who were at the hotel were smoking, so if you smoke you may like this. The check in person really made us feel like one of the many many millions

Summary Heading: Relaxed but professional air at this hotel
Summary: Cannot fault this hotel.  Loads of facilities, 3 pools, nice bar, restaurant.  Staff all very helpful & polite.  Quite a relaxed atmosphere which we prefer to the larger hotels.  Breakfast at the bar was great, croissants, breakfast rolls, cereals & I was even able to get soya milk as I'm cow milk intolerant.  Loads of choices of coffee, shakes & juices.  Also a restaurant if you want the full English or hot breakfast.  Always someone front of hotel to call taxis etc.

Summary Heading: Stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach
Summary: Clean rooms with excellent customer service. Very convenient location to sites in Irvine. 3 pools some for kids and some more quiet. Food was excellent and the ambience at the lounge area was superb. My only complaint was the small number of ice machines.

Summary Heading: lovely hotel overlooking newport back bay
Summary: i enjoyed my stay at the hyatt.  It was everything that I expected having researched several hotels in the area before going ahead with Hyatt.  The beds are comfortable, rooms are clean, spacious and well decorated, and furnished.  They have 3 pools, 1 especially for kids. Its in a quiet area but there is some noise from the john wayne airport.  If you want a quick breakfast the bar area is fine offering a range of pastries, cereals, smoothies etc etc at a reasonable price. There is free wifi throughout the hotel and the staff are very helpful - overall a very enjoyable stay

We stayed at the HRNB for a reunion of friends from across the country. We had a great experience. The hotel is older, but very well maintained. Rooms were comfortable and well appointed. We had a great set of rooms that overlooked the little golf course. The balcony was a great place to have coffe in the morning. Lots of little rabbits and squirrels on the greens in the morning. The restaurant was very good. We had breakfast each morning and it was great. Jessica in the restaurant took care of our little group with a smile and efficiency.  Friday night Kenny G did a concert on the hotel grounds and we had a great seat from our balcony. Awesome little perk. Also have to mention Phil from the Valet department. He was friendly and very helpful with directions and speedy service.

We arrived at this hotel on June 27th.  They allowed my husband and I and our two small children to check in early and gave us a room right by the pool/slide.  However, when I was in the room I noticed a pubic hair on one of the sheets.  That caused me to inspect the sheets more closely.  There was orange/reddish caked on matter on another sheet on the same bed and two small blood droplets on the sheet from the second bed as well as another stain.  The cleaning staff was apologetic and came down and replaced the sheets with brand new sheets out of the plastic wrappers and the manager credited us $100.00 but I never felt good about being in the room after that.  Further, I requested a wake-up call to ensure that we would wake early to catch our flight and the call never came.

Very nice place to stay for business or pleasure. I've recently stayed at Hyatt properties in Sacramento and Washington D.C. They are all excellent hotels with wonderful service and attention to detail.

Summary Heading: Engineering in my room 3 out of 4 days
Summary: As someone that travels all over the world, I understand issues happen.  It is all in how it is handled.  I wasn't happy in the handling of the issues and likely wouldn't stay at the hotel again.  We had an air conditioning issue for the first 3 days, engineering came day 2 and 3.  It caused excessive water to get all over the bathroom floor from the ceiling.  Day 4 also had engineering in the room for an hour trying to unclog our sink.  Day 2, the engineer said he would take care of our breakfast.  Didn't happen.  I would suggest a complete refresh of the maintenance program for all rooms.  Be proactive.

Really enjoyed this hotel near the Back Bay. Rooms were very nice and very clean.       Beds very comfortable. Decent size gym for a hotel and 3 nice large pools. Our room was in a quiet area and overlooked the golf course. All of the staff were very friendly and attentive. Breakfast menu had some good choices. Nice area outside the bar to enjoy bar food and drinks. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Value is questianable and unclear rates
Summary: The rooms are nice, however, the hallways and doors look like a motel.  Central reservations was unclear on the total price (I was charged more than I expected as they excluded the resort fee and parking fee) and Central Reservations refused to send an email receipt stating I needed to go online to get a receipt.  Hiding something?

Sleep was impossible The elevator noise was constant Called central reservation  Property was fully booked  In addition room was not cleaned to late pm  Will never return How can a hotel rent a room that is an elevator shaft

We arrived at the hotel, tired from a weekend of soccer tournaments. The outdoor games for the kids perked everyone up immediately. Life size chess and shuffleboard? What could be more fun?!  Inside, the room was modern, lovely, with pizzazz that made the stay special for my 10 year old daughter and my little getaway.   Though close to Fashion Island, and our favorite Cheesecake Factory - Room service was the order of the day. Delicious, quick to the room. We enjoyed the Jacuzzi and pool before turning in for the night. All in all, a wonderful weekend stay. Look forward to returning!

We stayed here for one night in January and were upgraded to a connecting suite. The rooms were beautiful and spacious. However there was dog food pellets everywhere in one of the rooms. When we called about the pellets, they were most apologetic and very accommodating. The location and hotel itself is great and the staff is super friendly.

Was here for a conference.   Great location!  They gave me a harbour view and I really enjoyed sitting outside my room overlooking the harbour and marina.   A number of pools all very well maintained.   Wish I could spend a week here.    Conference food was excellent  Also, gas fire pits all over which is nice at night.

The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach is the perfect hotel whether traveling with family or as a couple!  The hotel staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful!  We experienced the Lobby Lounge and In-Room Dining and were more than pleased with each service and snack/food offerings!  The hotel is a great place to relax and recharge batteries or relationships!

Took my wife and three young children on a business trip with me.  The hotel itself was nice, and the pool amenities were as to be desired.  However, the floor/carpet in the room (Lido Building) was "extremely" filthy, and needed to be professionally cleaned.  Having white linens and spreads, I was continually having to wipe my kids feet with wet wipes to prevent black footprints from showing up on the sheets.  (Sandals come off very easily in the room for young ones).  Bathroom was also very small and congested.  The sink got in the way of the bath tub, which made bathing the kids a bit challenging.  Not a horrible experience, but expected more from a higher end hotel chain.

Felt at home from the time we checked in. Had a great room overlooking Back Bay with a small balcony. We were sorry to leave and are looking forward to our next visit. Not cheap, but good value for the money and great location with a convenient shuttle to Fashion Island shopping and Balboa Island.

This resort was wonderful!  Great service and great room.  They have three great pools and my kids loved it.  They even have beach equipment that you can check out.  The room was clean and the mattresses were good.

Summary Heading: A little old, but great service
Summary: Front counter staff are immensely helpful and polite. If you need food and a drink there's a bar, but with limited options. Nearest malls are a 20-30min taxi ride away. Internet costs extra if you're not on a corporate rate.

A fantastic hotel in a great location for major attractions at Newport Beach. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We travelled from Sydney with 2 children and the staff went above and beyond to accommodate our needs and provide valuable advice. The facilities including 3 swimming pools were well maintained and enjoyable to use, particular the water slide for our children (hours of fun!).

Every time I stay here check in has been easy, staff are friendly and proximity to local favorites is convenient. I was with my family this weekend and they had a blast. prices at the Shor were reasonable and quite delicious. Greg at the bar has made every one of stays in Newport familiar and quite at home.

Perfect blend of casual/elegance. Vacationed with friends and family . We found this a great place for meeting up with our companions and there was never a shortage of activities. Everyone working here was friendly and eager to help whenever they could. We can't wait to return.

For being a Hyatt we expected the room and overall appearance to very nice but found out the room was very average. The grounds had some nice area but not enough. The ground shuttle to two shopping areas was a bonus as there is nothing within a easy walk

This Hyatt resort is a joke.  We booked this hotel due to their amenities which included a kids pool with slides, handicap accessible rooms and accessible access to the entire resort.  Here's the reality.  The kid pool slides were closed and it was explained that they would be open on Thursday.  We were staying Monday-Wednesday and there were tons of kids on property.
