Opening the slides a couple days earlier would've demonstrated super service and hospitality but this resort decided that they are not in the service or hospitality business.  My sister is in a wheelchair and when she and my 78 year old mother checked in, they put them in a room that was not only impossible to find but in a room so far away from the front lobby, a guest had to step in and help.  The guest felt

Please excuse me if I have already written a report on this hotel. I'm experiencing some tech issues.   The hotel and staff are superb, especially Juan in the restaurant and the waitresses and waiters in the lounge and out door setting area.  Our rooms were not ready on arrival so the registration clerk organized our bags so we could continue shopping and sight seeing in the area.  Rooms were clean and well appointed. Room rate was reasonable. Hotel was well placed with a shopping mall up the road. We didn't get a chance to use any of the facilities as we were pressed with our schedule.  We stayed for three nights, we self parked for free.  If we ever travel to Newport Beach again, we know where we will definitely be staying.   GeoMav

Location is good, close to Balboa Island.  Not that people walk here you can walk to Balboa.  It is a Hyatt property, so it meets a certain standard. Rooms updated in 2013 I believe, though the exterior does have that look of So cal in the 60's.  One little note that my girlfriend and I noted is that they have decided to go cheap with the towels and their external towel service.  Would expect better quality for the hotel's standard

Summary Heading: Very nice for families on vacation
Summary: Very nice property that is really good for families.  We stayed on points and the Hyatt waived the resort fee, but charged $25/night for parking.  It's got a putting green next to the pool, ping pong table, water slide at the main pool, and has a few other amenities to enjoy.    The rooms are small and the rooms adjacent to the pool are VERY noisy at night 'till about 10:30pm, even to the point of the hotel providing ear plugs!    Still, it's a great place to stay.  It's location is fantastic if you want to explore other parts of Newport or Corona Del Mar, the weather is almost always nice and the hotel staff seemed ready to please.    If you're ok with the noise and small beds (doubles in all 2 rooms with 2 beds) and rooms, it's a nice place to stay

This is the best place to stay while visiting New Port Beach. They have a wonderful restaurant, service is excellent. Rooms are beautiful and extremely clean. They have two pools, one even has a slide for children the other very private for adults. We always have a wonderful time at this property!

Friendly staff, nice facilities, great rooms.  Vegetarians couldeasily starve at this hotel and surroundings!  Generally a pleasant place to stay, though the staff were remarkably ignorant of interesting places nearby -- particularly those within easy walking distance, e.g., a very pleasant walk straight from the hotel to the Back Bay. Bikes were available for free, but not publicised.

Clean room, comfy bedding, attentive staff, nice ammenities. Walking distance to Balboa Island which has great shops and good food. Would highly recommend this hotel for a business trip or personal trip.

The Hyatt Newporter is in a beautiful location and provides an idea setting for a business meeting. The staff is very well trained, extremely friendly and most accomodating. I would highly recommend this facility for business meeting or just leasure travel as it is outstanding.

Summary Heading: Nice sleeping rooms, good exercise facilities, awkward meeting rooms
Summary: We held a series of business meetings here over the course of 3 days.  The sleeping rooms are excellent.  They have a nice fitness center, good pool and golf course.  The meeting rooms are awkwardly configured with no bathrooms nearby.  To use the facilities, one must exit the meeting room area and pass through SHOR restaurant.  This detracts from the flow of any meeting.  Staff are pleasant and helpful

Returned to the hotel to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We were treated like royalty. The hotel of course has been upgraded since our last visit, We found our room and the grounds very comfortable and inviting. Despite its age, the management has done a good job in maintaining the quality of the hotel. The staff was truly wonderful and could have not have done anything better. We would not think about staying anywhere else in Newport Beach.

Summary Heading: Not Bad But Could Have Been Better
Summary: Came here for a conference and a small vacation.   To start, the resort itself is great. Very nice and accommodating. The staff, other than the bartenders, are all extremely nice and helpful.   First tip is to valet your car. The cost difference isn't so bad and the walk to self parking sucks.   Second tip is that if you are a runner, skip the treadmill and head  behind the resort. There is a beautiful walking trail and park along the water just behind the resort.   Olar is nice. Beds could have been better considering the cost of the stay. But overall nice place.

We stayed at the Newport Beach Hyatt Regency while attending the Jazz Festival, and it was a perfect, relaxed venue.  The people were friendly.  The room was spacious and well-appointed, and the location is great.  The staff was friendly, helpful and welcoming -- definitely made our stay more enjoyable.

My husband and I stayed here to attend the annual Newport Beach Jazz Festival.  The room was very clean and the bed VERY comfortable.  As with any festival there were tons of people there, but when sitting and the bar and ordering drinks and food, the wait staff were exceptional in completing our orders in decent time.  The front desk staff and doormen were very nice and helpful; and I love the fact that you can have pets there!  Since we were there for the Jazz Festival, there were TONS of people there.  Our room faced the sidewalk that everyone used to get to the performance stage.  If you don't want to wake up to lots of people talking VERY early in the morning because they're standing in line waiting to enter the grounds for the concert, don't get a room facing that

I have stayed at this property probably seven times in seven years.  I relax and unwind each time.   I have traveled for both business and please and would highly recommend this property to anyone.  The service is outstanding.  The staff is recognizable from past visits.  Must be a great place to work as well.

Se went with a group of friends to attend the Hyatt Newport Jazz Festival.  A wonderful experience.  Staff is very  professional and accommodating.  Although there was a limited menu, because of the festival, food was good and wait staff was very helpful.

This hotel, while its location has potential on the bay in Newport Beach, is dishonest at best and abusive at worst.  Despite a confirmed reservation, they denied my 80 year old parents their room and sent them to another Hyatt 10 miles away, during a college graduation family weekend.   On a second visit, despite my calling the front desk and confirming, they put my disabled child on a separate floor away from his parents.  They lie and are deceptive, and then offer up these false apologies and do nothing about it.

Very Nice, close to most major beaches in area and retail food chains.  Enjoyed the peace and quiet.  Pool and jacuzzi very clean and inviting.   Staff most helpful and room service was prompt.  Enjoyed business trip.

I stayed at your hotel for the LCPtracker conference the hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. The meeting rooms were very nice and we enjoyed that you had hotel shuttle service to and from the airport as well to the Fashion Island Mall.

Summary Heading: Back Again!!!! at end of Great American Adventure - Where else? Perfect
Summary: Last stop for 4 nights on our tour of America. Been here 4 times before - Perfect place. The wife calls it her Hotel California. Been refurbished since our last stay. Requested our usual room -336 in Catalina block but it was occupied until the next day. Helena, on reception booked us in for a move and gave us a wonderful room in the Balboa block for the night. The concierge moved us the next day. Thank you Helena -you made our stay. As   always, the staff are wonderful. Nice to see  the three friendly servers in the restaurant again - and they remembered us from previous trips. The hotel is perfect. Next to Fashion Island, Balboa Island (paradise), Near to Laguna Beach - Dana Point - Hunting ton Beach - South Coast Plaza - folks you are in an episode of Orange County Housewives

Friendly staff, beautiful views. Room was clean, and recently updated. Television was a flat screen with many movies to choose from. Restaurant menu was unique, fresh, and delicious and the staff friendly and accommodating. Only negative comment is there was no elevator in last building.

Great stay,, try to stay on the main floor.. Don't forget the COOKIES, YUM,YUM...families with children will love the bunk beds. The refreshing lemon and cucumber water makes a world of difference in the lobby area. The doormen and front desk staff are excellent.

Summary Heading: Have dogs must stay in Newport Beach Hyatt
Summary: We love this hotel, very accommodating to our pets.  On top of that the Hyatt resort provides a very relaxing getaway for a quick weekend and even a long stay away.  The rewards program is great and the Visa tied in works well, we charge all our purchases because the rewards add up quick and even when we stay on the rewards program the service is top notch.

Summary Heading: Stayed at the hotel and loved the bar
Summary: My girls had such a great time at the bar with Jeff!!!   With our Dustin Hoffman, look alike - he is our cloudy with meatballs....look alike.   Super fun and we will come back!    The Hyatt would not be the same without him.     Thank you for a fun night !!! Debbie Diablo, Julia Stiles, Carly Simon

Summary Heading: Tired property in need of an update
Summary: My husband and I have stayed here multiple times while visiting family in the area.  While the location is great and the setting lovely, the rooms and facilities are more appropriate to a Holifday Inn.  The housekeeping is indifferent and tardy, the amenities sparse, and the facilities sub-par.  There is no spa (shocking for a beach-area property at these prices) and the valet parking will give you a headache.  The best aspect of this resort is that it is located adjacent to the San Diego Creek bikeway, which is perfect for anyone wanting a long run or bike ride.  Overall, this is a property with a lot of potential which currrently does not live up to its promise.

Summary Heading: Weekend stay for a wedding over priced and under quality
Summary: The hotel employees were outstanding. The rooms were old and tired. Not worth the cost of the room. Added charge for a 9 hole golf course ( i do not play) and expensive parking. Bed mattresses were worn, towels were cheap, pillows were flimsy. I have stayed at other Hyatt Regencys at a lower price with significantly higher quality rooms.  self parking is a long hike . valet takes time to receive the car.

Summary Heading: Lovely bayside room w/balcony overlooking Newport Bay.
Summary: The hotel has been under renovations,  I requested a newly renovated room.  The check in clerk handed me two slips for a couple of cocktails, Sweet!  My room, 3 floors up from front desk was immaculate.  I requested a makeup mirror & robe before my arrival and boom, there they were.  Great food on the room service menu, quick delivery and the staff very friendly.  I highly recommend this hotel as well as the Hyatt Regency in Huntington Beach, which has a spa.

Great location near Newport Beach,  Balboa Island, Fashion Island and nice restaurants. Resort fees for nothing and mandatory valet parking added almost $60 per day.  We will look elsewhere the next visit to Newport Beach

The ONE thing to ensure about this hotel is NOT to get placed in a room in the lido  block . We did but asked to get moved which they did without any fuss they were very pleasant about it actually . It is a good location, the staff are very efficient if mixed in terms of friendliness . The room we eventually got moved to was clean, well appointed great for our five night stay . Good view and quiet it was in the BALBOA building . The family pool is good but noisy with kids .. The adult pool is great ... There is a pool at the lido wing but it resembles a 70's motel . The other thing to watch are the exorbitant resort fees and self parking which is a hike away from the main building . These fees really add up and ...my fault... caught me by surprise . it won't happen again asI

Summary Heading: The Place to Stay in Newport Beach
Summary: I stayed a second time at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach this year and again I was not disappointed.  This time I stayed in one of the Villas and had a nice view of the marina. The room was plenty big and had everything I needed.    The hotel has a ton of amenities and a fantastic restaurant called 'Shor' and the bar is a great place to hang out and meet new people - always something going on.  The bartenders are really knowledgeable and friendly.  The whole hotel has beautiful landscaping and a great outdoor sitting area with a gas fire along the wall as well as a library to read or do some work.  I will stay here again and would recommend it to any of my friends (already have).  Plus, its very close to downtown Newport Beach- and a short drive to John Wayne Airport. :)

I came here for a business event and it was my second time spending a week or so. It's a great location, near the beach, golf courses, kiddie pools, tube slides, decent restaurant and plenty of open spaces. That said, it can get expensive rather quickly and the hotel shuttle runs on a fixed schedule so keep that in mind.

Except for our waiter in the SHOR restaurant, the service at this hotel was terrible. Bartenders talking sports and inappropriately playing grabass and not waiting on customers.  Staff were generally listless and didn't seem to care about the guests.  This is one of the few negative reviews about anywhere that I've ever posted.  Do not go to this hotel - at least not now (if they ever get their stuff together it is such a great physical venue that it COULD be a heckuva place to vacation).

All the staff were very accommodating! Best service I have ever had at a large hotel. I Hosted a dinner for 13 people and the food was excellent as was the wait staff. Chef knows what he is doing! Everyone in my party were impressed with the service and food.

Summary Heading: Resort fee & valet charge exorbitant for very average hotel
Summary: When my mom comes to town, she enjoys staying at the Hyatt, so we get her a room for the weekend.  Although this hotel has made vast improvements over the last few years, it is just a very average hotel with ridiculous additional fees. In my Trip Advisor reviews, I am not one to complain about resort fees or parking costs, however, in this particular case, I think that $34 for valet parking and $23 for a resort fee is ridiculous.  To me, this is an old hotel that has been refurbished and is trying to be a resort by tacking on a  $57/night cost. The Grand Hyatt Kauai, a much nicer property, has a $25 resort fee and a $15 valet charge per night, which is completely reasonable for that resort.  To compare local hotels, The Montage Laguna Beach has no resort fee and valet parking is

This hotel was very nice. Three pool areas. Large tube slide at one pool for children.  Golf course. Restaurant had a really good breakfast.  Our room was decent.  Bathroom was awkward with the toilet literally right next to the shower but we were in a lower end room. Pretty grounds and clean. Very close to shopping and restaurants at Fashion Island. Would go back for sure.

Stayed for 25 th Wedding Anniversary , in Balboa building. Resort is nice with great grounds used complementary   shuttle  to Balboa Island .  Diamond Hyatt members so breakfast is complementary, recommend crab benedict .

We had a great stay at this property.  The proximity to an awesome pool was probably the feature we enjoyed the most!  That was excellent.  We appreciated that there were tons of pool loungers.  I loved the bathroom area for the mirrors and the lighting....just wish the shower and toilet area had a seperate door. It is important to get a good rate.  This is not a luxury hotel.  But the employees were super friendly and helpful and I would most certainly stay here again!

I stayed here for 2 nights - very relaxed atmosphere, with outdoor lounge seating, quaint restaurant and bar.  Food and drinks were of high quality and delicious.  Room was clean, bed comfortable.  The staff is very attentive.  I forgot my cosmetics bag at home and inquired where the nearest department store was during check-in, and not only did I get directions to Fashion Island (only a half mile away), but was also given a complimentary bag of essentials, i.e., toothbrush, makeup remover, etc.   This saved me from having to visit the department store AND Target.

Nice stafff and the property is always clean but an old and tired facility that is not up to typical Hyatt standards.  While the rooms and public spaces have been upgraded, the overall feel is very ordinary.  There are other Hyatt's in the area, namely the Huntington Beach location that is exceptional and well worth the extra $$.  This location is nice in it's proxiimity to JW airport and Newport Beach however the owners would do well to really upgrade the overall property.  I can't help but feel like this is an old "middle of the road" hotel with Hyatt slapped on the side of the building.

Summary Heading: It just keeps getting  better and better
Summary: I stay here while I visit my daughter and son in law in Newport Beach. I would never stay anywhere else. Employees love working here, and it shows! My daughter and her husband hung out at the pool with me, and we ate outside on the patio every night. Food is awesome. You can't beat this place for relaxation and fun.

A good hotel - service is first class, rooms a little dated but still very acceptable. Restaurant & bar meals all good value & great quality. Good leisure center , a little small but still better than many hotels. There is a Hertz renta car on site which is convenient. A good stay in a friendly warm atmosphere - recommended

Stayed here for four nights and loved it.  Beautiful grounds along with multiple pools.  The restaurant has delicious food and great smoothies.  Loved the multigrain pancakes with fresh fruit.  Lunch was excellent too with great soup, sandwiches, and salads.  Great wine selection too!  Our room was great, comfortable beds along with large bathroom.  Would highly recommend.  Used the shuttle service to go to dinner near the huge mall and of course took it to go to Balboa Island.  We felt we did not need a car as the shuttle also goes to the airport.  If you do want to rent a car, there is a Hertz rental on site next to gift shop.

The Hyatt Regency Newport is more a resort style than a hotel. We stayed here for business and I would have preferred another hotel. For holidays / leisure for a weekend this hotel is nice, however everything is located quite remotely.  Some of the rooms ask for some walking and also the (self)parking is located behind the hotel and one has to descend and climb a steep hill every time you want to use your car.  The rooms are okay and have all amenities, however some details might need some extra attention (the curtain of my room could not cover the whole window, the room was located on one of the remote building and the room had to be accessed from outside, people walking by could glimpse into your room, didn't feel very comfortable.  Service was really good as my room was

This hotel is a beautiful hotel with a full service staff and plenty of fun amenities for families and couples.  It is located in a gorgeous area with plenty of nearby activities to keep you busy.  We will definitely be returning to this hotel soon!

Excellent location, friendly staff, buzzy bar scene, three large pool areas and attractive, mature gardens.  Room was large and well equipped with a comfortable, large, bed though the view from our balcony was pretty uninspiring, overlooking the car park.  Service was slightly spotty - erratic newspaper delivery, sometimes we received bottled water and sometimes didn't.  My daughter's room was not cleaned one day, until she complained about it.  Both she and my son had rooms with connecting doors and both rooms were very noisy indeed with every detail of the guests next-door's middle of the night rows able to be heard.  In fact my son moved rooms at 4 am as it was impossible to get any rest due to the noise.  Overall though, we enjoyed our stay and would return if in the area.

This property is very nice, located near the beach, with several amenities including shuttle service.  We were fortunate enough to get upgraded to one of six villa rooms.  Very cool!  Great for couples and leisure travel.

Hotel is in a great location...close to shopping and the beach.  Staff is very friendly and hotel is clean.  Only problem is how close the shower is to the toilet in the guest room.  If you are overweight, it might be hard to get the shower turned on.

We stayed here for a half marathon run. The hotel couldn't have relaxed us or prepared us anymore for our run the next day. Top notch staff and service. The rooms were secluded, quiet, and clean. The pool we chose was quiet and just what we needed. We'll be back.

We were assigned a very dark, musty, depressing room that was reminiscent of a Motel 6. We were right down by the pool which was very noisy with lots of kids screaming in it and music blaring. I had specifically asked for a bathtub and got a very outdated shower instead. We will never book here again.

The hotel has been upgraded to a very lovely status. The venue could not be nicer. The staff and the hotel were very accommodating. The catered food is outstanding. The only downside was the quality of the restaurant food

The rooms are very nice.  But when we walked up to the buildings I said they looked like a Motel 6,  The one hottub was cold but the main one was very warm.  They do offer a shuttle bus down to Balboa Island and a free shuttle to the airport.  But it's overpriced for where and what it is.

Summary Heading: Very pretty hotel with everything you need
Summary: Loved my stay here. The resort fee includes loads of stuff like water, wifi and shuttle buses to 2 shopping places and airport.    The lobby bar is very trendy, with outdoor fire pits, but in   the morning it transforms to a buzzy breakfast and coffee bar. Loved that aspect.      All rooms have balconies, and although ours overlooked the entrance, it was fine at night to sit and have a coffee, which was complimentary in the room.      We saw 3 pools, and also there were at least 1 other wine bar and restaurant.  The reception staff were really helpful, and we would definitely stay here again

We came to the Hyatt Regency to check in at 2:45 (we were 15 minutes early), they told us that the room we requested would not be ready for awhile. We gave them our number, and went to Fashion Island to walk around and grab a coffee. We got a call, but missed it and came back to the hotel. They told us that the room was still not ready and offered us a temporary room for us to stay in, and promised they would call our room and cell when it was ready. at 8:15 I called the front desk (our dinner reservation was at 8:30) and asked if the room was ready. They said it was and asked if we would like our room key delivered to us (since our room was close to where they had put is, we agreed) 30 minutes later nobody had come and we went to the front desk to get the keys. The girl that

Fist the positive...The hotel is good landscaping, the rooms are clean, and the staff is very courteous. For the negative ..the food overall is below average...the buffet is not for the health conscious , with very limited selections, which most are  high in sugar or flower based.  The menu is average or below average...I never seen Caesar Sallad made  with red leaf lettuce, Romain lettuce is the choice for lettuce , because of the crispness...and the  Caesar sauce was horrible.  The pool area was crowded, with no service of any kind. You have to call for service by phone.  The presentation of the food in a paper box ,I have never seen..I just looks bad. My suggestion would be nice  white plastic plate for safety.  These comments made are not meant to in bad taste, but only to

Whether you're traveling for business or pleasure I'd recommend this hotel.The grounds are beautiful and the view from my patio, at sunset, was breathtaking.  There are plenty of activities near the hotel, including shopping, biking, sailing and swimming.  There are many restaurants locally, both chain restaurants (The Cheesecake Factory) and local favorites.

Bugs in the room, pruning of trees and bushes all day, sink would not drain, Internet was intermittent...beautiful location, nice pool, good food and amazing service!  Nice paths for walking and fitness center. 3 pools, 1 water slide, could use another hot tub. Parking was a bit inconvenient. Nice size rooms...further than would like from the beach. The hotel needs to get cleaned up but then will be a very nice property.

We have stayed here twice- great location- close to airport, beaches and an easy drive to Disneyland-  Nice staff, lovely pool area - boys loved the waterslides- and a fun par 3 golf course on the bay- a great value!

This was a delightful place to stay.  The landscaping was immaculate & lovely with flowers blooming in usual & unusual locations.  The rooms & beds were clean, comfortable  & well appointed.  The public areas were inviting, varied & pleasant to enjoy.

Great location and wonderful greeting from Morgan at check-in.  He made us feel important and took the time to ensure our stay would be just the way we wanted it to be.  Appetizers in the Lobby Bar were awesome!  Also, Newport Dunes is within walking distance.

Loved the room, the service the pools and the location.  It was close to the places I wanted to visit and to the beach.  Laguna Beach is a short drive away.  The hotel staff was friendly, the room very clean and the grounds are beautiful.

The hotel is located a mere fifteen minutes from Orange County Airport (John Wayne) and a short walk from Newport Beach. The staff at the front desk is welcoming and helpful. The service at the lobby lounge is very good and the quality of the food was good although a bit pricey. There is plenty of outdoor space and the grounds are well kept. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

The staff and lobby are as nice as you can get in a 60 year old facility, but the resort fee and ridiculous parking rates made me feel ripped off. Add to that the high City taxes and my room cost me 50% more than the quoted rate.

Excellent...Wonderful...A beautiful well maintained resort. I was here celebrating my birthday and I was not disappointed at all. It Has everything you need right there at your fingertips. No need to go else were. It would be nice to have a microwave though......

I last visited this hotel in September 2011 and decided not to return because the hotel needed to be renovated - the rooms smelled musty and the general property showing wear and tear of a popular hotel.  In the immediate area were better choices. I decided to return and I am glad I did. The hotel has been renovated - lobby, rooms and terraces, a new restaurant and bar.  The general property looked much improved also. This hotel is now on my list of Newport Beach hotels to return to and I make my final decision based upon price. Valet staff is welcoming and polite and the Lobby staff is genuinely glad that you have chosen to stay at their hotel.  The rooms are updated, clean and comfortable. The bar serves light breakfast fare in the morning and is a full fledged bar in the

Summary Heading: I enjoyed my trip but overall this is still a 3.5 STARS resort
Summary: I am still here for another day but I figure, I will write this review.   I truly think the staff/employees work really hard to make this resort a 4 STARS and i Thank them for that, BUT....  Rooms: Bathroom are updated (they look nice) but the sleeping area is not. The beds are average (comfortable enough to sleep) but they do make a lot of noises. I read a lot of comment about wall being too thin (well it is True). I was ok with it the first night, but the Sec Night I can hear every one. This is where they loss a STAR for me.   The rooms have no privacy, ppl who walk around can peak through the window ( not once we moved out curtains because we did not wanted people to see our room), Balcony same thing (every one can see you). Another 1/2 of STAR was loss here.  Rooms at the

What an awesome time I had this week. The property is immaculate, staff is awesome including Morgan at front desk, Ehran at bellman, and Kristina at the lounge,the best server in SOCAL! Highly recommend this Hotel! Oh, also a 9 hole course on campus!

Stayed here for a week with my family in April. Beautiful gardens and spacious comfortable clean guest rooms. All the staff very friendly and helpful. The choice of restaurants limited to only one plus the bar food menu. But the staff in both are well trained and very sociable. To name a few, Rob, Julio and Hachara were great. I would have given the hotel an overall rating of 5 but I found it outrageous to pay $34 for valet parking or $25 self parking per day when the hotel rooms cost over $250 per night and boasts having 26 acres of garden space. I could have understood paying for parking if the location was downtown.  But we still had an enjoyable week.

Great place for a conference. Great staff, wonderful food, and nice accommodations!  For a conference, it was well put together with what we were doing. Staff was very helpful and accommodating as well. Easy flowing from room to room and location of our lunches, snacks and meetings.

I was here for a night with a friend just to get out of town. I think the hotel is very nice and clean, staff is friendly and will be staying here again. Parking is not free , it's by the freeway so request to have a room far from it to minimize the noise.

Everything was absolutely perfect.  The staff were friendly, competent and very helpful.  The areas where our events took place were wonderful.  All the food which was served was very good.  They sure have their act together.  The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained.  There are a lot of lovely areas scattered around the property where people can sit and enjoy the view.  The pool has a colorful and fun water slide.  Everything was beautiful and sparkling clean.  Great hotel.

I have always been comfortable staying at the Hyatt, and this trip for a travel convention was no different.  Comfortable, clean rooms, fun pool with a slide for the kids to enjoy, multiple pools on the property so you don't feel crowded in any one of them, and good Hyatt food and service.  All in all, nice stay after spending a few days in the hustle and bustle of Disneyland.  Conference food was excellent, conference rooms were comfortable (not overly air conditioned), and staff was great.  I look forward to my next stay and will happily recommend to my clients in the future.  Oh, and did I mention the location??  Fantastic!  Close to Balboa Island, Corona Del Mar, Laguna Beach, Fashion Island.  All my favorite Orange County spots!

Summary Heading: Excellent experience, friendly staff and quiet location
Summary: My fiancee traveled to Newport Beach for a school conference, and I caught up wit her after it was over. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach and had an excellent experience all around.   The 2nd floor room was spacious, clean and had a cute balcony that we enjoyed each morning for breakfast. There is a star bucks in the hotel lobby, so be sure to check it out for your morning fix! The hotel staff were courteous, friendly and all of our requests were met. The washroom was also clean and spacious. I enjoyed the layout of the resort, which has a small golf course, pool, and several walking paths.  The free shuttle service was great, with pickup/drop off points at John Wayne Airport, Fashion Island mall and near Balboa island. However, we ended up walking directly from

Summary Heading: Incredible staff...free shuttle and great food.
Summary: All of our interactions with staff were top-notch; from our early check in, equipment/bicycle rentals, and restaurant service, The on-site menu and bar were incredible, and the options for dining nearby provide great variety. The complimentary shuttle service to the airport and nearby Fashion Island/Balboa is a nice bonus.  The property is an older one, which means that the landscaping is mature and beautiful, but the stairs could be hard for some to navigate. The rooms are nicely renovated, with a number on the ground floor with decks opening to the outside of the property--this makes for great, relaxed settings for groups, but check other options if this is not what you prefer in a property.

The property is difficult to navigate with luggage; it's built into a hillside- so there are steps everywhere. Sure there are ADA ramps, but they are not close to where you can obviously see that you need to go. The TV signal randomly went out in our room a couple times. Yeah, I know, first world problems. But for $269 a night, I'd expect better. Then, the GFI electrical outlet went out in our bathroom- of course it wouldn't reset. Yes, they sent a repair man to fix it, after we had already gotten ready for the day (in the dark) and left. The room was also quite small. It was well appointed and the bathroom was nice. Finally, I'd requested one King bed, but none was available. They did offer to upgrade me to a double Queen room- for $75 more - which we did not do. So we stayed

Wanted a nice place to stay after going to Disneyland with my kids. The Hyatt Regency was excellent. The waterslide at the main pool kept my kids entertained while mommy and daddy relaxed in the sun. Will def be back!

Loved the rate! Loved the breakfast! The restaurant was great and the staff remembered us and was soooo cute with the kids!  The fresh baked cookies in the lobby were super yummy. The bell hop/valets were very polite and gave both of the kids toys upon check in! That was such a great and personal touch!  Cucumber water and lemon water was always in the lobby, super convenient and refreshing.   The pool, the main one with the water slide was so fun and there is even a splash pad! The kids and my husband and I loved playing ping pong by the pool, and playing shuffleboard and life sized chess was great as well.  The room was very modern and spacious! Clean, comfy, loved the color scheme!   Not having complimentary wifi in room is annoying and dated.   A short drive to laguna and an

The Newport Hyatt has a wonderful staff, beautiful grounds, great restaurants and shopping nearby, and it is a great location close to the bay and near the beach.  There are multiple pools and water features for the kids.  You can go for a nice run around the bay on a place just across the street.   In the summer they have great concerts just outside you room.

I have stayed at this property several times and I am never disappointed.  The staff is friendly and attentive, the services excellent.  Great Newport Beach location.  expansive resort property with multiple pools.  recently renovated and in a convenient location.  You can't go wrong here.

My family decided to visit Newport Beach. We decided to stay at the Hyatt due to reviews on Trip Advisor. The customer service from the Check-in to the Shuttle driver was absolutely excellent! they were attentive and very professional with a genuine concern for their guest. Also as we waited for our shuttle observing the Valet service they were so attentive in their service. We had a room on the 2nd floor next to the pool. The room was small. However, clean!! I thought the room would be noisy next to the pool but it was not. We had a peaceful sleep. The Hyatt provide a free shuttle to John Wayne Airport every 30 minutes and Fashion Island and Balboa Island every 2 hours. The pool was beautiful with beach towels provided. They also provide bicycles to their guest. Balboa Island

We absolutely enjoyed our stay at this hotel in Newport Beach!!  It was fantastic.  The pools are great.   Loved the "doggie bar"!!  The grounds were beautifully landscaped.  The layout of hotel services are very convenient and the lobby bar is first class!!  And we love bartender Greg.  He's very attentive and a pleasure to visit with.  Hotel Operator Stephanie was a gem and handled all our requests promptly and professionally.  This was our first trip to this area, and the main reason we chose to stay in Newport Beach was the Hyatt.  We will DEFINITELY be coming back, when the Los Angeles Angels start their 2015 season.  We are Gold Passport Hyatt members and your hotel will be listed among the many folios we now have with Hyatt Hotels.

Fifth stay at this hotel and it gets better every time. I always enjoy my stay here and this time was no different. The rooms are always well done and the restaurant was excellent for breakfast. I've eaten there for dinner in the past but not this trip and those meals were delicious too. Friendly staff, very nice shuttle service and a nice property.

Older hotel with thin walls, didn't sleep well this entire trip.  Location is great, staff is great, but the hotel itself is older.  They needed brighter lighting in the room and magnifying mirrors in the bathroom.  One of it's best features is the showers, water pressure was great.

Summary Heading: Hotel that is worth a try!
Summary: The Hyatt is currently remodeling this property.  Please don't let that deter you from staying here.  Great staff, location and soon to be grounds.  Stayed for business but would like to go back for a long weekend or longer at some point.

Summary Heading: Older cali charm and a great resort
Summary: This resort is quite a sight it has several pools (including a waterslide), a 9 ole golf course (included in resort fees)  a great walking trail along the newport basin.  The room appointments were hyatt quality , it was spacious and comfortable. The staff was very helpful.

I loved the look and feel of the Hyatt in Newport Beach. Our room looked out onto a nice patio with a courtyard and pool. Very nice setting and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The hotel staff were very nice and the shuttles were excellent since I didn't have a car with me. The only con was I had to ask for maid service after 2 days with none. They did come immediately though. I would definitely go back.

Although the property was undergoing some improvements while I was there, I found  this hotel to be very quiet and beautifully landscaped. All of the staff were friendly and professional, the lobby lounge and patio were comfortable and casual. The pool areas fun and inviting or quiet and calm (there were a few to choose from). Easy access to Fashion Island, Balboa Island & the coast. Shuttle service to local attractions and the airport. The meeting rooms and catering were great as well.

Summary Heading: Great atmosphere, staff and pool areas
Summary: I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff were great - I really enjoyed George the Shuttle driver (they have a shuttle to Fashion Island, Balboa Island and the Airport). Front desk staff were kind and ensured I had an effortless check in and out.  The pool areas are great - I didn't ever find them busy and they are open until 10 pm so you can have a late night dip without issue. The gym is open 24 hours a day which is nice (only at night, it was a little to warm for my Canadian blood) and there wasn't a restroom inside the gym - you had to go to the pool area.  The Shor restaurant was great and the tapas in the lobby were also amazing. The lobby really feels very much like a resort. I would definitely consider staying here again. I wish I would have golfed.  This would be a great

Summary Heading: Perfect Weekend Getaway - Close to Beach, Balboa Peninsula and So Much More
Summary: From the moment you enter the Hyatt Regency's sprawling grounds, vacation starts. A modern lobby recently remodeled with plenty of seating areas, cool warm tones accented with splashes of bright beach turquoise and peach makes a great atmosphere for morning coffee or afternoon cocktails.  Three pools, with plenty of plush lounge chairs and beds, a  fitness room complete with outdoor spin bikes and whimsical yard games like giant chess, shuffle board and horse shoes to entertain guests of all ages.  We really enjoyed, and took full advantage of the onsite cruiser bikes. The bike / run path behind the resort wonders through an ecological preserve for just over ten miles. Also, A stone's throw down the road is balboa island where you can catch the ferry to the peninsula to ride the

Summary Heading: Resort fee and parking fee adds up to close to $40.  May not be an gool hotel for business traveler.
Summary: I have a job in Lake Forest, quite a drive from the hotel.  I just here just to check it out.  $25 for parking is not bad,but then the resort fee of $19.  They add up to close to $40.  I had a hard time explaining to my client who pay for it why I pick this hotel instead of cheaper and closer hotels without parking fee and resort fee.   I used one of my free suite upgrades to stay in a suite.  It was fine.  I  am a diamond member , so I get free breakfast.  I tried the steak and eggs ($17) and breakfast Beritto ($15).  They were good and reasonably priced.    It is a long walk to the parking lot after paying $25.  It is OK if I come here for vacation.  For business travel,  I would go some place else, unless management waive the resort fee and give me a discount on parking.

Hotel grounds are very beautifully kept. The hotel itself is a bit different from a traditional 'tower' like hotel but I think that's what gives this hotel its charm. The lobby is inviting, the pools are very nice and the rooms are clean, nice and very roomy. (bigger than a traditional room). We stayed in the Balboa building and it was just perfect. We had a great time and took advantage of the free golf, bikes, and various games around the hotel grounds. We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was delicious! Our waiter was awesome and very attentive. I read a few reviews stating that some people were frustrated with the walk to the 'self' parking lot, really? What's a 2 minute walk? CA's weather is beautiful, enjoy it! We will definitely stay here again.

this hotel is not ideal for business travelers. the first room offered backed onto an open pit where the pool construction was going on. We moved to a ground floor room adjacent to the other pool but it was noisy. The hotel plays music from 9am to 8pm so not conducive to quiet enjoyment. Found hair in the bathtub, otherwise the room was clean.

Stayed 3 nights in March 2015 for a business meeting. Hotel has excellent location and good service but the dining experience at SHOR restaurant was less than desirable. Arrived at 3:00 pm but had to wait 2 and half hours since the room was not clean. The front desk however was quick to apologize and offered compensation. Our first room had a leaking toilet but was corrected quickly. During the breakfast, the omelet was too greasy but the morning manager quickly corrected it offered credit towards dinner. Dinner experience was not good. The server was too busy to attend guests and not very friendly. Rooms in Cantalina building on 3rd floor have good views. Some buildings were under renovation. Building and grounds are maintained well. Free shuttle to Fashion Island and Balboa

Pros: Rooms were great, housekeeping phenomenal. Staff overall very accommodating. Pool area very nice, food in the hotel bar was very good. Cons: property Very inconvenient to navigate, one elevator at the far end served the entire building I occupied. Self Parking is available at an exorbitant rate, especially considering that you need to pack a lunch to get to the parking lot and back from the rooms! Valet parking also quite high priced. Stale, musty odor in the hallways but does not penetrate into the rooms.

Do not expect this to be a Hyatt experience that you are used to. Considering the locale, it could be much more luxurious and expensive. The rooms are average, and the bathrooms tiny. Some of the grounds are currently under construction. Amenities are basic. Although it does not live up to the Hyatt reputation for quality, the staff were excellent, and the location is good for a business trip to Irvine or surrounding Orange county. If you are motivated by the snob appeal or Newport Beach, and can afford it, there are probably better choices.

Summary Heading: Not what i would expect from the Hyatt Regency...
Summary: parts of it was nice..other parts could use a face lift. The pool area the cabanas need new cushions & tents look a bit shabby:( Service for food was inconvenient You had to walk out of pool area & go up some stairs.. Food was terrible & quite expensive for 2-adults & 1 child $75:(. Definitely branch out go to Fashion Island or the beach to grab a meal!! Evening time had some gross appetizers:( Rooms were nice, clean updated:)

The hotel did not look like a typical hotel or resort, each building was a ways from one another and smaller than the usual tower you think of when you think hotel. The staff was very polite and accommodating. Check in and check out were effortless. Both pool areas were gorgeous, the views are amazing, and the facility itself is clean. The rooms are of average size but the beds seemed smaller than usual. The rooms were clean and looked just like the pictures, however there were some cracks, spots, and dents in a few things. The toilet did not seemed to be glued down or nailed down properly, it moved a little when getting up or sitting down. The experience was a good one however for the price I have stayed in nicer establishments. I would reccomend this place to middle aged and

We stayed in a family room in modern two storey annexe, think the original rooms are a little more cramped, but we had a lovely 5 night stay. Car an essential, although they do offer a shuttle bus service. Crystal Cove, Beach and Back Bay definite highlights.

Summary Heading: Puppy friendly, people comfortable, but aging
Summary: When we are in the Newport area, and travelling with our dog Kelly, we usually book the Newport Hyatt Regency. Hard to beat the location and service. Just like me, they are starting to show their age, and while the Hyatt folks are keeping up with the maintenance, this property needs a makeover, IMHO. This property has not changed much since we lived in the area 30+ years ago. The lobby area, while comfortable, has relatively low ceilings, and is not the "grand space" conducive to a cocktail and people watching. Having said all that, we will be back because they treat you well, and do the things they control quite well.

I stayed here in November and i loved it! The location is great, right across the road from Fashion Island which is an amazing outdoor mall. Just to the back of the hotel is Back Bay and you can hire bikes (free) an go a 10 mile cycle over Back Bay. Beautiful in the morning and so peaceful!  The rooms are a great size, we had a room with 2 queen beds as i traveled with a friend. The beds are super comfy and the rooms are so clean and fresh. Bathrooms are really modern and the lighting makes you look really tan in the mirror which i loved (lol).   The hotel has 3 pools. One pool was gated off, not sure if it was because it was winter and not really pool season! The pool thats gated off was lovely they have a lot of funky day beds and a little parsnip hideaway which you will see

We came for a 3 day weekend and had a blast. From the welcome at the bell stand to the front desk , the Shor restaurant - everyone was smiling, friendly, welcoming and accomodating. One of the best hotel experiences that we have had ever! Close to every attraction - Balboa, Hunington Beach, Fashion Island, and close to many great restaurants.  Our room was clean and quiet with a golf course view , which we asked for, I would visit this property again and absolutely recommend it for anyone wishing to stay in the area.

This Hyatt has more outdoor amenities than most of the other Hyatts i've stayed at. The 9 hole golf course is a neat little layout and an easy way to get some exercise while having fun at this Hyatt. The Newport back Bay marina is within walking distance thru the West parking lot. Additionally Balboa Island can be reached by walking South on Jamboree. Very nice room and staff was the usual Hyatt very efficient, and pleasant. Hope to return soon.

Summary Heading: Great location and a resort hotel
Summary: Loved this place.  Its located beside the Newport Bay.  You can access the trail by exiting the back of the hotel and turn right.  About 1 block to the entrance.  This hotel also has it's own golf course - its a pitch and putt 9 hole. We were in the Balboa building and it is far from the parking lot.  Friendly bar tenders.

Summary Heading: The Newporter has been redone properly
Summary: In the 1970s and 1980s i stayed at the original newporter. My recent stay was very pleasing. The place has been rebuilt in a way that retains the original charm i experienced in the 1970s when newport beach was decidely less congested and the roads were not 3 lanes in each direction.  We rented a conference room for a single day of meetings And it became clear that the staff is unusually competent.

Business conference being held at location. Maybe because I received a discounted rate I was just "lucky" and received room on outside corridor(which made it seem more like a motel) and was facing pool construction area. Room was clean(only issue was stained pillowcase)and quiet. Parking at $25.00 per day was high especially with resort fee. If paying full price I would probably look at other hotels in area, but hotel did serve it's purpose of giving me a restful nights sleep. Grounds very well-kept.

Summary Heading: Good Service and Fun Lobby Bar are Highlights
Summary: Agree with the previous poster it is an interesting set up with a variety of buildings.  I had an unusual room with an outside entrance facing one of the pools.  Property feels a bit like a mini-resort vs. a full resort.  Walked the grounds and it is nice but not great property.  The lobby/bar area and service are highlights of the property.  Not much more to add.

Newport (Beach) Hyatt. You'd be expecting some sort of beach, etc. They have a Bay. Which is filthy. I mean cups and paper and glass everywhere. Pools were nice. Go to lay in a chair and they're FILTHY!! Bird poop all over them. Stains on the pillows. Food on them. Filthy!! Rooms are decent. Otherwise everything else is dirty.

We stayed in the hotel as our last stop from SFO to LA.  Since we do not wanted to stay in LA we choose a place out of LA but close to Disneyland.  From Newport it is only a short drive to Disney which we planned to visit. We liked the set up of the hotel, you walk in in the lobby and from and the rooms and pool are behind a few levels down. Behind the lobby is a spacious bar and reading area and you can as well sit outside in the garden area.  The pool is really big and nice for kids with a slide. There is a whirlpool as well for the time when the sunshine is gone.   We had a room facing the pool, the corridor is open to the outside which is some what the style there. The room was quite clean and had a nice bathroom as well.  To go around you need a car, since the hotel is

The hotel is nice. Rooms are a little small but the pool, jacuzzi, water slide, miniature golf, and atmosphere makes up for it. The staff are friendly and courteous. The parking is a little over priced. If you have kids, this is a great choice.

We stayed for 5 nights here.   Really good food, tropical and close to everything.   We rode our bikes down the trail to the back bay and also over to Balboa from here.   Room was nice and clean as well as the pool.   Staff was excellent.   Nice to have a patio to sit outside.

visited in march 2012, on business. staff was nice, nice hotel and surrounding area, golf course, gym very resorty-there was a shuttle provided. everything is a distance so you need a car to get round. it took over 1hr from airport to hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for this update well kept up hotel
Summary: I found this to be quite a value.  The property is sprawling and well maintained.  The lobby and rooms are all tastefully updated.  We stayed during valentine's day weekend and had a terrific stay.  Things to know is that they charge a lot for parking, I think $24 so the $34 valet is the better way to go.  Also we stayed close to the pool and were disturbed by the loud piped in music around the pool area.  So unless you have kids and want to be in view of the pool, try rooms that face the golf course.  They did tone it down when we complained.

Summary Heading: The front desk person took a disliking to me
Summary: When I checked in, the young girl on the front desk told me that they were sold out of king-sized beds, which I reserved, and offered to give me an upgraded room with two-double beds. Well, she actually gave me a handicapped room with a full/queen-sized murphy bed. She sent me by way of Timbuktu to get there, when the room was just across the parking lot. When I got to the room, I realized what she had done and complained. I spoke with the manager, who gave me a different room and a free breakfast for my trouble. I asked if she was new at her job, the manager said she wasn't. I said to him that she must have taken a disliking to me. He never denied that but said that he would talk with her. That set the tone for a very unpleasant stay. The free breakfast was good though.

They have renovated the whole place, It looks great.  Service was pretty good, the accommodations we good. The self parking is can be far depending on what location of your building. It's $24 per day self parking and $34 for valet.  They are adding an additional pool to one of the building complex due to be done by the end of February. For those of you that care the gym has great equipment.

I would have given them a lower rating had they not tried to make it nice for valentines day. The hotel is beautiful but the rooms are small and pricey. I have never heard of a major chain that the largest bed they have available is a queen sized bed, the room the stuck me in had two full sized beds, since I am 6 foot tall, the only way I would be able to sleep in a bed like that is diagonal. In these modern times I would also expect some sort of wifi in the room, crappy hotels like Holiday Inn and Best Western have wifi, but a Hyatt? Also they charge 35 for valet or 20 something for self parking, valet I can see but when self parking is almost as much, valet is just easier. The nicest thing I can say about the room is it was clean and was pretty, but I will never stay here

Summary Heading: Nice break from the cold in Canada
Summary: Spent 4 nights here attending a conference.  Lovely resort undergoing to updates.  Room was lovely and the housekeeping was outstanding.  Food at the conference was outstanding.  Nice relaxing bar and very friendly staff.  Pool was nice and grounds are well kept.  Internet charges over the top so I just used my phone.  Meeting rooms the Plaza had lousy acoustics and the audio service was not great.  Really like the hotel.

This hotel is on s huge campus with pools and other recreational attractions. The rooms are a good side, comfortable and mine has a patio to a pool.   It's close to the marina.   I was here on business so the holidaymakers roaming around was unusual but not unpleasant.   No only ate breakfast in the restaurant - it was good but expensive.

Summary Heading: Neat throwback property next to beautiful backbay
Summary: First off the front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  My room was very nice with a king bed overlooking the courtyard pool.  The property has this interesting 1960s feel to it with the motel type layout.  I love the landscaping on the grounds.  The best part is on my two mornings is that i could walk out and be in the backbay in 5 minutes.  Very picturesque and relaxing nature scenery.  I enjoyed strolling along the park road with bikers and joggers in the early morning chill.

Stayed here for work, room was beautiful unfortunately I was never there. Not much to do in area, need a car. Grounds are gorgeous and lush, like Jurassic park!  Only regret was not spending some decent time on the grounds. Pool looked great but never got there. Would absolutely stay here again.

This resort is amazing.  The property is lush with many palm trees, flowers and hummingbirds!  There are many meeting spaces including outside couches and benches throughout the property where you can sit and relax.  The staff treat you like family; like you are welcome and belong.  The rooms are updated.  Everything is clean.  There are several pools and hot tubs, a golf course, shuffleboard and other activities.  Many small touches like lime water in coolers, cookies and free internet in the spacious and comfortable lobby.

Stay here every year for a conference in January and the property needed a face-lift badly and it got it!  Kudos to the property for making LOTS of improvements.  The rooms are nicer than ever.  The staff is always so helpful!  The parking and internet fees are outrageous!!!!

This is a relaxed small resort which has seen more glamorous times but can can still pack a sparkle and take care of its guests. I was there for four nights on a conference and the staff were unfailingly helpful (great concierge/porter team). Pools are pleasant bars is fine and the rooms ok.

Summary Heading: Comfy for business trip, but a little at from the beach
Summary: Went to the Hyatt Newport for a seminar with my company. I enjoyed my stay as rooms are comfortable and quiet. Breakfast is of good quality and people are at your service.  Only downside I can see, would be the distance from the sea. I would have preferred to be closer for running

My husband and I and two other couples spent two nights at one of the fun villas! We had a great time hanging out by our private pool, visiting Balboa Island, and taking walks to the beach. I would have given this hotel five stars, however, we felt the villas were a bit run down and needed a make over. The decor was a mix matched and some of the paint was peeling in the bathrooms. Also, the two couples staying in the rooms upstairs were awaken every morning with the noise of the planes flying over. I was downstairs and didn't hear it.  In addition, the shuttle to pick us up from the airport took a long time. However, the return shuttle to the airport was fast.

I stayed at this Hyatt for business.  The in-house restaurants offered excellent food (ate there for breakfast, lunch and dinner at various times during my stay).  The staff there are very friendly and personable.  This is reflective of the management there.  While I was there, it rained several times.  The hotel offers complimentary umbrellas for guests to use.  Parking can be a hassle due to how spread out this hotel is set up.  However, talking to the valet/concierge will give you a "shortcut" that will get you to the self parking area faster (parking is not free).  The hotel offered free airport pickup and drop off, but I did not use it due to the lack of frequency and that it was pretty close for a short/quick cab ride.  There is a free shuttle to Fashion Island Mall, a

Summary Heading: Ocean Resort Feel for Biz Travel & Relaxation
Summary: The Newport Beach Hyatt Regency offers a true So-Cal resort look-n-feel which effectively combines modern and classic elements in one package. A refreshing change compared to the  biz focused offerings from other hotels in the area. Relax like the locals. The valet staff are friendly and focused on making you feel like a regular guest and waste no time retrieving your vehicle at a moments notice. Once you step inside the hotel you get the feeling you just appeared in some high-end Caribbean resort with an open look-n-feel. The hotel,bar and restaurant staff are great and always offer a friendly greeting. The pools, hot tubes, and surrounding rooms look and are basically brand new and offer a classic feel. Have a glass of wine or great cup of coffee as you sit in comfortable

Lovely grounds, excellent location. Spacious newly decorated rooms.  Walking distance to Balboa Island! Very friendly and helpful staff. Impressive amenities, others in my group raved about the pool and gym. The lobby has a comfortable reading room, bar, coffee bar. Had a relaxing business trip.

Good location and beautiful setting.  The 9 hole executive course was beautiful and fun.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Had dinner at the restaurant in the hotel and it was Awesome!   Didn't use any of the pools.   Great stay and huge room for an older hotel.

Good location for exploring Newport Beach and Balboa.Easy to find from John Wayne Airport. We visited in January which is down season so one of the pools was under rubble,being re modelled for next season. The other main pool had music playing all day and evening in my opinion too loud to be able to relax. Also our room 833 had a very noisy extraction fan that ran all the time.Other than those moans it was a good experience. From check in to check out the staff were very polite and very helpful. We enjoyed the ambience in the bar and the food in the Shors restaurant was very good.There are complimentary bicycles and 9 hole golf as well.

I stayed here for seven days for a work conference. Overall good experience. The location is good...close to the airport, shopping and restaurants. The service was good from front desk to housekeeping. While I did not use the resort amenities ( and you still get charged daily for them) I think you get bikes and golf etc. included. The hotel food was good. The bar area is too small and they ran out of of Miller lite beer. The rooms are nice. Noise carried easily from other rooms that connected. The property is large and there are lots of stairs to access many of the rooms.  My iron did not work and it was promptly replaced by one that barely worked. Overall, I would say good experience.

Summary Heading: Great spot for a business meeting
Summary: This hotel is located in a great spot (close to John Wayne Airport, close to great shopping, close to Balboa Island) and is a very nice resort type property.  The property was apparently recently refurbished and is in excellent condition

This is a great property. with 3 pools, whirlpools and amenities for children, water slides, etc… Great value, although the resort fee + parking fee are extra! The Hotel staff is always willing to help and ready to your needs. We needed a crib and we were surprised that when it arrived it came with a baby care kit (shampoo, toothpaste, etc…) I´d definitely recommend this hotel for families with children!

A meeting at the Beckman Center on the UC Irvine campus brought us to Newport Beach Hyatt on Saturday through Wednesday. Conveniently located close by the Fashion Center. Shuttle service is available from the hotel to the fashion center. The property is well kept, the staff is courteous. Upon checkin, we were greeted with a gracious room service welcome tray of hummus, olives, and delicious crackers.   Should your travel plans for either business or pleasure take you to Newport Beach, I reend the Hyatt Regency.

Summary Heading: A nice stay in Newport beach
Summary: This hotel is located 50 minutes from Los Angeles international airport (LAX) and has two nice poolareas. The third area was under renovation. It has a nice gym and excellent service both in the reception and bar. Avoid the giftshop. The things you can buy there is really overpriced. We had a couple of incidents during the stay: the valet company missed to book our taxi on new years eve so we had to take an overpriced privat shuttle instead. There was also a cockrouch in our room, but the hotel staff solved both incidents with splendure! You can absolutely chose this hotel if you are going to LA!

Summary Heading: Renovated, Refreshed, Re-visited and REALLY DISAPPOINTED!
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel 3 previous times, mostly while the hotel was undergoing its renovations. My feeling was that if I wanted to return to the hotel based on the service and despite the fact that most amenities were under construction then the hotel was worth a second and third visit. The service and quality I received the first three times were impressive, and made me return over and over but the last time proved I WAS VERY WRONG!  Though the hotel is completely renovated, now extremely popular, especially as a family friendly hotel the service is  not simply lacking but at all ends of the spectrum! Some staff were great but some were horrible! A lot of the service we did receive was as compensation due to major errors.  First of all when I booked our room for the july

Summary Heading: Perfect location in a lush setting!
Summary: From the moment you turn off Jamboree Road and turn on to the property you will feel removed from the hustle and bustle of Southern California.  I was so happy to see how lush the property was!  Very nice to see so much greenery in a state that has 14 lane highways (that was a first for me)!  This property has undergone renovation and is lovely!  It is also nicely situated and is convenient to everything you might need or every place you might want to explore. John Wayne Airport is not far away and easy to get to from the property.  I've read others' comments about the sound of the planes overhead.  Honestly can say I never heard them while in my room and if I did hear them when out and on the property cannot say that I was bothered by them there either!  Too busy enjoying the

I'm sure this property was fabulous 25 years ago but it's in dire need of upgrades. The lobby is beautiful and staff terrific, but it's way below par for both Newport Beach as well as Hyatt Regency. Our room had spiders, bathroom smelled terribly of skunk water and mold, the "bay view" was actually a parking lot, and the room was so small a roll away couldn't be brought in and there wasn't even room for a bathroom door; in its place was shutters that allowed light and sound in, giving bathroom user absolutely no privacy. I don't think my poor son used the toilet the whole trip out of sheer embarrassment.  The kids package i found out about by reading the in room materials; they were not proactive at all in giving us the free kid cups. Our paper was only delivered one out of the

I really liked this hotel. The rooms are lovely, it had everything I needed and the pool was great too. I'd recommend to anyone and I thought the cost was very fair too considering how nice the decor and layout was.

This does not feel at all like a four-star hotel. The rooms were clean, but the amenities and furnishings feel like a renovated 2.5-3 star and more importantly, this property sits right in the flight pattern for the Orange County airport. So, if you find the sound of jets flying overhead every 5-7 minutes romantic or exciting, this is definitely your place. After a 20 hour flight from Asia, we weren't as inclined. Also, be aware that there is a significant self parking fee and a resort fee - both daily. If I hadn't gotten about half off the hotel using a certain website, I would have been outraged at the regular price. We got about what we paid for. Pluses - convenient to interstate and nice clean area.

After staying at this hotel over 200 nights over numerous years due to business, this hotel called police on me one night for sitting in the bar waiting to meet a business associate without notice and without reason. I later inquired why they did not want me to return to the property. Apparently, the excuse was that I was sitting on the stairway one night for a few minutes. In reality, it was a discriminatory act because I am transgender. This hotel has lost many referrals because of this misconduct . They have lost tons of money over it. Stop bigotry. Do not support this establishment.

Summary Heading: Modernized hotel close to the ocean
Summary: This hotel was probably built in the '60's but Hyatt has done a great job bringing the property current yet keeping its eclectic charm. The onsite par 3 golf course is a lot of fun which if not crowded can be played in under an hour. You can rent clubs, bicycles and other beach necessities onsite at the hotel. There are several pools that are heated year round. Food in the restaurant and the bar is very good. The breakfast buffet is remarkably well stocked.

Summary Heading: Extraordinary Setting with Remarkable Customer Service...
Summary: Attended a 3-day meeting at this unique property where vintage orange county meets contemporary California for a very comfortable ambiance. The visit was during a most needed rain so no making use of the venue's outdoor pools and hot tubs which also boasted a waterpark like pool for family fun. The rooms were nicely updated and comfortable. There was plenty of spaces to gather for an impromptu meeting with colleagues or meet with friends, do a little work or just relax from the day. Most importantly was the exceptional customer service from every single person I encountered: from the front desk, help with bags, IT support for internet, AV assistance and even secured a prop for our event. I am a business traveler and stay regulary in hotels and this stay overall was different

This was my second stay at this hotel this year for business.  The first time was just an overnight trip, so I did not review it, but this time I was there four nights, so I think that I got a sufficient flavor to be fair and accurate.  The hotel and grounds are lovely (although somewhat dated but still very nice), with three swimming pools and hot tubs located around the large property.  Our room had two good sized full or queen beds that were quite comfortable.  There is a nice flat screen tv, a coffee maker, a blow dryer, and toiletries in the bathroom.  There is a tub in the bathroom (which you don't always get anymore), and a mini fridge.  There were no bathrobes, which would have been nice, since the hot tub was just outside my room and we used it several times.  The

I must say I have stayed here several times and the service I have received was superb. Recommendations for a restraunt I couldnt remember they found it and made reservations for us. The staff went out of their way several times to maker our stay wonderful. The comfort of the room was nice since it has been rentovated.. I like all the facilities including the spa and even the bike rental around the bay was fun. Food super!

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach for a work conference a few months ago. The hotel itself is located within a decent distance to the Santa Ana airport and Newport Beach, but I did feel somewhat isolated without a car. The shuttle service is helpful, but if I went again, I'd probably just rent a car. The hotel itself is on a large piece of land with pools and great places to lounge, but I found the main grounds were much better kept than the rooms themselves. My room itself wasn't cleaned too well before my arrival, which I brought to management's attention. I also was disappointed in the additional resort fee for things like wifi, the shuttle, the on-site workout room, additional "resort amenities", etc., especially since I was there for a conference and not for

We had some guest from out of town & put them in Newport Hyatt. This is an old hotel but kept very clean & has a nice view of the Bay. Its conveniently located in Newport Beach, close to the mall & beach areas. Service is good & we booked this online & got a very good deal. The only negative thing is the parking cost, which we felt was too much.

Summary Heading: Beautiful grounds, great location, super service
Summary: This hotel is on sprawling, impeccably manicured grounds.  Really very beautiful in a very classic, almost old-fashioned way.  We stayed here Thanksgiving and were very pleased with the experience.  The weather was awesome--even warmer than usual, which made being outdoors great.  There are several pools which are all very nice.  It's a great property just to hang out.  The lobby bar has a very fun and active vibe--crowded but not overly packed.  Bar menu was good--try the little piggy flatbread.  Hummus also good.  Plenty of outdoor seating with fire pit areas for the chill.  We did the Thanksgiving buffet, which was expensive but well done.  Rooms are nice size and comfortable bed.  We had a nice room overlooking the golf course.  Service was really good from the front desk,

Summary Heading: Quiet Oasis for People and Pets during Relocation from Coast to Coast
Summary: After traveling 2500 miles in four days from South Carolina to California with my wife and two English Bulldogs arrived exhausted in Newport Beach to a lovely property. The hotel has recently ben remodeled, but even better if you are traveling with pets. Having a room on the first floor with the sliding glass doors made potty breaks quick and painless not to have to find elevators. Morgan, Morgan, and Helena at the front desk were very understanding and helpful as our reservation was "open" while we waited for our movers to arrive. As a Hyatt Platinum member breakfast at the hotel for up to four guests was provided and included 15% gratuity for the servers, which Jessica and Julio were two great people to start your day. Very pet friendly hotel in all the public areas and high

Summary Heading: Charming hotel in a convenient location
Summary: This was the second time that I stayed here. While the hotel is charming, great location and grounds, I must share some concerns. There was a guest that was smoking marijuana in the lobby and the staff turned a blind eye to it. Personally I was annoyed and had to relocate. Another problem was when I walked past a chair in my room, a nail was projecting out of a chair and I suffered a laceration, I did report to the staff but never got a follow up. Then there was also a strong marijuana odor in the hotel hallways. The floors are wooden and noisy when people walk about which disrupted my sleep.So, it was a mixed bag staying here. Hope they can change the smoker Inn policy. But maybe that is just California?

I stayed here for work for 3 nights in June. What a nice time.  The staff was very friendly, even when there was a snafu where my room got released. (I came back from meetings and I didn't have a hotel room, even though the company was paying for it)  They figured it out very quickly, and even though I was kinda mad at first, everyone more than made up for it.    The grounds themselves have a gorgeous "California resort" style that is awesome.  It is close to a bay for a nice walk.  There is even a liquor store behind the hotel that has cheap beer, etc.  The rooms were nice enough, I had a view of one of the pools.  The landscaping is great!  I was actually really sad when I came back and had to stay at the Wydham instead of the Hyatt because, it is one of the best!!  The patio

Summary Heading: Get a room in the Catalina building
Summary: Excellent hotel, friendly staff. Close to John Wayne airport with a free shuttle to/from the airport, Fashion Island, and Balboa Island. Each pool (3 in total, plus one small pool in each villa) has a jacuzzi, both pool and jacuzzi are open 06:00 - 22:00. The gym is open 24/7.  Though the hotel is a resort style hotel it seems a little over priced, and plays host to many business meetings/conferences etc. There were around 6 separate groups during my 2 week stay.

The good: close to airport, staff mostly pleasant, nice breakfast, decent sized room, everything worked, comfy bed, good toiletries.   The bad: noisy! Others' rooms, pool music, housekeeping, golf buggies around the pool, airplanes - all contribute to make this hotel one of the noisiest that I've stayed at. The hotel feels more like a motel in places. The self parking is a hike  Unlikely to stay again
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Tripadvisor! I apologize for noise during your stay. I would highly recommend staying in our Balboa building as it is known to be the most quiet. I completely understand your frustration with the distance of self-parking. You are more than welcome to call the operator and request a golf cart ride to the lobby. Again, I thank you for your response, this will be used for future reference.

Summary Heading: Very nice but very over priced
Summary: We stayed 3 days and the rooms are nice, clean, but the housekeepers don't always deal w little trash, its not much but they left it there.  And valet wants 34 bucks for your car a night! self parking 20 bucks.  Really??  How am I supposed to come back and forth and worry about being charged constantly and valet guys look at you with that tip me look which is so annoying, I tipped and they keep giving you that look, its inappropriate, they work for the hotel, be kind and help me out.  The hotel lounge didn't have the wine selection I expected, overpriced wine that shouldn't be there.  In the rooms, you definitely hear the person upstairs, stomp stomp.  Otherwise, a beautiful view from our room, sort of, and nice staff for the most part.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Tripadvisor! We truly appreciate your feedback. When parking a car with us, you are only charged nightly and can come and go as you please. We will speak to our valet team and our housekeeping department to make sure they use this feedback as a coaching tool for the future. Please feel free to contact us directly if you stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach again so that we may make sure you are well taken care.  Thank you again for your feedback.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: Visiting family in Corona Del Mar, we chose to stay at the Hyatt Regency. First, because of the close proximity to the John Wayne, Orange County Airport, and second, we can walk to our children's home just over a mile away! The hotel is lovely, great layout, open and airy. King room is very comfortable, nice outside seating with view of swimming pool. Service at the bar and the restaurant off the lobby is was perfect. Great food and wait staff. Hotel offers shuttle to airport, free wi-fi in lobby, fee for in room wi-fi. Room has coffee, refrigerator, safe, ample towels and bottled water. Lovely, lush landscaping too. Look forward to next stay.

Living in Los Angeles, sometimes it's nice to just get away to relax and rekindle romance without driving in hours of traffic.  The Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach is the perfect spot for just that.  The hotel has gone through a renovation and the rooms are nicely updated.  The grounds are lovely and the resort has a secluded feel though it is close to nearby attractions.
