Balboa Island is a quaint diversion and an easy stroll from the hotel.  Staff is helpful and friendly.  When we checked-out we noticed a "resort fee" and asked about it.  When we were told it was to cover internet, etc. and we assured Hyatt staff we weren't told about that and consequently never used the internet.  The front desk removed the charge without hesitation or our even having to ask which was very

My wife and I made rsvp on the phone and called in on day of check in and and asked for a quiet room to enjoy our 21st anniversary. A male attendant took care of it for us and left a message on my phone to let me know he got our room ready. Truly enjoyed our stay. Everything is clean and the ground is well kept. Would come back again. Thank you Newport Hyatt staff!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great feedback on Tripadvisor! We are very glad you enjoyed your stay!

Summary: My wife, two sons (7 and 12) and I stayed here for 3 days in August and loved the property, would absolutely return again. The grounds were gorgeous, well manicured, clean & maintained. We enjoyed the executive 9 hole golf course, wasn't overly challenging, but was fun, and the views of the harbor and cliff top homes were memorable. Late night shuffle board was enjoyed, and playing ping pong and using water slide at the expansive pool area was a highlight. The room was very nice, did us well.. there was a pull out chaise lounge sleeper that would have been perfect for my 7 year old, but unfortunately, it was well worn, coils protruding through, my son referred to it as "little bones poking him in the back". Resort was "full", so we had to endure with him sharing a bed with one

In our experience this hotel is a rare find and during our recent stay we really could not find fault.  Our first impressions of the hotel were excellent as we drove onto the property, left our car out front and meandered into the lobby to check-in.  The money invested in this hotel was evident at the start, with the light and open lobby opening up to casual lounge areas, bar and library, all dressed with clique and cool style.    Check-in was swift - though we were early and our room wasn't ready - and we were offered a key to use the pool and self park our car.  Back to the main building in a moment, we first walked the grounds and explored the three pools, outside patio areas and 9 hole golf course, all the while weighing up the numerous "motel style" buildings, which we were

This hotel is in a great location and offers a very relaxed atmosphere.  I really enjoyed the layout of the lobby & patio area as a welcoming lounge.  The staff was all very friendly and helpful the food was some of the best I've had in a long time.  I would highly recommend the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for fun in the sun!

Summary Heading: Perfect for a single person but rooms are small, lack privacy.
Summary: The rooms are small and appear clean. However, I wore white socks at night just in the room and they were black from the filthy carpet. The door to the bathroom is slatted and gives you absolutely no privacy.  The TV has to be turned up if someone is in the shower. The pools are awesome and clean and the hotel is in a great location for easy access to the PCH.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Trip Advisor. I am very sorry the carpet in your room was dirty. We have all rooms on a rotation to be deep cleaned. I'm glad you were able to enjoy our pools on property during your stay. Your feedback allows our team to make improvements on our hotel. Please reach out to me directly if you need any assistance with upcoming reservation.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: Had the pleasure of staying here for a work conference. Absolutely loved this place. The location is great. Beautiful grounds, with lots to do.. Great views. Pleasant staff. Comfortable room. Shuttle was very convenient! Wish my trip was longer.

just had the pleasure of spending 3 nights here! beautiful, well managed... great brunch on Sunday! 3 pools with different themes , one for children...great hot tubs! nice little executive course to fool around on!  bike rentals shop was great! especially Gerry!

This Hotel is really beautiful, huge property near the Back Bay area. Our room was very nice but I think double beds are quite outdated and the bathroom lacked any semblance of privacy. The double doors leading into it were louvered and the toilet was just around a corner next to the shower. Unless I have a room to myself I prefer to have doors to keep my bathroom activities from my companions. Everything was wonderfully clean and well cared for and the Staff we encountered were all pleasant. Had breakfast at the Hotel restaurant  the next morning, a delicious meal, and great service!

Nice hotel, but expensive. Parking is $20.00 a day for guests.....! Staff is friendly and the rooms are clean. It is also in a great location to explore the surrounding areas. The restaurant serves delicious meals.

I stayed for a weekend with a group.  The resort is very clean with many amenities.  The rooms have nice views.  My sofa bed wasn't very comfortable (the springs poked me).  Has jacuzzi & large pool with a slide.    The complimentary shuttle service to Fashion Island & Balboa Island was great.  However, it couldn't accommodate the number of people who wanted to go there during lunch time, so multiple trips had to be taken.    Ask for a cookie at the front desk in the afternoon.  The staff there is friendly.  After you check out, you can request an electric cart to drive you & your luggage to the parking lot.  A complaint I have is that the cart's driver didn't wait for my luggage even though my carpool's luggage is already in the cart.

Stayed here for one night on a weekend visit to see our daughter. This hotel feels very dated despite some visible attempts to contemporize, such as updated vanity in the bathroom and a nice fire pit in the lobby patio lounge.  We did not have any sense of luxury staying here, not what I expected from a Hyatt Regency, but I can't exactly pinpoint the problem.  We were 3 adults so I already knew about the room with 2 doubles (always an annoyance to me - if you have more than 2 people you really need 2 queens.) Check-in staff was not very friendly, did not bother to tell us about hotel amenities (why wouldn't you take an opportunity to plug your own restaurant, or lounge, or your 3 pools,) just directed us to the room and sent us on our way.  We reserved a Bay View room, which was
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Trip advisor. We will share your feedback with our staff to remind everyone to highlight our restaurants, pools, and all the other great amenities  we offer on property. I am truly sorry you didn’t receive a proper check-in experience. I am also very sorry that the airplanes disturbed your sleep. We are about 6 miles from the Orange County Airport. We do offer complimentary tranquility kits upon request for our guests that have a difficult time sleeping due to noise. If you stay with us again, please contact me directly so that I can better assist you in the future.

Summary: The location was great. The pool(s) was good. The complaints for us started immediately. Room number 617, Friday Oct. 17 and Saturday Oct. 18. 1.  No place to park while registering (park along the driveway curb, but have to leave the key with the attendant) and driveway highly impacted by new arrivals and those trying to leave. Place is huge. A few parking spaces for registering and checking out would be very helpful. Self-parking lot huge, but have to have a room key to get in and out. Would be good to have information available on how to check out and drop the key in the box BEFORE driving to the lobby. 2.  Room was very comfortable, but lacking in decor. A few pictures would be nice. Walls are stark. 3.  Room had one rolling desk chair and a bed. A second chair would have

The check in process with the late night people was the only nice part of this experience.  Once they had your money, then it was downhill from there.  The front staff in the morning and afternoon were unfriendly and each tried to pawn work on each other rather than help a customer at the front desk.  It takes a while to get your luggage to your room and the poor bellhop carried them up a flight of stairs because there was not an elevator near the room or a push cart to load our luggage.  Parking and internet were expensive and an additional $4.80 was posted and have no idea where that came from. Watch your credit card statement or better yet, go elsewhere.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Trip advisor. We are very sorry to hear that you didn’t enjoy your stay with us. Please reach out to me by phone or email so that we can look over your bill together and see where the additional charges are coming from. I look forward to hearing from you.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris qualitynewpo@hyatt.com 949-729-1234

Summary: They have 3 pools! One with a water slide. They have a little putting green and  ping pong table by the pool. Near one of the other pools is a large chess board and shuffle board as well. Also a small space with sand and a hammock. Great for  out of town families especially if flying in from john wayne AP. Shuttle service to and from. Also shuttle service every 2 hrs to nearby Fashion Island for dining, movies & shopping.

While this hotel is aesthetically pleasing, there were many things about it that made our stay less than impressive. The hotel charges every guest $25 a day parking fee and $16 a day to use the wi-fi.  (Added expenses tacked on to the already-expensive price of the room.)  We were there for a local triathlon and had our equipment with us (including bikes) and they put us on the second floor with no elevator.  We had to carry everything up and down the stairs.   There seemed to be about 5 weddings going on at the hotel the same weekend as our triathlon making it unbearably crowded and loud.   We wanted to buy gifts and gum in the gift shop on Saturday evening around 5:00 PM and it was closed with a sign that said "will return in 15 minutes."  There was no other hotel employee

The place is huge with plenty of comfortable outdoor living areas.  Did not use but tested the water in the pool - heated.....very nice.  The rooms were phenomenal with complete open sliding glass doors to bring the outdoors in.  If you forgot to bring something from home....no worries they had you covered as their list was endless.  Classy beautiful place.  I would recommend this place to anyone and look forward to a return.

Out of all of the destination that we have been to, the kids every year want their party to be held at the Hyatt Newport Beach which says a lot.  Christina Fry and the staff at the hotel made our party one to remember.  At every step, they went above and beyond what is normally expected.  I cannot say thank you enough to the well trained staff.  The villa's are to die for, love this place.  My only negative would be that my bill was not accurate, but the staff was very professional and dealt with the matter quickly.

This hotel is in a wonderful central location for Balboa Island, Fashion Island, etc. The check in staff was very unfriendly, and my room was a dungeon.  The view from my room was the laundry cart and two spare beds.  There was no cell/wifi available in the room. I have stayed here before, but this was awful and I doubt that in spite of the location that I would return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Tripadviosr. I am truly sorry you were unable to receive Wi-Fi in your guestroom. Our Internet is included with our resort fee. We are currtenly updating our Internet system so that every guestroom has the best internet experience possible. If you stay with us again, please reach out to me personally so that I can better assist you.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: I stayed at this hotel while in Newport Beach for a conference. it is amazingly nice. The rooms are large, comfortable and have beautiful views (my view was of the pool area), the lobby is nice and very active, and the staff was excellent (although there should have been more staff available to check people in). I had trouble with my phone and I questioned a pool party that was happening right outside my window when I first checked in, but the staff was so helpful and friendly and all was resolved in a timely manner (Pool parties have very reasonable ending times!). I would recommend this hotel if you are in Newport Beach!

Summary Heading: Close to shopping and the water
Summary: The hotel is perfectly sited for Newport Beach. Fashion Island is 5 minutes away as is the ocean. The John Wayne Airport is a 15 minute drive and 20 minutes away is more shopping at the South Coast shopping center. The hotel grounds are beautifully landscaped and the setting is tropical peaceful. The food is nicely prepared and the wait staff is very attentive. The rooms have been remodeled over the last 5 years and the bathrooms are very attractive. I spent two nights here this time and will be back!

I arrived yesterday for a conference held at the hotel and was really surprised by the great quality of this beautiful place. Staff is so helpful, my room is wide with a beautiful view on the garden, and food is so good. Staying there for a few days, hope i will have more and more good times at this OC hotel.

Beautiful setting, great location, friendly helpful staff. It is a sprawling facility with several pools so you never feel crowded. There were several business meetings & functions while we were there but it was never crowded or uncomfortable. While the room we had was very nice, the "bay view" description is a stretch. Lovely place, would stay there again when in the area.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel but now a bit dated
Summary: I stayed here many years ago and loved the place but on a recent visit, signs of the hotel's past charm were occassionally present but overall, it definitely felt like it was a bit dated and needed a facelift.

This was my first visit to the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach. I had high hopes as the reviews seemed positive and the location is close to the water. The location is great, rooms are comfortable and restaurant food was good. However I reduced my rating for two reasons. I was in room 330 and the door to the bathroom was a flimsy sliding door that was much smaller than the door frame. I was on my own, but this hotel boosts that it is a family hotel and if this room was being shared by a couple or family it could have been awkward during bathroom visits. Also on my final night I asked for a wake up call, with a follow up call and received neither and so almost missed my flight back to Boston. One thing I would highly recommend is trying the cheesecake special.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Tripadviosr. I am very sorry that your bathroom door was flimsy. I will have my engineering team look into that immediately. I  also want to apologize that our team missed your wake up call. This is completely unacceptable and I am truly sorry for any inconvenience we have might have caused. We have changed our wakeup call system so that we don’t miss anymore wake up calls in the future. I understand that this is very frustrating. Please contact me directly if you stay with us again so I can make sure you are well taken care of on your next visit.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: The hotel lobby is decorated very nicely but the front desk area is small. We checked in on a Friday and it was busy. I read that some reviewers were offered toys upon check-in for their children but none was offered to us. The did let us check in early though which was great.  We stayed in a king sized room, which was very spacious. The bed was very comfortable too. There's a card in the room that says which items you can request for, which we appreciated. You can ask them to bring you slippers, robes, a tea kettle, etc. I wish they had just provided most of the things in the room though so you didn't have to call for them since it's a high-end property anyway.  Our room was located in the Balboa building and we did hear music from a function nearby though it didn't last till

I love it here. This hotel has a very beachy and tropical feel to it It's pretty close to Fashion Island and there are shuttles available, if you feel the need to shop.  Another really neat thing here is the staff. The people are super friendly and the waiters at the Shor are exceptionally awesome. Truly outstanding service. The room is nice and the bathroom seems to have been upgraded. Both, room and bathroom seem a bit small, but work great for just one person. I have a nice little patio that looks over to the harbor. Lobby decor is really pretty and again has this beach kind of feel to it. There are 3 different pools, which I didn't try, since I am here on business. I would have given 5 stars, if the WiFi were better and not as wonky. Also, as is my pet peeve with any high

I stayed here for 5 days with a friend on a short trip to LA. It was a lovely hotel big rooms lovely food and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It was in a lovely location with lovely pools and facilities. would def recommend to others looking to stay in the Orange county area.

The location was convenient for me and the setting was pleasant enough. Room was nothing special, nor was the grass bank outside the window, but the worst aspect was the adjoining door that allowed much noise to penetrate from the neighbouring room. I was offered an upgrade when I booked, but not when I arrived, although they tried to charge me for the non-existent upgrade. Food was pretty good, though.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on tripadvisor. I want to apologize that we were unable to exceed your expectations at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. I am also very sorry that we were unable to honor your request for an upgrade. If there are any questions or concerns on your billing for your guestroom, please feel free to contact us at qualitynewpo@hyatt.com so that we can go over your folio with you.  Thank you again for your feedback.   Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: Our third visit to Hyatt Newport, this time we had a room in the Catalina Building. Brigette on reception was very welcoming & helpful. We told her we had stayed before and didnt want the Bay Block. Room was nice, although due to the large trees outside it was a bit dark & gloomy. Still, the balcony was kept cool. The large pool has been altered since our last visit, with a slide being put where there used to be tall trees. I thought the slide ended in the pool, but it doesnt, it curves round and ends side by side to the pool.  It was only open at weekends. Music plays all the time by the pools now aswell. At times during the week there were only a handful of people sunbathing, but busier at weekends. Weather was glorious for 7days out of 8. Parking is, as everyone says, very

I was fortunate enough to stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for two days of my vacation! I work for Hyatt, and have high expectations when I stay at any Hyatt property! Hyatt Regency Newport Beach excesses my expectations! Shawna and Bridgette checked me into the hotel. Shawna has excellent customer service skills! She was personable and seemed interested in where I worked and what I had to say! Dave was the bellman that checked us in and is from Indiana! (I'm from Indiana!) it was awesome to talk to him and see how he liked the property and California! He went the extra mile with information about the room and area! He is an excellent addition to your team! I truly enjoyed my stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach!

I travel to the socal area a lot for work and try to stay at hyatt for reward points. I usually stay at hyatt huntington beach but they were sold out. Upon first arriving I was underwhelmed at the property...it seems as if several motels were converted into one property many years ago. The lobby is nice but nothing fancy...and I am given a room in the lido building. This building is a motel with nice interiors. No elevator...noisy...outdoor corridors...etc. (see photo) the room and bathroom were very small, room has window unit for ac, and bathroom has barely any counter space (literally my suite on the cruise had a bigger bathroom!). The door doesn't go all the way to the ground and it is not very clean. Nothing bad happened, it was just a very different experience than
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Tripadvisor! Our hotel was built in the 60s and still maintains the historical feel. We have 4 buildings on property in which all offer a different experience to our guests.   I am truly sorry you didn’t fully enjoy your stay with us. If you stay with us again, I would recommend requesting the Balboa building. That building is often the most quiet building and also has an interior entrance.   We hope to see you again at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach!  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: We booked this hotel for a six night stay recently and were not disappointed. Very handy location - near to restaurants, shopping, the Coast Highway and an easy walk to Balboa Island and ferry to Balboa peninsula. Three pools - the lower one is kid friendly. If you stay over a Friday night there is a jazz concert series that is very popular. Self- parking is a bit expensive at $22 and not too convenient as it is on a lower level and a walk uphill. All in all we were very happy with this hotel.

Wonderful location for all of our needs. The pool for the children was great. Kept the four grandchildren entertained for hours. Three pools on the property with comfortable couches for relaxing. The staff outstanding.  We will return to this hotel.

On the plus side, we were able to check in early (1pm), and the room was clean and adequately sized.   Unfortunately:  1. The air conditioner did not work when we arrived at the room, and clearly had not worked for some time, as the room was very warm. A repair person was sent out and was able to repair the unit within about 90 minutes, but the A/C unit was still inefficient, and it took until the middle of the night before our room was a comfortable temperature (i.e. below 80). 2. The wifi login did not work, and after two calls to the front desk we were finally given a separate access code, which worked - but the access worked only intermittently. 3. The hotel app - which is advertised as a "great new app" in the hotel's own confirmation email - does not work. Upon arrival at
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Tripadvisor. I am very sorry to hear about your experience with the Internet not working in your guestroom. We are aware of this issue and we are currently working on upgrading our system as we see this as an area of opportunity to improve.   I am very sorry about the inconvenience of the air conditioning unit not working as well. I understand this would be very frustrating with the high temperatures we have experienced this summer. If you stay with us again, please do not hesitate to contact me directly so I may better assist you in the future.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary Heading: Best place for the 4th of July
Summary: This was the second year we stayed at this hotel for the 4th of July weekend with our two children.  the best part is the fireworks show.  You walk out to a slope at the hotel's golf course, sit on the grass and enjoy the fireworks display below in front of you.  They bring out a bar set up, so a glass (or two) of wine enhances the experience nicely.  Great reception area, with chocolate chip cookies and sand toys for the kids.  Most rooms have balconies, but make sure to get the room in the updated part of the hotel.  We also walked to the Balboa Island Ferry through the town (1/2hr walk) and took it over to the beach.  The entire trip took about 1.5 hrs one way but we all enjoyed it
Manager Response: It’s great to hear that you enjoyed our property on the 4th of July. Our hotel definitely has a great view of the fireworks! All rooms were renovated in May 2013. We have four buildings on property. All buildings offer a different layout of the guestroom.

Summary: Nowhere near the level of property one expects at a Hyatt Regency. Overpriced. Overrun with heavily tattooed, heavily drinking 40 something's with barking dogs. Whomever owns the property should've reinvested 30 years ago in rebuilding two of the four buildings- we stayed on hard-earned reward points- mistake- they'd only offer rooms I. The oldest, run down sections with paper thin walls, same place they stick all the discount p.line guests. I'm used to hotel chains that try to upgrade you in appreciation for having enough points for a reward. Tried to change rooms to something better but met with resistance. Our wing looked like a cheap motel from the 40s- which I think it was. They did toss in breakfast, which they must commonly do to get people to stay in these motel6 like
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Tripadvisor. I'm sorry to hear that you didn’t have a great experience with us. We truly appreciate all of our gold passport members and want to make sure that we always exceed your expectations when staying with us on hard earned points. Please feel free to reach out to me at qualitynewpo@hyatt.com so that we can discuss your past visit with us.   Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: With a name like the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach, you picture something rather flashy and spectacular.  This Hyatt was okay, but hardly what I'd call sparkly.    LOCATION:  Not close to the bay, as I'd imagined.  There's actually a big hedge, a road and huge parking lot between the hotel and the water.  Balboa Island is closer than I thought--walkable actually.  Disneyland is farther than I thought--about a $55 taxi ride.    LOBBY:  Not fancy, but more a comfortable casual California style.  The bar functions as a breakfast bar (croissants, yogurt, gourmet coffee) in the morning, a lobby sitting space in the afternoon, and a drink/appetizer lounge in the evening.  The lounge is the happening place.    ROOMS:  Modern, nice, but with that rather austere decor that's the rage these

Beautiful grounds. Very lush, I felt like I was in Hawaii! The pools were nice and the main one offered a slide for the kids, which I think mine would love. The other pools seemed very tranquil and a good place or adults to relax. The hotel seemed to offer a lot of different activities geared for the family as well. On our visit, we stayed in one of the villas, which sat up on the 2nd floor away from everyone, so it was very quiet and romantic. The room was spacious and closets were very big for a hotel room. Bathrooms could have been a little bigger, maybe even a spa tub. All in all, the experience was one of a kind. Can't wait to be back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great response on trip advisor! We hope to see you soon!

Summary: I had the perfect weekend.  I love all the new renovations they did.  The pool with the slide was great for my granddaughter.  She loved it, so did my brother in law.  I loved how a 1/4 of the pool is 4 ft deep.  My granddaughter can walk all over.  Everything is new.  The lounge chairs, the rooms, the bathrooms, flat screen TV's.  The hotel looks great.  Everyone was nice and helpful. We had appetizers and drinks at the pool, which the drinks were delicious.  The view was incredible, I didn't get a room overlooking water but it was still great, I looked at the golf course and the flowering trees made me feel like I was in Hawaii.  Great job Hyatt!!!!!!
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed your weekend! Our new water slide and pool area is great for families with children! I'm also happy you enjoyed your golf course view. We hope you visit us again soon!

Summary: My room was very private.  I had a view of the Bay on a 2nd floor.  I had a private patio, and a/c unit.  The bed was super comfy and the room was clean.  I was able to get to fashion island very quick/easily.  The restaurant was a bit stuffy for me, but the breakfast food was good.  No mini bar;(. The pool was very quiet and I enjoyed the ambiance, relaxing.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great feedback on Tripadvisor! The Bay View is beautiful! We are so happy your enjoyed it! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: Lovely hotel. Beautiful grounds. Nice pools. Our room was a bit snug for our family of four. But very pretty and clean. Daily parking fee was a bit harsh but more and more hotels are charging it.  Daily resort fee included free wi-if and bottles of water.  Friday nights had a jazz festival which were well attended. Might be a negative if your room was near the venue but didn't bother us.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great feedback on Tripadvisor! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Birthday Party at the Hyatt was outstanding.
Summary: I went to a birthday party at the Hyatt last Saturday night and blown away!  The event coordinator's name was Kate and she was the best. The food, staff and grounds were perfect. I got a room for the night and was surprised how spacious it was, especially the bathroom. And it seemed to be recently renovated.  This resort would be perfect for a wedding, especially in the summer.  Be sure to ask for Kate if you have an event here, you won't be sorry.
Manager Response: It’s great to hear you enjoyed your time at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach! Kate is a great asset to our team! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We checked in late Saturday of Labor Day weekend. What a sad room we were given, It was in the Lido building, with a tiny view of the bay even though we paid for a bay view room.  The room was sparsely furnished, towels thread bare, and lots of noise from the nearby rooms.  Every time water was run in a neighboring room it sounded like there was a waterfall in our room.  We planned to spend the day at the family pool on Sunday.  The waterslide is definitely for the 5 year old crowd.  They do offer activities for smaller children, but our pre-teens just laughed at the thought. The pools look a lot better on the website than they do in person. A lot of time is spent on checking you into the pool area with a wristband, but why?  The employees would have been better utilized, moving
Manager Response: We are very sorry to hear about your poor experience with us this past Holiday weekend. I apologize that your pre-teens didn’t enjoy the Oasis pool and the waterslide. We decided to have a wristband station this year to create a better experience for our guests at the pool. Often times on holiday weekends our pools get very crowded. The wristbands allowed us to manage the crowds better. I am also very sorry about your view from your guestroom. Please feel free to contact me at the hotel regarding your past stay so I can look into your reservation. Thank you for your feedback as this will allow us to make improvements to our Hotel.  Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary: I am giving this hotel more stars due to the fact my stay was over a holiday weekend. Things were a little crazy. There was also a wedding and birthday party going on Saturday night, so things were chaotic when I arrived to check in.   I had reserved 2 rooms,and I was the 2nd room to check in, so maybe things were said to my friends in the 1st room, but I had to ask a bunch of questions about dumb stuff that should have just been provided.   Parking is self or valet, I just valeted because it was easier. The valets were super nice.  Room was not cleaned until 4.30 pm, just as we were trying to get ready to go out for the night.  But odd at some point they came in to get our glasses and plates, etc..  We went to breakfast and instead of a good morning, I was greeted with is
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on Trip advisor. I would like to apologize for your experience with us over Labor Day weekend. I am very sorry about your food and beverage experience. I will speak to our staff to make sure we use this as a coaching tool for the future. I would like to make sure your appetizer is taken care of. Please contact me so I may look up the check number.   Sincerely, Sarah Morris

Summary Heading: All up HILL  from the SELF PARK
Summary: Beautiful room...  Love the modern edge to the furnishings....But they should warn you and provide water for the hike to the LOBY....Check in was graet   and very helpful in providing info for a Great Seafood restaurant....Wish my visit was longer....but do the traffic   it was a brief visit
Manager Response: It’s great to hear your enjoyed your stay with us. We will make sure our front office team is explaining where the self-parking lot is located to each guest. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: We stayed for 4 nights on our road trip from San Fran to San Dieago. The staff were tremendous, the 3 pools offered something different for multiple types of guests.   Valet parking was great and self park was ok if you fancied a walk.   The rooms were spacious and very clean, but overall, it was the staff who made our stay great. Thanks to all of you for a great time. See you next year.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Trip Advisor! It’s great to hear that your enjoyed our property and staff! We hope to see you next year!

Summary: My son and I recently visited the Hyatt newport beach for the 3rd time. The renovations they've completed the last few years are fantastic! What an adventure! We love the back gate to the Back Bay, where you can run, bike, walk, or go birding. The pools were beautiful, our room was quiet and immaculate, and the lobby is modern, airy, and just plain fun! The staff seemed to be as happy as we were; everyone was just so pleasant and helpful. The gal at the breakfast bar remembered just how my son liked his mocha frappe chino by the second day he ordered it. This is not a hotel- it's an adventure. I even swam laps in the oasis pool early in the morning. I can't say enough about this beautiful resort hotel! One more things- the grounds are so beautiful!

Been here many times over 20 years.  Great location, quiet and recently updated. Lot of walking though as it is spread out and a lot of up and down. Parking lot is a long way away. They are not afraid to ask premium prices, but location counts.

We were here for a wedding. There are multiple buildings on rooms, so I think the distance from the main area might depend on how many people are staying in your room. We had 2 beds and we were in a room at the very edge of the resort. Although the check in lady said we had a view of the golf course, unfortunately since we were on the first floor, our view was of the hill on the edges of the golf course - which was fine because we were only sleeping in our room. There are 3 separate pools in the whole place. The one near our room seemed to be the quietest and least crowded, but we were close to the gym. If you have kids, I'd recommend trying to get a room closest to the kid pool so your children don't have to wander around the whole resort just to get back to the room. We didn't

I stayed at the Hyatt in early August 2014 and found it to be quite the happening place. They have a summer music night on Fridays with different performers throughout the summer. It is held in a small amphitheater, with plenty of night life after the excellent performers!   You're only a few minutes from the spectacular Huntington beach area and just s few more miles up Pacific Coast Highway 1, you're in Newport Beach with the great assortment of restaurants. Also, shopping at Fantasy Island and the shops on Balboa Island.  I used the Par 3, ( hole golf course to brush up my chip shots with a great view from the 8th tee into the Back Bay. The service was efficient and friendly. It is an excellent location to explore Southern California with prices to match.   Thank you Hyatt

We stayed for 3 nights and had a fun time. Clean room. Kids enjoyed the giant chess set, shuffleboard and pools. Very good breakfast at SHOR restaurant. Cafe in lobby with good breakfast options and Starbucks converts into a bar in the afternoon.

We stayed at the Hyatt in August 2013 and enjoyed it so much that we decided to visit again this year!  Of all the places that we have stayed on our travels, this is one of our favourites from a family point of view!  Our second visit did not disappoint.  We again avoided the smaller Bay Rooms and had a spacious room in the Balboa building.  The children love the slide, the swimming pool, childrens' food menu and the Dive In movie.  We found the service to again be efficient and friendly, however, we never feel that staff go the "extra mile" to be helpful as some other reviewers emphasise, apart from the young man who works on the slide.  We think it has an excellent and affordable location to explore Southern California.  This year we were able to enjoy Laguna and Huntingdon
Manager Response: Thank you for your great feedback on Trip Advisor. It’s great to hear your children are able to enjoy the amenities we offer on property for kids. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary: The only reason I did not give a five star is that they should have a LOT more seating around their three pools.  Securing a chair/lounge is not easy.  Other than that we found it to be clean, well staffed and the staff was friendly.  Food was great, room service prompt.  Their help in my arriving from LAX where I was stranded was greatly appreciated.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach! We are sorry to hear that you had difficulties finding a seat at the pool. We will definitely look into adding more pool chairs next summer. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary: My husband came here on business and I came with him.  We stayed in the Balboa wing in room 814 facing the golf course. We had a king room with balcony.  The room was a very comfortable size and the furniture/amenities up to date. It was nice sitting out on the balcony relaxing in the early morning. The pool for the Balboa wing was very nicely appointed..Towels were provided and many comfortable upholstered cabana lounger's..The grounds are immaculate..so many nooks and crannies for quiet reading or resting amongst the tropical tree's.  The SHOR restaurant is too high priced..We sat down to dinner, saw the prices and offerings and promptly got up and left.  I took advantage of the lobby bar breakfast which gave choices of fruit, oatmeal, many breads and.pastries, juices, etc and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! It’s so great to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Great Spot for the 4th of July
Summary: We planned a family trip over the Fourth of July with four other families.  Overall the trip was great.  The food was solid, there was plenty to do for the 7 kids we had that were under 9 years old with the water slide, movie by the pool, and easy access to the back bay.  The rooms were a bit small but updated and very clean, as you can tell they spent some money updating the property.    The only complaint I have is that they did not have enough servers around the pool.  I saw managers (3 of them) standing around telling the servers what to do and where to go instead of jumping in and helping them out.  On a busy weekend like that, I would imagine it would be better to have more indians than chiefs.    It is a great hotel for a staycation, or if you are in town for business, it
Manager Response: Thank you for spending July 4th with us! It’s great to hear that you had a nice time with your family! We have already began planning for the next holiday weekend to make sure we manage our pools better and have more staff! We hope to see you again next year!

Summary: This is a well located resort. Rooms have been renovated to typical corporate Hyatt standards...you know what you are getting with them, they are clean. The hotel was built in the 60's; and the exterior, walkways, small lobby, landscaping and pool area are in dire need of renovation. There are three wings, one of which looks like a cheap motel: dreary, drab. The pool area is in the center of this under landscaped area, and the cheap lounge chairs look out onto a sea of chipped painted exterior dull hallways and housekeeping carts. Very depressing. Brick walkways from the 60's are cracked; the lobby is the coffee shop, no nice place to sit. Other wings are a little better, but no part of the place is crisp. Service is fair...they lost our dry cleaning, the check-in had no idea
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear about your poor experience with us. We do offer 4 different buildings on property. Two buildings have an exterior entrance. I'm sorry that you didn’t find our resort fee beneficial. We offer many amenities such as Internet, golf bike rentals, shuttle service, bottled etc. to make the resort as cost effective as possible. If you stay with us again, please reach out to me personally so I may better assist you in the future.  Best, Sarah Morris

Summary Heading: Older hotel, not up to typical Hyatt standard
Summary: We stayed at this hotel for two nights over a weekend.  After getting the "Diamond" treatment at other Hyatt properties (upgraded room, complimentary drinks, Regency club, waived fees), this hotel was cold and impersonal.  Charged us 48 cents somehow for breakfasts.  Even newer rooms are small and unspectacular.  $22/day for self park 10 minutes from one's room seems egregious, but they were willing to waive the resort fee.  I'm not sure what the resort fee covers.    That being said, children had a good time - the pools are decent sized and there is a nice lobby to relax in (if you are willing to be asked every ten minutes if you need a drink or something to eat).
Manager Response: Thank you for your response on Trip Advisor! I'm glad to hear your kids enjoyed our pools! Our resort fee includes many concessions that are great for families to take advantage of. We offer complimentary golf,2 hour bike rentals, a shuttle service to John Wayne Airport, Fashion Island, and Balboa Island, complimentary 800 calls, beach valet kits and so much more! If you stay with us again, feel free to reach out to me so I can better assist you in the future!

Summary: Just left after a weeks stay everything was excellent we had emailed before arrival requesting rooms we had stayed in before,They had sorted it out & we got our rooms  Nothing was a problem all staff friendly,Pool for the kids was very good, rooms all good,will definatly be returning A++++++++++
Manager Response: We can’t wait to see you again at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach!

Summary: Hyatt Regency Newport Beach has been a great option for family travelers. The location is great as it is close to the beach. There are a lot of activities for adults and kids a like such as the pool with water slide, 9 hole golf, tennis, outdoor (huge) chess, table tennis and biking among others. Food has been great wherein KUDOS to chef Sean Leone for his innovative cuisine as well as to chef Leo Gianulis for a creating a perfect healthy and yet appetizing menu at Shor Restaurant. Staff has been friendly and courteous from the front desk, restaurant and room service.   If someone who would like to have a great time in Orange County, I will highly suggest staying at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review on our property. We are so happy to hear that you enjoyed SHOR restaurant. Our Chefs always working on creating new items for our menu. We hope to see you again at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach soon!

Summary Heading: Older resort, refurbished rooms, kid friendly.
Summary: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency New Port beach for only one night. This was after we left our 5 day stay at the Omni in San Diego. I decided to book at the Hyatt Regency last minute because I wasn't ready for our Summer vacation to end. Our stay was just ok, there is a resort fee & parking fee. Rooms are furnished nicely but the property itself is showing it's older age. We were bummed out that the pool slide was closed pretty early and that was actually the deciding factor in me choosing this resort. My boys ages 5 and 8 still enjoyed the pool anyway and my 5 year old swam for the first time without his life vest. Staff put on a family movie night at the pool. We didn't stay to watch it because it was getting cold and there was a wedding going on outside and it was pretty loud.
Manager Response: I'm sorry to hear that you didn’t have a memorable experience with us at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. Our slide is open every day at 11am-6pm. I will make sure to pre-shift our pool attendants to make sure we are keeping the slide open to that time daily. Thank you for your feedback on our hotel.

Summary: Just returned from a 2 night 3 day stay at the Hyatt Newport and had a wonderful time with the kids.  At check in, they wheeled out a wagon filled with toys so that each child could pick something.  Each child also received a plastic hyatt cup so they could get free drinks at the pool.  The rooms were very comfortable and the crib(pack 'n play) came with a johnson and johnson's travel box of shampoo and lotion.  They kids pool was great.  There was a huge water slide, water shooters, mini golf, and a huge pool that was 3.5 feet at the shallow end.  There is a cute play area across the street from the hotel (where self parking is)- with a couple of small slides, teeter totter and swings.  I'd say good for kids 5 and under.  Fashion Island is a 5 min drive and has a ton of nicer
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your great feedback! It's so great to hear that you enjoyed your vacation with us! We are very happy that your kids were able to choose a toy from our welcome wagon! We hope to see you and your family again soon.

Summary Heading: Old hotel and Internet is NOT free
Summary: When you arrive at this hotel, you will be happy with the settings and its garden; however, once you get to the room, it is very very small. I guess this Hyatt acquired few very old hotel and refurbished. SO you will see the room is very small and many signs of old hotel. The swimming pool looks great in the website but they are just average. It is located in the back bay, it looks nice in the website but the beach is dirty.  One bad feature is the ceiling is only 8 ft, as a 6' person, low ceiling gave me feeling claustrophobic.  Another annoying thing is the internet is NOT free. For 3-4 start hotel, requiring to pay internet is very lame.  not very happy with my stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback! We no longer charge for Internet in our guestrooms. Our Internet is now included in the resort fee which also includes many other concessions such as golf, bike rentals, beach rentals, access to our shuttle, complimentary printing station, ipad rentals, local and 800 calls, and kids cups with complimentary re-fills. We hope you were able to enjoy our amenities we offer on property! We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Modern, refurbished hotel with excellent facilities
Summary: This is a really good hotel with excellent facilities, lovely refurbished spacious rooms and very friendly, helpful staff. Loved the pool areas, grounds and gym.  We had a lovely room but unfortunately not a good view facing the car park.  As our holiday company had incorrectly  cancelled our booking we  were just so happy the staff pulled out all the stops to make sure we had a room at a time when the hotel was full, so didn't complain about the view.  The only negative is that the hotel caters for a lot of corporate events so we found the bar full in the evening with a particular group, and it didn't feel like a holiday bar. The hotel restaurant is also very good although we found it a bit pricey

I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It has been beautifully refurbished, the pools are fantastic, and the staff are so friendly and so helpful - especially Katie, Helena & Joe. We were given a fantastic room with a balcony in the Catalina building on the top floor overlooking the quiet pool. It was really lovely. And if you have forgotten anything they pretty much have everything you might need - nothing was any trouble. The food is great, there is also a Starbucks in the morning and the bar is fab. It's lovely to eat/have a glass of wine out on the terrace with the palm trees! The kids loved the family pool, especially the water slide and the kids activities which were free every friday/sat while we were there. The shuttle buses to Balboa and Fashion Island were so
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback! We do host a summer night concert series on Friday evenings every week in the summer. We are very sorry that you were disturbed by people attending sky boxes for the concert. If you stay with us again, I would highly recommend the Balboa Building for your stay because it has great views of our golf course and pool, yet is away from the lobby and the concert so you can have peace and quiet. Feel free to reach out to me directly if you stay with us again.

Summary: Very nice hotel with an excellent and very accommodating staff.  I had gone on a fishing trip and they were nice enough to store my big catch of fresh tuna in their freezer for a couple of days!  Great location as it is close to Balboa and Fashion Island.  Just the ideal spot in Newport that I plan on visiting again soon.  The people at the bar are awesome!

Unfortunately I stayed here for business and could not take advantage of all this hotel had to offer. With 3 pools, a 9 hole executive (par 3) golf course, tennis, spa, plus more you could take a vacation at the hotel and never leave. The rooms are spacious and roomy with a balcony overlooking a courtyard. The hotel restaurant "The Shor" offers a fixed price menu where you choose from options for each course. The food was excellent, despite the limited offering. The bar offers burgers and other pub fare. Outside the rooms you could tell you were on the flight path of the Orange County, John Wayne Airport. However, inside the rooms were very quite.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your great experience with us! We hope to see you soon!

Summary: My friend and I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach and had a blast! The beds were super comfy. The room was clean. Room service was quick and delicious. Parking was easy and convenient. Staff seemed very happy all of the time.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your great feedback! I'm glad you enjoyed the Villa!

Summary: On a positive, the hotel itself is excellent - 3 great pools with beds, hammocks etc. Nice lobby and outside bar, and a decent location - Balboa island is walkable (15 minutes). Service was a different story. We booked two separate queen size rooms, and they gave us 1 queen size room and a suite which had a sofa bed! Obviously we complained and they finally managed to find us another queen size room - But very annoyed after messing around for 45 minutes. Secondly, when we got into the room, we found that there was urine all over the floor in the bathroom from the last guest - Once again, I had to return to the lobby to request a cleaner, i got an apology but nothing more! Next - We ordered coffees they told us to wait outside and they would bring them over, 15 minutes passed

This Hyatt is an older structure but the rooms are well maintained and the grounds are spread out and lovely. Three pools, shuffleboard, golf, bikes to rent all add to the fun. Location convenient to Balboa Island and Fashion Island.  We found the service to be friendly and very accommodating. Lobby attractive and there is Starbucks available. Family friendly. We make this our Orange County hotel.

Summary Heading: Perfect Location, nice bar great staff that would about it!
Summary: Stayed at this hotel over 4th of July and the location is perfect! and fairly nice bar with great staff and that would be about it!  Ok I will say the newly renovated gym was nice a little small but fine for a workouts.  The property needs a lot of upgrades it looks run down kind of reminded us of a 70's motel 6.  The walls are thin so thin they sent an email saying please keep your voices down because our hotel is old and has thin walls.  The beds are terrible and squeaky so they would wake you if you moved when you went to sleep. The carpets needed to be replaced and the a/c unit worked fine but you could see rust all around it(wall unit).  All in all I will not be staying here again until they can do a full remodel and upgrade to all rooms.(because our room was updated)

I was here for a conference and the room was free for me but it seems like 100% of my fellow attendees had a balcony or patio--which I would expect at a beachside hotel. Not me...I was in the upstairs of one of the Villas. I think these are designed to be the room you stick the kids or your freeloading brother-in-law in if you rent the whole Villa. So while the main room had access to the private pool and the front bedroom got a big terrace, I got bupkis. Plus, the room layout is stupid. There's an armoire where the TV should be and the TV is off to the left and hard to see from the bed. There were two closets...why? The only place to plug the coffee machine in was the bedside table...really? My martini was $17, yowza! I'm sure it's a nice place if you get a good room but I

This was an excellent venue for a small conference. The bar was a great place to meet and network during the conference and the food was great. The hotel is also very close to great restaurants. I would have loved to have utilized the pools and other facilities at the hotel but didn't have time unfortunately. Looks like a great place to bring the family.

We stayed for three nights and it was a pleasant place with some minor drawbacks.  There was an odd smell in our building.  The rooms were fairly comfortable, but set up weird. For example, there is a vinyl loveseat in a niche at the end of the room facing the wall with no view of the TV.  The toilet is right across from the bathroom counter.  I am wondering if the place used to be a retirement  center, since there is shuffleboard and a golf course on location and smells slightly like it. All the rooms in our building had a balcony or patio.  The food at the bar was good, especially the wings and the bar has a very nice ambience.  Disappointed with the service. They were definitely under staffed for the bar and pool at a very obviously peak season, but no one seemed to notice.

The Newport Hyatt is a great location for visitors or locals on a "stay cation." The rooms are basic, but have all that you need. With their resort fee it now includes wifi for up to 6 devices, golf on their 3 par adjoining course, and an hour bike ride. The only downside to the hotel is their restaurant menu. While I appreciate that they have healthy options, and some fine dining choices, they lack the basics. If you are staying there multiple nights they really should add some easy choices.

Summary Heading: Depends on what you are looking for
Summary: My husband and I had to stay here due to his corporate rate policy.  I read the many reviews about this place and was very hesitant about going there but after staying there two nights, I think I can sum it up by saying it depends on what you are looking for.  The Hyatt is great for families.  There is so much to do for kids and the place is very "active".  If you are a couple looking for peace and quiet, this is not the place for you.  Also, if you are looking for luxury accommodations, this is not the place for you.  If you are looking for nice accommodations at a nice value with good service, then great.  I think this sums up all of the reviews from my perspective.    When we arrived very late on check in, we were told that they had no more King rooms and only could offer a

We had reservations for Friday - Monday and had requested a bay view room. The first night none was available, but was given a nice room on the top floor. I got a phone call Saturday AM to state the Bay view room was available and requested permission to move my belongings to the new room. When we arrived back to the hotel, I got the new keys and everything was moved into a nice Bay view room.

Summary Heading: A Ghost Hotel?  Me Thinks So.
Summary: Let me start off by saying that the property is renovated and very pretty.  The rooms are average at best, more motel-like than hotel-like, but the property is nice with a par 3 golf course, nice pools, a volleyball court, shuffle board, etc.  So the landscape and property is fairly nice but that is where the good stops, and that is certainly not enough to qualify as an acceptable hotel.  The service was good at check-in but plummeted downward like a plane without engine support after that.  Here are some examples:  I went to the restaurant for breakfast, nobody waited on us as we sat at our table for 30 minutes -- we walked out.  I called the for our car valet, there was no answer.  I called room service wanting a simple meal, there was no answer.  I called the bellman wanting

Summary Heading: Great place for a family with kids
Summary: This is a big place, so be prepared to walk some. We stayed 3 nights and have an 8 and 12 yr old- it was fine for them  The good: Room is comfortable with mini fridge, flat screen, really comfy beds Total of 3 pools, one with a water slide that our youngest loved Friendly staff You can charge to your room, which our boys liked to get their slushies Feels like a resort and has many activities to do - good ones too like giant chess, shuffleboard, poolside movie night, volleyball and more  The less than good: - The first day we returned to our room , no one had cleaned it ;(, we called the front desk and they said they would be happy to send someone right away- we understand it happens, and their offer was fair   Overall it was a great stay, and would definitely stay again

This was our second stay at the Hyatt.  We stayed in room 635 and it was an excellent room because it was somewhat larger than most rooms and it had bunk beds which our kids enjoyed.  The room overlooked the swimming pool.

Should have gone with the Marriott. Booked a great room and arrived to much less. Overpriced. Booked a room with a bay view and got the old bait and switch. Room with a view...of white event tents and pool noise.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on TripAdvisor. I am very sorry you didn’t receive a Bay View room. If you stay with us again, please reach out to me so I may better assist you.  Best, Sarah Morris

Summary Heading: Good stay, nice hotel with very helpful staff
Summary: The ground of the hotel are really good with interesting things to do. Nice pools and gym. The concierge, the valet parking folks and rest of the staff were so helpful and friendly that they made our stay very enjoyable. The rooms were all right, although the screens on the doors to the balcony were old and should be replaced.  Beds and room amenities were not up to Hyatt standards. Rooms could use an update; they looked somewhat old.  Food and service in the hotel restaurant was very good. The valet parking fee was very expensive. Good location for accessing the Pacific Coast Highway and various attractions.

They needed our two bed room for something else, so we got the opportunity to upgrade. It was a king bed room, and we had to put an extra bed in. With the room it followed a number of amenities, which was great. We also found out that the room had a great view. That was also great.  But 22 dollars for self-park is a fail. The resort fee disease has also infected this hotel. There is no reason not to include this in the total when you reserve the hotel room. It is just a stupid practice.   Other than that it was a good hotel.

Summary Heading: Depends on where your room is.
Summary: I had a wonderful room with a view of one of the pools. Plenty of space, but no microwave in the room.  Wait staff in the bar was overwhelmed with the number of people there for the convention I was at.  They need to have more wait staff during these times.They had a giant chess board and full size shuffle board that you could play at no charge.

This Hyatt Regency has lush rolling lawns with mature landscaping and lots of bunnies roaming the venue. We appreciate this setting.  The premium location is wonderful for visitors. The property is situated on Newport Back Bay and a very short distance to world class shopping, restaurants and beautiful Newport Beach, Balboa Island and Laguna Beach.  Friendly staff and recent room upgrades were welcomed. It is a more casual Hyatt Regency,but, well suited for the beach. Request rooms in the pavilion area. Rooms by the pool are older , smaller snd do not have patios.  Many great restaurants are nearby. This is the area we live in and appreciate yhe selection.

As a Hyatt Diamond member I've stayed at many Hyatt Regency hotels and this is on the bottom of my list. The noise level in the rooms is appalling. You can literally hear people above, below, and to the side. The walls in the newly refurbished rooms in the main building are paper thin. Any time someone opens their door to get outside it sounds like bowling balls rolling around above you. The staff at the hotel is fully aware of the sound issues but play coy any time a guest brings this up. I brought it up with a front desk agent who did an amazing job of acting like he had never heard of the noise issues. Not 15 minutes goes by and another guest approached the same front desk agent who was told the same response that the agent has never heard this! When asking if they had

This has been one of the most wonderful resorts I have been to. The charm, the laid back atmosphere, the decor, the food, the entertainment was fabulous.  This resort is a must do vacation spot for families or couples. I love how spread out it is and how relaxing it is. It's a stone's throw from Balboa Island, and Fashion Island so don't wait, book a trip now.. This would be a memory you wouldn't want to miss...

Summary Heading: Excellent Service and Mgmt was on top of everything
Summary: Great time at this property. Very relaxing. And mgmt was on top of everything. From front desk check to room service.  Excellent!!! The shuttles from the hotel to the shopping mall and to the beach area was a definite plus. Also, the early morning coffee area was a great plus for early risers like myself. The concert on Friday evening was very well presented with areas for refreshments set and well maintained.

Summary Heading: Amazing trip because we felt like we were at home! Very comfortable and welcoming!
Summary: Outstanding friendly staff who went out of their way to be helpful. Amazing atmosphere with tons to do for kids and adults! The food on site was outstanding! The many pool options allowed fun or just relaxing pool side. Overall it was an amazing hotel that I would stay at again and recommend to everyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great feedback!

Summary Heading: A wonderful place for my family!
Summary: This is our second stay at this resort.  And, as before, we stayed there because we are in between long term vacation rentals.  It is the perfect place for our family of 5.  My three young boys enjoy the pool facilities.  The staff, from the bell desk, to front office, housekeepiers, pool attendants, life guards and bartenders…. They are very friendly and helpful.  The room is clean and there's free wifi!  The location is great because it is close to beaches, beautiful Balboa Island and Fashion Island.  Couldn't ask for more!  When ever the opportunity arises, we will go bak.

A great hotel in Newport Beach.  Althoug not directly on the beach, you can rent cruisers from the hotel and boike down to the beach.  If you are looking to stay right on th ebeach, there is not much in Newport that that accompdate that.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response! I'm happy that you were able to take your bike to the beach! Our resort fee includes complimentary bike rentals for up to 2 hours. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: The hotel was wonderful! I wanted to do 4.5 stars but couldn't. The ONLY downside was that you can hear rolling suitcases going down the sidewalk...and at midnight, that is an issue. Also there were kids in the pool after hours one night. ON the positive side, concierge is very helpful, housekeeping was wonderful, the rooms are very comfortable, everything was clean, the convention set-up was great and they do no how to make a margarita!
Manager Response: It’s great to hear that our staff gave you great service! I will make sure they are all aware of your positive feedback. I am truly sorry that there were kids in the pool after hours. I will mention this to my security team to make sure they are keeping a close eye on quiet hours. Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to see you soon!

Summary: Great customer service and great amenities. From stay fit , shuffle boards, life size chess board, two different pools one with a slide and their complimentary fresh baked cookies are great.. It's about a ten minute ride to the peninsula but you have your own private beach in the back so if you just want to stay away this is the place to be.
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a great time at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach! We are so happy to hear that you were able to take advantage of all of our amenities. The Back Bay  is a great option to explore aside from the beach. They also offer lots of water rentals and activities. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: My husband and three children (14, 13, 11) stayed here for 2 nights on our way home to Australia and we should have skipped this hotel and gone directly home! We arrived at 1am after driving up from San Diego. Lady at front desk was not friendly or welcoming. Only told us where the rooms were located (apparently way over in the 70's style older building that looks like a motel, not resort style hotel). She failed to tell us about any of the amenities, including where to get breakfast, location of pools, gym etc. We were all starving after getting off a 6 hour flight from Hawaii and arriving after midnight, room service is closed and as hotel is not near any shops we went to our room hungry! Rooms were Ok having undergone a refurbishment, but beware if travelling with more than 2
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on our hotel. I'm sorry to hear we didn’t meet all your expectations. I will make sure my overnight front office team is aware of your comments and is coached for all future check-ins. I'm also sorry you weren’t impressed with breakfast. Our full buffet cost $24 and that includes coffee or juice. We also offer a continental breakfast for $14 per person and a regular menu that ranges in price from $8-$15. If you have any questions or concerns about charges, please reach out to a hotel manager directly so we can look into your billing. Again thank you for your feedback so we may make improvements.

Summary Heading: A little rule enforcement would go a long way
Summary: The staff is lovely, the property is amazing & the rooms are comfortable.  The shuffleboard screams til 1:30am and the pool closing around whenever are major negatives, especially for weekday work conferences held on site

Summary Heading: Nice, but fairly isolated resort hotel.
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Hyatt as I was attending a conference there.  For conference setting, it was great except it is not close to very many restaurants if one wants to leave the campus at day's end.  We stayed on the second floor of the Lido which is very far from the self parking, but very quiet.  We had a beautiful balcony overlooking the small golf course and bay; it was a great place to be to relax after conference.  King-size bedroom was large and modern although bathroom a bit small.  A refrigerator and low ball glasses in bathroom are available.  Aesthetically, this hotel can't be beat.  Great for children and adults alike.  We would stay here again.

My husband, two kids (3 1/2 years and 10 months) and I spent three nights at this amazing resort and did not want to leave!! The kid pool was great entertainment for all of us from the water slide to the putting green and the fun activities throughout the resort kept us having a great time. Also the bike rental (free with the resort fee) allowed us to explore the beautiful Back Bay each day. We also enjoyed the great food and beverages on the resort grounds. We also loved the size and cleanliness of our room. My husband and I enjoyed the quite adult pool as well as our room balcony while our boys napped. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone!!

Summary Heading: Great location & staff, small & noisy rooms
Summary: Hotel service from staff is exceptional, from check-in, to the pool attendants, to room service. As other reviews indicate, the Bay rooms are noisy. You are steps away from a pool that is 9 ft to 4 ft. deep, a water slide, and a splash kids area. Therefore,  through the windows and door you hear plenty of hallway traffic and families having fun. Through the walls and ceilings you could hear bumps, conversations & arguments, kids cry, water noises, and people's steps. Definitely, noisy!   We were there for the 4th of July weekend and so it was quite busy. Pool chairs got used up quickly, but the staff was diligent in helping you find a spot. Kids loved the pool, splash area, and slide! The hotel also had kids activities like face painting, cookie decorating, etc. (though it may

Generally a rather good hotel. If and when i need to return to the area, I will certainly stay here again.  The common areas are very nice. There is a terrific patio (outdoor lounge) area out behind the bar, with nice lighting and comfortable seating.The staff very helpful and courteous. There are several swimming pools, and i had the one nearest my room to myself. I understand you can play tennis and golf too.   With regards to the accommodation I was staying in the building furthest from the lobby. Probably cheaper rooms as it was a company rate. The bathroom was small yet stylishly decorated. The bedroom itself was large, with a small terrace overlooking the golf course. The room had very little character and the energy saving bulbs in the lamps created a cold sterile mood.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response. We are glad to hear that overall you had a nice time at our hotel. I'm sorry you were not completely satisfied with the room location. It sounds like you were in our Lido Building. The lido building is near the gym and the golf course. It also offers nice patios and great views. If you stay with us again, please request to stay in the Catalina or Balboa building as I think it would fit your preferences better. Our parking is run through a 3d party company. Our parking prices are competitive with other hotels in the area. Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel but room are small
Summary: At this hotel the rooms are very nice and clean. Through this might be cleaned at the not very large went to room with two double beds not Queens. Two people Exspecially adults to not fit on this bed is very easy. The layout of the room is the door is open and it does hit the one of the beds across one of the birds there is a desk then there is any dresser with ETV on top of it any chair for lamp closet and then on the other side of the wall for the same class appears there is a bathroom and then parrelle are the 2 beda is not very much room in this hotel room but I guess since the the Pool is so nice there is no need to be in your room. It also have plenty of fun activities for the kids like there is a giant sack trust that little cool room outside the lobby – of a boring many
Manager Response: It’s great to hear that you had fun at the pool. Every weekend in the summer we offer great activities for kids in our main pool including face painting, water balloon toss, and dive in movie night. I'm sorry to hear that the rooms and the beds were not large enough for your family. We recommend that families request the Balboa building. This building has king beds or double beds but they also offer a small pull out sofa that is great for a family who needs an extra sleeping space. You can also book a "family plan" when making a reservation. This plan is like booking two rooms however the second room is at a discounted rate. It’s also great to book that plan because the rooms will be connected. Thank you again for your feedback. I'm happy to hear you had a great time!

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel, perfect pool for kids
Summary: From the second we got there we were treated like royalty.  Every person (except the gift shop staff) we came into contact with was helpful, very positive, and friendly.  We stopped by the gift shop on Thursday morning and the staff was not friendly at all.  Didn't greet us, didn't know the prices on stuff.  We stopped in again on Friday and same thing, they weren't friendly at all.  When I asked for five 1's she acted annoyed and then I realized I needed more 1's and asked to change another $5, she rolled her eyes.  I saw her and made a comment to my husband that everyone in this hotel is so nice except for in here.  Okay, done with the negatives.  Everyone else was so great! I had my two young kids with me at breakfast by myself one morning and the waitress and everyone were
Manager Response: Thank you for your great response. I'm so sorry to hear that the gift shop didn’t provide you with the same excellent service as the rest of our hotel staff. I will make sure they are aware of your comments so that they can make improvements for the future. We hope to see you again soon!

Summary Heading: Fine place to spend a couple of days
Summary: Enjoyable resort with very good service. Near many great amenities in Newport Beach. not far frm freeway or beach. Fun activities on resort property: giant chessboard, shuffleboard, golf, and several swimming pools.  Overall a very good facility. Great for kids.
Manager Response: We are glad to hear you were able to enjoy some of the amenities we have on property. Our giant chessboard is a pleaser for both kids and adults!

Summary Heading: A first-rate hotel that's great for families!
Summary: We stayed in the Hyatt Newport Beach for three nights in June 2014, and I'm SO glad we did! My husband and I were traveling with my 72-year-old mother and our two sons (ages 3 and 7), and the Hyatt offered something for everyone. The hotel and grounds are lovely. It's a 26-acre campus that's incredibly well-manicured and inviting. It's super fancy without being snooty. The hotel has been renovated fairly recently, and everything is modern and beautiful. The staff welcomed our kids with open arms, including giving them complementary cookies at check in, slushies by the pool, and toys when we left. The kids' pool (one of three) has a great water slide, splash pad, ping pong table, and mini-golf. We ordered burgers by the pool one afternoon, which was a blast. Our kids also loved
Manager Response: I'm so happy to hear you had a great experiance with your family by the pool. We hope to see you again very soon!

Summary Heading: Very Nice Place but don't give them your credit card for incidentals
Summary: I was there this past week on a company training.  I was told that I had to give them my credit card for incidentals.  Well when I checked my statement I find that they have charged everything to me!  I have called them everyday this week to have this removed and despite them saying they were removed I have still been charged.  This is the 2nd time I have had this experience with Hyatt this year alone.  The other time earlier this year at the Hyatt in Miami.  I am beginning to think this may be standard operating procedure to play dumb and then apologize to increase revenue!
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear about your frustrating experience with your credit card. Every bank has a different method of clearing credit card authorizations. If you use a debit card or credit card most banks will take 48-72 hours to release any type of authorization done through a bank. When checking into any hotel the standard operating procedure is to authorize your credit card for the full amount of room and tax as well as incidentals. Incidentals will be a different authorization depending on what hotel you stay at. If you are still experiencing issues with your credit card, please feel free to contact our accounting department so they may look into your account.

Summary: Sophisticated, stylist and comfortable rooms.  However, selecting the correct room is important. The Bay rooms look over a large pool area with water slides for kids.  If you have a family this is the ideal room for you.  These rooms will be noisy during the day.  The Lido rooms look toward the 9-hole golf course and in some rooms you also can see the harbor.  These rooms have access to a pool but are quiet.  We were explicit and told several people at check-in that we wanted a quiet room.  We were there at 11am.  We didn't get our room till after 2pm and they put us in the noisy Bay rooms.  The problem was corrected but very annoying. So make sure you get confirmation on your room choice. Most buildings have 3 floors and some have 2 floors.  Get a high floor so you can enjoy
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed so many different outlets in our hotel! I agree that every building offers something different and appeals to our guests in different ways. Thank you for your feedback. We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great resort but ask for a room away from the kids pool
Summary: When we first got to this resort we were overwhelmed by the crowd and very dissapointed with our room, but the next day they fixed this.  First, if you arrive on a Saturday afternoon, be prepared for crowds and chaos as they have weddings at the resort, but after Saturday the resort settled down tremendously.  Our first night, we were at a room by the kids pool.  It was a bit loud, smaller and we had no balcony/patio as their website suggested.  The next day we called the front desk and asked if we could pay to upgrade to a larger room and/or something with a balcony.  They were wonderful and immediately moved us to a quiet, larger room with a private balcony.  The grounds are BEAUTIFUL and the resort fee is very very much worth the price.  It includes, wifi, golf, beach
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your feedback on Trip Advisor. It’s great to hear that you were able to take full advantage of our resort fee and all the amenities we include! I'm happy our staff was able to turn your trip around and make sure you had a great experience!

Summary: My husband was in Newport Beach for business and I decided to tag along. We were there for 3 nights and I really enjoyed my stay. They have complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport, and shuttle to Balboa Island and the Fashion Island Mall as well. There are 3 swimming pools on the property and the grounds are beautiful. The rooms were clean and comfortable, but pretty standard, other than having our own little patio to enjoy sitting outdoors. Food on the property was a bit expensive, but very good. The thing that impressed me the most was the staff. They were friendly, accommodating and provided outstanding customer service!
