It was difficult to see the resort features of this Hyatt Regency.  But then again, if one's staying there on business, it's quite possible to miss much of what someone would look for in a resort.  Rooms exit to the outdoors about the large, unused pool.  Depending on your room location, it can be quite a hike to get to either the lobby of the facility or self-parking area.  The exercise one gets from the long walks around the facility will make up for the broken treadmills in the fitness room!  Anyone trying to get to LAX needs to plan plenty of time for checkout, as this must be accomplished in the main lobby and the delay apparently can be quite long (as evidenced by the line markers).  It took me about 15 minutes to check out, resulting in additional stress in trying to race

Summary Heading: Nice hotel/resort with something for everyone
Summary: This hotel is more like a resort with multiple buildings, multiple pools, tennis, golf, etc. In general, the grounds are well maintained and the landscaping is very pretty. The rooms are nice and what you would expect from this level of hotel - they're not as luxurious as some more expensive hotels but they are comfortable and clean.   I stayed in the Bay Building and we had a very large room with a king bed and a large bathroom. There was also a set of bunk-beds in our room which we did not use, but I'm sure would have been nice if you were traveling with children. Our room was right by the largest of the 3 pools. It had a hot tub, water slide, spray park, cabanas, and ping pong table. They played music all day that could be heard inside the rooms. I really enjoyed this area

There are lots of hidden fees at this hotel. You will pay extra for parking, wifi and then there's the $75/night incidental fee that is mentioned no where on the front of site. I wouldn't have minded so much if I was expecting these additional charges and could plan accordingly. Oh yeah and the room smelled kind of funky and the a/c was loud, outdated and didn't really cool the room that well. Not what I was expecting for a four and a half star hotel.

Our stay at this Hyatt was exceptional. The property has been completely renovated. It has a new, fresh and contemporary feel. The staff was friendly and attentive. Rooms were exceptionally clean, quiet and well furnished. The grounds are beautiful. Even better the price was outstanding for the quality.  Overall we couldn't be more pleased and will return again.

Stayed to help a family member who did a conference there.  Had stayed there years ago, the remodel and update are very nice.  The grounds are wonderful, very lushly planted and extensive, nice just to walk around. Very California feel which is quite relaxing.  Had an upgraded room on the ground floor with table and chairs and lawn outside our door, close to the adult pool.  Very comfortable room, great air conditioning.  Staff very responsive when I requested a robe and crib.  The crib came with blankets, sheets and a little gift pack of lotions, soaps a much appreciated extra touch.  Liked that the refrigerators did not have the mini bar stock stuff because we needed to store breast milk for the baby.  Had breakfast in the coffee shop each morning, both were outstanding.  Even

I stayed here one night on a business trip.  It's not overly fancy but everything was more than comfortable.  The gym was quite cramped but the location is great for a run along the nature reserve.  It's about a mile from the Fashion Island Mall.  Nothing to complain about.

My husband and I stayed there for a wedding so we enjoyed a discounted rate. The rooms are well updated. My only issue was that I don't think they do a good job at cleaning the restroom, including the shower/bathtub, sink, etc. They definitely need to train their employees on that. But, otherwise everyone there is very friendly and our overall experience was good. The grounds are well kept and the location is convenient.

This newly remodeled hotel has a lot going for it -- and a few faults we couldn't overlook. The room was spacious with a balcony, a somewhat obscured but still nice view of the bay (though we didn't pay extra), wonderfully responsive staff on all levels, and lush, interesting grounds. I enjoyed walking my dog all over.The entire property was clean and beautifully maintained. I didn't have time for the pools or tennis but there's 3 (pools) that looked like they suited a variety of needs whether it's noisy fun with the kids, sunbathing or reading, etc. The on site restaurant wasn't too pricey - I managed a lunch for one for $20.00 plus tip - but the menu was limited. As was room service selections. My 2 major complaints are the size of the standard bathrooms. One sink, small room

Summary Heading: Staff Takes Care of Problems To Make Your Stay GREAT!
Summary: We almost let the negative reviews scare us away from this property, but we are glad we didn’t put much faith in them or we would have missed a GREAT stay!  We realize that when people have a great stay, they usually don't bother to write a review.  Those who have problems can't wait to let everyone know, so reviews are usually skewed towards the negative.  From the moment we arrived in the middle of the busy hustle and bustle of valet parking, people unloading luggage, and people trying to check in, we were impressed.  The parking attendants had vehicles unloaded and whisked off at a record pace, when we thought we were going to have to wait a long time, being about tenth in line.  The check-in process at the front desk was awesome too, and the bellman had our bags on a cart

Stayed several times on business from 2008 onwards, and once with family. The sprawling richly landscaped grounds, fountains and swimming pools transform an otherwise ordinary 'motel type' complex into a lush SoCal resort. Also a very decent bar and restaurant....certainly  my choice in Orange County. Newport Beach also has its own charm.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel ! Dog Friendly and Very Relaxing
Summary: We recently stayed here when our house was being tented, the termite company wanted to put us in a Ramada which was more like a motel, we decided to stay here instead.  We have two dogs and wanted a better place to walk them in the 3 days we were out of our house. The back bay is directly behind the Hyatt which is gorgeous to walk the dogs and they have easy access gates to get in and out with your room key, you can also head over to the aquatic center and rent kayaks and stand up paddle boards. The Hyatt has 3 beautiful pools, a awesome gym, a great patio to have a glass of wine (with your dogs) and a really cute library style reading area. Easy access to great restaurants and right up the hill is quaint balboa island. The service was exceptional and if you like golf it sits

Summary Heading: Red Roof Inn posing as a Hyatt
Summary: Hotel is run down and a mishmash of different buildings.  I stayed in the "main" building for the first night; elevator looked more like a freight elevator.  I requested a bay view quiet room - was right above where they were having an outdoor event and across from ice maker; bay view was a joke.  I also found a condom on the floor.  Next quiet room they moved me to was in the Balboa building.  They were doing construction on the rooms next door.  Next room they moved me to was adequate, but could not run A/C because it roared.  They 3 night managers I dealt with were arrogant and could care less.  However, Michael, Victor  and the GM  tried very hard to make things right, but by that time, I was done with Hyatt.  Parking quoted on website when I made reservations was $5 less

We spend one night in this beautiful hotel, it is very specious and they have 3 different pools all heated (it was fall so outside it was a bit chilly). Service was great. Valet is free during the day. Location is very convinient, across the street from the fasion island and 3 min drive from Balboa island. The reasons I reduced a star from this hotel are: 1. I would expect hotel in this level to have queen size beds and not double 2. Parking is $22 (or thirty something if you valet) which should be mentioned more clearly during reservation

This exceptional hotel is perfect for a Southern California family vacation!  It is Spanish architecture and the newly renovated rooms are spacious and very comfortable. There are 3 swimming pools, one with a water slide that makes this a good kid's pool.  The food is delicious and reasonably priced. There are plenty of great beaches close by, our favorite was Crystal Cove, a state beach with  a very safe swimming beach.  Balboa Island is less than a mile from the hotel, and is a short and inexpensive small ferry ride.   Other things the kids enjoyed were Disneyland, 45 minutes away, and Sea World, 1 1/2 hours away, as well as Legoland.  Just across  the street is Fashion Island, one of the great shopping areas of America, with every imaginable store.  Also next to the hotel is

Summary Heading: Peaceful and relaxing, good value for money
Summary: The hotel accommodation is spread across several buildings on a very large site and this gives the place a relaxing feel. The pool we used in the Lido block was quiet and never busy as  people with young children tend to use the pool with the slide which is nearer the lobby area. (I would recommend the Lido rooms as they are furthest from the restaurant and lobby but still only 2-3 mins walk). The staff were excellent, food very good and the location is great if you want to visit Huntingdon Beach, Laguna etc. The hotel also provides a free courtesy bus to the Mall and Balboa island. The rooms are very comfortable, have nice balconies (worth requesting one overlooking Back Bay for the views) and whilst the buildings are relatively old they are well maintained. Overall, a nice

Summary Heading: Very enjoyable and relaxing hotel GREAT STAFF
Summary: First of all they staff at this hotel is some of the BEST. I have traveled many different places on business but the staff at this hotel seems to go above and beyond. When I stayed that had just finished renovating the interiors of the hotel. The also have appeared to renovate the ground or were working on it. I had a room in the Lido section it is the fartherst from the Lobby but it is very quiet. I had a nice view of the golf course and could see the bay. The hotel does have a free airport shuttle which is very nice and leaves every hour from the hotel but it is a bit hard to pick it up from the airport. There is a shuttle to the Fashion Centre Mall and to the edge of Balboa Island but I wish there was a shuttle that went a little further or at least maybe on the went to the

Summary Heading: Great Staff; Updates trying to compensate
Summary: Stayed for conference hosted by hotel. Would come back if had to but would not seek out.  VERY good and accommodating staff!...they compensate for most short-comings & seem to take pride in that. Typical "SW Resort" outdoor walking layout. Decent place. Clean throughout. Well maintained. Can tell bldgs. must have been built in 1960s or so. Not contemporary feel of most Hyatts. Nice grounds, plantings/etc, pool, chip-n-putt golf 'course', tennis courts.  Solid Wifi, but better be @ $13~$17/day!  Average but tasty breakfast (included in conference fee). Good food & catering staff and conference facilities for our ~350people. Room beds & surfaces are updated but generally a typical feel.  Bonus: rooms have ample sized balconies for nice days.  Shuttle to-from John Wayne/Orange Cty

Summary Heading: Hyatt charge a high price for a hotel that is in need of major renovation
Summary: Large, sprawling hotel that is tired looking and in need of a total overhaul. The hotel has focused on the aesthetics of the lobby area to mask an old, poorly maintained establishment.  ˃ BEACH: the hotel is located over 2 miles from the beach. No bus\shuttle service is provided by the hotel, and there is no public bus link available.   ˃ BARS: nightlife in Newport is centred in two locations, ‘the Peninsula’ and ‘the triangle.’ Both are a $20-30 cab ride from the hotel. A bar is available on site, with friendly\pleasant staff. A pint of Bud Light is $6. The food menu is simple and limited. Bar food service is slow, especially at the weekends. Small fridges are provided in room. The nearest grocery store is 1.2 miles away.  ˃ SHOPPING: an hourly shuttle service is provided to
Manager Response: Hugo, Thank you for taking the time to leave a review from your recent stay, as your comments provide us a chance to further improve our property for you and our future guests. Although the beach is not located directly across from the hotel, we do have the bay just across the street, and there is public transportation pick up right on the corner of PCH and Jamboree Rd, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. We also offer a complimentary shuttle ride to Fashion Island as well as Balboa Island. Our season staff has departed, but we feel our hotel app is a step toward the future and see this as a way to provide our guests food and beverage to the pool area year round, which I dont think you will find in many places. I am truly sorry that your stay was not as perfect as we would like for you. I hope that you will give us another chance, as I am sure we will amaze you with our top notch customer service and beautiful property. Please feel free to contact us before you return so we can ensure your future stay goes smooth and effortlessly. Thank you again for your time, and we look forward to having you back.

Summary: Stayed for 8 days as part of a vacation in the US.  Bear in mind we were already in holiday mode so our patience for minor frustration may be greater than it may normally.  Most of our not so good experiences are relatively minor but the sum total of these left us feeling a bit miffed.  It's the small things that make a big difference.  Our experience in the US is that overall customer service is excellent.  The staff at this hotel are very willing, always smiling and try there best.  In my view the problem does not lie with the quality of the frontline staff  So, the not so good #1  Despite explaining that we were a couple staying at the hotel for 8 days we were dispatched to the furthest room from reception which had 2 small double beds made up as singles, with a view out of

We chose the Hyatt Regency at Newport Beach, CA for our last hotel in a trip driving down the coast, and it was definitely a case of saving the best for last! We arrived very early - before 11 am, and were told we could get in our room which was much appreciated. We were given a choice of two locations that had rooms ready and we picked the garden view - definitely a great decision. This room had a good size balcony which overlooked the beautiful gardens and had a tiny view of the bay also. Everything appeared brand new and freshly remodeled with all the most modern touches. They have 3 pools and we chose the one that had wonderful furniture- huge bed with overstuffed pillows and large umbrellas around, couches, and a firepit! The service was top notch and everyone was so

We were here for a conference.  Our room was convenient to the conference rooms, but right next to the pool.  I was working in our room while my boyfriend attended the conference.  My work involves a lot of phone work.  Between the thumping loud music blasted from speakers at the pool, the rush of water down the long tube slide, and children screaming incessantly...getting much work done was very difficult.  The room was spacious but quite stripped down.  No artwork of any kind on the walls and plain white bed covering.  Not even a bedspread.  This hotel has just one restaurant and it is high priced.  The portions are very small.  In the morning, the bar transformed into a continental breakfast bar where you pay for coffee, pastries, bagels, juice, or fruit.  There was no

Summary Heading: Not sure we would go back
Summary: We pulled up to the hotel on a Friday evening to a power outage and tons of people outside. My husband went in while the family waited in the car. He came back out and a bellman came with to get the bags. As we were unloading the car, the lights came back on. We got in the elevator (probably not the best idea) and headed up to floor 2 (Catalina) and the guy said how much longer until the power goes off again?  I was thinking to myself, not exactly what I want to hear in an elevator....we get to the room and the staff had given us an envelope with a room number, but no keys.  We finally get in the room to find 1 bed for 4 people. How the bellman would allow that to even occur without fixing it is beyond me...  We asked him for a rollaway and to be put on the list to be moved to a

Summary Heading: Some part have been improved still work in progress
Summary: This was my fourth stay in about 10 years. Some things have improved since my last visit about 4 years ago. I was staying there for a conference. I would strongly recommend the balboa wing of rooms. These room have been recently upgraded and the carpet smelt fresh. I stayed in a room looking on to the balboa pool however the trees are so mature and block the light out you have to have a light on all day. Bed was very comfortable. The Balboa pool area is the best out of all the three there. The sun longueurs are new and comfortable. We spent two days down there and there was a max of 10 people there per day. If you wanted service at the pool they have this app you can down load to order however you must have a US phone number so from the UK you have to us the pool side phone.

The Newport Beach Hyatt has some things you'd expect and one that I was shocked to discover.  The TV in my room was analog!  The picture was terrible!  What a massive disappointment.  The other issue was Internet access.  That they still don't offer free Wi-Fi is another shocker.  You have to ASK for robes which is troubling in this price range.    I will admit that the food at our banquet was quite good and the service very friendly.  And, the bathroom in my room was delightful with back-lit mirrors and updated furniture/fixtures.  It is not near anything scenic except for a nature preserve but the property itself is lovely.

Summary Heading: Relaxing location in family friendly property
Summary: I was here for a work meeting so I would've normally never stayed here for pleasure. I would highly recommend for families that would like to be close to water as there is a bay right next to hotel. Not sure if its available to all because our group rented it out for an evening. Ideal waters for paddle boarding and kayaking.  Liked: -  Self parking is convenient because property is sprawling. Easy access to car if your room was in a building away from the lobby. I was in the Balboa building which I would recommend- clean and quiet (apart from loud air conditioner)            - Hotel catering was one of the best I've had! Greek yogurt fruit parfaits, green tea pana cotta...            - cool kid friendly pool but also had cabana options  Dislikes: - some of the meeting rooms and

This is a high end luxury resort hotel and one pays a very steep price to stay here.  Expect extra charges for self-parking, etc.  Just don't expect complimentary breakfast or anything without paying more.  It is what it is. Thus, one should expect top service and amenities.  The staff did not disappoint. The food was outstanding.  I had one of the best steaks ever here in the dining room.  There are several pools and it is just a short walk to the beach.  The rooms are well-appointed.  Yes, it is true that there is very little privacy (well, not really any privacy) due to louvers in the bathroom doors.  Annoying, cheap and low class, but that is about the only flaw in the room.  The cleanliness was outstanding. The beds are very comfortable.

Summary Heading: I didn't even pay for this hotel and wouldn't stay again
Summary: I travelled here on a work trip.  My work paid for the room and everything else.  We have to have roommates in my profession and was put into a room with double beds.  First off the bathroom door is not really there.  They are shutters!  You can hear and see almost everything through them.  If you need a room with a double bed then you are staying with friends or children and I don't think that the whole room needs to hear you go to the bathroom!  Put freaking doors up!  Plus the beds have a sheet as a comforter and there are NO blankets in the room.  Freezing cold even when they brought be an extra thin blanket.  Then there is the sewage smell that spews up from the back of the building. Our room was at the back of the hotel so from the lobby it was a long walk that was up and

Summary Heading: Customer service and hospitality is INCREDIBLE !!
Summary: My first stay at The Hyatt Newport Beach was March 2013 (business trip) and it was shortly after they just completed the 15 million-dollar renovation. This by far is one of the cleanest and well laid-out resorts I have visited. The beds are super comfortable with many fluffy pillows. The drapes are designed to block out the daylight so you'll get a restful sleep. The room decor is warm and reflects the upscale feel of Newport Beach. I actually stay at this property just about every other weekend and I truly look forward to seeing the friendly staff. Robert, the valet, always greets me with a pleasant smile and Sarah Morris has been absolutely phenomenal !! Out of all the Hyatt hotels I frequent, Hyatt Newport Beach is by far my favorite. For the business traveler, its perfect

We stayed here for one night in the beginning of September. I found the customer service to be top notch. I expect great service from a hotel of this caliber but you don't always receive it. Check-in was smooth. They gave us an option of a few different rooms. We choose one straight through the main building in the next building by the pool with the water slide. As for the room: bathroom was great, beds were very comfortable, plenty of space. We did not visit the restaurant at the hotel but there was one. We did use the hot tub, which was actually quite large. Training for a half marathon, there was a really nice running path easily accessible out the back of the hotel, something I couldn't in every location we visited on this trip. They did have a fitness center as well that

Not your typical  business and convention type Hyatt but a relaxed resort type hotel. Property is sprawling as such valet parking is well worth your buck  more so as the place was packed with a lot of people that weekend with a wedding and a jazz festival going on.    I got a room at the swimming pool level which meant walking down a few steps . Room was huge and the bathroom was  nicely decorated.  What was surprising was the noise from the pool did not permeate into the room.  I was a bit worried about the internet connectivity due to the size of the property but no problem at all.    What I really liked about the people here was the great customer service that you receive from everyone.   From the valet, front desk, bartender and even room service, everyone gave their utmost

We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for three nights in mid-September.  We were there for a family wedding (held on a yacht).  The room was quite nice with a desk, chair, T.V., iron, ironing board and amenities.  Strangely, the coffee maker was located in the bathroom.  Even stranger, there was no outlet, so you had to move all the coffee-making implements into the main room.  Also, there was only one towel hook - for everything - including bath towels, beach towels, bathing suits, clothes, etc. All that being said, it was a wonderful spot - family was close together and the pool was nice.  The kids especially enjoyed the water slide.   It is a quick walk to the beach, although we didn't spend much time there, it looked like there was a lot to do - paddle boats, paddle

Well what to say. Firstly all those Lazy People moaning about Parking is to far from the Hotel and rooms funny it's like minutes away up a small and I mean small hill. The Hotel looks great there are a few issues with maintenance there were a lot of floor tiles broken around the pool areas and around the Hotel. All staff except from Reception staff were amazing. Reception staff was not interested in helping at all even when they can see you really need help. Another issue is that when they have concerts and functions there they let them take over the Hotel, the pool is over crowded with people smoking and eating at these time making price guest feel very unwelcome.  The Hotel is in a great location to all beaches and local amenities. Good food and drink not to bad priced. Would

Stayed here from September 17-20, 2013 because of a business conference in the area. The hotel was about a $20 cab ride (with tip) from SNA (John Wayne airport) and very quick.  Scoped out the area upon check-in and everything looked very clean and modern with canisters full of water to fill your water bottle with (until around 7pm) in the lobby/foyer area.   When I had checked in, the hotel had run out of the room that I had booked for myself online, so they upgraded me (for free) to a pool view room and a balcony. These rooms are located in the same building as the check-in, check-out, which was very convenient and close to get to; however, I noticed others attending the same conference as me that had rooms far away from the main lobby and those rooms were a bit of a walk.  My

Stop at this hotel for 3 nights no complaints about the service,staff friendly ,choice of pools and the one we went in was good the water slide for ' kids' was good fun I really must grow up.The rooms were clean tidy and unlike other reviewers no complaints about thin walls.  We stopped at the week end and so the hotel was full of families plus wedding parties this made the lobby/bar area very busy but no problems. Only problem the hotel is about a mile from any other restaurants so you have to drive,those the walk down to Balboa Island was ok. Well worth stopping at this hotel.

My husband, 5 month old daughter and I stayed here for a night in the beginning of September. We received absolutely terrible service. Despite calling ahead and confirming a pack and play could be provided, when we arrived at the hotel we were informed they were "out". We were informed then, pack and plays are given on a "first come" basis. This information was not shared with me on the phone earlier, and I also feel calling ahead to request a pack and play for a specific night would be considered a reservation. We were informed there is a pull out couch in the room....which is highly unsuitable for a baby that can roll now! We were very frustrated as we would have travelled with our pack and play if we knew there was any possibility we would not have one provided.  The front
Manager Response: I am very sorry for the mix-up with the pack and play, and I can completely understand your frustration upon arriving to find that the pack and play's were not available. I agree with you completly that the first come first serve basis information should have been explained to you on the phone when you first called. This information has been relayed to our staff to ensure we provide our guests with thourough information so they will know what the hotel offers, especially when young children are travelling. Although we have had an unfortunate miscommunication with you I can assure you that this was a rare error and something we plan to make sure does not happen again. I hope that you will give us the opportunity to show you how amazing our service truly is.

Summary: The hotel has apparently undergone renovations recently. While the lobby is lovely and the rooms look modern, I don't care how stylish the bathroom is when I can hear every word of my neighbor's conversation in their room at 11pm and 6am. This place needs soundproofing!  In addition to that, I found the layout strange. To get to the Lido Building I had to lug my suitcases out of the main building, up a few stairs, across a service road, up a few more stairs, and then up a full flight of stairs since I was on the 2nd floor and there is no elevator.   Wifi is $10.95 per *device* (not per room) per 24 hours. I couldn't get my A/C to work properly. The Fashion Island Mall is close, but requires a walk up a steep hill. Shuttles exist, but are infrequent.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave comments from your recent stay as this is a way for us to continually improve our level of service for our guests. I am very sorry that you were unhappy with the level of noise from your neighbors, as we do put up signs to be quiet between 10pm to 6am. We also have a night patrol to ensure guests are keeping their noise to a respectable level. However, if you ever have a noise problem, please feel free to let our staff know so that we may address it quickly for your satisfaction. Although the Lido building is on the side of the main building it offers great views of the Golf Course as well as the Back Bay. If you are in need of assistance with your luggage we have a great bell staff who will not only take your luggage but they can tell you about the amazing history of our property while on the way to your room. The shuttle service to Fashion Island and Balboa Island runs every 2 hours, which hopefully gives you enough time to walk around those areas or grab a bite to eat and be ready for pick-up by the time you are finished. We hope that you will be back in the future to enjoy our property. Thank you

Summary: Being a USA travel agent, I have seen a lot of USA hotels and this one was gorgeous...great location for the beach and getting to Huntington Beach for nightlife. We loved our 2 night stay here, but make sure you book a bay view room...sunsets are stunning.

I'm a frequent Hyatt customer and this trip specific was a great experience, Sarah who oversees the Hyatt passport customers went out of her way to make my stay great, she was helpful with my requests, contacted me afterwards to make sure everything was taken care of and even met me the next morning in the lobby to personally introduce herself.   Everyone at the hotel was courteous and always willing to help in anyway possible.    Perfect customer service!!!

My girlfriend and I just stayed here for two nights for a girl's weekend.  The staff was very courteous and helpful - they advised us on room location telling us, honestly, about noise level.  We chose a room in the Balboa building near a very quiet, adult pool and loved it.  The pool we were at, though not the main pool, still have beverage and food service.  The room was clean and spacious and beds were very comfortable.  We did not eat at the hotel but they have a nice bar area which serves coffee and light breakfast items in the morning (very handy) and turns into a bar at night.  This hotel has a nice tropical feel and is extremely well located to enjoy all of Newport and Balboa Island.  I would highly recommend it!

Summary Heading: Let down by too much noise from other rooms and the corridor/courtyard
Summary: I wanted to like the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach but I value my sleep too much. We stayed in the Lido Building and other parts of the hotel might not suffer from the same noise issues.  My main problems with noise include: a) You can hear every word of your neighbour's conversation through the connecting doors - you can even join in the conversation if you want! b) The courtyard outside is bare so noise bounces around. This is especially a problem with drunken guests saying their long "good nights" in the small hours - you can hear every word because it will wake you up. c) The passageway outside each room is stone/brick and you can hear guests wheeling their luggage around throughout the night - it sounds like a rail track. d) The flight path from John Wayne Airport is overhead

We stayed for 2 nights after we had flown in to LAX.  Check in was simple and the room we had was a good size and felt like it had recently been refurbished.  The safe wasn't working and when we tried to ring to tell them we found the phone didn't work either.  We told them about the problems as we went out for food. On returning to our room later, neither were fixed and we couldn't be bothered to walk all the back to reception that night.  We made them aware again in the morning and eventually people came to fix it all.  No big deal, but for the price I expected better service. Location is OK, but not much within walking distance.

I am giving this hotel this high rating because of the service.  the hotel itself underwent a large renovation, so everything looks clean and modern, but the designs of the building still look a bit dated.  that said, we checked into a great room (lido bldg.) second floor, overlooking bay and golf course. it was as though everyone agreed that the area would be quiet and private!  we wound up with some neighbors smoking on their patio and it was coming into our room.  we called to find out if we could get in another room and Ariana said she would check with management.  after waiting some time we headed down to the restaurant and our server Shaun (I hope I spelled it right), was fantastic.  it was our first wedding anniversary, so he bought us a bottle of champagne.  dinner was

Summary Heading: A unique resort with a lot to offer
Summary: When i first saw the reviews i thought the resort is a typical one in a deserted area. What i experienced was total leisure in a unique resort that has a lot of attractions and events for a great price compared to rival hotels/resorts. The rooms are clean and spacious. The resort offers 3 distinct pools plus jacuzzis. A state of the art mall (fashion island mall) is nearby with great restaurants and movie theaters. I would totally stay there again and again if I had the chance to.

We stayed here for 4 nights to start our 2 weeks in California and do the Disney thing for our daughter.  Easy access to Disney the coast and just over an hour to LA.  I was a little worried after some of the reviews but as others have said really no need.  The room was clean modern and everything we needed.  The pool was lovely and the kids the were happen to spend all day in it.  The restaurant was really good fantastic food and service. Expensive but what else would you expect for a hotel in such a nice area.  Staff happy to help and give advice on travel restaurants and any other questions you may have.

Spent 3 days here on our journey through California. Couldn't have been happier, the hotel looks as if its had a recent makeover so everything was clean and new looking. The large family pool was great and there was plenty of sun loungers to spend the day on. The food from the bar area was lovely and relaxing sitting outside round the fire wall. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Excellent hotel for a long stay in the US
Summary: We have stayed at the Hyatt in Newport Beach on many occasions and have always experienced excellent service from everyone there. Its quite quiet during the week which means you get exclusive use of the pools and bar and restaurants but at the weekends its often very busy with weddings and jazz fesivals, all of which adds to the ambience. Food is plentiful and good quality. Parking can be expensive but if you are on a long stay the management may waive the parking fees, especially if you are making use of their facilities. There are free, regular shutlle busses to Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza. Its in an excellent position too, with Disney, Laguna, Balboa Island and Huntington Beach all close by. Like anywhere int he US a car is a must.

Summary Heading: There is nothing to complain about at this hotel.
Summary: We travelled from the UK and spent 9 happy nights at the Hyatt which was a perfect base for exploring Balboa Island, shopping at Fashion Island or heading out onto the Pacific Highway.  Our first room was in the Bay block next to the family swimming pool.  We only moved as there was no room safe.  We relocated to the Catalina building to a much bigger room with a balcony, which suited our family of 4 better.  I think we would have been squashed for 9 days in the initial room, particularly as there is no separate bathroom.  Both rooms were finished to a high modern standard.  We booked through Virgin Holidays in the UK and enjoyed complimentary parking, no resort fee, free wi-fi and continental breakfast.  Excellent!  The family pool was fantastic.  Only busy at the weekend and

What a great way to end the summer!  The remodel changed the hotel dramatically.  All upgrades were done first class! We had 2 rooms in the Lido Building.  The pool in that area still needs to be redone, broken tiles everywhere, however that didn't change our views of the grounds.  We spent the day in the big pool where the kids could enjoy the water slide and water area.  The pool service was excellent, food was alittle pricey (but it was our last hurrah for summer) however, delicious.  Rooms were big and very comfortable.  Our Favorite place for a STAYCATION!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel stay- but don't book a care with the onsite Hertz car rental
Summary: Awesome hotel... beautiful grounds, several pools, walking distance to arena.  Clean and nice rooms.  Onsite restaurant was amazing!  Would be willing to stay there again.  If not for my car experience I would have rated much higher.  One problem was the Hertz car rental on the property grounds.  Would not advise booking a car here.  Renee Murtaza was rude  She was late, could not find the car, finally gave me a car and said go, realized later the car had only a 1/4th tank of gas and had garbage in it.  When I mentioned it to Renee that afternoon when I returned she was extreemly rude but said she knew the car didn't have gas and would cover the gas.  I was shocked she KNEW the car didn't have gas and let me take it without telling me.  Wow!  I had to put gas in the car to drive

I've stayed in this hotel many times when traveling to So-Cal and I love the quiet location.  It's close to the PCH and right across the road from Balboa Island.  Check in is always a breeze and staff is courteous and helpful.

Spent 6 nights , and had a couple of added extras at no cost. Heard a great band on Friday from our terrace free of charge, had a back seat at a local wedding, and experience and so different from weddings back home. Pool area clean and tidy, spent mose days at the family pool tho we had no kids. Breakfast was good, tho buffet option quite expensive, found a great deal at cocos along jamboree.  Rooms spacious and kept clean, nothing too much trouble. Only complaint was charge orvwifimin rooms.  No charge for guest parking. Great location for trips to other areas, visited Disney, Hollywood (tacky!) and  took in a LA Galaxy game. Balboa Island beautiful and the village inn is he place to o or food, dink and entertainment.  .

horrible reservations experience! They raised my rate from what I had been quoted and what we had agreed to after I had already booked my reservation. I phoned back several days later to pay in advance, and found that 2 night stay was now more than $130 more than expected and agreed upon. Very unscrupulous when you've already made the reservation! I'm finding other hotels with better prices and better location in Newport and would recommend looking elsewhere. I was just unfortunate because this stay was for a wedding in which I was the best man, and most of the party was staying here... They knew this. I guess they figured they could jack the rate up on me and I'd just bend over and take it for the wedding :(
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave a review from your recent stay, and I am very sorry to hear about the issue with the reservations. I am a little confused about what happened, as we would not be able to change the rate of your reservation unless there had been a change made to the dates or some other part of the original reservation. I can completly understand your frustration with the confusion over the change in the rates and would love to help make sure this was not an error or mistake. I will send you a message so that you may contact us and we can look into this reservation more thoroughly. Thank you

Summary: The Hyatt Regency Newport Beach has that tropical island and resort feel. Although I was 40 minutes away from home the entire weekend it felt like I was at a resort on a island. If you want to experience a nice local getaway that takes you away the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach, in Newport Beach California is the place to be. You're surrounded by many food and shopping experiences(Fashion Island), entertainment and beaches. Most of which are within walking distance or you can ride bikes. The Hyatt has a concert series they host and we plan to enjoy a few our favorites artist. The rooms are nice, clean and up to date. The grounds are well kept and the staff friendly.You'll be doing yourself a favor if you spend some time at the Hyatt Regency in Newport Beach,Ca.

The ground were beautiful, hotel room was filthy.  Spilled toothpaste on bathroom floor and wiped it up, my cloth was black.  Horrible dirty ring around the toilet bowl.  Requested towels at 4pm, left at 6:30 pm, came back at 12:00 pm, still no towels.  Phoned again, no towels.  Phoned again in morning, no response. went out in nightgown to get my own.  Service in the restaurant was terrible, coffee, no mug.  Tea cup no tea.  It took 20 minutes to get a cup, 15 minutes to get "sugar in the raw".  Ordered car service through head valet for Sunday morning to LAX, advised him that we required an "extended SUV" like an escalade, or suburban to help with the luggage.    We arrived in an Infiniti we told them and it held all of our luggage. Asked them for confirmation number of
Manager Response: Fluffybelly,  Thank you for the feedback on your experiences at our hotel.  First let me apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay.  We strive to be the preferred brand of leisure and luxury for our guests when they stay in Newport Beach and it seems we fell well short of that during your time with us.  These concerns will definitely be forwarded to the appropriate managers and we will make sure corrective actions are put in place.  Though it does not make what happened during your stay go away, I truly hope that you will give us another chance because I know that we have the ability to give you a far better experience then you encountered.  If you ever visit in the area again, please keep us in mind, we would love to have you back and show you what a great stay is supposed to be like.  All the Best,  Mike P - A Hyatt Brand Ambassador

Summary: I've just returned from a fun weekend stay at Hyatt Regency Newport Beach.  I've stayed there before, but was thrilled to see this hotel has gone through a major renovation.  Our guest room was bright, clean and very SoCal with a balcony.  If you have a big group, consider renting a Villa.  Ours slept 6 adults and 3 kids easily and had the bonus of a pool!   Worth every penny.  As soon as we arrived, we headed across the road to Fashion Island which has awesome outdoor shopping and restaurants.  That night, we saw Trombone Shorty at the amphitheater on property as part of the Summer Jazz Series.  I could not believe one of my favorite musicians was playing at such an intimate venue!   The next day we enjoyed a bike ride from the hotel to Balboa while the kids played on the slide

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Newport.  Love the renovation!!!
Summary: Our family and friends spent the weekend together over Labor Day and had the best time.  The staff was friendly and efficient from checkin to checkout.  Food and Beverage was superb, the new slide pool was the perfect afternoon for the kids.  I love the location too...so close to Balboa, the beach, Fashion Island, restaurants...but you really dont even need to leave since you have everything right there.  This hotel is perfect for a family getaway, business trip, or a relaxing escape.  A true jewel in Newport, CA!!

Stayed 2 weeks with family here during an extended Cali vacation and was pretty impressed. Good friendly atmosphere from arrival to departure, no issues whatsoever and room newly decorated, clean and very pleasant.  That said, we switched rooms after initially staying 1 night on our way past earlier in the holiday and the rooms around the main pool are MUCH nicer than those in the main building... given there is no extra charge this is worth noting. Also they are set back enough from the pool that noise was not an issue. All in all, would happily stay there again and probably will.

Summary Heading: Fantastic time at the Reej in Newport Beach
Summary: From check in to check out our family of four (6yr old and 9yr old) felt welcome and at ease at this resort.  It would seem that this resort will keep you happy whether you want to be attended to or not.  Typically we like to take care of ourselves,  we booked a walk-up pool view room.  The hotel is quite old we  understood and had gone through a year long extensive renovation.  As recent as this April I saw some grumbling about the construction but that would appear to be completed.  The room was great, fresh from its reno.  Our walk up door from poolside was a great shortcut for us.  We also appreciated the desk and couch as we like to bring food back to the room and don't like sitting on the beds.    Lobby and restaurant area seemed okay but the menu didn't really appeal to

My wife and I stayed just one night recently. We frequent Hyatt's and this one is somewhere in the middle of the pack. The property is set back from the main road and the overall location is next to world class shopping at Fashion Island. Fashion Island also features movie theaters and restaurants. If the beach is your thing then you are in luck because the hotel is central to Huntington and Newport Beach to the north and Corona del Mar to Laguna Beach and down to San Clemente to the south. All of these places are off of famed Pacific Coast Highway which is just one mile from the resort entry point. Each of those beach cities is it's own day trip but if time is a factor then you still have plenty of options. The resort itself is nothing fancy. The entry point leading to check in

Not your typical Hyatt, this is an older hotel well layed out in the natural landscape. Fun to walk around the property. Outside seating by the bar has a nice candle/firelight ambience. Apparently there were also activities about the grounds, but we never saw how to participate. Well located near local beaches, Crystal Cove State Park and just a short drive from Disneyland. The room was small. Ours had two double beds (apparently there are no rooms with two queens). There are French-style slotted closet doors separating the bed space from the bathroom. There is a spacious variety area but a tiny space behind the vanity for both the toilet and shower. There is no door separating this space and your legs would be completely visible to anyone standing in the vanity area. Awkward to

Summary Heading: Funky property with Great New Rooms
Summary: Spent three days for conference at facility.  I stayed in the Balboa building in King room with balcony overlooking a parking lot.  The rooms have been completely renovated and are better than most Hyatts that have not had the reno work.  The beds, linens, bathrooms are all new and look new--no signs of just a quick paint job and carpet.  Everything in the room worked well and looked new.  The room was quiet with a good desk area and nice sitting area  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  I rented a bike one evening and rode around the area--it was inexpensive and the staff made it easy to set up.  I led a two-day conference held in the Garden Rooms.  The room has plenty of natural light and fairly quiet.  We had breakfast and lunch on the patio area outside the room.

I visited Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for a work-ation (work w/ a little vacation).  The hotel is recently renovated and has a boutique feel.  Very spacious room that was clean and had a walk out patio. Since the weather was cooler than expected for August I wasn't able to use the pools, but they had three separate pools that could accommodate kids and adults that wanted to be away from the noise.  The staff was incredibly welcoming and helpful.  Everyone was friendly and greeted me when walking the property.  For me - that goes a long way.  In addition, the hotel was walking distance to Balboa Island and other outdoor entertainment. I would definitely recommend.

This property has so many pluses--outstanding lobby and valet service, 3 pools, a water slide (that our granddaughter loved!), shuffleboard, ping pong, restaurant, lovely indoor/outdoor bar, and location. The down side is that they don't advertise the activities and their restaurant and bar in the rooms; you have to wander around and figure it out for yourself! I expected something in the room telling about the hotel, the pools and water slide, the restaurant and the surrounding area--but the small folder in the room only gave the barest basics. As we were leaving, I went online to their website and found a lovely description of the hotel and all the things to do at the hotel, as well as the surrounding area. This should be in the rooms, at your fingertips. The rooms are well

the rooms were small and still outdated even though they had been renovated, good for young families because it has a good pool area with a slide but still not really nice.  not a really nice Hyatt more like 3 stars. Some of the hotel looks like an old motel. Staf was very nice and good location

Summary Heading: More renovation and service staff needed
Summary: The hotel location is very good.  It had a resort feel with the golf course and three pools.  There were couple of incidents made me feel like they are understaffed. The bellboy complaining about his knees wasn't very professional either.   The hotel claims 15 million Dolar worth of renovations have been made. The hotel lobby is nice, rooms are ok the rest needs more work. Self parking is too far.

Summary Heading: Quiet Hotel overlooking Back Bay of Newport Beach
Summary: Stayed one night room 254 facing the back bay and Balboa Island in the distance.  It is an older property  but they have kept it current in room décor, gardens, pool, & restaurant.  The staff were friendly and very helpful.  This is a nice property and really quiet for being in the middle of busy Newport Beach.

The newly remodeled Hyatt Regency Newport Beach is an amazing get away. The property is beautiful, the rooms very well appointed.  The grounds are park like, with three beautiful pools. Their Jazz Concert Series provides a great line up of live entertainment under the stars.  And the food provided is top notch.  Can't rave about this property enough.  Highly recommend you give it a try.  Bet you will  be glad you did!

Summary Heading: Peace and Quiet on the Coast Highway
Summary: I have stayed at this property several times over the last few years, and always find it to be consistent in amenities, price, and property condition.  I have relatives that have lived in Newport for years, and are yet to even know where for sure this property is (I believe it used to be called 'The Newporter', and locals still call it that).  Nevertheless, it is absolutely easy access from the coast highway, Jamboree, Fashion Island and the back bay.  The rooms are clean and nice, although not as luxurious as other Hyatt's.  The green areas are welcoming with plenty of activities and little nooks to sit and relax.  If you sneek out the back (service) entrance of the property on foot, you have low traffic access to an awesome walking/running trail that circles the back bay.  I

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, great location, SLOW service
Summary: I stayed here for a wedding for only one night.  The area is great and the hotel offers shuttles to got you around, or you can rent bikes.  They had a lot of great ideas to keep you busy.  The room itself was nice and they were able to get us checked in early (12:30) which we needed as the shuttle for the wedding was picking us up at 3pm.  We decided to go have lunch at 12:45 while waiting for our luggage to be delivered to the room.  I wish we had just taken it ourselves.  Lunch took an hour and a half- it was very busy in the lobby bar and only one server was working.  We rushed back to the room at 2:15 to get ready only to find out our bags still hadn't been delivered.  After a phone call and some searching, our bags arrived at 2:45 - there was no way we could make the 3pm

My wife and I decided to skip driving back home after attending a wedding and stay the night. Seems other guests were there for the same reason. Since we didn't have much luggage we decided to not use the valet service. When we saw how long the hike was from the parking lot we changed our minds. Although the gate not opening for us had something to do with that.  Our room was overly spacious for just two of us over looking the pool. We never heard anyone using the pool during our stay. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom more spacious then it needed to be. We got a good laugh about the automatic light that would come on at night when you broke the beam. We had plenty of light coming in from the door to find our way to the bathroom. Having the light switch on the outside of

Perfect in every way.  Great location, beautiful resort. Helpful staff, clean, quiet updated & comfortable rooms!  Only wished we could have stayed longer! The property was booked full so we couldn't extend our stay.

Summary Heading: Great resort for family wedding event!
Summary: Recently stayed at the Newport Beach Hyatt for our son's wedding with many family and friends from out of town. The staff at the Hyatt made a great time even better.  Given that they were fully booked due to a music event, we were very pleased that the staff although busy went out of their way and seemed genuinely pleased to help in any way possible.  The rooms, the grounds and the meals were excellent but the politeness and helpfulness of the staff in assisting with last minute wedding details will bring us back on future visits.

We stayed at this property for our 30th wedding anniversary. When we reserved the room we requested the Honeymoon extras..more on that later.  Positives:Check in was very easy. Our renovated room is clean and comfortable with a view of the bay.   The food and drinks at the Hyatt are delicious..especially the watermelon , basil sodas. It's quiet at night. The adult pool offered a break from the noise coming from the family pool. Negatives: The valet couldn't find our car..making us late for our own anniversary dinner party but at least we were comped one night parking. Some parts of the property show wear and tear still  ie: the elevators. Hopefully it will be updated. Our towels were not replaced so we had to get them ourselves from the cart. That request for the honeymoon

When you first drive up to the Hotel, you don't realize how big the property actually is. There seems to be a lot of events held there from weddings to Business dinners. There are three pools. One has water features that children will love. The other two are more adult and quiet. There is a Golf Course adjacent to the Hotel.  The rooms were large. There are four different buildings depending on where you want to be. There is also a restaurant on the premises which is convenient. We opted for the breakfast upgrade which seemed to be a good value as the Breakfast Buffet is $20 a person.   I did not appreciate having to pay for parking.

What started off as a terrible experience with the restaurant staff was flipped into a great success by the GM, Daniel Kuperschmid. He holds himself and the hotel to the highest standard & turned this customer from completely dissatisfied to a brand loyalist. We plan on going back regularly and would welcome the opportunity to visit any hotel Daniel is overseeing. Hyatt is lucky to have a polished GM like Dan on the team.

I had a good experience at the hotel, thanks to the manager Norm Hutton.  Some confustion and frustration when I first checked in was taken care of, thanks to Norm's professionism and good natured personality.  I do understand that "things" do happen, but I do appreciate it when the problem is taken care of immediately.  I look forward to my next visit to the hotel.

Stayed on site at the Hyatt regency for the 6th year,( Jazz fest weekend 3 amazing days) I have always loved the people(staff) kind and friendly and if they can't help you they will get someone who will! The remodel is beautifully updated and fresh. I stayed in the main hotel where the lobby is with a ground floor facing the Friday evening stage amphitheater! The check in was the fastest I have ever experienced. I got in early around noon to beat the crowed and after a long 3 hour drive I walked straight to the desk and had the key to my room under 4 minutes, the longest part was getting directions to where the room was :) The bar area is nice and open and busy all weekend but they always acknowledged you and got to you ASAP. I had never cared for their restaurant but OMG what a

this was my first stay at the New Port property. I am never disappointed when staying at a Hyatt when it comes to facilities and service. The staff was super friendly and helpful and the grounds were clean and perfect. My only issue if I had one was the location since I was without transportation and everything was a cab ride. Kudos to the staff at the Hyatt as they were top notch in every field. Next time I will be renting a car and enjoying all that New Port Beach has to offer.

We won this on a bid through Priceline, so we got a great deal. But I would not have been happy had I paid the full asking price of the hotel.  The staff was nice and helpful, and both the lounge and restaurant serve great food and drinks. The bed in our room was comfortable and the location is convenient and close to everything in the Newport Beach area. The hotel itself is a great base if you want to explore this area.   The grounds are gorgeous and well kept and the lobby and common areas are very nice and comfortable. The Pool and Hot Tub were clean and very relaxing as well.   With that said, as other reviewers have stated…many of the rooms are tired and a bit dark. Our ground floor room only had one small window and it was facing the pool, so we had to keep our curtains

A very beautiful resort hotel with a few swimming pools to select from. One having a slide and another a little sand pit. Table tennis, shot and putt golf green. Most of the rooms are set out around the various pools, but I would request to stay in the main building, it's far nicer and not so "motel" style.  We stayed in the newly renovated main building where the rooms had been done up to 5* quality. They had a spacious enough bathroom and large room for two double beds and a balcony.    The hotel is a short distance from Balboa Island (a must visit) and Fashion Island, a shopping mall.    Two things I was disappointed with, one being no free WIFI in the rooms where all the other hotels we stayed in in California offered free wifi.  This hotel only offeres free wifi in the

The Shor restaurant as it is now called has been redone with new menus and decoration. This is an excellent place for dinner with fresh locally sourced food and a unique method of ordering main course, sauces and side dishes and an outstanding wait staff. Well worth the experience with one exception. While I have not experienced this problem for several years the hotel does host music performances on the property and I have been told at those times the staff may not be able to handle the crowd. The rest of the time Shor is nearly empty except for breakfast and that is quite a shame for those who do not enjoy what is available there.

I just came back from a 4 night at the HRNPB, and after reading a lot of reviews, i was a little concerned. Here's the real deal about what I found. 1. This is Newport Beach (orange county) expect high fees and overpriced everything, its not the Hyatt, its all the hotels in the area. 2. Treat all employees with respect and you will be respected back. After a few issues with our T.V., maintenance came and fixed it and gave us 2 free movie just for the inconvenience (hyatt treatment) 3. We where here for business and only occupied the room in the evenings, every day we found it   very cleaned and fresh, when we needed extra anything it was promptly supplied. My overall opinion is that if you want to be treated like royalty and expect people to kiss your @#$%* then maybe you won't

Summary Heading: Lovely Hotel, good location, but a little dissapointed with the bill
Summary: It's a lovely hotel with great facilities. Several swimming pools, a water slide, table tennis etc.. Service was excellent. Food and drink was a little expensive, but I expected that. What left a sour taste in my mouth was the fee I paid to self-park in the hotel car park. $20 each time. I used my car twice one day, so that cost me $40. It was the only hotel car park that I paid for in 2 weeks in California.

I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach for 2 nights for a wedding in June 2013. As a bridesmaid, the bride (a Hyatt employee elsewhere in CA) asked for early check in for all of us, but asked that I call to request it as well, which I did two days in advance. Upon arrival at the hotel (where the wedding ceremony and reception were being held) about an hour before the rehearsal, not only was there an extremely long wait in the lobby to check in, my room was not ready early--in fact was ready about 15 minutes after the usual check-in time despite the multiple calls for early check-in that they said they would have no problem accomodating. Because of this, I had to get ready for the rehearsal in the lobby bathroom.  In the morning, after I took a shower the smoke alarm went

Summary Heading: Family-oriented hotel with beautiful grounds but rooms and service need improvement
Summary: I have really mixed feelings about this hotel, while in some aspects it was excellent, in others the quality was severely lacking.  Location: 4 stars The hotel is about an hour drive from LA and is a very short drive from a local John Wayne airport. It is within 15 min walk of Balboa island that has some shopping and boardwalk. Other than that there is not much within walking distance, though hotel does provide a free shuttle to nearby Fashion Island mall. If you'd like to be near the beach however, the closest one would be a 40 minute walk. Hotel does provide bike rentals but having a car seems optimal, except parking is rather pricey.Also be aware, that the hotel has a quiet policy starting at 10 pm, obviously geared toward children with families.   Grounds: 5 starts Recently

Overall, upon arrival I felt that Hyatt did a nice job renovating tihs old hotel.  The rooms were nicely appointed and overall it had a nice feel to it.  The parking charges were a bit confusing and made it not user friendly if you wanted to have guest come and visit you.  We finally deceided to meet off property due to high charges for our guest.  The only real issue is that tehy missed my wake-up calls for early in the morning.  When I inquired about it, they acknowledge it but never really felt like it was a big deal.  Would have used my phone s an alarm but it was muted due to a baby sleeping in our room.  Needless to say we were late for a function, so next tiem will travel with an alarm clock!

We just spent 7 nites here and had a great experience.  The staff were all super friendly and helpful.  The location suited us perfectly as we were able to explore close by beaches and dine at numerous restaurants in the area.  The pool staff made our "pool time" enjoyable.  The recently renovated rooms were nice.  We will be back!

Stayed one night here, got the standard room, which was very good. The room also had a small balcony, everything was renovated and looked new. Liked the style of the room and the whole hotel(very modern). The breakfast was really expensive, cost more than our room. Excellent service from the hotel staff.

Me and a couple of my girlfriends spent the weekend here recently and had a wonderful time.  The grounds are magnificent..the rooms are very comfortable and luxurious.  I kept waiting for the spa staff to knock on our door to give us a massage!!  Service was great, front desk was attentive to our every need, even suggesting a wonderful offsite breakfast spot on Pacific Coast Highway that we will definitely visit again.  No downsides to staying at this hotel.

5 stars because of their great on-site customer service.  Front desk went out of way to accommodate our request and give special birthday treat. Each dept. took great care of us.  The facilities were very nice. I would and hope to indeed go back.

Having been to the Hyatt Newport Beach several times, I was thrilled to hear they were giving this atmospheric southern California resort once owned by John Wayne  a 10 million dollar face lift. It had become a bit sad through its long star-studded years, though its ambiance continued to burn through the lush vegetation and the settling of its bones. Its proportions had withstood time, its legends of movie stars and Hollywood shenanigans, the tales of Wayne and Monroe and Kennedy all adding to its panache. Still I was excited to see what $10 M could accomplish. I booked a mid-June vacation and could not have been happier with my stay. The rooms were softly enhanced with the usual plumped up crisp Hyatt bedding, smooth colors, new carpeting. Everything was brighter, and it being

Stayed just one night.  Easy drive from Orange County Airport. Valet drive through small, but no problems dropping off or pick up. The staff exceptionally helpful and service was good. We had lunch on the terrace area and breakfast in the restaurant. Food was good (as always) but twenty bucks for a hamburger is, well, so Newport Beach.  Room was comfortable. The hotels located along Jamboree are close to the air port and you will hear the jet roar take offs. This hotel is full of kids and busy. If you want a quiet stay somewhere with a really big pool and space, re think.

The location was wonderful and the staff very friendly and helpful.  It was great to have bikes right there to rent and also close to great shopping at Fashion Island.  We were there the weekend after the 4th.  The pools were crowded and they ran out of pool towels.  Everyone was complaining and asking for towels.  This really shouldn't happen at a Hyatt even on a holiday weekend.  There were two of us in our room and on the third day we ran out of toilet tissue, not a good thing.  I called housekeeping and they said there was a spare in the closet.  No there wasn't, I tracked down a housekeeper and asked her for some, she said there was a spare in the closet, I told her no and she came and looked.  Finally they brought me a roll.  The next day there was no bath mat when we

The renovation on this hotel has made it much nicer and a better value. There is now a water slide in the main pool which is nice for families with kids. There is a separate pool, a bit smaller though without the noise of the slide or screaming kids.  Each 4th of July there is a large concert and spectacular fireworks show across the street on the back bay. Staying at this hotel makes it simple to enjoy without dealing with parking. Ill be heading back next year.

We've stayed at this property several times over the last several years.  They have updated since our last visit and it was a nice change including a new format in the lobby for quick bites and coffee on the go.  Colors and design were hip and had a younger vibe than it did before. Our room had all decor and bed was awesome. One of their pools could use to be updated but there are two others if you didn't like the larger one and we found one with a steel drum musician at the other and poolside bar service. We'll be back.

Surprisingly nice. Hyatt just did a $15M renovation to the property. Very attentive and friendly staff. Nice size room over looking the lagoon. Close to Fashion Island shopping and a short cab ride to Balboa Island (or a mile walk). Very clean and comfortable. Great bed (better than mine at home). Nice bar for an evening drink that converts to a Starbucks in the morning for a quick breakfast or have a sit down breakfast at Shor. For $169/night it is a great value. I will stay here again the next time I am in Newport Beach.

My husband, two kids and I stayed here for the first time over the weekend of June 29-July 1. It was a very hot weekend throughout Southern Ca, but the weather here was perfect. The hotel has undergone a renovation and the room we stayed in was clean and everything looked nice, although it was a bit small. We stayed in the bay rooms by the large pool with the water slide. My kids had a blast and swam most of the time we were there. Friday night there was a concert on the property that ended at 10 pm ...it was loud, and the rooms next to the concert would have been affected. We ate at the Shor restaurant on site and it was good, although pricey.   There were a few problems we encountered during our stay: 1. The shuttle service to balboa island stops at the mall first to pick up

Whenever I have a few days this is where I love to go. The rooms are clean but basic, but the grounds are superb. A great place to relax, but there are 3 pools, a water slide and play area for kids, ping pong, shuffle board, 9 hole 3 par course, bike and walking trails. The breakfast us great, fine bar food and great relaxing indoor outdoor bar. I highly, highly recommend!

The Hyatt Regency Newport was an amazing hotel to stay. The property was situated overlooking the ocean!! I was greeted by a friendly valet, he assisted me with my two bags. The front office staff was attentive and accommodating. My room was spacious and comfortable. It included a flat screen TV, coffee maker, refrigerator a separate bath & shower area. I highly recommend this hotel. Hyatt staff were all very friendly and welcoming. Well done Hyatt Staff!!

I spent 4 nights in this hotel as part of a convention. I arrived to the hotel late at night and the receptionists told me that there is no room (even if it was arranged in advance by the conveners). So at 1AM I had to find another hotel in the area. This was unacceptable, but after 20 hours of flights, I wasn't prepared for fighting. Yet, on the following day the hotel provided me with a room. The rooms are good, comfortable and clean. The pool and spa facility are OK and nice, but can get crowded. The gym is too small and only one machine to practice... It is well located next to a natural reserve which provides in only a walking distance, a perfect setting for morning jogging. I will recommend this hotel, but they should definitively improve the hospitality. Specially

We found a great place for a little getaway for our family of four. It's on Jamboree which is a beautiful street in Newport Beach and the surrounding area is very upscale. Our room was clean and modern with plenty of space. There was an outdoor patio and we could walk to the shuffleboard court and one of the pool areas (there are three). Also adjacent is an ecological preserve behind the Newport Dunes RV park and we had a nice walk there and back. The pool area with the waterslide is a great size. Plenty of lounge chairs, a little putting green for the kids, a water play zone with cannons and sprinklers for toddlers, a huge jacuzzi and a warm pool. The waterslide is really fun and was open from 10 am-7 pm (on a Saturday). I also loved how the towels at the pool were self serve

Notwithstanding their double billing my room and trying to pass the proverbial buck back and forth between hotel and central accounting all while failing to respond to multiple emails and phone calls,  the stay itself was enjoyable and the property relatively nice.  It is nice to have some free space to walk around and I would rather wake up to green than parking lots.   Admittedly, their design will have your guests paying excessively in order to visit you at your hotel, but that seems to be generally acceptable practice for the area.  As for the room itself.   The carpet, bed, and fixtures were new enough to make it pleasant.  Most of the space in the room was seemingly wasted in their design, but that doesn't effect one's sleeping.   I would point out that there are older
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us comments regarding your stay at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. I am really sorry to hear about the mix up with your billing, this is something that should not have occured in the first place. However I am glad to hear that your actual stay was nice. All of our rooms have been renovated now so no matter which area you prefer you will have an updated room. We have also renovated all of the pools and pool areas in the hotel. These are just a few of the things we have changed to ensure that our guests have a wonderful time here. We look forward to you coming back, and hope we can make your next stay even more enjoyable. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Quiet location easy access to Newport Beach
Summary: Easy to find from Orange County airport late on a Friday night. Arrived at 1030pm to find the joint a jumping with some sort of speakeasy flapper fundraising event. A bit scared it would be really noisy but everything was quiet very soon as they have notices all around asking for nightime quiet hours. Our room on the 3d floor had a lovely little balcony with a view of the outdoor event venue and the back bay.  Well thought out bathroom with decent amenities and a hair dryer. Iron and ironing board and the usual not so great coffee and tea maker. They did have ice water in the lobby infused with orange or cucumber complimentary.  Beds were VERY comfortable and super crisp and clean looking. Adequate black out drapes and funky and fun artwork through the hotel. An easy 20 minute

Summary Heading: Not my favorite Hyatt property, but Good
Summary: Pretty grounds, although doesn't quite compare with other Hyatts we have stayed. It wasn't as big, which made it easier to find our way around. The pool areas were decent-the family pool had a slide, though it's only open on weekends, which was disappointing for the kids. Some of the room buildings had exterior corridors, which gave it a very cheap, motel feel. They initially put us in one of those rooms, facing the street and I was not happy. I called front desk and was moved to the main building which had interior corridors, bigger room and a balcony overlooking one of the pools. 100x better than original room. Rooms are well appointed and good size. Only downside was the bathroom had a sliding door that didn't lock or even close completely. Hotel bar and restaurant were both
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review from your recent stay at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. We are glad to hear that you had an enjoyable stay and you were able to take in the beautiful grounds as well as our newly renovated pool area. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the room you were first assigned, but am glad to hear that you really enjoyed the room they moved you to. As well as being located very close to Balboa, we are right next to back bay, which offers a berautiful path to walk or bike. Please come back and stay with us again if you are ever in Newport Beach. Thank you

Summary: First impressions of recently renovated hotel were extremely good. However when we got to reception no accessible room with roll- in shower available for the first night- even though we booked 8 months ago! Gave us a free meal first night and free breakfast and then moved into new room. Did have to wait and complain that new room still wasn't ready after 4pm! Husband concerned over room on small balcony if he turned chair on his own could have gone over the edge. Some brilliant staff - Julio the waiter and a porter who tried to move our luggage for us 4 times but even he found the room not ready. Good food and bar area lovely. Large pool inviting but due to all fuss never had chance to use it. Only 3 rooms have a roll in shower at this recently renovated hotel so be careful if
Manager Response: Thank you for leaving a review from your recent stay at the Hyatt Regency Newport Beach. It is wonderful to hear that you liked the recent renovations that took place at the hotel. However I am very sorry to hear that you were not happy with the first room that you received. Although it looks like the agent tried to compensate you for not receiving the room you originally requested, I can understand how this would throw off your stay. Hopefully we were able to turn things around for you and make sure that you had an enjoyable time here. It sounds like you were able to experience some excellent service from our staff, which we really try to be a leader when it comes to customer service. I hope that you will come back to the hotel so we can show you just how amazing we can make your stay. Thank you.

Summary: 1st impressions are important, and they failed at theirs. After traveling, I looked forward to a shower and a rest before dinner. My son and I arrived at check in time (3:00pm) per our reservation confirmation. We were told our room wasn't ready and that checking was at 4:00 anyway. After questioning this, and showing my confirmation, the clerk insisted it was 4:00 and asked for my cell number to call when the room was ready. Now we had to tip the bellhop to store our luggage and retrieve it later, an expense that we needn't had incurred if we got our room as promised. We took a walk. At 4:30pm we got the call that our room was ready. We had to make our way back from Balboa Island, the closest area with anything to do. Therefore we didn't get settled into our room until well
Manager Response: Hi Debra, I am very sorry to hear that you did not have a more enjoyable time at our hotel. I am not sure where the confusion came regarding check-in time, however I can assure you that the normal hotel check-in time is at 4:00pm. If you know you will be arriving early we would recommend that you call the hotel to request an early check-in, we will always do our best to try and accommodate your request. I am also sorry to hear about the confusion regarding the internet, these are problems that should not have come up and I am truly sorry they had a negative impact on your stay. We always take our guest reviews seriously and use them as to tool to improve our service so these kinds of mistakes do not happen in the future. We really hope that you will give us another chance as I can assure you that your experience was not normal for our hotel. Please feel free to contact me regarding a future reservation or if you would like to further discuss your past experience. Again I would like to thank you for taking the time to leave a review and showing us areas that we can improve.

Summary: Here on business for 4 nights, I've had a great stay. The room was adequate and up-to-date and the staff couldn't do more to make my stay comfortable. At $20 per day, parking is not cheap, but nothing in Newport Beach is. The location is a walk or bike ride from Balboa Island and the back bay provides great scenery.
